Sanskrit verse: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय
Translation (English): Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjay, after gathering on the holy field of Kurukshetra, and desiring to fight, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do?
Hinglish (1): Dhritarashtra said: Sanjay, jab mere bete aur Pandu ke bete Kurukshetra mein yudh ke liye aaye, to uss waqt woh kya kar rahe the?
Hinglish (2): Dhritarashtra ne poochha: Hey Sanjay, us pavitra zameen Kurukshetra par, jab mere aur Pandu ke bete ladne ke liye ikattha hue, toh unhone aakhir kya kiya?
Summary: The blind king’s attachment to his sons clouded his judgement. Despite the certainty of war, he asked what both sides were doing, fearing the holy place might inspire peace, which he did not want.
message:
धृतराष्ट्र उवाच धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय
Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjay, after gathering on the holy field of Kurukshetra, and desiring to fight, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do?
Dhritarashtra said: Sanjay, jab mere bete aur Pandu ke bete Kurukshetra mein yudh ke liye aaye, to uss waqt woh kya kar rahe the?

Sanskrit verse: सञ्जय उवाच दृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा आचार्यमुपसंगम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत्
Translation (English): Sanjay said: O King, after observing the Pandava army arranged in military formation, King Duryodhana approached his teacher Dronacharya and spoke the following words.
Hinglish (1): Sanjay said: Raja, Pandav sena ki formation dekhkar Duryodhan guru Drona ke paas gaye.
Hinglish (2): Sanjay ne kaha: Pandavo ki sena ko fauji formation mein dekhkar, Raja Duryodhan apne guru Dronacharya ke paas gaye aur yeh baatein kahin.
Summary: Noting the Pandava formation, Duryodhana sought counsel from his mentor, revealing both awareness and concern.
message:
सञ्जय उवाच दृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा आचार्यमुपसंगम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत्
Sanjay said: O King, after observing the Pandava army arranged in military formation, King Duryodhana approached his teacher Dronacharya and spoke the following words.
Sanjay said: Raja, Pandav sena ki formation dekhkar Duryodhan guru Drona ke paas gaye.

Sanskrit verse: पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम् व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता
Translation (English): Behold, O teacher, this mighty army of the sons of Pandu, arrayed by the son of Drupada, your wise disciple.
Hinglish (1): Duryodhan: Guruji, dekhiye Pandavon ki yeh shaktishaali sena jo Drupad-putra (Dhrishtadyumna), aapka buddhimaan shishya, ne formulate ki hai.
Hinglish (2): "Hey Guru, dekhiye Pandu ke beton ki is vishaal sena ko, jise aapke hi hoshiyaar chele, Drupad ke bete ne, taiyaar kiya hai."
Summary: Duryodhana points out that the Pandava army has been arranged by Dhrishtadyumna, ironically trained by Drona himself.
message:
पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम् व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता
Behold, O teacher, this mighty army of the sons of Pandu, arrayed by the son of Drupada, your wise disciple.
Duryodhan: Guruji, dekhiye Pandavon ki yeh shaktishaali sena jo Drupad-putra (Dhrishtadyumna), aapka buddhimaan shishya, ne formulate ki hai.

Sanskrit verse: अत्र शूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि युयुधानो विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः
Translation (English): Here in this army are many heroic bowmen equal in fighting to Bhima and Arjuna: Yuyudhana, Virata, and the great chariot-warrior Drupada.
Hinglish (1): Duryodhan: is sena me bahut shoorveer dhanurdhar hain jo Bhim aur Arjun ke barabar ladein – jaise Yuyudhan, Virat aur maharathi Drupad.
Hinglish (2): "Is sena mein Bheem aur Arjun jaise bade-bade yoddha hain. Yahan Yuyudhan, Virat, aur Drupad jaise maharathi bhi hain."
Summary: Duryodhana lists formidable warriors on the Pandava side to underscore their strength.
message:
अत्र शूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि युयुधानो विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः
Here in this army are many heroic bowmen equal in fighting to Bhima and Arjuna: Yuyudhana, Virata, and the great chariot-warrior Drupada.
Duryodhan: is sena me bahut shoorveer dhanurdhar hain jo Bhim aur Arjun ke barabar ladein – jaise Yuyudhan, Virat aur maharathi Drupad.

Sanskrit verse: धृष्टकेतुश्चेकितानः काशिराजश्च वीर्यवान पुरुजित्कुन्तिभोजश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुंगवः
Translation (English): There are also great heroes like Dhrishtaketu, Chekitana, the valiant king of Kashi, Purujit, Kuntibhoja, and Shaibya, the best of men.
Hinglish (1): Duryodhan: Aur bhi mahan yoddha hain jaise Dhrishtaketu, Chekitana, shaktishali Kashi raja, Purujit, Kuntibhoj, aur Shaibya.
Hinglish (2): "Yahan Dhrishtaketu, Chekitan, Kashi ke shaktishali raja, Purujit, Kuntibhoj aur Shaibya jaise mahaan log bhi maujood hain."
Summary: He continues listing experienced warriors, showing concern about Pandava strength.
message:
धृष्टकेतुश्चेकितानः काशिराजश्च वीर्यवान पुरुजित्कुन्तिभोजश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुंगवः
There are also great heroes like Dhrishtaketu, Chekitana, the valiant king of Kashi, Purujit, Kuntibhoja, and Shaibya, the best of men.
Duryodhan: Aur bhi mahan yoddha hain jaise Dhrishtaketu, Chekitana, shaktishali Kashi raja, Purujit, Kuntibhoj, aur Shaibya.

Sanskrit verse: युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान सौभद्रो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्व एव महारथाः
Translation (English): There are the courageous Yudhamanyu, the valiant Uttamauja, Abhimanyu, son of Subhadra, and the sons of Draupadi—all great chariot-warriors.
Hinglish (1): Yudhamanyu, Uttamauja, Abhimanyu aur Draupadi ke putra – sabhi shaktishaali aur maharathi hain.
Hinglish (2): "Yahan parakrami Yudhamanyu, shaktishali Uttamauja, Subhadra ke bete Abhimanyu aur Draupadi ke paancho bete bhi hain - ye sabhi maharathi hain."
Summary: He emphasizes that even the young fighters are highly capable.
message:
युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान सौभद्रो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्व एव महारथाः
There are the courageous Yudhamanyu, the valiant Uttamauja, Abhimanyu, son of Subhadra, and the sons of Draupadi—all great chariot-warriors.
Yudhamanyu, Uttamauja, Abhimanyu aur Draupadi ke putra – sabhi shaktishaali aur maharathi hain.

Sanskrit verse: अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थं तान्ब्रवीमि ते
Translation (English): But for your knowledge, O best of the twice-born, let me name the distinguished leaders of my army.
Hinglish (1): Ab main apni sena ke vishisht yoddhaon ke naam bataata hoon, hey Dwijottam.
Hinglish (2): "Hey sabse uttam Brahmin, ab aapki jaankari ke liye, main aapko apni sena ke un mukhya yoddhaon ke baare mein batata hoon."
Summary: Duryodhana shifts focus to highlight key warriors on his own side.
message:
अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थं तान्ब्रवीमि ते
But for your knowledge, O best of the twice-born, let me name the distinguished leaders of my army.
Ab main apni sena ke vishisht yoddhaon ke naam bataata hoon, hey Dwijottam.

Sanskrit verse: भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिञ्जयः अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च
Translation (English): These are personalities like yourself, Bhishma, Karna, Kripacharya—ever victorious in battle—Ashwatthama, Vikarna, and also the son of Somadatta.
Hinglish (1): Aap swayam, Bhishma, Karna, Kripacharya, Ashwatthama, Vikarna aur Somadatta ka putra – yeh sab mahan yoddha hain.
Hinglish (2): "Aap khud, Bheeshma, Karna, aur yuddh mein hamesha jeetne waale Kripacharya. Saath hi Ashwatthama, Vikarna, aur Somadatta ke bete Bhurishrava."
Summary: He lists trusted veterans and powerful warriors from his own army.
message:
भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिञ्जयः अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च
These are personalities like yourself, Bhishma, Karna, Kripacharya—ever victorious in battle—Ashwatthama, Vikarna, and also the son of Somadatta.
Aap swayam, Bhishma, Karna, Kripacharya, Ashwatthama, Vikarna aur Somadatta ka putra – yeh sab mahan yoddha hain.

Sanskrit verse: अन्ये च बहवः शूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविता नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः
Translation (English): And many other heroes who are prepared to lay down their lives for my sake, all armed with various weapons, and all experienced in military science.
Hinglish (1): Aur bhi kai shoorveer jo mere liye apni jaan dene ko tayyar hain, vibhinna shastron me nipun.
Hinglish (2): "Aur bhi bahut se veer hain jo mere liye apni jaan dene ko taiyar hain. Ve sab alag-alag hathiyaron se lais hain aur yuddh-kala mein expert hain."
Summary: Duryodhana boasts about the loyalty and expertise of his fighters.
message:
अन्ये च बहवः शूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविता नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः
And many other heroes who are prepared to lay down their lives for my sake, all armed with various weapons, and all experienced in military science.
Aur bhi kai shoorveer jo mere liye apni jaan dene ko tayyar hain, vibhinna shastron me nipun.

Sanskrit verse: अपर्याप्तं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम् पर्याप्तं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम्
Translation (English): Our strength, protected by Bhishma, is immeasurable, whereas the strength of the Pandavas, protected by Bhima, is limited.
Hinglish (1): Hamari sena, Bhishma ki raksha me, apar hai; unki sena, Bhima ki raksha me, simit hai.
Hinglish (2): "Hamari sena ki shakti, jiski raksha Bheeshma kar rahe hain, anant hai, jabki Bheem dwara surakshit Pandavo ki sena seemit lagti hai."
Summary: He shows confidence in his army, downplaying the Pandavas despite earlier worry.
message:
अपर्याप्तं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम् पर्याप्तं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम्
Our strength, protected by Bhishma, is immeasurable, whereas the strength of the Pandavas, protected by Bhima, is limited.
Hamari sena, Bhishma ki raksha me, apar hai; unki sena, Bhima ki raksha me, simit hai.

Sanskrit verse: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिताः भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्तः सर्व एव हि
Translation (English): Therefore, all of you, positioned in your respective divisions, should give full support to Grandfather Bhishma.
Hinglish (1): Apne-apne mokam par tainat rehkar, sab log Bhishma ji ki poori raksha karein.
Hinglish (2): "Isliye, aap sab apne-apne morchon par date rahen aur har taraf se Pitamah Bheeshma ki raksha karein."
Summary: Duryodhana urges his warriors to protect their greatest commander, Bhishma.
message:
अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिताः भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्तः सर्व एव हि
Therefore, all of you, positioned in your respective divisions, should give full support to Grandfather Bhishma.
Apne-apne mokam par tainat rehkar, sab log Bhishma ji ki poori raksha karein.

Sanskrit verse: तस्य सञ्जञ्जनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्धः पितामहः सिंहनादं विनद्योष्च शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान्
Translation (English): Then, to boost Duryodhana’s morale, the mighty grandsire Bhishma, the eldest of the Kuru dynasty, roared like a lion and blew his conch.
Hinglish (1): Tab Duryodhan ka hosla badhane ke liye, veer pitamah Bhishma ne sher ki tarah garajkar apna shankh bajaya.
Hinglish (2): "Tab Kuru vansh ke sabse buzurg aur shaktishali Pitamah Bheeshma ne Duryodhan ko khush karne ke liye sher ki tarah garajkar apna shankh bajaya."
Summary: Bhishma’s conch sound symbolized readiness and inspired his troops.
message:
तस्य सञ्जञ्जनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्धः पितामहः सिंहनादं विनद्योष्च शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान्
Then, to boost Duryodhana’s morale, the mighty grandsire Bhishma, the eldest of the Kuru dynasty, roared like a lion and blew his conch.
Tab Duryodhan ka hosla badhane ke liye, veer pitamah Bhishma ne sher ki tarah garajkar apna shankh bajaya.

Sanskrit verse: ततः शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखाः सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत्
Translation (English): Thereafter, conchs, drums, bugles, trumpets, and horns suddenly blared forth, producing a tumultuous sound.
Hinglish (1): Uske baad shankh, dhol, bheri, turahi aur narsingha ekdum se bajne lage aur maha shor mach gaya.
Hinglish (2): "Uske turant baad, shankh, nagaade, dhol aur trumpets ek saath baj uthe, jisse ek bohot hi bhayankar shor paida hua."
Summary: The loud instruments announced the official commencement of battle preparations.
message:
ततः शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखाः सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत्
Thereafter, conchs, drums, bugles, trumpets, and horns suddenly blared forth, producing a tumultuous sound.
Uske baad shankh, dhol, bheri, turahi aur narsingha ekdum se bajne lage aur maha shor mach gaya.

Sanskrit verse: ततः श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ माधवः पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतुः
Translation (English): Then, in their grand chariot yoked with white horses, Madhava (Sri Krishna) and Arjuna sounded their divine conches.
Hinglish (1): Phir, safed ghodon wale vishal rath par baithe Madhav (Sri Krishna) aur Arjun ne apne divya shankh bajaye.
Hinglish (2): "Dusri taraf, safed ghodon waale ek shaandaar rath par baithe Shri Krishna aur Arjun ne bhi apne divya shankh bajaye."
Summary: The entry of Krishna and Arjuna with divine conch sounds signified the righteous side’s declaration.
message:
ततः श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ माधवः पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतुः
Then, in their grand chariot yoked with white horses, Madhava (Sri Krishna) and Arjuna sounded their divine conches.
Phir, safed ghodon wale vishal rath par baithe Madhav (Sri Krishna) aur Arjun ne apne divya shankh bajaye.

Sanskrit verse: पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनञ्जयः पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशंखं भीमकर्मा वृकोदरः
Translation (English): Hrishikesh (Krishna) blew the Panchajanya, Dhananjaya (Arjuna) blew the Devadatta, and Vrikodara (Bhima) blew the great conch Paundra.
Hinglish (1): Hrishikesh(Sri Krisha) ne Panchajanya bajaya, Arjun ne Devadatta, aur Bhima ne bada shankh Paundra bajaya.
Hinglish (2): "Shri Krishna ne apna Panchajanya shankh bajaya, Arjun ne Devadatta, aur zyaada bhojan karne waale Bheem ne apna Paundra naam ka vishaal shankh bajaya."
Summary: Each warrior’s conch had a name and history, reflecting their strength and identity.
message:
पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनञ्जयः पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशंखं भीमकर्मा वृकोदरः
Hrishikesh (Krishna) blew the Panchajanya, Dhananjaya (Arjuna) blew the Devadatta, and Vrikodara (Bhima) blew the great conch Paundra.
Hrishikesh(Sri Krisha) ne Panchajanya bajaya, Arjun ne Devadatta, aur Bhima ne bada shankh Paundra bajaya.

Sanskrit verse: अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः नकुलः सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ
Translation (English): King Yudhishthira, son of Kunti, blew the Anantavijaya; Nakula and Sahadeva blew the conches Sughosha and Manipushpaka.
Hinglish (1): Raja Yudhishthir ne Anantavijaya bajaya, Nakul ne Sughosh aur Sahadev ne Manipushpak.
Hinglish (2): "Kunti-putra Raja Yudhishthir ne apna Anantavijaya shankh bajaya; aur Nakul aur Sahadeva ne Sughosha aur Manipushpaka naam ke shankh bajaye."
Summary: The Pandava brothers announced unity and readiness with their own conch calls.
message:
अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः नकुलः सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ
King Yudhishthira, son of Kunti, blew the Anantavijaya; Nakula and Sahadeva blew the conches Sughosha and Manipushpaka.
Raja Yudhishthir ne Anantavijaya bajaya, Nakul ne Sughosh aur Sahadev ne Manipushpak.

Sanskrit verse: काश्यश्च परमेष्वासः शिखण्डी च महारथः धृष्टद्युम्नो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्चापराजितः
Translation (English): The king of Kashi, the great archer; Shikhandi the maharatha; Dhrishtadyumna; Virata; and the undefeated Satyaki blew their respective conches.
Hinglish (1): Kashi naresh, shreshtha dhanurdhar; maharathi Shikhandi; Dhrishtadyumna; Virat; aur ajey Satyaki ne apne shankh bajaye.
Hinglish (2): "Mahan dhanurdhar Kashi-raj, maharathi Shikhandi, Dhrishtadyumna, Virata, aur ajey Satyaki ne bhi apne-apne shankh bajaye."
Summary: Prominent allies of the Pandavas also joined in the symbolic sound of readiness.
message:
काश्यश्च परमेष्वासः शिखण्डी च महारथः धृष्टद्युम्नो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्चापराजितः
The king of Kashi, the great archer; Shikhandi the maharatha; Dhrishtadyumna; Virata; and the undefeated Satyaki blew their respective conches.
Kashi naresh, shreshtha dhanurdhar; maharathi Shikhandi; Dhrishtadyumna; Virat; aur ajey Satyaki ne apne shankh bajaye.

Sanskrit verse: द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वशः पृथिवीपते सौभद्रश्च महाबाहुः शङ्खान्दध्मुः पृथक्पृथक्
Translation (English): Drupada; the sons of Draupadi; and the mighty-armed son of Subhadra blew their conches from various positions, O King.
Hinglish (1): Drupad, Draupadi ke putra, aur Subhadra-putra ne bhi apne-apne mokam par shankh bajaye.
Hinglish (2): "Hey Rajan, Drupad, Draupadi ke beton, aur Subhadra ke mahabali bete (Abhimanyu) ne bhi alag-alag shankh bajaye."
Summary: The sound resonated from all sides, enveloping the battlefield.
message:
द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वशः पृथिवीपते सौभद्रश्च महाबाहुः शङ्खान्दध्मुः पृथक्पृथक्
Drupada; the sons of Draupadi; and the mighty-armed son of Subhadra blew their conches from various positions, O King.
Drupad, Draupadi ke putra, aur Subhadra-putra ne bhi apne-apne mokam par shankh bajaye.

Sanskrit verse: स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत् नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलो व्यनुनादयन्
Translation (English): That tumultuous sound shattered the hearts of Dhritarashtra’s sons and echoed through the sky and earth.
Hinglish (1): Yeh bhayanak shankh-naad ne Dhritarashtra ke putron ke dil hila diye, asmaan-zameen goonj uthi.
Hinglish (2): "Us bhayankar aawaz ne aasmaan aur dharti ko hila diya, aur Dhritarashtra ke beton ke dilon mein dar paida kar diya."
Summary: The morale of the Kaurava side was shaken by the overwhelming spiritual challenge.
message:
स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत् नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलो व्यनुनादयन्
That tumultuous sound shattered the hearts of Dhritarashtra’s sons and echoed through the sky and earth.
Yeh bhayanak shankh-naad ne Dhritarashtra ke putron ke dil hila diye, asmaan-zameen goonj uthi.

Sanskrit verse: अथ व्यवस्थितान्दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान् कपिध्वजः प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसंप्रह्रे धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डवः
Translation (English): At that time, seeing Dhritarashtra’s sons positioned for battle, Arjuna, whose flag bore the Hanuman emblem, picked up his bow as the war was about to begin.
Hinglish (1): Tab Arjun, jinke rath par Hanuman ka dhwaj tha, ne Kauravon ko vyuh me dekha aur yudh shuru hone se pehle apna dhanush uthaya. (Hanuman emblem symbolizes strength and devotion; Arjuna prepared himself mentally for action.)
Hinglish (2): "Hey Rajan, us samay jab teer chalne hi waale the, Hanuman-dhwaj waale rath par baithe Arjun ne apna dhanush uthaya aur Shri Krishna se yeh kaha."
Summary: Hanuman emblem symbolizes strength and devotion; Arjuna prepared himself mentally for action.
message:
अथ व्यवस्थितान्दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान् कपिध्वजः प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसंप्रह्रे धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डवः
At that time, seeing Dhritarashtra’s sons positioned for battle, Arjuna, whose flag bore the Hanuman emblem, picked up his bow as the war was about to begin.
Tab Arjun, jinke rath par Hanuman ka dhwaj tha, ne Kauravon ko vyuh me dekha aur yudh shuru hone se pehle apna dhanush uthaya. (Hanuman emblem symbolizes strength and devotion; Arjuna prepared himself mentally for action.)

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच सेनयोः उभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत
Translation (English): Arjuna said: O Achyuta, please place my chariot between the two armies.
Hinglish (1): Arjun (requests): Hey Krishna, mera rath dono side ke beech me laga do.
Hinglish (2): "Arjun ne kaha: Hey Achyuta (Krishna), kripya mera rath dono senaon ke beech mein le chaliye."
Summary: Arjuna requests Krishna to position the chariot so he can view both sides before the battle.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच सेनयोः उभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत
Arjuna said: O Achyuta, please place my chariot between the two armies.
Arjun (requests): Hey Krishna, mera rath dono side ke beech me laga do.

Sanskrit verse: यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्धुकामानवस्थितान् कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन्रणसमुद्यमे
Translation (English): So that I may observe those arrayed for battle, wishing to fight, with whom I must contend in this great trial of arms.
Hinglish (1): Taaki main dekh sakun kaun ladne ke liye khade hain, aur kis se mera samna hoga.
Hinglish (2): "Taaki main dekh sakoon ki yahan kaun-kaun yuddh karne ki ichha se khada hai, aur is mahayuddh mein mujhe kiske saath ladna hai."
Summary: Arjuna wants to assess the warriors participating in the war.
message:
यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्धुकामानवस्थितान् कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन्रणसमुद्यमे
So that I may observe those arrayed for battle, wishing to fight, with whom I must contend in this great trial of arms.
Taaki main dekh sakun kaun ladne ke liye khade hain, aur kis se mera samna hoga.

Sanskrit verse: योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागताः धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्युद्धे प्रियचिकीरिषवः
Translation (English): Let me see those who have come here to fight, wishing to please the evil‑minded son of Dhritarashtra.
Hinglish (1): Main dekhna chahta hoon kaun is dushtbuddhi Dhritarashtra‑putra ke liye ladne aya hai.
Hinglish (2): "Main un sabko dekhna chahta hoon jo yahan Dhritarashtra ke dusht bete (Duryodhan) ko khush karne ke liye ladne aaye hain."
Summary: Reveals moral judgement against Duryodhana’s intentions.
message:
योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागताः धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्युद्धे प्रियचिकीरिषवः
Let me see those who have come here to fight, wishing to please the evil‑minded son of Dhritarashtra.
Main dekhna chahta hoon kaun is dushtbuddhi Dhritarashtra‑putra ke liye ladne aya hai.
tags: family conflict, negative thoughts, office politics

Sanskrit verse: सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेशेन भारत सेनयोः उभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम्
Translation (English): Sanjay said: O Bharata, after being addressed by Gudakesha (Arjuna), Hrishikesh placed the finest chariot between the two armies.
Hinglish (1): Sanjay bola: Hey Bharat, Arjun ki baat sun kar Krishna ne rath dono senaon ke beech laga diya.
Hinglish (2): "Sanjay ne kaha: Hey Bharatvanshi, Arjun ke aisa kehne par, Shri Krishna ne us shaandaar rath ko dono senaon ke beech laakar khada kar diya."
Summary: Krishna fulfills Arjuna’s request, setting the stage for the emotional turning point.
message:
सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेशेन भारत सेनयोः उभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम्
Sanjay said: O Bharata, after being addressed by Gudakesha (Arjuna), Hrishikesh placed the finest chariot between the two armies.
Sanjay bola: Hey Bharat, Arjun ki baat sun kar Krishna ne rath dono senaon ke beech laga diya.

Sanskrit verse: भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखतः सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम् उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरूनिति
Translation (English): In front of Bhishma, Drona, and all rulers, Krishna said: O Parth, behold these Kurus assembled here.
Hinglish (1): Bhishma, Drona aur anya rajaon ke samne, Krishna bole: Hey Parth, dekho yeh sab Kuruvanshi khade hain.
Hinglish (2): "Bheeshma, Drona aur doosre sabhi rajaon ke saamne rath ko khada karke Krishna ne kaha: Hey Parth, yahan ikattha hue in sab Kuruvanshiyon ko dekho."
Summary: Krishna draws Arjuna’s attention to his own kin in battle.
message:
भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखतः सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम् उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरूनिति
In front of Bhishma, Drona, and all rulers, Krishna said: O Parth, behold these Kurus assembled here.
Bhishma, Drona aur anya rajaon ke samne, Krishna bole: Hey Parth, dekho yeh sab Kuruvanshi khade hain.

Sanskrit verse: तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान्पार्थः पितृन्थ पितामहान् आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातृन्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा श्वशुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोर्वय पृष्ठतः
Translation (English): There Arjuna saw grandfathers, fathers, teachers, maternal uncles, brothers, sons, grandsons, friends, fathers‑in‑law, and well‑wishers in both armies.
Hinglish (1): Arjun ne dekha – dada, pita, guru, mama, bhai, bete, potay, dost, sasur, aur mitra dono senaon me hain.
Hinglish (2): "Wahan Arjun ne dono hi senaon mein apne chacha, tau, dada, guru, mama, bhai, bete, pote aur doston ko dekha."
Summary: This recognition of relatives shakes Arjuna emotionally.
message:
तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान्पार्थः पितृन्थ पितामहान् आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातृन्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा श्वशुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोर्वय पृष्ठतः
There Arjuna saw grandfathers, fathers, teachers, maternal uncles, brothers, sons, grandsons, friends, fathers‑in‑law, and well‑wishers in both armies.
Arjun ne dekha – dada, pita, guru, mama, bhai, bete, potay, dost, sasur, aur mitra dono senaon me hain.
tags: family conflict, dealing with grief, guilt

Sanskrit verse: तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेयः सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान् कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत्
Translation (English): Seeing all his relatives thus, Arjuna was overwhelmed with compassion and spoke grief‑stricken.
Hinglish (1): Apne sab rishtedaar dekhkar Arjun daya se bhar gaya aur dukhi hokar bola.
Hinglish (2): "Jab Arjun ne apne sabhi rishtedaaron aur doston ko wahan dekha, toh uska dil karuna (compassion) se bhar gaya aur usne dukh mein yeh kaha."
Summary: Arjuna’s compassion begins to weaken his will to fight.
message:
तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेयः सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान् कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत्
Seeing all his relatives thus, Arjuna was overwhelmed with compassion and spoke grief‑stricken.
Apne sab rishtedaar dekhkar Arjun daya se bhar gaya aur dukhi hokar bola.
tags: dealing with grief, stress, family conflict

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच दृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम् सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिशुष्यति
Translation (English): Arjuna said: O Krishna, seeing my people eager to fight, my body fails and mouth is drying.
Hinglish (1): Hey Krishna, apne logon ko yudh ke liye taiyyar dekhkar mera sharir dhila ho raha hai, muh sookh raha hai.
Hinglish (2): "Arjun ne kaha: Hey Krishna, apne hi logon ko yuddh ke liye saamne khada dekhkar mere shareer ke ang kaamp rahe hain aur mera munh sookh raha hai."
Summary: Physical signs of stress manifest in Arjuna’s body.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच दृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम् सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिशुष्यति
Arjuna said: O Krishna, seeing my people eager to fight, my body fails and mouth is drying.
Hey Krishna, apne logon ko yudh ke liye taiyyar dekhkar mera sharir dhila ho raha hai, muh sookh raha hai.

Sanskrit verse: वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्त्वक्चैव परिदह्यते
Translation (English): My body trembles, my hair stands, Gandiva slips from my hand, and my skin burns.
Hinglish (1): Mera sharir kaanp raha hai, romanch ho raha hai, dhanush haath se nikal raha hai, twacha jal rahi hai.
Hinglish (2): "Mera poora shareer kaamp raha hai, rongte khade ho gaye hain, mere haath se Gandiva dhanush fisal raha hai aur meri twacha mein jalan ho rahi hai."
message:
वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्त्वक्चैव परिदह्यते
My body trembles, my hair stands, Gandiva slips from my hand, and my skin burns.
Mera sharir kaanp raha hai, romanch ho raha hai, dhanush haath se nikal raha hai, twacha jal rahi hai.

Sanskrit verse: न च शक्नोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मनः निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव
Translation (English): I cannot stand still; my mind reels; I see bad omens, O Keshav.
Hinglish (1): Main khada nahi reh paa raha, dimag ghoom raha hai, bura shagun dekh raha hoon, hey Keshav.
Hinglish (2): "Main ab khada bhi nahi ho paa raha hoon, mera mann buri tarah se bhatak raha hai. Hey Keshav, mujhe sirf bura hone ke hi sanket dikh rahe hain."
message:
न च शक्नोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मनः निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव
I cannot stand still; my mind reels; I see bad omens, O Keshav.
Main khada nahi reh paa raha, dimag ghoom raha hai, bura shagun dekh raha hoon, hey Keshav.

Sanskrit verse: न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे
Translation (English): I see no good in killing my kinsmen in battle.
Hinglish (1): Mujhe apne logon ko maarne me koi bhalai nahi lagti.
Hinglish (2): "Is yuddh mein apne hi logon ko maarkar mujhe koi bhalai nahi dikhti. Main na toh jeet chahta hoon, na rajya, aur na hi isse milne waale sukh."
message:
न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे
I see no good in killing my kinsmen in battle.
Mujhe apne logon ko maarne me koi bhalai nahi lagti.
tags: purpose of life, confusion, negative thoughts

Sanskrit verse: न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च
Translation (English): O Krishna, I desire neither victory, nor kingdom, nor pleasures.
Hinglish (1): Hey Krishna, na vijay chahiye, na rajya, na sukh.
Hinglish (2): "Hey Krishna, mujhe na toh jeet chahiye, na rajya, aur na hi koi sukh."
message:
न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च
O Krishna, I desire neither victory, nor kingdom, nor pleasures.
Hey Krishna, na vijay chahiye, na rajya, na sukh.
tags: what is the purpose of life, detachment

Sanskrit verse: किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा
Translation (English): Of what use is kingdom, O Govinda? Of what use are pleasures or life?
Hinglish (1): Rajya ka kya kaam, hey Govind? Sukh aur jeevan ka kya kaam?
Hinglish (2): "Hey Govind, aise rajya ka kya fayda? Aise bhog ya jeewan ka hi kya laabh?"
Summary: Questions meaning of life in this context.
message:
किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा
Of what use is kingdom, O Govinda? Of what use are pleasures or life?
Rajya ka kya kaam, hey Govind? Sukh aur jeevan ka kya kaam?
tags: what is the purpose of life, feeling lost in life

Sanskrit verse: ये षामर्थे काङ्क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगाः सुखानि च त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च
Translation (English): Those for whose sake we desired kingdom and pleasures stand here prepared to give up lives and wealth.
Hinglish (1): Jinke liye rajya-sukh chahte the, woh yahan jaan-dhan dene ko tayyar hain.
Hinglish (2): "Jinke liye humein yeh rajya, bhog aur sukh chahiye, wohi sab toh yahan apni jaan aur daulat daav par laga kar khade hain."
Summary: Points at futility of war gains.
message:
ये षामर्थे काङ्क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगाः सुखानि च त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च
Those for whose sake we desired kingdom and pleasures stand here prepared to give up lives and wealth.
Jinke liye rajya-sukh chahte the, woh yahan jaan-dhan dene ko tayyar hain.
tags: family conflict, purpose of life, guilt

Sanskrit verse: आचार्याः पितरः पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहाः मातुलाः श्वशुराः पौत्राः श्यालाः सम्बन्धिनस्तथा
Translation (English): Teachers, fathers, sons, grandfathers, maternal uncles, fathers‑in‑law, grandsons, brothers‑in‑law, relatives...
Hinglish (1): Guru, pita, bete, dada, mama, sasur, potay, sala aur sambandhi...
Hinglish (2): "Guru, pita, bete, dada, mama, sasur, pote, saale aur doosre sabhi rishtedaar..."
message:
आचार्याः पितरः पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहाः मातुलाः श्वशुराः पौत्राः श्यालाः सम्बन्धिनस्तथा
Teachers, fathers, sons, grandfathers, maternal uncles, fathers‑in‑law, grandsons, brothers‑in‑law, relatives...
Guru, pita, bete, dada, mama, sasur, potay, sala aur sambandhi...
tags: family conflict, guilt, dealing with grief

Sanskrit verse: एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्नतोऽपि मधुसूदन अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतुं किन्नु महीकृते
Translation (English): O Madhusudan, I do not wish to slay them even for sovereignty of the three worlds, what to speak of earth.
Hinglish (1): Hey Madhusudan, main inhe nahi maarna chahta, teenon lok ka rajya mile tab bhi nahi.
Hinglish (2): "Hey Madhusudan, main inhein maarna nahi chahta, bhale hi woh mujhe maar dein. Teeno loko ke rajya ke liye bhi nahi, toh is dharti ki kya baat hai."
message:
एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्नतोऽपि मधुसूदन अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतुं किन्नु महीकृते
O Madhusudan, I do not wish to slay them even for sovereignty of the three worlds, what to speak of earth.
Hey Madhusudan, main inhe nahi maarna chahta, teenon lok ka rajya mile tab bhi nahi.
tags: guilt, letting go of greed, Dharma

Sanskrit verse: न हि प्रीत्याऽस्य पापं कर्तव्यं वयं हत्वा स्वजनं हि कथं सुखिनः स्याम माधव
Translation (English): It is not proper to commit sin by killing our relatives; how can we be happy, O Madhav?
Hinglish (1): Apne logon ko maar ke kaise khush rahenge; paap lagega, hey Madhav.
Hinglish (2): "In Dhritarashtra ke beton ko maarkar humein kya khushi milegi? In atatayiyon ko maarkar toh humein paap hi lagega."
message:
न हि प्रीत्याऽस्य पापं कर्तव्यं वयं हत्वा स्वजनं हि कथं सुखिनः स्याम माधव
It is not proper to commit sin by killing our relatives; how can we be happy, O Madhav?
Apne logon ko maar ke kaise khush rahenge; paap lagega, hey Madhav.

Sanskrit verse: यद्यप्येते न पश्यन्ति लोभोपहतचेतसः कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं मित्रद्रोहे च पातकम्
Translation (English): Even if these, blinded by greed, see no evil in destroying families and betraying friends...
Hinglish (1): Ye lobh se andhe hain, na kul-naash ka paap dekh pa rahe hain, na dost-droh ka.
Hinglish (2): "Bhale hi inka mann laalach se bhrasht ho gaya hai aur yeh parivaar ko nasht karne ya doston se droh karne mein paap nahi dekhte..."
Summary: Contrasts his awareness with their ignorance.
message:
यद्यप्येते न पश्यन्ति लोभोपहतचेतसः कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं मित्रद्रोहे च पातकम्
Even if these, blinded by greed, see no evil in destroying families and betraying friends...
Ye lobh se andhe hain, na kul-naash ka paap dekh pa rahe hain, na dost-droh ka.
tags: letting go of greed, family conflict, negative thoughts

Sanskrit verse: कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभिः पापादस्मान्निवर्तितुम् कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भिर्जनार्दन
Translation (English): Why should we not turn away from sin, seeing the evil of family destruction, O Janardan?
Hinglish (1): Jab hume pata hai kul-naash paap hai, to kyun na bachen, hey Janardan?
Hinglish (2): "Toh hey Janardan, hum log, jo parivaar ko nasht karne ke dosh ko saaf-saaf dekh sakte hain, is paap se peechhe kyun na hatein?"
Summary: Sees moral clarity as guiding principle.
message:
कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभिः पापादस्मान्निवर्तितुम् कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भिर्जनार्दन
Why should we not turn away from sin, seeing the evil of family destruction, O Janardan?
Jab hume pata hai kul-naash paap hai, to kyun na bachen, hey Janardan?

Sanskrit verse: कुलक्षये प्रणश्यन्ति कुलधर्माः सनातनाः धर्मे नष्टे कुलं कृत्स्नमधर्मोऽभिभवत्युत
Translation (English): When the dynasty perishes, eternal family traditions vanish and lawlessness overwhelms.
Hinglish (1): Kul ke binash se parampara mit jaati hai, aur dharm tootne par adharma gher leta hai.
Hinglish (2): "Parivaar ke nasht hone se, purane kul-dharm (family traditions) bhi nasht ho jaate hain. Aur dharm ke nasht hone par poore kul mein adharm phail jaata hai."
message:
कुलक्षये प्रणश्यन्ति कुलधर्माः सनातनाः धर्मे नष्टे कुलं कृत्स्नमधर्मोऽभिभवत्युत
When the dynasty perishes, eternal family traditions vanish and lawlessness overwhelms.
Kul ke binash se parampara mit jaati hai, aur dharm tootne par adharma gher leta hai.

Sanskrit verse: अधर्माभिभवात्कृष्ण प्रदुष्यन्ति कुलस्त्रियः स्त्रीषु दुष्टासु वार्ष्णेय जायते वर्णसङ्करः
Translation (English): From lawlessness, O Krishna, women become corrupted; from this arises unwanted progeny.
Hinglish (1): Adharm badhne par striyan bigad jaati hain, aur varna-sankar hota hai.
Hinglish (2): "Hey Krishna, jab adharm badh jaata hai, toh kul ki striyan dushit ho jaati hain. Aur striyon ke dushit hone se, hey Vrishni-vanshi, varn-sankar (unwanted progeny) utpann hota hai."
Summary: Links moral decay to social chaos.
message:
अधर्माभिभवात्कृष्ण प्रदुष्यन्ति कुलस्त्रियः स्त्रीषु दुष्टासु वार्ष्णेय जायते वर्णसङ्करः
From lawlessness, O Krishna, women become corrupted; from this arises unwanted progeny.
Adharm badhne par striyan bigad jaati hain, aur varna-sankar hota hai.

Sanskrit verse: सङ्करो नरकायैव कुलघ्नानां कुलस्य च पतन्ति पितरो ह्येषां लुप्तपिण्डोदकक्रियाः
Translation (English): Such unwanted progeny consign family destroyers and their families to hell, ending ancestor offerings.
Hinglish (1): Aisi santaan se kul narak jaata hai, pind-daan ruk jaata hai.
Hinglish (2): "Varn-sankar se kul ko nasht karne waalon ko aur unke kul ko narak mein jaana padta hai. Unke pitar bhi pind-daan aur jal-kriya na milne se neeche gir jaate hain."
message:
सङ्करो नरकायैव कुलघ्नानां कुलस्य च पतन्ति पितरो ह्येषां लुप्तपिण्डोदकक्रियाः
Such unwanted progeny consign family destroyers and their families to hell, ending ancestor offerings.
Aisi santaan se kul narak jaata hai, pind-daan ruk jaata hai.

Sanskrit verse: दोषैरेतैः कुलघ्नानां वर्णसङ्करकारकैः उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मनुष्याणां जनार्दन
Translation (English): Due to these sins creating unwanted progeny, family traditions perish, O Janardan.
Hinglish (1): Hey Janardan, in paapon se kul dharm mit jaata hai.
Hinglish (2): "Kul-ghatiyon ke in varn-sankar paida karne waale doshon se, jaati-dharm aur kul-dharm dono hi nasht ho jaate hain."
message:
दोषैरेतैः कुलघ्नानां वर्णसङ्करकारकैः उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मनुष्याणां जनार्दन
Due to these sins creating unwanted progeny, family traditions perish, O Janardan.
Hey Janardan, in paapon se kul dharm mit jaata hai.

Sanskrit verse: उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मानवाः पतन्त्यधः
Translation (English): Without family traditions, such people go to hell.
Hinglish (1): Kul dharm ke bina, log adhogati ko prapt hote hain.
Hinglish (2): "Hey Janardan, humne suna hai ki jinke kul-dharm nasht ho jaate hain, un manushyon ko hamesha narak mein rehna padta hai."
message:
उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मानवाः पतन्त्यधः
Without family traditions, such people go to hell.
Kul dharm ke bina, log adhogati ko prapt hote hain.

Sanskrit verse: अहो वत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम् यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यता
Translation (English): Alas, driven by greed for royal happiness, we prepare to kill relatives — a great sin.
Hinglish (1): Haye! Rajya ke lobh me apne logon ko maarne ko taiyar hain hum.
Hinglish (2): "Afsos! Hum kitna bada paap karne jaa rahe hain. Sirf rajya aur sukh ke laalach mein, hum apne hi logon ko maarne par tule hain."
message:
अहो वत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम् यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यता
Alas, driven by greed for royal happiness, we prepare to kill relatives — a great sin.
Haye! Rajya ke lobh me apne logon ko maarne ko taiyar hain hum.
tags: guilt, letting go of greed, negative thoughts

Sanskrit verse: यदि मामप्रतीकारमशस्त्रं शस्त्रपाणयः धार्तराष्ट्रा रणे हन्युस्तन्मे क्षेमतरं भवेत्
Translation (English): If the sons of Dhritarashtra kill me unarmed and unresisting, that is better for me.
Hinglish (1): Agar Kaurav mujhe bina hathiyar ke maar dein, to behtar hai.
Hinglish (2): "Mere liye yeh zyada behtar hoga ki Dhritarashtra ke bete hathiyar lekar, mujhe nihatthe aur virodh na karne waale ko is yuddh-bhoomi mein maar daalein."
message:
यदि मामप्रतीकारमशस्त्रं शस्त्रपाणयः धार्तराष्ट्रा रणे हन्युस्तन्मे क्षेमतरं भवेत्
If the sons of Dhritarashtra kill me unarmed and unresisting, that is better for me.
Agar Kaurav mujhe bina hathiyar ke maar dein, to behtar hai.
tags: depression, dealing with grief, fear of failure

Sanskrit verse: सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्त्वार्जुनः संख्ये रथोपस्थ उपाविशत् विसृज्य सशरं चापं शोकसंविग्नमानसः
Translation (English): Sanjay said: Speaking thus, Arjuna set aside his bow and arrows and sat down on the chariot, grief‑stricken.
Hinglish (1): Sanjay bola: Aisa kehkar Arjun ne dhanush-baan rakh diye aur shok se bhar gaya.
Hinglish (2): "Sanjay ne kaha: Yuddh-bhoomi mein aisa kehkar, Arjun ne apna dhanush-baan alag rakh diya aur shok se bhare mann ke saath rath ke pichhle hisse mein baith gaya."
Summary: Arjuna’s refusal to fight sets up Krishna’s teachings in the next chapter.
message:
सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्त्वार्जुनः संख्ये रथोपस्थ उपाविशत् विसृज्य सशरं चापं शोकसंविग्नमानसः
Sanjay said: Speaking thus, Arjuna set aside his bow and arrows and sat down on the chariot, grief‑stricken.
Sanjay bola: Aisa kehkar Arjun ne dhanush-baan rakh diye aur shok se bhar gaya.
tags: depression, dealing with grief, burnout at work

Sanskrit verse: सञ्जय उवाच तं तथा कृपयाविष्टमश्रुपूर्णाकुलेक्षणम् विषीदन्तमिदं वाक्यमुवाच मधुसूदनः
Translation (English): Sanjay said: Seeing Arjuna full of compassion, with sorrowful, tear-filled eyes, Madhusudan spoke these words.
Hinglish (1): Sanjay bola: Arjun ko daya se bhara, aansuon se bhari aankhon wala dekh, Madhusudan bole.
Hinglish (2): Sanjay ne kaha: Jab Shri Krishna ne Arjun ko is tarah karuna se bhara, dukhi aur aansuon se bhari aankhon waala dekha, tab unhone yeh shabd kahe.
Summary: Krishna addresses Arjuna, who is overwhelmed with grief on the battlefield.
message:
सञ्जय उवाच तं तथा कृपयाविष्टमश्रुपूर्णाकुलेक्षणम् विषीदन्तमिदं वाक्यमुवाच मधुसूदनः
Sanjay said: Seeing Arjuna full of compassion, with sorrowful, tear-filled eyes, Madhusudan spoke these words.
Sanjay bola: Arjun ko daya se bhara, aansuon se bhari aankhon wala dekh, Madhusudan bole.

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच कुतस्त्वा कश्मलमिदं विषमे समुपस्थितम् अनार्यजुष्टमस्वर्ग्यमकीर्तिकरमर्जुन
Translation (English): Shri Bhagavan said: Arjuna, from where has this weakness come upon you at this critical hour? It is not befitting, it does not lead to heaven, and brings infamy.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Arjun, is sankat ki ghadi mein yeh kamzori tumhare andar kahan se aayi? Yeh na toh shreshth logon ka kaam hai, na swarg dilati hai, balki sirf apmaan ka kaaran banti hai.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Arjun, is mushkil ghadi mein, yeh kamzori tum par haavi kaise ho gayi? Yeh na toh shreshth logon ke anuroop hai, na swarg dilati hai, aur na hi isse yash milta hai.
Summary: Krishna rebukes Arjuna for succumbing to unmanliness in a crisis.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच कुतस्त्वा कश्मलमिदं विषमे समुपस्थितम् अनार्यजुष्टमस्वर्ग्यमकीर्तिकरमर्जुन
Shri Bhagavan said: Arjuna, from where has this weakness come upon you at this critical hour? It is not befitting, it does not lead to heaven, and brings infamy.
Shri Krishna ne kaha: Arjun, is sankat ki ghadi mein yeh kamzori tumhare andar kahan se aayi? Yeh na toh shreshth logon ka kaam hai, na swarg dilati hai, balki sirf apmaan ka kaaran banti hai.
tags: overcoming self-doubt, fear of failure, depression

Sanskrit verse: क्लैब्यं मा स्म गमः पार्थ नैतत्त्वय्युपपद्यते क्षुद्रं हृदयदौर्बल्यं त्यक्त्वोत्तिष्ठ परन्तप
Translation (English): Do not yield to cowardice, O Parth; it is unworthy of you. Abandon this petty weakness of heart and arise, O chastiser of enemies.
Hinglish (1): Hey Parth, aisi kamzori mat dikhao. Apne dil ki is chhoti si baat ko chhodkar utho aur lado, hey shatru-vijeta!
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, is napunsakta ko mat praapt ho, yeh tumhe shobha nahi deti. Apne dil ki is chhoti si kamzori ko tyag kar yuddh ke liye utho, hey shatru-vijeta!
Summary: Krishna urges Arjuna to rise above weakness and fight.
message:
क्लैब्यं मा स्म गमः पार्थ नैतत्त्वय्युपपद्यते क्षुद्रं हृदयदौर्बल्यं त्यक्त्वोत्तिष्ठ परन्तप
Do not yield to cowardice, O Parth; it is unworthy of you. Abandon this petty weakness of heart and arise, O chastiser of enemies.
Hey Parth, aisi kamzori mat dikhao. Apne dil ki is chhoti si baat ko chhodkar utho aur lado, hey shatru-vijeta!
tags: overcoming self-doubt, depression, lack of focus

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच कथं भीष्ममहं संख्ये द्रोणं च मधुसूदन इषुभिः प्रतियोत्स्यामि पूजार्हावरिसूदन
Translation (English): Arjuna said: O Madhusudan, how can I fight Bhishma and Drona with arrows? They are worthy of my worship, O destroyer of enemies.
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Madhusudan, main Bhishma aur Drona par teer kaise chalaun, jo poojne layak hain?
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Madhusudan, main yuddh mein Bheeshma aur Drona jaise poojniya logon par teeron se kaise prahaar kar sakta hoon?
Summary: Arjuna is torn between his duty as a warrior and respect for his elders.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच कथं भीष्ममहं संख्ये द्रोणं च मधुसूदन इषुभिः प्रतियोत्स्यामि पूजार्हावरिसूदन
Arjuna said: O Madhusudan, how can I fight Bhishma and Drona with arrows? They are worthy of my worship, O destroyer of enemies.
Arjun bola: Madhusudan, main Bhishma aur Drona par teer kaise chalaun, jo poojne layak hain?

Sanskrit verse: गुरूनहत्वा हि महानुभावाञ्छ्रेयो भोक्तुं भैक्ष्यमपीह लोके हत्वार्थकामांस्तु गुरूनिहैव भुञ्जीय भोगान्रुधिरप्रदिग्धान्
Translation (English): Better to live by begging in this world than to kill these great-souled teachers; killing them would taint our enjoyments with blood.
Hinglish (1): Bhiksha maang kar jeena behtar hai bajaye mahan guruon ko maarne ke; unka khoon sukh ko daag laga dega.
Hinglish (2): Aise mahaan guruon ko maarne se toh behtar hai ki is duniya mein bheekh maang kar jeevan guzaar loon. Kyunki unhe maarkar jo bhi rajya-sukh milega, woh toh khoon se sana hua hoga.
Summary: Arjuna prioritizes moral values over material wealth.
message:
गुरूनहत्वा हि महानुभावाञ्छ्रेयो भोक्तुं भैक्ष्यमपीह लोके हत्वार्थकामांस्तु गुरूनिहैव भुञ्जीय भोगान्रुधिरप्रदिग्धान्
Better to live by begging in this world than to kill these great-souled teachers; killing them would taint our enjoyments with blood.
Bhiksha maang kar jeena behtar hai bajaye mahan guruon ko maarne ke; unka khoon sukh ko daag laga dega.
tags: guilt, job dissatisfaction, finding career purpose

Sanskrit verse: न चैतद्विद्मः कतरन्नो गरीयो यद्वा जयेम यदि वा नो जयेयुः यानेव हत्वा न जिजीविषामस्तेऽवस्थिताः प्रक्ति
Translation (English): We do not know which will be better for us—to conquer them or be conquered by them. Even after killing them, we would not wish to live.
Hinglish (1): Hume pata hi nahi jeetna behtar hai ya harna; unhe maar kar jeena nahi chahenge.
Hinglish (2): Hum yeh bhi nahi jaante ki humare liye kya behtar hai - un par jeet haasil karna ya unse haar jaana. Jinhe maarkar hum jeena bhi nahi chahenge, wahi Dhritarashtra ke bete humare saamne khade hain.
Summary: Arjuna cannot see a victorious outcome as desirable.
message:
न चैतद्विद्मः कतरन्नो गरीयो यद्वा जयेम यदि वा नो जयेयुः यानेव हत्वा न जिजीविषामस्तेऽवस्थिताः प्रक्ति
We do not know which will be better for us—to conquer them or be conquered by them. Even after killing them, we would not wish to live.
Hume pata hi nahi jeetna behtar hai ya harna; unhe maar kar jeena nahi chahenge.
tags: confusion, indecision, feeling lost in life

Sanskrit verse: कार्पण्यदोषोपहतस्वभावः पृच्छामि त्वां धर्मसम्मूढचेताः यच्छ्रेयः स्यान्निश्चितं ब्रूहि तन्मे शिष्यस्तेऽहं शाधि मां त्वां प्रपन्नम्
Translation (English): My nature is overcome with weakness, my mind is confused about duty; I ask you, tell me what is best. I am your disciple; instruct me, for I have surrendered to you.
Hinglish (1): Mera swabhav kamzor pad gaya hai aur main dharm ke baare mein uljhan mein hoon. Main aapka shishya hoon, kripya mujhe raasta dikhayein.
Hinglish (2): Mera mann aur swabhav kamzori se ghir gaya hai aur mujhe apne kartavya (Dharma) ke baare mein kuch samajh nahi aa raha. Main aapse poochhta hoon, jo nishchit roop se mere liye kalyankari ho, woh bataiye. Main aapka shishya hoon, aapki sharan mein hoon, kripya mujhe maarg dikhayein.
Summary: Arjuna formally surrenders to Krishna for guidance.
message:
कार्पण्यदोषोपहतस्वभावः पृच्छामि त्वां धर्मसम्मूढचेताः यच्छ्रेयः स्यान्निश्चितं ब्रूहि तन्मे शिष्यस्तेऽहं शाधि मां त्वां प्रपन्नम्
My nature is overcome with weakness, my mind is confused about duty; I ask you, tell me what is best. I am your disciple; instruct me, for I have surrendered to you.
Mera swabhav kamzor pad gaya hai aur main dharm ke baare mein uljhan mein hoon. Main aapka shishya hoon, kripya mujhe raasta dikhayein.

Sanskrit verse: न हि प्रपश्यामि ममापनुद्याद्यच्छोकमुछोषणमिन्द्रियाणामवाप्य भूमावसपत्नमृद्धं राज्यं सुराणामपि चाधिपत्यम्
Translation (English): I do not see how to remove the sorrow drying up my senses, even with an unrivalled kingdom on earth or sovereignty over the gods.
Hinglish (1): Mujhe dukh khatm hota nahi dikh raha, chahe poora rajya mil jaye ya dev rajya bhi.
Hinglish (2): Mujhe aisa koi upaay nahi dikh raha jo mere is shok ko door kar sake, bhale hi mujhe dharti par ek nishkantak, samriddh rajya ya devtaon ka swami-pan bhi mil jaaye.
Summary: Material rewards cannot counter Arjuna’s deep grief.
message:
न हि प्रपश्यामि ममापनुद्याद्यच्छोकमुछोषणमिन्द्रियाणामवाप्य भूमावसपत्नमृद्धं राज्यं सुराणामपि चाधिपत्यम्
I do not see how to remove the sorrow drying up my senses, even with an unrivalled kingdom on earth or sovereignty over the gods.
Mujhe dukh khatm hota nahi dikh raha, chahe poora rajya mil jaye ya dev rajya bhi.

Sanskrit verse: सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्त्वा हृषीकेशं गुडाकेशः पार्थः न योत्स्य इति गोविन्दमुक्त्वा तूष्णीं बभूव ह
Translation (English): Having said to Hrishikesha, "I will not fight," Gudakesha (Arjuna) fell silent.
Hinglish (1): Aisa kehkar “Main nahi ladunga”, Arjun chup ho gaya.
Hinglish (2): Sanjay ne kaha: Hey Rajan, aisa kehne ke baad, shatruon ko taap dene waale Arjun ne Krishna se kaha, "Main yuddh nahi karunga," aur chup ho gaye.
Summary: Arjuna’s refusal is firm at this point.
message:
सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्त्वा हृषीकेशं गुडाकेशः पार्थः न योत्स्य इति गोविन्दमुक्त्वा तूष्णीं बभूव ह
Having said to Hrishikesha, "I will not fight," Gudakesha (Arjuna) fell silent.
Aisa kehkar “Main nahi ladunga”, Arjun chup ho gaya.
tags: depression, indecision, feeling lost in life

Sanskrit verse: तमुवाच हृषीकेशः प्रहसन्निव भारत सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये विषीदन्तमिदं वचः
Translation (English): Hrishikesh, as if smiling, spoke these words to the grieving Arjuna, in the midst of both armies.
Hinglish (1): Krishna muskurate hue dono senaon ke beech pareshan Arjun se bole.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharatvanshi, tab dono senaon ke beech, us shok-magn Arjun se Shri Krishna ne muskurate hue yeh vachan kahe.
Summary: Krishna prepares to impart deep teachings.
message:
तमुवाच हृषीकेशः प्रहसन्निव भारत सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये विषीदन्तमिदं वचः
Hrishikesh, as if smiling, spoke these words to the grieving Arjuna, in the midst of both armies.
Krishna muskurate hue dono senaon ke beech pareshan Arjun se bole.

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच अशोच्यानन्वशोचस्त्वं प्रज्ञावादांश्च भाषसे गतासूनगतासूंश्च नानुशोचन्ति पण्डिताः
Translation (English): You grieve for those who should not be grieved for, yet speak words of wisdom. The wise lament neither the living nor the dead.
Hinglish (1): Tum jinke liye shok nahi karna chahiye unke liye ro rahe ho, aur gyaan ki baatein kar rhe ho; buddhiwan na jeevit ke liye rote hain na mrit ke. (the difference between the wise and the ignorant)
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Tum unke liye shok kar rahe ho jinke liye shok nahi karna chahiye, aur baatein gyaan ki kar rahe ho. Jo pandit (gyaani) hote hain, ve na toh jeevit aur na hi mrit vyakti ke liye shok karte hain.
Summary: Krishna introduces the difference between the wise and the ignorant.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच अशोच्यानन्वशोचस्त्वं प्रज्ञावादांश्च भाषसे गतासूनगतासूंश्च नानुशोचन्ति पण्डिताः
You grieve for those who should not be grieved for, yet speak words of wisdom. The wise lament neither the living nor the dead.
Tum jinke liye shok nahi karna chahiye unke liye ro rahe ho, aur gyaan ki baatein kar rhe ho; buddhiwan na jeevit ke liye rote hain na mrit ke. (the difference between the wise and the ignorant)
tags: dealing with grief, fear of death, inner peace

Sanskrit verse: न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपाः न चैव न भविष्यामः सर्वे वयमतः परम्
Translation (English): Never was there a time when I did not exist, nor you, nor all these kings; nor will any of us cease to exist in the future.
Hinglish (1): (The soul is eternal); Kabhi aisa samay nahi tha jab main, tum, aur yeh sabhi jeevit nhi the; aage bhi hum kabhi mrit nahi honge.
Hinglish (2): Aisa kabhi nahi hua ki main nahi tha, ya tum nahi the, ya yeh sab raja nahi the. Aur na hi bhavishya mein aisa hoga ki hum sab nahi rahenge.
Summary: Teaches the eternal nature of the soul.
message:
न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपाः न चैव न भविष्यामः सर्वे वयमतः परम्
Never was there a time when I did not exist, nor you, nor all these kings; nor will any of us cease to exist in the future.
(The soul is eternal); Kabhi aisa samay nahi tha jab main, tum, aur yeh sabhi jeevit nhi the; aage bhi hum kabhi mrit nahi honge.

Sanskrit verse: देहिनोऽस्मिन्यथा देहे कौमारं यौवनं जरा तथा देहान्तरप्राप्तिर्धीरस्तत्र न मुह्यति
Translation (English): Just as the soul passes in this body from childhood to youth to old age, so it passes into another body; the wise are not deluded by this.
Hinglish (1): Jaise body mein aatma bachpan, fir jawani, fir budhapa se guzarti hai, waise hi ek sharir se doosre sharir se bhi guzarti hai; the wise are not deluded by this. (reincarnation)
Hinglish (2): Jaise is shareer mein aatma bachpan se jawani aur jawani se budhape mein jaati hai, theek usi tarah mrityu ke baad aatma doosre shareer mein chali jaati hai. Dheeryavaan vyakti isse mohit nahi hota.
message:
देहिनोऽस्मिन्यथा देहे कौमारं यौवनं जरा तथा देहान्तरप्राप्तिर्धीरस्तत्र न मुह्यति
Just as the soul passes in this body from childhood to youth to old age, so it passes into another body; the wise are not deluded by this.
Jaise body mein aatma bachpan, fir jawani, fir budhapa se guzarti hai, waise hi ek sharir se doosre sharir se bhi guzarti hai; the wise are not deluded by this. (reincarnation)

Sanskrit verse: मात्रास्पर्शास्तु कौन्तेय शीतोष्णसुखदुःखदाः आगमापायिनोऽनित्यास्तांस्तितिक्षस्व भारत
Translation (English): O son of Kunti, sensations of cold, heat, pleasure and pain are temporary; endure them, O Bharata.
Hinglish (1): Hey Kunti‑putra, garmi‑thand, sukh‑dukh aate‑jaate rahte hain; inhe seh lo (endure all experiences).
Hinglish (2): Hey Kunti-putra, sardi-garmi aur sukh-dukh ka anubhav indriyon ke vishayon se sampark se hota hai. Yeh aate-jaate rehte hain aur anitya hain. Inhe sehan karna seekho.
message:
मात्रास्पर्शास्तु कौन्तेय शीतोष्णसुखदुःखदाः आगमापायिनोऽनित्यास्तांस्तितिक्षस्व भारत
O son of Kunti, sensations of cold, heat, pleasure and pain are temporary; endure them, O Bharata.
Hey Kunti‑putra, garmi‑thand, sukh‑dukh aate‑jaate rahte hain; inhe seh lo (endure all experiences).
tags: how to stay calm, mental peace, equanimity

Sanskrit verse: यं हि न व्यथयन्त्येते पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ समदुःखसुखं धीरं सोऽमृतत्वाय कल्पते
Translation (English): O best among men, who is not disturbed by happiness and distress, and is steady — such a person is fit for liberation.
Hinglish (1): Jo sukh‑dukh me ek samaan rahta hai, wahi amrit pad ko praapt kar sakta hai. (if you arr not disturbed by happiness and distress, and you remain steady — then you will be fit for liberation).
Hinglish (2): Hey purush-shreshth, jo vyakti sukh aur dukh mein samaan rehta hai aur in anubhavon se vichlit nahi hota, wahi amaratva (Moksha) ke liye yogy hai.
message:
यं हि न व्यथयन्त्येते पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ समदुःखसुखं धीरं सोऽमृतत्वाय कल्पते
O best among men, who is not disturbed by happiness and distress, and is steady — such a person is fit for liberation.
Jo sukh‑dukh me ek samaan rahta hai, wahi amrit pad ko praapt kar sakta hai. (if you arr not disturbed by happiness and distress, and you remain steady — then you will be fit for liberation).

Sanskrit verse: नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सतः उभयोरपि दृष्टोऽन्तस्त्वनयोस्तत्त्वदर्शिभिः
Translation (English): The unreal has no existence; the real never ceases to be. The truth is seen by the seers of reality.
Hinglish (1): Jo cheez anitya (temporary) hai, jaise ki dukh-sukh, uska koi sthayi astitva nahi hai. Aur jo nitya (eternal) hai, jaise ki Aatma , uska kabhi ant ya abhaav nahi ho sakta. (Philosophical foundation about eternal reality.)
Hinglish (2): Jo asat (unreal) hai, uska koi astitva nahi hota, aur jo sat (real) hai, uska kabhi abhaav nahi hota. Tattva-darshi gyaaniyon ne in dono ke is sach ko dekha hai.
message:
नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सतः उभयोरपि दृष्टोऽन्तस्त्वनयोस्तत्त्वदर्शिभिः
The unreal has no existence; the real never ceases to be. The truth is seen by the seers of reality.
Jo cheez anitya (temporary) hai, jaise ki dukh-sukh, uska koi sthayi astitva nahi hai. Aur jo nitya (eternal) hai, jaise ki Aatma , uska kabhi ant ya abhaav nahi ho sakta. (Philosophical foundation about eternal reality.)

Sanskrit verse: अविनाशि तु तद्विद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् विनाशमव्ययस्यास्य न कश्चित्कर्तुमर्हति
Translation (English): Know that to be indestructible by which all this is pervaded; no one can destroy that imperishable reality.
Hinglish (1): Uss chetna (consciousness) ko avinashi jaano jo tumhare poore sharir mein vyaapt hai. Is amar tattva (immortal element) ka naash koi nahi kar sakta.
Hinglish (2): Us tattva ko avinashi jaano jisse yeh poora sansaar vyaapt hai. Is avinashi ka vinaash karne mein koi bhi samarth nahi hai.
Summary: Krishna speaks about the imperishable soul.
message:
अविनाशि तु तद्विद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् विनाशमव्ययस्यास्य न कश्चित्कर्तुमर्हति
Know that to be indestructible by which all this is pervaded; no one can destroy that imperishable reality.
Uss chetna (consciousness) ko avinashi jaano jo tumhare poore sharir mein vyaapt hai. Is amar tattva (immortal element) ka naash koi nahi kar sakta.

Sanskrit verse: अन्तवन्त इमे देहा नित्यस्योक्ताः शरीरिणः अनाशिनोऽप्रमेयस्य तस्माद्युध्यस्व भारत
Translation (English): These bodies are perishable; the soul within is eternal, indestructible, immeasurable. Therefore fight, O Bharata.
Hinglish (1): Sharir nasht hone wala hai, aatma amar hai; isliye hey Bharat, yudh karo (which is your duty).
Hinglish (2): Is amar, avinashi aur apramey aatma ke yeh shareer ant-waan (perishable) hain. Isliye, hey Bharat, tum yuddh karo.
Summary: Body is temporary but soul is eternal, hence duty must be done.
message:
अन्तवन्त इमे देहा नित्यस्योक्ताः शरीरिणः अनाशिनोऽप्रमेयस्य तस्माद्युध्यस्व भारत
These bodies are perishable; the soul within is eternal, indestructible, immeasurable. Therefore fight, O Bharata.
Sharir nasht hone wala hai, aatma amar hai; isliye hey Bharat, yudh karo (which is your duty).

Sanskrit verse: य एनं वेत्ति हन्तारं यश्चैनं मन्यते हतम् उभौ तौ न विजानीतो नायं हन्ति न हन्यते
Translation (English): He who thinks the soul kills, and he who thinks the soul is killed, both lack understanding. The soul kills not, nor is killed.
Hinglish (1): Jo yeh maanta hai ki Aatma hatya karti hai, ya jo yeh maanta hai ki Aatma ki hatya ho sakti hai, ve dono hi agyaani hain. Sach yeh hai ki Aatma na toh kisi ko maarti hai, aur na hi maari jaa sakti hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo is aatma ko maarne waala samajhta hai, aur jo ise mara hua maanta hai, ve dono hi nahi jaante. Kyunki yeh aatma na toh kisi ko maarti hai aur na hi kisi ke dwara maari jaati hai.
Summary: Krishna explains the spiritual nature of the self beyond death.
message:
य एनं वेत्ति हन्तारं यश्चैनं मन्यते हतम् उभौ तौ न विजानीतो नायं हन्ति न हन्यते
He who thinks the soul kills, and he who thinks the soul is killed, both lack understanding. The soul kills not, nor is killed.
Jo yeh maanta hai ki Aatma hatya karti hai, ya jo yeh maanta hai ki Aatma ki hatya ho sakti hai, ve dono hi agyaani hain. Sach yeh hai ki Aatma na toh kisi ko maarti hai, aur na hi maari jaa sakti hai.
tags: Atman, fear of death, dealing with grief

Sanskrit verse: न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचि न्नायं भूत्वा भविता वा न भूयः अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे
Translation (English): The soul is never born, nor does it die; having once been, it never ceases to be. It is unborn, eternal, everlasting, and primeval; it is not slain when the body is slain.
Hinglish (1): Aatma na kabhi janm leti hai, na marti hai; yeh ajar, amar aur puratan hai (It is unborn, eternal, everlasting,).
Hinglish (2): Yeh aatma na kabhi janm leti hai aur na hi kabhi marti hai. Yeh hamesha se hai aur hamesha rahegi. Yeh ajanma, nitya, shaashvat aur puratan hai. Shareer ke maare jaane par bhi yeh nahi maari jaati.
Summary: Reinforces immortality and timelessness of the soul.
message:
न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचि न्नायं भूत्वा भविता वा न भूयः अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे
The soul is never born, nor does it die; having once been, it never ceases to be. It is unborn, eternal, everlasting, and primeval; it is not slain when the body is slain.
Aatma na kabhi janm leti hai, na marti hai; yeh ajar, amar aur puratan hai (It is unborn, eternal, everlasting,).

Sanskrit verse: वेदाविनाशिनं नित्यं य एनमजमव्ययम् कथं स पुरुषः पार्थ कं घातयति हन्ति कम्
Translation (English): He who knows the soul to be indestructible, eternal, unborn, and immutable—how can such a person kill or cause to be killed?
Hinglish (1): Jo jaanta hai aatma avinaashi hai, ajar hai, use kaise koi maar sakta hai ya marwa sakta hai? (Logic to inspire Arjuna to give up fear of killing on the soul’s level).
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, jo vyakti is aatma ko avinashi, nitya, ajanma aur avyaya jaanta hai, woh kaise kisi ko maar sakta hai ya marwa sakta hai?
Summary: Logic to inspire Arjuna to give up fear of killing on the soul’s level.
message:
वेदाविनाशिनं नित्यं य एनमजमव्ययम् कथं स पुरुषः पार्थ कं घातयति हन्ति कम्
He who knows the soul to be indestructible, eternal, unborn, and immutable—how can such a person kill or cause to be killed?
Jo jaanta hai aatma avinaashi hai, ajar hai, use kaise koi maar sakta hai ya marwa sakta hai? (Logic to inspire Arjuna to give up fear of killing on the soul’s level).
tags: Atman, fear of death, dealing with grief

Sanskrit verse: यथा सर्वाणि भूतानि शरीराणि विनश्यति तत्र शरीरिणः शरीराणि वदन्ति न केवलम्
Translation (English): Just as a person sheds worn‑out garments and puts on new ones, so the soul discards worn‑out bodies and takes new ones.
Hinglish (1): Jaise purane kapde utarke naye pehne jate hain, waise hi aatma purane sharir chhod ke naye leti hai.
Hinglish (2): Jaise manushya purane kapde utaar kar naye kapde pehen leta hai, theek usi tarah aatma purane aur bekaar shareeron ko tyag kar naye shareer dhaaran karti hai.
Summary: Explains reincarnation by a simple analogy.
message:
यथा सर्वाणि भूतानि शरीराणि विनश्यति तत्र शरीरिणः शरीराणि वदन्ति न केवलम्
Just as a person sheds worn‑out garments and puts on new ones, so the soul discards worn‑out bodies and takes new ones.
Jaise purane kapde utarke naye pehne jate hain, waise hi aatma purane sharir chhod ke naye leti hai.

Sanskrit verse: नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः न चैनं क्लेदयन्त्यापो न शोषयति मारुतः
Translation (English): Weapons do not cut the soul, fire does not burn it, water does not wet it, wind does not dry it.
Hinglish (1): Aatma na talwar kaat sakti hai, na aag jala sakti hai, na paani bhigo sakta hai, na hawa sukhha sakti hai. (The soul is beyond physical harm.)
Hinglish (2): Is aatma ko shastra nahi kaat sakte, aag nahi jala sakti, paani nahi gila kar sakta, aur hawa nahi sukha sakti.
Summary: The soul is beyond physical harm.
message:
नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः न चैनं क्लेदयन्त्यापो न शोषयति मारुतः
Weapons do not cut the soul, fire does not burn it, water does not wet it, wind does not dry it.
Aatma na talwar kaat sakti hai, na aag jala sakti hai, na paani bhigo sakta hai, na hawa sukhha sakti hai. (The soul is beyond physical harm.)

Sanskrit verse: अच्छेद्योऽयमदाह्योऽयमक्लेद्योऽशोष्य एव च नित्यः सर्वगतः स्थाणुरचलोऽयं सनातनः
Translation (English): The soul is uncuttable, incombustible, insoluble, and undryable; it is eternal, all‑pervading, stable, immovable, and everlasting.
Hinglish (1): Aatma kata nahi sakti, jalti nahi, bhigti nahi, sukhhti nahi; yeh nitya, sthir, aur sanatan hai. (The soul is uncuttable, incombustible, insoluble, and undryable; it is eternal, all‑pervading, stable, immovable, and everlasting.)
Hinglish (2): Yeh aatma achhedya, adaahya, akledya aur ashoshya hai. Yeh nitya, sarvavyapi, sthir, achal aur sanatan hai.
message:
अच्छेद्योऽयमदाह्योऽयमक्लेद्योऽशोष्य एव च नित्यः सर्वगतः स्थाणुरचलोऽयं सनातनः
The soul is uncuttable, incombustible, insoluble, and undryable; it is eternal, all‑pervading, stable, immovable, and everlasting.
Aatma kata nahi sakti, jalti nahi, bhigti nahi, sukhhti nahi; yeh nitya, sthir, aur sanatan hai. (The soul is uncuttable, incombustible, insoluble, and undryable; it is eternal, all‑pervading, stable, immovable, and everlasting.)

Sanskrit verse: अव्यक्तोऽयमचिन्त्योऽयमविकर्योऽयमुच्यते तस्मादेवं विदित्वैनं नानुशोचितुमर्हसि
Translation (English): The soul is said to be invisible, inconceivable, and immutable; knowing this, you should not grieve for the body.
Hinglish (1): Aatma adrishya, avichaarniya, aur avikari hai; (The soul is said to be invisible, inconceivable, and immutable); ise jaankar tumhe sharir par shok nahi karna chahiye.
Hinglish (2): Is aatma ko avyakt (unmanifested), achintya (inconceivable) aur avikari (unchangeable) kaha jaata hai. Isliye, aatma ke is swaroop ko jaankar tumhe shok nahi karna chahiye.
message:
अव्यक्तोऽयमचिन्त्योऽयमविकर्योऽयमुच्यते तस्मादेवं विदित्वैनं नानुशोचितुमर्हसि
The soul is said to be invisible, inconceivable, and immutable; knowing this, you should not grieve for the body.
Aatma adrishya, avichaarniya, aur avikari hai; (The soul is said to be invisible, inconceivable, and immutable); ise jaankar tumhe sharir par shok nahi karna chahiye.
tags: Atman, dealing with grief, mental peace

Sanskrit verse: अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम् तथापि त्वं महाबाहो नैवं शोचितुमर्हसि
Translation (English): Even if you think the soul is continuously born and dies forever, still, O mighty armed, you should not grieve.
Hinglish (1): Agar tum samjho ki aatma baar‑baar janm leti hai aur marta hai, tab bhi shok na karo.
Hinglish (2): Aur yadi tum maante ho ki yeh aatma hamesha janm leti hai aur hamesha marti hai, tab bhi, hey Mahabahu, tumhe is tarah shok nahi karna chahiye.
Summary: Even materialistic view offers no reason for grief.
message:
अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम् तथापि त्वं महाबाहो नैवं शोचितुमर्हसि
Even if you think the soul is continuously born and dies forever, still, O mighty armed, you should not grieve.
Agar tum samjho ki aatma baar‑baar janm leti hai aur marta hai, tab bhi shok na karo.
tags: dealing with grief, how to stop worrying

Sanskrit verse: जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृतस्य च तस्मादपरिहार्येऽर्थे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि
Translation (English): For the born, death is certain; for the dead, birth is certain. Therefore, you should not grieve over the inevitable.
Hinglish (1): Jo paida hota hai, uska marna nischit hai; jo mar gaya, uska janm nischit hai; isliye shok na karo.
Hinglish (2): Kyunki jisne janm liya hai, uski mrityu nishchit hai, aur jiski mrityu hui hai, uska janm nishchit hai. Isliye, jo anivarya hai, uske liye shok karna व्यर्थ hai.
Summary: Life and death are natural cycles.
message:
जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृतस्य च तस्मादपरिहार्येऽर्थे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि
For the born, death is certain; for the dead, birth is certain. Therefore, you should not grieve over the inevitable.
Jo paida hota hai, uska marna nischit hai; jo mar gaya, uska janm nischit hai; isliye shok na karo.
tags: fear of death, dealing with grief, reincarnation

Sanskrit verse: अव्यक्तादीनि भूतानि व्यक्तमध्यानि भारत अव्यक्तनिधनान्येव तत्र का परिदेवना
Translation (English): Beings are unmanifest in the beginning, manifest in the middle, and unmanifest again at the end; so why lament?
Hinglish (1): Hey Arjun, sabhi jeev janm se pehle aprakat (unmanifest) the, aur mrityu ke baad phir aprakat ho jaayenge. Ve sirf janm aur mrityu ke beech mein prakat (manifest) hote hain. Ismein shok karne jaisi kya baat hai?
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, sabhi jeev janm se pehle aprakat the, aur mrityu ke baad phir aprakat ho jaayenge. Ve sirf beech mein prakat hote hain. Toh ismein shok karne jaisi kya baat hai?
message:
अव्यक्तादीनि भूतानि व्यक्तमध्यानि भारत अव्यक्तनिधनान्येव तत्र का परिदेवना
Beings are unmanifest in the beginning, manifest in the middle, and unmanifest again at the end; so why lament?
Hey Arjun, sabhi jeev janm se pehle aprakat (unmanifest) the, aur mrityu ke baad phir aprakat ho jaayenge. Ve sirf janm aur mrityu ke beech mein prakat (manifest) hote hain. Ismein shok karne jaisi kya baat hai?
tags: dealing with grief, fear of death, what is the purpose of life

Sanskrit verse: आश्चर्यवत्पश्यति कश्चिदेनमाश्चर्यवद्वदति तथैव चान्यः आश्चर्यवच्चैनमन्यः शृणोति श्रुत्वाप्येनं वेद न चैव कश्चित्
Translation (English): Some see the soul as amazing, others speak of it as amazing, others hear of it as amazing; and even after hearing, none truly knows it.
Hinglish (1): Kuch log aatma ko adbhut dekhte hain, kuch bolte hain, kuch sunte hain, par janate koi nahi.
Hinglish (2): Koi is aatma ko aashcharya ki tarah dekhta hai, koi iska aashcharya ki tarah varnan karta hai, aur koi ise aashcharya ki tarah sunta hai. Par sunne ke baad bhi, koi ise vastav mein nahi jaan paata.
Summary: The profound nature of the soul eludes most.
message:
आश्चर्यवत्पश्यति कश्चिदेनमाश्चर्यवद्वदति तथैव चान्यः आश्चर्यवच्चैनमन्यः शृणोति श्रुत्वाप्येनं वेद न चैव कश्चित्
Some see the soul as amazing, others speak of it as amazing, others hear of it as amazing; and even after hearing, none truly knows it.
Kuch log aatma ko adbhut dekhte hain, kuch bolte hain, kuch sunte hain, par janate koi nahi.

Sanskrit verse: देही नित्यं अवध्योऽयं देहे सर्वस्य भारत तस्मात्सर्वाणि भूतानि न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि
Translation (English): The eternal soul in all bodies cannot be slain; therefore you should not grieve for any being.
Hinglish (1): Aatma nitya aur amar hai, isliye kisi ke liye shok na karo.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, sabke shareeron mein yeh aatma avadhya (jise maara na jaa sake) hai. Isliye, tumhe kisi bhi praani ke liye shok nahi karna chahiye.
message:
देही नित्यं अवध्योऽयं देहे सर्वस्य भारत तस्मात्सर्वाणि भूतानि न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि
The eternal soul in all bodies cannot be slain; therefore you should not grieve for any being.
Aatma nitya aur amar hai, isliye kisi ke liye shok na karo.
tags: Atman, dealing with grief, fear of death

Sanskrit verse: स्वधर्ममपि चावेक्ष्य न विकम्पितुमर्हसि धर्म्याद्धि युद्धाच्छ्रेयोऽन्यत् क्षत्रियस्य न विद्यते
Translation (English): Considering your duty as a warrior, you should not waver. For a Kshatriya, there is no better duty than a righteous war.
Hinglish (1): Apne kshatriya (warrior) dharm ko dekhkar tumhe kamzor nahi padna chahiye; dharmik yudh se acha aur kuch nahi.
Hinglish (2): Apne swa-dharm (kartavya) ko dekhte hue bhi, tumhe vichlit nahi hona chahiye, kyunki ek kshatriya ke liye dharm-yuddh se badhkar koi aur kalyankari kaam nahi hai.
message:
स्वधर्ममपि चावेक्ष्य न विकम्पितुमर्हसि धर्म्याद्धि युद्धाच्छ्रेयोऽन्यत् क्षत्रियस्य न विद्यते
Considering your duty as a warrior, you should not waver. For a Kshatriya, there is no better duty than a righteous war.
Apne kshatriya (warrior) dharm ko dekhkar tumhe kamzor nahi padna chahiye; dharmik yudh se acha aur kuch nahi.
tags: Dharma, job dissatisfaction, finding career purpose

Sanskrit verse: यदृच्छया चोपपन्नं स्वर्गद्वारमपावृतम् सुखिनः क्षत्रियाः पार्थ लभन्ते युद्धमीदृशम्
Translation (English): Happy are the Kshatriyas to whom such a war comes unsought, opening the gates of heaven.
Hinglish (1): Hey Parth, jo yudh apne aap milta hai aur swarg ka dwar kholta hai, woh kshatriya (warriors) bade bhagyashali hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, jin kshatriyon ko bina maange aisa yuddh ka avsar milta hai, ve sukhi hote hain, kyunki yeh unke liye swarg ke khule hue dwaar ke samaan hai.
message:
यदृच्छया चोपपन्नं स्वर्गद्वारमपावृतम् सुखिनः क्षत्रियाः पार्थ लभन्ते युद्धमीदृशम्
Happy are the Kshatriyas to whom such a war comes unsought, opening the gates of heaven.
Hey Parth, jo yudh apne aap milta hai aur swarg ka dwar kholta hai, woh kshatriya (warriors) bade bhagyashali hote hain.

Sanskrit verse: अथ चैनं धर्म्यमेवं संग्रामं न करिष्यसि ततः स्वधर्मं कीर्तिं च हित्वा पापमवाप्स्यसि
Translation (English): If you do not fight this righteous war, you will sin, abandoning your duty and honor.
Hinglish (1): Agar tum yeh dharmik yudh nahi ladoge to tum paap karoge, apna dharm aur maan chhodkar.
Hinglish (2): Kintu, yadi tum yeh dharm-yuddh nahi karoge, toh tum apne swa-dharm aur yash ko khokar paap ke bhagi banoge.
Summary: Warns of moral and social consequences of retreat.
message:
अथ चैनं धर्म्यमेवं संग्रामं न करिष्यसि ततः स्वधर्मं कीर्तिं च हित्वा पापमवाप्स्यसि
If you do not fight this righteous war, you will sin, abandoning your duty and honor.
Agar tum yeh dharmik yudh nahi ladoge to tum paap karoge, apna dharm aur maan chhodkar.

Sanskrit verse: अकीर्तिं चापि भूतानि कथयिष्यन्ति तेऽव्ययाम् सम्भावितस्य चाकीर्तिर्मरणादतिरिच्यते
Translation (English): People will speak of your disgrace forever; for the honored, dishonor is worse than death.
Hinglish (1): Log tumhari badnaami hamesha karenge; sammanit vyakti ke liye badnaami maut se bhi buri hai.
Hinglish (2): Log hamesha tumhari badnami karenge. Aur ek sammanit vyakti ke liye, apmaan mrityu se bhi badhkar hota hai.
Summary: Stresses the shame of renouncing duty.
message:
अकीर्तिं चापि भूतानि कथयिष्यन्ति तेऽव्ययाम् सम्भावितस्य चाकीर्तिर्मरणादतिरिच्यते
People will speak of your disgrace forever; for the honored, dishonor is worse than death.
Log tumhari badnaami hamesha karenge; sammanit vyakti ke liye badnaami maut se bhi buri hai.
tags: fear of failure, dealing with jealousy, stress

Sanskrit verse: भयाद्रणादुपरतं मंस्यन्ते त्वां महा-रथाः येषां च त्वं बहुमतो भूत्वा यास्यसि लाघवम्
Translation (English): Great warriors will think you have withdrawn from battle out of fear; they held you in high esteem, and will now think little of you.
Hinglish (1): Mahan yoddha samjhenge ki tum dar kar yudh chhod gaye; jo tumhe maante the, tumhari beizzati karenge.
Hinglish (2): Jin maharathiyon ki nazar mein tum bahut sammanit ho, woh sochenge ki tumne dar ke kaaran yuddh chhod diya, aur ve tumhe tuchchh samajhne lagenge.
message:
भयाद्रणादुपरतं मंस्यन्ते त्वां महा-रथाः येषां च त्वं बहुमतो भूत्वा यास्यसि लाघवम्
Great warriors will think you have withdrawn from battle out of fear; they held you in high esteem, and will now think little of you.
Mahan yoddha samjhenge ki tum dar kar yudh chhod gaye; jo tumhe maante the, tumhari beizzati karenge.
tags: fear of failure, overcoming self-doubt, stress

Sanskrit verse: अवाच्यवादांश्च बहून्वदिष्यन्ति तवाहिताः निन्दन्तस्तव सामर्थ्यं ततो दुःखतरं नु किम्
Translation (English): Your enemies will speak many unmentionable words, slandering your ability; what could be more painful than that?
Hinglish (1): Tumhare dushman tumhara apmaan karenge; isse bada dukh aur kya hoga?
Hinglish (2): Tumhare shatru tumhari kshamta ki ninda karte hue bahut se na kehne yogya shabd kahenge. Isse zyada dukhdayi aur kya ho sakta hai?
Summary: Shame and insult as deterrents to abandoning battle.
message:
अवाच्यवादांश्च बहून्वदिष्यन्ति तवाहिताः निन्दन्तस्तव सामर्थ्यं ततो दुःखतरं नु किम्
Your enemies will speak many unmentionable words, slandering your ability; what could be more painful than that?
Tumhare dushman tumhara apmaan karenge; isse bada dukh aur kya hoga?
tags: negative thoughts, stress, dealing with jealousy

Sanskrit verse: हतो वा प्राप्स्यसि स्वर्गं जित्वा वा भोक्ष्यसे महीम् तस्मादुत्तिष्ठ कौन्तेय युद्धाय कृतनिश्चयः
Translation (English): Slain, you attain heaven; victorious, you enjoy the earth. Therefore, O son of Kunti, arise with determination for battle.
Hinglish (1): Agar margaye to swarg milega; jeet gaye to dharti ka sukh. Isliye hey Kunti-putra, purn sankalp se uth kar yudh karo.
Hinglish (2): Yadi tum maare jaoge toh swarg prapt karoge, aur yadi jeet jaoge toh prithvi ke sukh bhogoge. Isliye, hey Kunti-putra, yuddh ka nishchay karke khade ho jao.
Summary: Krishna presents both outcomes as beneficial.
message:
हतो वा प्राप्स्यसि स्वर्गं जित्वा वा भोक्ष्यसे महीम् तस्मादुत्तिष्ठ कौन्तेय युद्धाय कृतनिश्चयः
Slain, you attain heaven; victorious, you enjoy the earth. Therefore, O son of Kunti, arise with determination for battle.
Agar margaye to swarg milega; jeet gaye to dharti ka sukh. Isliye hey Kunti-putra, purn sankalp se uth kar yudh karo.

Sanskrit verse: सुखदुःखे समे कृत्वा लाभालाभौ जयाजयौ ततः युद्धाय युज्यस्व नैवं पापमवाप्स्यसि
Translation (English): Treat pleasure and pain, gain and loss, victory and defeat alike, and then fight—you will not incur sin.
Hinglish (1): Sukh-dukh, labh-hani, jeet-har ko samaan samajhkar yudh karo; paap nahi lagega.
Hinglish (2): Sukh-dukh, laabh-haani, aur jeet-haar ko ek samaan maankar yuddh ke liye taiyaar ho jao. Aisa karne se tumhe paap nahi lagega.
Summary: Teaches equanimity as the basis of action.
message:
सुखदुःखे समे कृत्वा लाभालाभौ जयाजयौ ततः युद्धाय युज्यस्व नैवं पापमवाप्स्यसि
Treat pleasure and pain, gain and loss, victory and defeat alike, and then fight—you will not incur sin.
Sukh-dukh, labh-hani, jeet-har ko samaan samajhkar yudh karo; paap nahi lagega.
tags: equanimity, mental peace, detachment, Nishkama Karma

Sanskrit verse: एषा तेऽभिहिता साङ्ख्ये बुद्धिर्योगे त्विमां शृणु बुद्ध्या युक्तो यया पार्थ कर्मबन्धं प्रहास्यसि
Translation (English): This I have spoken to you from the perspective of knowledge; now hear it from the perspective of yoga, by which you will be freed from karma‑bondage.
Hinglish (1): Mainne tumhe gyaan roop me kaha; ab yoga (connection with God, Union) roop me suno, jisse karm ka bandhan toot jata hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, maine yeh buddhi tumhe gyaan-yog (Sankhya) ke sandarbh mein batayi. Ab ise karm-yog ke sandarbh mein suno, jisse yukt hokar tum karmon ke bandhan ko kaat doge.
Summary: Krishna transitions from philosophy to practical application.
message:
एषा तेऽभिहिता साङ्ख्ये बुद्धिर्योगे त्विमां शृणु बुद्ध्या युक्तो यया पार्थ कर्मबन्धं प्रहास्यसि
This I have spoken to you from the perspective of knowledge; now hear it from the perspective of yoga, by which you will be freed from karma‑bondage.
Mainne tumhe gyaan roop me kaha; ab yoga (connection with God, Union) roop me suno, jisse karm ka bandhan toot jata hai.

Sanskrit verse: नेहाभिक्रमनाशोऽस्ति प्रत्यवायो न विद्यते स्वल्पमप्यस्य धर्मस्य त्रायते महतो भयात
Translation (English): In this path, no effort is lost, nor is there any harm; even a little of this dharma protects one from great fear.
Hinglish (1): Is marg par koi mehnat bekar nahi jaati; thoda sa bhi dharm bada bhay door karta hai.
Hinglish (2): Is (karm-yog) ke maarg par ki gayi shuruaat kabhi nasht nahi hoti, aur na hi koi vipreet parinaam hota hai. Is dharm ka thoda sa bhi paalan bade se bade bhay se raksha karta hai.
Summary: Encouragement to take the first step in yoga.
message:
नेहाभिक्रमनाशोऽस्ति प्रत्यवायो न विद्यते स्वल्पमप्यस्य धर्मस्य त्रायते महतो भयात
In this path, no effort is lost, nor is there any harm; even a little of this dharma protects one from great fear.
Is marg par koi mehnat bekar nahi jaati; thoda sa bhi dharm bada bhay door karta hai.

Sanskrit verse: व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिरेकेह कुरुनन्दन बहुशाखा ह्यनन्ताश्च बुद्धयोऽव्यवसायिनाम
Translation (English): Those with resolute intellect are single‑pointed, O joy of the Kurus; but for the irresolute, intelligence is many‑branched and endless.
Hinglish (1): Hey Kurunandan, ek path par nishchay karne wali buddhi ek hi lakshya par kendrit rehti hai. Lekin jinki buddhi sthir nahi hai, unki ichhayein anant shaakhaon mein bikhri rehti hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kurunandan, is maarg par nishchay-yukta buddhi ek hi hoti hai, kintu jinki buddhi avyavasthit hai, unki ichhayein anant shaakhaon mein bikhri rehti hain.
message:
व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिरेकेह कुरुनन्दन बहुशाखा ह्यनन्ताश्च बुद्धयोऽव्यवसायिनाम
Those with resolute intellect are single‑pointed, O joy of the Kurus; but for the irresolute, intelligence is many‑branched and endless.
Hey Kurunandan, ek path par nishchay karne wali buddhi ek hi lakshya par kendrit rehti hai. Lekin jinki buddhi sthir nahi hai, unki ichhayein anant shaakhaon mein bikhri rehti hain.
tags: lack of focus, indecision, finding purpose

Sanskrit verse: यामिमां पुष्पितां वाचं प्रवदन्त्यविपश्चितः वेदवादरताः पार्थ नान्यदस्तीति वादिनः
Translation (English): Unwise men speak flowery words, delighting in Vedic rituals, claiming there is nothing else.
Hinglish (1): Moorkh log vedic (superficial ritualism)  karma me atke rahte hain, aur kehte hain aur kuch nahi hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, jo aviveki log Vedon ke sundar shabdon mein hi khoye rehte hain aur kehte hain ki iske alawa aur kuch nahi hai...
message:
यामिमां पुष्पितां वाचं प्रवदन्त्यविपश्चितः वेदवादरताः पार्थ नान्यदस्तीति वादिनः
Unwise men speak flowery words, delighting in Vedic rituals, claiming there is nothing else.
Moorkh log vedic (superficial ritualism)  karma me atke rahte hain, aur kehte hain aur kuch nahi hai.
tags: letting go of greed, Jnana Yoga

Sanskrit verse: कामात्मानः स्वर्गपरा जन्मकर्मफलप्रदाम क्रियाविशेषबहुलां भोगैश्वर्यगतिं प्रति
