Translation (English): Desiring pleasure and heaven, they speak of repeated rebirth and results of actions, performing elaborate ceremonies for pleasure and power.
Hinglish (1): Voh log bhog aur swarg ke lobhi hote hain, karmo ke phalon ke liye kathin kriya karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Ve kaamnaon se bhare hote hain, swarg ko hi param lakshya maante hain, aur bhog-aishwarya paane ke liye aisi karm-kand ki kriyaon mein lage rehte hain jo punarjanm deti hain.
Summary: Criticizes those distracted by material rewards.
message:
कामात्मानः स्वर्गपरा जन्मकर्मफलप्रदाम क्रियाविशेषबहुलां भोगैश्वर्यगतिं प्रति
Desiring pleasure and heaven, they speak of repeated rebirth and results of actions, performing elaborate ceremonies for pleasure and power.
Voh log bhog aur swarg ke lobhi hote hain, karmo ke phalon ke liye kathin kriya karte hain.

Sanskrit verse: भोगैश्वर्यप्रसक्तानां तयापहृतचेतसाम व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिः समाधौ न विधीयते
Translation (English): For those attached to pleasure and power, whose minds are stolen by such things, resolute intelligence is not possible.
Hinglish (1): Jo bhog aur shakti me doobe hote hain, unka dhyan vyavasthit nahi hota.
Hinglish (2): Jo log bhog aur aishwarya mein atyant aasakt hain aur jinka chitt in cheezon se har liya gaya hai, unki buddhi samadhi mein sthir nahi ho paati.
message:
भोगैश्वर्यप्रसक्तानां तयापहृतचेतसाम व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिः समाधौ न विधीयते
For those attached to pleasure and power, whose minds are stolen by such things, resolute intelligence is not possible.
Jo bhog aur shakti me doobe hote hain, unka dhyan vyavasthit nahi hota.
tags: lack of focus, letting go of greed, mental peace

Sanskrit verse: त्रैगुण्यविषया वेदा निस्त्रैगुण्यो भवार्जुन निर्द्वन्द्वो नित्यसत्त्वस्थो निर्योगक्षेम आत्मवान्
Translation (English): The Vedas deal with the three modes (gunas); be beyond these, O Arjuna—free from dualities, established in goodness, unconcerned with gain and safety, self‑controlled.
Hinglish (1): Ved gunon se sambandhit hain; tum gunon se pare raho, sukh-dukh ke par, sthir raho, aur aatmsanyami (self-controled) bano.
Hinglish (2): Hey Arjun, Ved mukhya roop se teen guno ke vishay mein batate hain. Tum in teeno guno se upar utho, dwandwon se mukt ho, hamesha sattva mein sthit raho, yog-kshem ki chinta mat karo, aur aatmavaan bano.
message:
त्रैगुण्यविषया वेदा निस्त्रैगुण्यो भवार्जुन निर्द्वन्द्वो नित्यसत्त्वस्थो निर्योगक्षेम आत्मवान्
The Vedas deal with the three modes (gunas); be beyond these, O Arjuna—free from dualities, established in goodness, unconcerned with gain and safety, self‑controlled.
Ved gunon se sambandhit hain; tum gunon se pare raho, sukh-dukh ke par, sthir raho, aur aatmsanyami (self-controled) bano.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, detachment, self-realization

Sanskrit verse: यावानर्थ उदपाने सर्वतः सम्प्लुतोदके तावान्सर्वेषु वेदेषु ब्राह्मणस्य विजानतः
Translation (English): As much use as a well has when floodwaters abound, so useful are all the Vedas to the enlightened Brahman.
Hinglish (1): Jaise badhi hui nadi me kuan bekaar ho jata hai, waise hi gyaani ke liye ved ke vidhan seemit ho jaate hain.
Hinglish (2): Jaise sab taraf se paani se bhare jalaashay ke mil jaane par ek chhote se kuen ka jitna prayojan reh jaata hai, utna hi prayojan gyaan-sampann Brahman ko janne waale ke liye sabhi Vedon ka reh jaata hai.
message:
यावानर्थ उदपाने सर्वतः सम्प्लुतोदके तावान्सर्वेषु वेदेषु ब्राह्मणस्य विजानतः
As much use as a well has when floodwaters abound, so useful are all the Vedas to the enlightened Brahman.
Jaise badhi hui nadi me kuan bekaar ho jata hai, waise hi gyaani ke liye ved ke vidhan seemit ho jaate hain.

Sanskrit verse: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि
Translation (English): Your right is to action alone, never to its fruits; let not the fruits be your motive, nor be attached to inaction.
Hinglish (1): Karam karo, fal ki chinta mat karo; Tumhara adhikar sirf karm pe hai, fal pe nahi.
Hinglish (2): Tumhara adhikar sirf apna kaam karne par hai, uske result par kabhi nahi. Isliye, apne kaam ke result ko apna motive mat banao, aur na hi kaam na karne mein attach ho.
Summary: One of the Gita’s most famous teachings on selfless action.
message:
कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि
Your right is to action alone, never to its fruits; let not the fruits be your motive, nor be attached to inaction.
Karam karo, fal ki chinta mat karo; Tumhara adhikar sirf karm pe hai, fal pe nahi.
tags: Nishkama Karma (selfless action), Karma, detachment, work-life balance India

Sanskrit verse: योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते
Translation (English): Perform your duty established in yoga, abandoning attachment, being equal in success and failure. This equanimity is yoga.
Hinglish (1): Arjun, kendrit rehte hue [Yoga mein] apne karm karo. Parinaam se aasakti ko chhodkar, safalta aur asafalta mein santulit raho. Man ke isi santulan ka asli matlab hi Yoga hai. (Arjun, perform your actions while being centered [in Yoga]. Let go of attachment to the outcome, staying balanced in success and failure. This state of mental balance itself is the true meaning of Yoga.)
Hinglish (2): Hey Dhananjay, attachment ko tyagkar aur safalta-asafalta mein samaan bhav rakhte hue, yog mein sthit hokar apne kartavya karo. Isi samatva-bhav ko yog kehte hain.
Summary: Defines yoga as balance in action.
message:
योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते
Perform your duty established in yoga, abandoning attachment, being equal in success and failure. This equanimity is yoga.
Arjun, kendrit rehte hue [Yoga mein] apne karm karo. Parinaam se aasakti ko chhodkar, safalta aur asafalta mein santulit raho. Man ke isi santulan ka asli matlab hi Yoga hai. (Arjun, perform your actions while being centered [in Yoga]. Let go of attachment to the outcome, staying balanced in success and failure. This state of mental balance itself is the true meaning of Yoga.)
tags: Karma Yoga, equanimity, detachment, mental peace

Sanskrit verse: दूरेण ह्यवरं कर्म बुद्धियोगाद्धनञ्जय बुद्धौ शरणमन्विच्छ कृपणाः फलहेतवः
Translation (English): Work driven by fruit is far inferior to work done through buddhi‑yoga; seek refuge in wisdom. The miserly are motivated by results.
Hinglish (1): Fal ki ichha se kiya karm gyaani karm se neecha hai; gyaan me sharan lo. (Seek wisdom, the miserly are motivated by results)
Hinglish (2): Hey Dhananjay, samatva-buddhi-yog se phal ki ichha waala karm bahut neeche star ka hai. Isliye, tum samatva-buddhi ki sharan lo. Phal ki ichha karne waale log deen (miserly) hote hain.
message:
दूरेण ह्यवरं कर्म बुद्धियोगाद्धनञ्जय बुद्धौ शरणमन्विच्छ कृपणाः फलहेतवः
Work driven by fruit is far inferior to work done through buddhi‑yoga; seek refuge in wisdom. The miserly are motivated by results.
Fal ki ichha se kiya karm gyaani karm se neecha hai; gyaan me sharan lo. (Seek wisdom, the miserly are motivated by results)
tags: Jnana Yoga, Nishkama Karma (selfless action), letting go of greed

Sanskrit verse: बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते तस्माद्योगाय युज्यस्व योगः कर्मसु कौशलम्
Translation (English): One with wisdom in action casts off both good and bad results; therefore strive for yoga, which is skill in action.
Hinglish (1): Gyaan-yukt vyakti achhe-bure fal chhod deta hai; yoga karm (skill in action) me kaushal hai.
Hinglish (2): Samatva-buddhi-yukta vyakti is jeevan mein hi punya aur paap, dono se upar uth jaata hai. Isliye, tum is yog mein lago. Yog hi karmon mein kushalta hai.
message:
बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते तस्माद्योगाय युज्यस्व योगः कर्मसु कौशलम्
One with wisdom in action casts off both good and bad results; therefore strive for yoga, which is skill in action.
Gyaan-yukt vyakti achhe-bure fal chhod deta hai; yoga karm (skill in action) me kaushal hai.

Sanskrit verse: कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनीषिणः जन्मबन्धविनिर्मुक्ताः पदं गच्छन्त्यनामयम्
Translation (English): Wise ones abandon fruits of action, becoming free from birth’s bondage, and attain the state beyond all evil.
Hinglish (1): Gyaani fal chhod kar janm bandhan se mukt ho jaate hain aur nirdosh pad ko praapt karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Kyunki samatva-buddhi-yukta gyaani log karmon se utpann hone waale phal ko tyagkar, janm ke bandhan se mukt ho jaate hain aur us pad ko prapt karte hain jo sabhi dukhon se pare hai.
Summary: Detachment from results leads to liberation.
message:
कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनीषिणः जन्मबन्धविनिर्मुक्ताः पदं गच्छन्त्यनामयम्
Wise ones abandon fruits of action, becoming free from birth’s bondage, and attain the state beyond all evil.
Gyaani fal chhod kar janm bandhan se mukt ho jaate hain aur nirdosh pad ko praapt karte hain.

Sanskrit verse: यदा ते मोहकलिलं बुद्धिर्व्यतितरिष्यति तदा गन्तासि निरवेदं श्रोतव्यस्य श्रुतस्य च
Translation (English): When your intellect crosses the mire of delusion, then you will become indifferent to all that has been heard and is yet to be heard.
Hinglish (1): Jab tumhari buddhi moh se pare ho jayegi, tab tum sune-ansune sab se virakt ho jaoge.
Hinglish (2): Jab tumhari buddhi is moh-roopi daldal ko paar kar jaayegi, tab tum jo sun chuke ho aur jo sunne laayak hai, un sabse vairaagya ko prapt ho jaoge.
Summary: Freedom from illusion brings inner peace.
message:
यदा ते मोहकलिलं बुद्धिर्व्यतितरिष्यति तदा गन्तासि निरवेदं श्रोतव्यस्य श्रुतस्य च
When your intellect crosses the mire of delusion, then you will become indifferent to all that has been heard and is yet to be heard.
Jab tumhari buddhi moh se pare ho jayegi, tab tum sune-ansune sab se virakt ho jaoge.

Sanskrit verse: श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्चला समाधावचला बुद्धिस्तदा योगमवाप्स्यसि
Translation (English): When your intellect stands unmoving, unwavering in the stillness of meditation, you will attain yoga.
Hinglish (1): Jab tumhara man sthir ho jayega aur dhyan me chipak jayega, tab tum yoga praapt karoge.
Hinglish (2): Jab tarah-tarah ke vachano ko sunkar bhatki hui tumhari buddhi, samadhi mein achal aur sthir ho jaayegi, tab tum yog ko prapt kar loge.
Summary: Steadiness of mind marks true yoga.
message:
श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्चला समाधावचला बुद्धिस्तदा योगमवाप्स्यसि
When your intellect stands unmoving, unwavering in the stillness of meditation, you will attain yoga.
Jab tumhara man sthir ho jayega aur dhyan me chipak jayega, tab tum yoga praapt karoge.
tags: self-realization, Raja Yoga, inner peace, ધ્યાન

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच स्थितप्रज्ञस्य का भाषा समाधिस्थस्य केशव स्थितधीः किं प्रभाषेत किमासीत व्रजेत किम्
Translation (English): Arjuna said: O Keshav, what is the description of one whose wisdom is steady, who is established in samadhi? How does such a person speak, sit, and walk?
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Hey Keshav, sthir gyaan wala yogi kaisa hota hai? Kaise bolta, baithta, chalta hai?
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne poocha: Hey Keshav, samadhi mein sthit, sthir-buddhi waale vyakti ke kya lakshan hain? Woh sthir-buddhi wala vyakti kaise bolta hai, kaise baithta hai, aur kaise chalta hai?
Summary: Arjuna asks Krishna to describe the enlightened person.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच स्थितप्रज्ञस्य का भाषा समाधिस्थस्य केशव स्थितधीः किं प्रभाषेत किमासीत व्रजेत किम्
Arjuna said: O Keshav, what is the description of one whose wisdom is steady, who is established in samadhi? How does such a person speak, sit, and walk?
Arjun bola: Hey Keshav, sthir gyaan wala yogi kaisa hota hai? Kaise bolta, baithta, chalta hai?

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच प्रजहाति यदा कामान्सर्वान्पार्थ मनोगतान् आत्मन्येवात्मना तुष्टः स्थितप्रज्ञस्तदोच्यते
Translation (English): Shri Bhagavan said: O Parth, when one renounces all desires of the mind and is satisfied in the self alone, that person is said to be of steady wisdom.
Hinglish (1): Hey Parth, jab vyakti man ke sabhi kaamon ko chhodkar sirf apne aap me santusht hota hai, use sthitpragya (self-realised/wise) kehte hain.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Hey Parth, jab vyakti apne mann ki saari kaamnaon ko poori tarah se tyag deta hai aur apni aatma mein hi santusht rehta hai, tab use 'sthitaprajna' (sthir-buddhi) kaha jaata hai.
Summary: Defines the first quality of a self‑realized person.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच प्रजहाति यदा कामान्सर्वान्पार्थ मनोगतान् आत्मन्येवात्मना तुष्टः स्थितप्रज्ञस्तदोच्यते
Shri Bhagavan said: O Parth, when one renounces all desires of the mind and is satisfied in the self alone, that person is said to be of steady wisdom.
Hey Parth, jab vyakti man ke sabhi kaamon ko chhodkar sirf apne aap me santusht hota hai, use sthitpragya (self-realised/wise) kehte hain.
tags: self-realization, inner peace, detachment, letting go of greed

Sanskrit verse: दुःखेष्वनुद्विग्नमनाः सुखेषु विगतस्पृहः वीतरागभयक्रोधः स्थितधीर्मुनिरुच्यते
Translation (English): One whose mind is undisturbed in sorrow, free from desire in pleasure, and free from attachment, fear, and anger is a sage of steady wisdom.
Hinglish (1): Jiska mann dukh mein vichalit (agitated) nahi hota, jise sukh ki laalsa (craving) nahi hoti, aur jo raag (attachment), bhay (fear), aur krodh (anger) se mukt hai, wahi sthir-buddhi wala muni ('Sthitaprajna') kehlata hai.
Hinglish (2): Dukhon mein jiska mann udvign nahi hota, sukhon mein jise koi laalsa nahi hoti, aur jo attachment, bhay aur krodh se mukt hai, aisa muni sthir-buddhi kehlata hai.
message:
दुःखेष्वनुद्विग्नमनाः सुखेषु विगतस्पृहः वीतरागभयक्रोधः स्थितधीर्मुनिरुच्यते
One whose mind is undisturbed in sorrow, free from desire in pleasure, and free from attachment, fear, and anger is a sage of steady wisdom.
Jiska mann dukh mein vichalit (agitated) nahi hota, jise sukh ki laalsa (craving) nahi hoti, aur jo raag (attachment), bhay (fear), aur krodh (anger) se mukt hai, wahi sthir-buddhi wala muni ('Sthitaprajna') kehlata hai.
tags: how to stay calm, mental peace, equanimity, how to control anger

Sanskrit verse: यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम् नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता
Translation (English): One who is unattached everywhere, neither rejoices nor hates upon obtaining good or evil, has steady wisdom.
Hinglish (1): Jo har jagah asakta (unattached) hai, jo shubh‑ashubh me na anandit hota hai na ghrina karta hai, uski buddhi sthir hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo vyakti har jagah sneh-rahit hai aur shubh ya ashubh prapt hone par na toh khush hota hai aur na hi dvesh karta hai, uski buddhi sthir hai.
Summary: Detachment from highs and lows marks steadiness.
message:
यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम् नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता
One who is unattached everywhere, neither rejoices nor hates upon obtaining good or evil, has steady wisdom.
Jo har jagah asakta (unattached) hai, jo shubh‑ashubh me na anandit hota hai na ghrina karta hai, uski buddhi sthir hai.

Sanskrit verse: यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता
Translation (English): When, like a tortoise withdrawing its limbs, one withdraws the senses from their objects, wisdom is steady.
Hinglish (1): Jaise kachhua apne pair kheench leta hai, waise hi jo indriyon ko vishayon se kheench leta hai, uski buddhi sthir hai.
Hinglish (2): Jab koi vyakti kachhue ki tarah apne sabhi ango ko samet leta hai, usi tarah jab koi apni indriyon ko indriya-vishayon se har taraf se kheench leta hai, tab uski buddhi sthir maani jaati hai.
message:
यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता
When, like a tortoise withdrawing its limbs, one withdraws the senses from their objects, wisdom is steady.
Jaise kachhua apne pair kheench leta hai, waise hi jo indriyon ko vishayon se kheench leta hai, uski buddhi sthir hai.
tags: how to control anger, detachment, inner peace

Sanskrit verse: विषया विनिवर्तन्ते निराहरस्य देहिनः रसवर्जं रसोऽप्यस्य परं दृष्ट्वा निवर्तते
Translation (English): Sense objects fall away for the abstinent, though taste remains; the taste also ceases upon realizing the Supreme.
Hinglish (1): Jab koi insaan indriyon par zabardasti kabu karta hai, toh woh vishayon (sense objects) se toh door ho jaata hai, lekin unke liye mann mein laalsa (craving) bani rehti hai. Par jab usey ek uchchatar aanand (a higher bliss) ka anubhav hota hai, tab yeh chhoti laalsa apne aap mit jaati hai.
Hinglish (2): Indriyon ko vishayon se door rakhne waale vyakti ke vishay toh mit jaate hain, par unke prati ras (taste) bana rehta hai. Par Param-tattva ka anubhav hone par, uska yeh ras bhi samapt ho jaata hai.
message:
विषया विनिवर्तन्ते निराहरस्य देहिनः रसवर्जं रसोऽप्यस्य परं दृष्ट्वा निवर्तते
Sense objects fall away for the abstinent, though taste remains; the taste also ceases upon realizing the Supreme.
Jab koi insaan indriyon par zabardasti kabu karta hai, toh woh vishayon (sense objects) se toh door ho jaata hai, lekin unke liye mann mein laalsa (craving) bani rehti hai. Par jab usey ek uchchatar aanand (a higher bliss) ka anubhav hota hai, tab yeh chhoti laalsa apne aap mit jaati hai.
tags: letting go of greed, detachment, self-realization

Sanskrit verse: यततो ह्यपि कौन्तेय पुरुषस्य विपश्चितः इन्द्रियाणि प्रमाथीनि हरन्ति प्रसभं मनः
Translation (English): O son of Kunti, even striving, the wise person’s unstable senses can forcibly carry away the mind.
Hinglish (1): Hey Kunti‑putra, buddhiwan ke bhi chanchal indriya man ko kheench lete hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kunti-putra, prayaas karne waale samajhdaar vyakti ke mann ko bhi, yeh prabal indriyan bal-poorvak har leti hain.
message:
यततो ह्यपि कौन्तेय पुरुषस्य विपश्चितः इन्द्रियाणि प्रमाथीनि हरन्ति प्रसभं मनः
O son of Kunti, even striving, the wise person’s unstable senses can forcibly carry away the mind.
Hey Kunti‑putra, buddhiwan ke bhi chanchal indriya man ko kheench lete hain.
tags: lack of focus, negative thoughts, how to stop worrying

Sanskrit verse: तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्परः वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता
Translation (English): Controlling all the senses, one should sit focused on Me; one whose senses are controlled has steady wisdom.
Hinglish (1): Sab indriyaon ko niyantrit karke mera dhyan karo; jiski indriya vash me hain, uski buddhi sthir hai.
Hinglish (2): Un sabhi indriyon ko vash mein karke, mere paraayan hokar dhyan mein baithe. Kyunki jiski indriyan vash mein hoti hain, usi ki buddhi sthir hoti hai.
message:
तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्परः वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता
Controlling all the senses, one should sit focused on Me; one whose senses are controlled has steady wisdom.
Sab indriyaon ko niyantrit karke mera dhyan karo; jiski indriya vash me hain, uski buddhi sthir hai.

Sanskrit verse: ध्यायतो विषयान्पुंसः सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते सङ्गात्सञ्जायते कामः कामात्क्रोधोऽभिजायते
Translation (English): By contemplating objects, attachment develops; from attachment comes desire; from desire arises anger.
Hinglish (1): Vishayon (sense objects) ke baare mein sochte rehne se, unke prati aasakti (attachment) paida hoti hai. Aasakti se unhein paane ki kaamna (craving) janm leti hai, aur kaamna (poori na hone par) se krodh utpann hota hai.
Hinglish (2): Cheezon ke baare mein lagaatar sochne se unse attachment ho jaata hai. Attachment se unhein paane ki ichha (desire) badhti hai, aur jab ichha poori nahi hoti, toh gussa aata hai.
Summary: Chain of degradation begins with contemplation.
message:
ध्यायतो विषयान्पुंसः सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते सङ्गात्सञ्जायते कामः कामात्क्रोधोऽभिजायते
By contemplating objects, attachment develops; from attachment comes desire; from desire arises anger.
Vishayon (sense objects) ke baare mein sochte rehne se, unke prati aasakti (attachment) paida hoti hai. Aasakti se unhein paane ki kaamna (craving) janm leti hai, aur kaamna (poori na hone par) se krodh utpann hota hai.
tags: how to control anger, letting go of greed, negative thoughts

Sanskrit verse: क्रोधाद्भवति सम्मोहः सम्मोहात्स्मृतिविभ्रमः स्मृतिभ्रंशाद्बुद्धिनाशो बुद्धिनाशात्प्रणश्यति
Translation (English): From anger comes delusion; from delusion, loss of memory; from loss of memory, destruction of intellect; from destruction of intellect, one perishes.
Hinglish (1): Krodh se moh, moh se smriti bhram, smriti bhrasht hone se buddhi nash, buddhi nash se vinash.
Hinglish (2): Gusse se moorkhta (delusion) paida hoti hai, moorkhta se smriti bhrasht ho jaati hai. Smriti ke bhrasht hone se buddhi ka naash ho jaata hai, aur buddhi ke naash hone se vyakti ka patan ho jaata hai.
Summary: Describes the fall of a person.
message:
क्रोधाद्भवति सम्मोहः सम्मोहात्स्मृतिविभ्रमः स्मृतिभ्रंशाद्बुद्धिनाशो बुद्धिनाशात्प्रणश्यति
From anger comes delusion; from delusion, loss of memory; from loss of memory, destruction of intellect; from destruction of intellect, one perishes.
Krodh se moh, moh se smriti bhram, smriti bhrasht hone se buddhi nash, buddhi nash se vinash.
tags: how to control anger, negative thoughts, lack of focus

Sanskrit verse: रागद्वेषवियुक्तैस्तु विषयानिन्द्रियैश्चरन् आत्मवश्यैर्विधेयात्मा प्रसादमधिगच्छति
Translation (English): But one who moves among objects, free from attachment and aversion, with senses under control, attains grace.
Hinglish (1): Jo raga‑dvesh (free from attachment) se mukt ho kar vishayon me ghoomta hai aur apna man niyantrit rakhta hai, vah kripa paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Parantu, jo vyakti apne mann ko vash mein rakhta hai aur attachment-dvesh se mukt indriyon se vishayon mein vichran karta hai, wahi Ishwar ki kripa aur shaanti prapt karta hai.
message:
रागद्वेषवियुक्तैस्तु विषयानिन्द्रियैश्चरन् आत्मवश्यैर्विधेयात्मा प्रसादमधिगच्छति
But one who moves among objects, free from attachment and aversion, with senses under control, attains grace.
Jo raga‑dvesh (free from attachment) se mukt ho kar vishayon me ghoomta hai aur apna man niyantrit rakhta hai, vah kripa paata hai.
tags: mental peace, inner peace, detachment, self-realization

Sanskrit verse: प्रसादे सर्वदुःखानां हानिरस्योपजायते प्रसन्नचेतसो ह्याशु बुद्धिः पर्यवतिष्ठते
Translation (English): In grace, all sorrows end, and in a serene mind, intellect is quickly established.
Hinglish (1): Shant man me saare dukh khatam ho jaate hain, aur buddhi sthir ho jaati hai.
Hinglish (2): Us shaanti ko prapt karne par saare dukhon ka ant ho jaata hai. Aur prasann-chitt waale vyakti ki buddhi jaldi hi sthir ho jaati hai.
message:
प्रसादे सर्वदुःखानां हानिरस्योपजायते प्रसन्नचेतसो ह्याशु बुद्धिः पर्यवतिष्ठते
In grace, all sorrows end, and in a serene mind, intellect is quickly established.
Shant man me saare dukh khatam ho jaate hain, aur buddhi sthir ho jaati hai.
tags: mental peace, inner peace, how to stay calm

Sanskrit verse: नास्ति बुद्धिरयुक्तस्य न चायुक्तस्य भावना न चाभावयतः शान्तिरशान्तस्य कुतः सुखम्
Translation (English): For the uncontrolled, there is no intellect, nor meditation; for one without meditation, there is no peace; without peace, how can there be happiness?
Hinglish (1): Jiska man vash me nahi, uske paas gyaan nahi; bina dhyan ke shanti nahi; bina shanti ke sukh nahi.
Hinglish (2): Jo sanyami nahi hai, uski buddhi sthir nahi hoti aur na hi uske mann mein bhavna hoti hai. Bina bhavna waale ko shaanti nahi milti. Aur ashant vyakti ko sukh kaise mil sakta hai?
Summary: Shows the linkage from control to happiness.
message:
नास्ति बुद्धिरयुक्तस्य न चायुक्तस्य भावना न चाभावयतः शान्तिरशान्तस्य कुतः सुखम्
For the uncontrolled, there is no intellect, nor meditation; for one without meditation, there is no peace; without peace, how can there be happiness?
Jiska man vash me nahi, uske paas gyaan nahi; bina dhyan ke shanti nahi; bina shanti ke sukh nahi.
tags: mental peace, lack of focus, how to stop worrying

Sanskrit verse: इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते तदस्य हरति प्रज्ञां वायुर्नावमिवाम्भसि
Translation (English): When the mind follows wandering senses, it carries away wisdom like the wind carries a boat on water.
Hinglish (1): Jo man chanchal indriyon ke peeche chalta hai, uska gyaan hawa me naav ki tarah beh jaata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jaise paani mein chalti naav ko hawa baha le jaati hai, usi tarah vishayon mein vicharti indriyon mein se jis ek ke saath bhi mann lag jaata hai, woh uski buddhi ko har leti hai.
message:
इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते तदस्य हरति प्रज्ञां वायुर्नावमिवाम्भसि
When the mind follows wandering senses, it carries away wisdom like the wind carries a boat on water.
Jo man chanchal indriyon ke peeche chalta hai, uska gyaan hawa me naav ki tarah beh jaata hai.

Sanskrit verse: तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वशः इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता
Translation (English): Therefore, O mighty‑armed, one whose senses are fully controlled from sense objects has steady wisdom.
Hinglish (1): Hey Mahabaahu, jisne apni indriyaon ko poori tarah vishayon (attachments) se rok liya hai, uska gyaan sthir hai.
Hinglish (2): Isliye, hey Mahabahu, jiski indriyan indriya-vishayon se poori tarah vash mein ki hui hain, usi ki buddhi sthir hai.
message:
तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वशः इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता
Therefore, O mighty‑armed, one whose senses are fully controlled from sense objects has steady wisdom.
Hey Mahabaahu, jisne apni indriyaon ko poori tarah vishayon (attachments) se rok liya hai, uska gyaan sthir hai.

Sanskrit verse: या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी यस्यां जाग्रति भूतानि सा निशा पश्यतो मुनेः
Translation (English): What is night for all beings is the time of awakening for the self‑controlled; what is awakening for others is night for the sage.
Hinglish (1): Jis sachchai (spiritual truth) se aam log bekhabar hain, ek sanyami usmein poori tarah aware rehta hai. Aur jis duniya (material world) ke peeche aam log bhaagte hain, ek gyani ke liye woh andhere jaisi hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo sabhi praaniyon ke liye raat hai, usmein sanyami vyakti jaagta hai. Aur jab sabhi praani jaagte hain, tab tattva ko dekhne waale muni ke liye woh raat hoti hai.
Summary: Yogi’s vision is opposite to worldly vision.
message:
या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी यस्यां जाग्रति भूतानि सा निशा पश्यतो मुनेः
What is night for all beings is the time of awakening for the self‑controlled; what is awakening for others is night for the sage.
Jis sachchai (spiritual truth) se aam log bekhabar hain, ek sanyami usmein poori tarah aware rehta hai. Aur jis duniya (material world) ke peeche aam log bhaagte hain, ek gyani ke liye woh andhere jaisi hai.

Sanskrit verse: आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठं समुद्रमापः प्रविशन्ति यद्वत् तद्वत्कामा यं प्रविशन्ति सर्वे स शान्तिमाप्नोति न कामकामी
Translation (English): As rivers enter a full, unmoving ocean, so desires enter one who attains peace—not one who desires.
Hinglish (1): Jaise nadiyan samundar me sama jaati hain, waise hi saare kaam us vyakti me sama jaate hain jo shant hai, na ki ichhavan me.
Hinglish (2): Jaise alag-alag nadiyan hamesha bhare hue, sthir samudra mein sama jaati hain (par samudra vichlit nahi hota), usi tarah jis vyakti mein saari kaamnaayein sama jaati hain, wahi shaanti prapt karta hai, na ki kaamnaon ko chahne waala.
message:
आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठं समुद्रमापः प्रविशन्ति यद्वत् तद्वत्कामा यं प्रविशन्ति सर्वे स शान्तिमाप्नोति न कामकामी
As rivers enter a full, unmoving ocean, so desires enter one who attains peace—not one who desires.
Jaise nadiyan samundar me sama jaati hain, waise hi saare kaam us vyakti me sama jaate hain jo shant hai, na ki ichhavan me.
tags: inner peace, mental peace, letting go of greed, detachment

Sanskrit verse: विहाय कामान्यः सर्वान्पुमांश्चरति निःस्पृहः निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः स शान्तिमधिगच्छति
Translation (English): One who abandons all desires, lives without longing, free from the sense of possessiveness and ego, attains peace.
Hinglish (1): Jo manushya sabhi kaamnaon (desires) ko tyag kar, laalsa-rahit (free from craving), mamta-rahit (free from mineness), aur ahankar-rahit (free from ego) hokar jeeta hai, wahi shaanti ko prapt hota hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo vyakti saari kaamnaon ko tyagkar, laalsa-rahit, mamta-rahit, aur ahankar-rahit hokar jeeta hai, wahi shaanti ko prapt hota hai.
Summary: Desirelessness, non‑possessiveness, and humility bring peace.
message:
विहाय कामान्यः सर्वान्पुमांश्चरति निःस्पृहः निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः स शान्तिमधिगच्छति
One who abandons all desires, lives without longing, free from the sense of possessiveness and ego, attains peace.
Jo manushya sabhi kaamnaon (desires) ko tyag kar, laalsa-rahit (free from craving), mamta-rahit (free from mineness), aur ahankar-rahit (free from ego) hokar jeeta hai, wahi shaanti ko prapt hota hai.
tags: Moksha, self-realization, inner peace, letting go of greed

Sanskrit verse: एषा ब्राह्मी स्थितिः पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य विमुह्यति स्थित्वास्यामन्तकालेऽपि ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृच्छति
Translation (English): This is the Brahmic state, O Parth. Having attained this, one is never deluded; even at the last moment, one attains brahma‑nirvana.
Hinglish (1): Hey Parth, yahi 'Brahmi Sthiti' [adhyatmik chetna ki avastha] hai. Ise paane ke baad vyakti kabhi moh-grast (deluded) nahi hota. Is avastha mein ant samay mein bhi sthir rehne par, Brahma-nirvan [Param-dhaam ya Moksha] ki prapti hoti hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, yahi 'Brahmi Sthiti' (adhyatmik chetna) hai. Ise paane ke baad vyakti kabhi mohit nahi hota. Ant samay mein bhi is avastha mein sthir rehne par, Brahma-nirvan (Moksha) ki prapti hoti hai.
Summary: Conclusion of the chapter describing final liberation.
message:
एषा ब्राह्मी स्थितिः पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य विमुह्यति स्थित्वास्यामन्तकालेऽपि ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृच्छति
This is the Brahmic state, O Parth. Having attained this, one is never deluded; even at the last moment, one attains brahma‑nirvana.
Hey Parth, yahi 'Brahmi Sthiti' [adhyatmik chetna ki avastha] hai. Ise paane ke baad vyakti kabhi moh-grast (deluded) nahi hota. Is avastha mein ant samay mein bhi sthir rehne par, Brahma-nirvan [Param-dhaam ya Moksha] ki prapti hoti hai.

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच ज्यायसी चेत्कर्मणस्ते मता बुद्धिर्जनार्दन तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव
Translation (English): Arjuna said: O Janardana, if You consider knowledge superior to action, O Keshava, why then do You engage me in this terrible action?
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Hey Janardan, agar aap gyaan ko karm se bada maante ho, to mujhe is bhayanak yudh me kyun laga rahe ho?
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Janardan, agar aapki nazar mein karm se gyaan behtar hai, toh phir hey Keshav, aap mujhe is bhayanak kaam (yuddh) mein kyun laga rahe hain?
Summary: Arjuna is confused why Krishna urges him to fight if wisdom is higher.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच ज्यायसी चेत्कर्मणस्ते मता बुद्धिर्जनार्दन तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव
Arjuna said: O Janardana, if You consider knowledge superior to action, O Keshava, why then do You engage me in this terrible action?
Arjun bola: Hey Janardan, agar aap gyaan ko karm se bada maante ho, to mujhe is bhayanak yudh me kyun laga rahe ho?
tags: confusion, indecision, Jnana Yoga, Karma Yoga

Sanskrit verse: व्यामিশ्रेणेव वाक्येन बुध्धिं मोहयसीव मे तदेकं वद निश्चित्य येन श्रेयोऽहमाप्नुयाम्
Translation (English): Your statements seem mixed and perplexing my mind; please tell me decisively that by which I may attain the highest good.
Hinglish (1): Aapki baatein mila‑jula lagti hain aur mera man bhatka rahi hain; kripya spasht batayein jo mera kalyan kare.
Hinglish (2): Aapki mili-juli baaton se meri buddhi bhatak si gayi hai. Isliye, kripya nishchit roop se ek raasta bataiye jisse main param shreyas (highest good) ko prapt kar sakoon.
Summary: Requests clarity on the correct path.
message:
व्यामিশ्रेणेव वाक्येन बुध्धिं मोहयसीव मे तदेकं वद निश्चित्य येन श्रेयोऽहमाप्नुयाम्
Your statements seem mixed and perplexing my mind; please tell me decisively that by which I may attain the highest good.
Aapki baatein mila‑jula lagti hain aur mera man bhatka rahi hain; kripya spasht batayein jo mera kalyan kare.

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच लोकेऽस्मिन्द्विविधा निष्ठा पुरा प्रोक्ता मयानघ ज्ञानयोगेन सांख्यानां कर्मयोगेन योगिनाम्
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: O sinless one, in this world, as I told before, there are two paths—knowledge for the contemplative and action for the active.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Hey nirdosh, sansaar me do marg hain – gyaan marg santon ke liye aur karm marg kriyasheel ke liye.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Hey nishpaap Arjun, is sansaar mein do tarah ki nishtha (paths) hain, jaisa ki maine pehle bataya tha - gyaan-yogiyon ke liye gyaan ka maarg aur karm-yogiyon ke liye karm ka maarg.
Summary: Clearly states dual paths suited to different natures.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच लोकेऽस्मिन्द्विविधा निष्ठा पुरा प्रोक्ता मयानघ ज्ञानयोगेन सांख्यानां कर्मयोगेन योगिनाम्
The Blessed Lord said: O sinless one, in this world, as I told before, there are two paths—knowledge for the contemplative and action for the active.
Shri Krishna bole: Hey nirdosh, sansaar me do marg hain – gyaan marg santon ke liye aur karm marg kriyasheel ke liye.
tags: Jnana Yoga, Karma Yoga, Dharma, finding purpose

Sanskrit verse: न कर्मणामनारम्भान्नैष्कर्म्यं पुरुषोऽश्नुते न च संन्यसनादेव सिद्धिं समधिगच्छति
Translation (English): Not by refraining from action does one attain freedom from action, nor by renunciation alone does one reach perfection.
Hinglish (1): Karm tyag se hi vyakti karm se mukt nahi hota, aur sirf sanyas se siddhi nahi hoti.
Hinglish (2): Na toh karmon ko shuru na karne se manushya 'naishkarmya' (freedom from action) ko prapt hota hai, aur na hi sirf karmon ko tyag dene se siddhi (perfection) milti hai.
message:
न कर्मणामनारम्भान्नैष्कर्म्यं पुरुषोऽश्नुते न च संन्यसनादेव सिद्धिं समधिगच्छति
Not by refraining from action does one attain freedom from action, nor by renunciation alone does one reach perfection.
Karm tyag se hi vyakti karm se mukt nahi hota, aur sirf sanyas se siddhi nahi hoti.
tags: Nishkama Karma (selfless action), Karma Yoga, Moksha

Sanskrit verse: न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत् कार्यते ह्यवशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः
Translation (English): No one can remain without action even for a moment; everyone is driven to act by the modes born of nature.
Hinglish (1): Koi ek pal ke liye bhi bina karm ke nahi reh sakta; prakriti ke gun sabse karm karwate hain.
Hinglish (2): Koi bhi vyakti ek pal ke liye bhi bina karm kiye nahi reh sakta. Prakriti se utpann hue gun har praani ko vivash karke karm karwate hi hain.
message:
न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत् कार्यते ह्यवशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः
No one can remain without action even for a moment; everyone is driven to act by the modes born of nature.
Koi ek pal ke liye bhi bina karm ke nahi reh sakta; prakriti ke gun sabse karm karwate hain.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, Karma

Sanskrit verse: कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मरन् इन्द्रियार्थान्विमूढात्मा मिथ्याचारः स उच्यते
Translation (English): One who, restraining senses of action, sits mentally dwelling on sense objects, is deluded and a hypocrite.
Hinglish (1): Jo manushya apni karm-indriyon (organs of action) ko toh bal-purvak rok leta hai, lekin mann hi mann unke vishayon (pleasures) ka chintan karta rehta hai, us moh-grast (deluded) vyakti ko mithyachari ya pakhandi kaha jaata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo insaan apne haath-pair (karm-indriyon) ko toh zabardasti rok leta hai, par mann se unhi cheezon ke baare mein sochta rehta hai, us bhatke hue insaan ko pakhandi (hypocrite) kehte hain.
message:
कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मरन् इन्द्रियार्थान्विमूढात्मा मिथ्याचारः स उच्यते
One who, restraining senses of action, sits mentally dwelling on sense objects, is deluded and a hypocrite.
Jo manushya apni karm-indriyon (organs of action) ko toh bal-purvak rok leta hai, lekin mann hi mann unke vishayon (pleasures) ka chintan karta rehta hai, us moh-grast (deluded) vyakti ko mithyachari ya pakhandi kaha jaata hai.
tags: guilt, negative thoughts, letting go of greed

Sanskrit verse: यस्त्विन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यारभतेऽर्जुन कर्मेन्द्रियैः कर्मयोगमसक्तः स विशिष्यते
Translation (English): But one who controls the mind and engages the organs of action in karma‑yoga without attachment is superior.
Hinglish (1): Asli yogi toh woh hai, jo pehle apne mann se apni desires ko control karta hai, aur phir bina result ki chinta kiye, apne haath-pair (karm-indriyon) se duniya mein apna kartavya nibhata hai. Wahi insaan behtar hai.
Hinglish (2): Par hey Arjun, jo vyakti mann se indriyon ko control karke, bina attachment ke apni karm-indriyon se karm-yog ka paalan karta hai, wahi shreshth hai.
message:
यस्त्विन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यारभतेऽर्जुन कर्मेन्द्रियैः कर्मयोगमसक्तः स विशिष्यते
But one who controls the mind and engages the organs of action in karma‑yoga without attachment is superior.
Asli yogi toh woh hai, jo pehle apne mann se apni desires ko control karta hai, aur phir bina result ki chinta kiye, apne haath-pair (karm-indriyon) se duniya mein apna kartavya nibhata hai. Wahi insaan behtar hai.
tags: Nishkama Karma (selfless action), Karma Yoga, detachment

Sanskrit verse: नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिद्ध्येदकर्मणः
Translation (English): Perform your prescribed duty; action is better than inaction. Even bodily sustenance is not possible without action.
Hinglish (1): Apna nirdharit karm karo; karm akarm se behtar hai, sharir ka palan bhi bina karm ke nahi ho sakta.
Hinglish (2): Tum apna nirdharit kartavya (prescribed duty) karo, kyunki karm na karne se toh karm karna behtar hai. Bina karm kiye toh tumhare shareer ka nirvah bhi nahi ho sakta.
message:
नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिद्ध्येदकर्मणः
Perform your prescribed duty; action is better than inaction. Even bodily sustenance is not possible without action.
Apna nirdharit karm karo; karm akarm se behtar hai, sharir ka palan bhi bina karm ke nahi ho sakta.
tags: finding career purpose, job dissatisfaction, Dharma, Karma

Sanskrit verse: यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्गः समाचर
Translation (English): Work done for sacrifice is free from bondage; work done otherwise binds. Therefore, O Kaunteya, perform duty without attachment, for that purpose.
Hinglish (1): Yagya ke liye kiya karm bandhan nahi deta; anya uddeshya se kiya bandh deta hai. (perform duty without attachment, for that purpose)
Hinglish (2): Yajna (Ishwar ke liye kiye gaye kartavya) ke alawa kiye gaye karm is sansaar mein bandhan ka kaaran bante hain. Isliye, hey Kunti-putra, attachment se mukt hokar kewal Yajna ke liye hi karm karo.
message:
यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्गः समाचर
Work done for sacrifice is free from bondage; work done otherwise binds. Therefore, O Kaunteya, perform duty without attachment, for that purpose.
Yagya ke liye kiya karm bandhan nahi deta; anya uddeshya se kiya bandh deta hai. (perform duty without attachment, for that purpose)
tags: Nishkama Karma (selfless action), Karma, Bhakti Yoga

Sanskrit verse: सहयज्ञाः प्रजाः सृष्ट्वा पुरोवाच प्रजापतिः अनेन प्रसविष्यध्वमेष वोऽस्त्विष्टकामधुक्
Translation (English): At creation, Prajapati created humanity with sacrifice and said: By this you shall prosper; let it fulfill all your desires.
Hinglish (1): Srishti ki shuruaat mein, Ishwar ne insaan ko contribution (Yajna) ki bhaavna ke saath banaya aur kaha: 'Is selfless contribution ke principle se tum aage badhoge, aur yahi tumhari zarooraton ko poora karega.'
Hinglish (2): Srishti ki shuruaat mein, Prajapati (creator) ne yajna sahit praja ko rachkar kaha: 'Is yajna se tum vriddhi karo, aur yeh yajna tumhari saari ichhaon ko poora karne waala ho.'
Summary: Establishes sacrifice as a basis for prosperity.
message:
सहयज्ञाः प्रजाः सृष्ट्वा पुरोवाच प्रजापतिः अनेन प्रसविष्यध्वमेष वोऽस्त्विष्टकामधुक्
At creation, Prajapati created humanity with sacrifice and said: By this you shall prosper; let it fulfill all your desires.
Srishti ki shuruaat mein, Ishwar ne insaan ko contribution (Yajna) ki bhaavna ke saath banaya aur kaha: 'Is selfless contribution ke principle se tum aage badhoge, aur yahi tumhari zarooraton ko poora karega.'

Sanskrit verse: देवान्भावयतानेन ते देवा भावयन्तु वः परस्परं भावयन्तः श्रेयः परमवाप्स्यथ
Translation (English): Please the gods with sacrifice and they will please you; thus nourishing one another you will attain the highest good.
Hinglish (1): Apne contribution (Yajna) se tum nature (Devas) ko nourish karo, aur nature tumhein nourish karega. Is mutual cooperation ke cycle se hi tum sab supreme well-being (param shreyas) haasil karoge.
Hinglish (2): Is yajna se tum devtaon ko prasann karo, aur ve devta tumhein prasann karenge. Is tarah ek doosre ko prasann karte hue, tum param kalyan ko prapt karoge.
Summary: Highlights mutual support between humans and higher powers.
message:
देवान्भावयतानेन ते देवा भावयन्तु वः परस्परं भावयन्तः श्रेयः परमवाप्स्यथ
Please the gods with sacrifice and they will please you; thus nourishing one another you will attain the highest good.
Apne contribution (Yajna) se tum nature (Devas) ko nourish karo, aur nature tumhein nourish karega. Is mutual cooperation ke cycle se hi tum sab supreme well-being (param shreyas) haasil karoge.

Sanskrit verse: इष्टान्भोगान्हि वो देवा दास्यन्ते यज्ञभाविताः तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव सः
Translation (English): The gods, pleased by sacrifice, will grant you desired enjoyments; one who enjoys what they give without offering in return is a thief.
Hinglish (1): Jab tum Yajna (contribution) se Nature ko nourish karte ho, toh Nature tumhari zarooraton ko poora karta hai. Lekin jo Nature ke diye gaye gifts ko enjoy karta hai, par badle mein contribute nahi karta, woh asal mein ek chor hi hai.
Hinglish (2): Yajna se prasann hue devta tumhein bina maange hi ichhit bhog pradaan karenge. Par jo unke diye hue bhogon ko unhe arpit kiye bina bhogta hai, woh nishchit roop se chor hai.
message:
इष्टान्भोगान्हि वो देवा दास्यन्ते यज्ञभाविताः तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव सः
The gods, pleased by sacrifice, will grant you desired enjoyments; one who enjoys what they give without offering in return is a thief.
Jab tum Yajna (contribution) se Nature ko nourish karte ho, toh Nature tumhari zarooraton ko poora karta hai. Lekin jo Nature ke diye gaye gifts ko enjoy karta hai, par badle mein contribute nahi karta, woh asal mein ek chor hi hai.
tags: letting go of greed, guilt, Karma

Sanskrit verse: यज्ञशिष्टाशिनः सन्तो मुच्यन्ते सर्वकिल्बिषैः भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात
Translation (English): The righteous who eat the remnants of sacrifice are freed from all sins; sinners cook for their own sake and eat sin.
Hinglish (1): Jo sajjan Yajna [apna kartavya poora karne] ke baad bache hue phal ko grahan karte hain, ve sabhi paapon se mukt ho jaate hain.
Hinglish (2): Yajna se bache hue ann ko khane waale sant sabhi paapon se mukt ho jaate hain. Lekin jo paapi log sirf apne liye bhojan pakate hain, ve toh paap hi khate hain.
message:
यज्ञशिष्टाशिनः सन्तो मुच्यन्ते सर्वकिल्बिषैः भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात
The righteous who eat the remnants of sacrifice are freed from all sins; sinners cook for their own sake and eat sin.
Jo sajjan Yajna [apna kartavya poora karne] ke baad bache hue phal ko grahan karte hain, ve sabhi paapon se mukt ho jaate hain.

Sanskrit verse: अन्नाद्भवन्ति भूतानि पर्जन्यादन्नसम्भवः यज्ञाद्भवति पर्जन्यो यज्ञः कर्मसमुद्भवः
Translation (English): From food come beings; from rain comes food; from sacrifice comes rain; and sacrifice is born of action.
Hinglish (1): Ann se prani hote hain, varsha se ann, yagya se varsha, aur karm se yagya.
Hinglish (2): Sabhi praani ann se utpann hote hain, ann varsha se utpann hota hai, varsha yajna se hoti hai, aur yajna nirdharit karmon se utpann hota hai.
message:
अन्नाद्भवन्ति भूतानि पर्जन्यादन्नसम्भवः यज्ञाद्भवति पर्जन्यो यज्ञः कर्मसमुद्भवः
From food come beings; from rain comes food; from sacrifice comes rain; and sacrifice is born of action.
Ann se prani hote hain, varsha se ann, yagya se varsha, aur karm se yagya.

Sanskrit verse: कर्म ब्रह्मोद्भवं विद्धि ब्रह्माक्षरसमुद्भवम् तस्मात्सर्वगतं ब्रह्म नित्यं यज्ञे प्रतिष्ठितम्
Translation (English): Know that action comes from Brahma, Brahma comes from the Imperishable; thus the all‑pervading Brahma is eternally situated in sacrifice.
Hinglish (1): Samjho ki har action ka blueprint cosmic law (Brahma) mein hai, aur cosmic law ultimate reality (Akshar) se aata hai. Isliye, all-pervading divinity (Brahman) hamesha selfless contribution (Yajna) ke har kaam mein maujood rehti hai.
Hinglish (2): Karmo ko Vedon se utpann jaano, aur Vedon ko avinashi Brahman se. Isliye, sarvavyapi Brahman hamesha yajna mein sthit rehta hai.
Summary: Ties action to the divine principle.
message:
कर्म ब्रह्मोद्भवं विद्धि ब्रह्माक्षरसमुद्भवम् तस्मात्सर्वगतं ब्रह्म नित्यं यज्ञे प्रतिष्ठितम्
Know that action comes from Brahma, Brahma comes from the Imperishable; thus the all‑pervading Brahma is eternally situated in sacrifice.
Samjho ki har action ka blueprint cosmic law (Brahma) mein hai, aur cosmic law ultimate reality (Akshar) se aata hai. Isliye, all-pervading divinity (Brahman) hamesha selfless contribution (Yajna) ke har kaam mein maujood rehti hai.

Sanskrit verse: एवंत्वेनं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह यः अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति
Translation (English): One who does not follow the wheel of sacrifice set in motion lives in vain, delighting in senses.
Hinglish (1): Jo is yagya chakra ka paalan nahi karta, sirf indriya sukh me jeeta hai, uska jeevan vyarth hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, jo is sansaar mein is tarah sthapit chakra ka paalan nahi karta, woh indriyon ke sukh mein jeene waala paapi vyakti व्यर्थ hi jeeta hai.
Summary: Life without contribution or duty is wasted.
message:
एवंत्वेनं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह यः अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति
One who does not follow the wheel of sacrifice set in motion lives in vain, delighting in senses.
Jo is yagya chakra ka paalan nahi karta, sirf indriya sukh me jeeta hai, uska jeevan vyarth hai.
tags: finding purpose, feeling lost in life, letting go of greed

Sanskrit verse: यस्त्वात्मरतिरेव स्यादात्मतृप्तश्च मानवः आत्मन्येव च सन्तुष्टस्तस्य कार्यं न विद्यते
Translation (English): But the one who rejoices in the self, is satisfied in the self, and content within, has no duty to perform.
Hinglish (1): Jo apne aap me prasann, santusht aur tript hai, uske liye koi kartavya nahi.
Hinglish (2): Parantu jo manushya apni aatma mein hi anandit rehta hai, aatma mein hi tript rehta hai, aur aatma mein hi santusht rehta hai, uske liye koi kartavya shesh nahi rehta.
Summary: True self‑realized souls act without compulsion.
message:
यस्त्वात्मरतिरेव स्यादात्मतृप्तश्च मानवः आत्मन्येव च सन्तुष्टस्तस्य कार्यं न विद्यते
But the one who rejoices in the self, is satisfied in the self, and content within, has no duty to perform.
Jo apne aap me prasann, santusht aur tript hai, uske liye koi kartavya nahi.

Sanskrit verse: नैव तस्य कृतेनार्थो नाकृतेनेह कश्चन न चास्य सर्वभूतेषु कश्चिदर्थव्यपाश्रयः
Translation (English): For such a person, there is no gain in what they do or don’t do, and no dependence on anything in creation.
Hinglish (1): Aise vyakti ka kuchh bhi karne ya na karne me labh nahi, aur kisi par nirbhar bhi nahi.
Hinglish (2): Aise aatm-gyaani vyakti ka na toh is sansaar mein karm karne se koi prayojan hota hai, aur na hi karm na karne se. Use kisi bhi praani par apne kisi bhi arth ke liye nirbhar nahi rehna padta.
message:
नैव तस्य कृतेनार्थो नाकृतेनेह कश्चन न चास्य सर्वभूतेषु कश्चिदर्थव्यपाश्रयः
For such a person, there is no gain in what they do or don’t do, and no dependence on anything in creation.
Aise vyakti ka kuchh bhi karne ya na karne me labh nahi, aur kisi par nirbhar bhi nahi.

Sanskrit verse: तस्मादसक्तः सततं कार्यं कर्म समाचर असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्नोति पुरुषः
Translation (English): Therefore, without attachment, constantly perform what is to be done; by acting without attachment, one attains the supreme.
Hinglish (1): Isliye bina asakti ke sada apna kartavya karo; bina asakti ke karm se param pad milta hai.
Hinglish (2): Isliye, tum attachment se mukt hokar hamesha apne kartavya-karm ko achhi tarah karo. Kyunki bina attachment ke karm karne se manushya Param-tattva ko prapt kar leta hai.
Summary: Non‑attachment in duty leads to liberation.
message:
तस्मादसक्तः सततं कार्यं कर्म समाचर असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्नोति पुरुषः
Therefore, without attachment, constantly perform what is to be done; by acting without attachment, one attains the supreme.
Isliye bina asakti ke sada apna kartavya karo; bina asakti ke karm se param pad milta hai.
tags: Nishkama Karma (selfless action), Karma Yoga, detachment

Sanskrit verse: कर्मणैव हि संसिद्धिमास्थिता जनकादयः लोकसंग्रहमेवापि सम्पश्यन्कर्तुमर्हसि
Translation (English): Indeed, Janaka and others attained perfection through action alone; you should act also for the welfare of the world.
Hinglish (1): Janak raja jaise log karm karke hi siddh hue; tum bhi lok kalyan ke liye karm karo.
Hinglish (2): Raja Janak jaise log bhi kewal karm karke hi siddhi ko prapt hue the. Isliye, lok-sangrah (welfare of the world) ko dekhte hue bhi, tumhein karm karna chahiye.
Summary: Uses historical example to inspire action.
message:
कर्मणैव हि संसिद्धिमास्थिता जनकादयः लोकसंग्रहमेवापि सम्पश्यन्कर्तुमर्हसि
Indeed, Janaka and others attained perfection through action alone; you should act also for the welfare of the world.
Janak raja jaise log karm karke hi siddh hue; tum bhi lok kalyan ke liye karm karo.

Sanskrit verse: यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जनः स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते
Translation (English): Whatever a great person does, others follow; whatever standard they set, the world pursues.
Hinglish (1): Shreshth vyakti jo karta hai, anya log usi ka anukaran karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Ek shreshth purush jo-jo aacharan karta hai, doosre log bhi waisa hi aacharan karte hain. Woh jo pramaan sthapit karta hai, poora sansaar usi ka anusaran karta hai.
Summary: Importance of setting a good example.
message:
यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जनः स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते
Whatever a great person does, others follow; whatever standard they set, the world pursues.
Shreshth vyakti jo karta hai, anya log usi ka anukaran karte hain.

Sanskrit verse: न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन नानवाप्तमवाप्तव्यं वर्त एव च कर्मणि
Translation (English): O Parth, I have nothing to gain in the three worlds, nothing unattained to attain—yet I am engaged in action.
Hinglish (1): Hey Parth, mujhe teenon lok me kuchh prapt ya prapt karne layak nahi, phir bhi main karm me laga hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, mere liye in teeno lokon mein na toh koi kartavya hai aur na hi koi prapt karne yogy vastu hai. Phir bhi, main nirdharit karmon mein laga rehta hoon.
Summary: Even God acts to sustain cosmic order.
message:
न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन नानवाप्तमवाप्तव्यं वर्त एव च कर्मणि
O Parth, I have nothing to gain in the three worlds, nothing unattained to attain—yet I am engaged in action.
Hey Parth, mujhe teenon lok me kuchh prapt ya prapt karne layak nahi, phir bhi main karm me laga hoon.

Sanskrit verse: यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मण्यतन्द्रितः मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः
Translation (English): If I did not tirelessly perform action, people would follow My path in all respects, O Parth.
Hinglish (1): Agar main alas ho kar karm na karun, to log mere raaste par chalenge hi nahi.
Hinglish (2): Kyunki yadi main saavdhani se karm na karoon, toh hey Parth, sabhi manushya har prakaar se mere hi maarg ka anusaran karne lagenge.
Summary: God’s example holds the world together.
message:
यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मण्यतन्द्रितः मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः
If I did not tirelessly perform action, people would follow My path in all respects, O Parth.
Agar main alas ho kar karm na karun, to log mere raaste par chalenge hi nahi.

Sanskrit verse: उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम् सङ्करस्य च कर्ता स्यामुपहन्यामिमाः प्रजाः
Translation (English): These worlds would perish if I ceased to act; I would cause disorder and destroy these beings.
Hinglish (1): Agar main karm chhod du, to ye lok nasht ho jayenge, aur vyavastha bigad jayegi.
Hinglish (2): Yadi main karm na karoon, toh yeh saare lok nasht ho jaayenge. Main varn-sankar ka kaaran banunga aur is praja ke naash ka jimmedaar hounga.
message:
उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम् सङ्करस्य च कर्ता स्यामुपहन्यामिमाः प्रजाः
These worlds would perish if I ceased to act; I would cause disorder and destroy these beings.
Agar main karm chhod du, to ye lok nasht ho jayenge, aur vyavastha bigad jayegi.

Sanskrit verse: सक्ताः कर्मण्यविद्वांसो यथा कुर्वन्ति भारत कुर्याद्विद्वांस्तथासक्तश्चिकीर्षुर्लोकसंग्रहम्
Translation (English): As the ignorant act attached to work, so should the wise act without attachment, wishing for the welfare of the world.
Hinglish (1): Jaise agyaani asakti se karm karte hain, waise hi gyaani bina asakti ke lok kalyan ke liye karein.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, jaise agyaani log phal mein aasakt hokar karm karte hain, usi tarah gyaani ko attachment-rahit hokar, lok-kalyan ki ichha se karm karna chahiye.
Summary: Act in the world without being bound.
message:
सक्ताः कर्मण्यविद्वांसो यथा कुर्वन्ति भारत कुर्याद्विद्वांस्तथासक्तश्चिकीर्षुर्लोकसंग्रहम्
As the ignorant act attached to work, so should the wise act without attachment, wishing for the welfare of the world.
Jaise agyaani asakti se karm karte hain, waise hi gyaani bina asakti ke lok kalyan ke liye karein.
tags: Nishkama Karma (selfless action), Karma Yoga, detachment

Sanskrit verse: न बुद्धिभेदं जनयेदज्ञानां कर्मसङ्गिनाम् जोषयेत्सर्वकर्माणि विद्वान्युक्तः समाचरन्
Translation (English): The wise should not disturb the minds of the ignorant attached to work; instead, inspire them by performing all actions with discipline.
Hinglish (1): Gyaani ko agyaani logon ka man todna nahi chahiye; apne karm se prerna deni chahiye.
Hinglish (2): Gyaani vyakti ko, karmon mein aasakt agyaaniyon ki buddhi mein bhram paida nahi karna chahiye. Balki, usey स्वयं yog-yukt hokar sabhi karm achhi tarah karte hue unhe bhi karm karne ke liye prerit karna chahiye.
message:
न बुद्धिभेदं जनयेदज्ञानां कर्मसङ्गिनाम् जोषयेत्सर्वकर्माणि विद्वान्युक्तः समाचरन्
The wise should not disturb the minds of the ignorant attached to work; instead, inspire them by performing all actions with discipline.
Gyaani ko agyaani logon ka man todna nahi chahiye; apne karm se prerna deni chahiye.

Sanskrit verse: प्रकृतेः क्रियमाणानि गुणैः कर्माणि सर्वशः अहंकारविमूडात्मा कर्ताहमिति मन्यते
Translation (English): All actions are performed by the modes of material nature; the deluded self thinks, "I am the doer."
Hinglish (1): Sab karm prakriti ke gunon se hote hain; moorkh sochta hai “main karta hoon”.
Hinglish (2): Sabhi karm vastav mein prakriti ke guno dwara kiye jaate hain. Par ahankar se mohit hua agyaani vyakti 'main karta hoon' aisa maan leta hai.
message:
प्रकृतेः क्रियमाणानि गुणैः कर्माणि सर्वशः अहंकारविमूडात्मा कर्ताहमिति मन्यते
All actions are performed by the modes of material nature; the deluded self thinks, "I am the doer."
Sab karm prakriti ke gunon se hote hain; moorkh sochta hai “main karta hoon”.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, Jnana Yoga, detachment

Sanskrit verse: तत्त्ववित्तु महाबाहो गुणकर्मविभागयोः गुणा गुणेषु वर्तन्त इति मत्वा न सज्जते
Translation (English): But one who knows the truth, O mighty‑armed, understands the gunas act upon the gunas and is not attached.
Hinglish (1): Hey Arjun, jo sach ko jaanta hai, woh samajhta hai ki yeh saara khel prakriti ke teen gunon ka hi hai. Yeh jaankar ki 'gun hi gunon se pratikriya kar rahe hain', woh is khel mein fasta nahi.
Hinglish (2): Par hey Mahabahu, jo gun aur karm ke vibhaag ke tattva ko jaanta hai, woh yeh samajhkar ki 'gun hi guno mein barat rahe hain', unmein aasakt nahi hota.
Summary: Wise detach from the interplay of nature.
message:
तत्त्ववित्तु महाबाहो गुणकर्मविभागयोः गुणा गुणेषु वर्तन्त इति मत्वा न सज्जते
But one who knows the truth, O mighty‑armed, understands the gunas act upon the gunas and is not attached.
Hey Arjun, jo sach ko jaanta hai, woh samajhta hai ki yeh saara khel prakriti ke teen gunon ka hi hai. Yeh jaankar ki 'gun hi gunon se pratikriya kar rahe hain', woh is khel mein fasta nahi.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, Jnana Yoga, detachment

Sanskrit verse: प्रकृतेर्गुणसम्मूढाः सज्जन्ते गुणकर्मसु तानकृत्स्नविदो मन्दान्कृत्स्नविन्न विचालयेत्
Translation (English): Those deluded by nature’s gunas become attached to their works; the knower should not unsettle the ignorant.
Hinglish (1): Prakriti ke gunon me uljhe log apne karm se jude rehte hain; gyaani ko unhe pareshan nahi karna chahiye.
Hinglish (2): Prakriti ke guno se mohit hue log, guno aur karmon mein aasakt rehte hain. Un adhoore gyaan waale mand-buddhi logon ko, poorn gyaan waala gyaani vichlit na kare.
Summary: Patience with those not ready for deeper truth.
message:
प्रकृतेर्गुणसम्मूढाः सज्जन्ते गुणकर्मसु तानकृत्स्नविदो मन्दान्कृत्स्नविन्न विचालयेत्
Those deluded by nature’s gunas become attached to their works; the knower should not unsettle the ignorant.
Prakriti ke gunon me uljhe log apne karm se jude rehte hain; gyaani ko unhe pareshan nahi karna chahiye.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, confusion

Sanskrit verse: मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि संन्यस्याध्यात्मचेतसा निराशीर्निर्ममो भूत्वा युध्यस्व विगतज्वरः
Translation (English): Dedicate all actions to Me, with your mind on the self, free from hope and possessiveness, and fight without grief.
Hinglish (1): Mere liye sab karm arpan karke, nirasha aur nirmam hokar bina chinta yudh karo.
Hinglish (2): Apne sabhi karmon ko mujhe samarpit karke, adhyatmik chetna mein sthit hokar, aasha-rahit aur mamta-rahit hokar, aur shok-rahit hokar yuddh karo.
Summary: Devotional surrender removes bondage of action.
message:
मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि संन्यस्याध्यात्मचेतसा निराशीर्निर्ममो भूत्वा युध्यस्व विगतज्वरः
Dedicate all actions to Me, with your mind on the self, free from hope and possessiveness, and fight without grief.
Mere liye sab karm arpan karke, nirasha aur nirmam hokar bina chinta yudh karo.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, Nishkama Karma (selfless action), detachment

Sanskrit verse: ये मे मतमिदं नित्यमनुतिष्ठन्ति मानवाः श्रद्धावन्तोऽनसूयन्तो मुच्यन्ते तेऽपि कर्मभिः
Translation (English): Those who continually practice My teaching with faith and without envy become free from karma.
Hinglish (1): Jo log mere updesh ko shraddha se bina jalan ke maante hain, ve karm bandhan se mukt hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Jo manushya shraddha-yukta hokar aur dvesh-rahit hokar hamesha mere is mat ka anusaran karte hain, ve bhi sabhi karmon ke bandhan se mukt ho jaate hain.
message:
ये मे मतमिदं नित्यमनुतिष्ठन्ति मानवाः श्रद्धावन्तोऽनसूयन्तो मुच्यन्ते तेऽपि कर्मभिः
Those who continually practice My teaching with faith and without envy become free from karma.
Jo log mere updesh ko shraddha se bina jalan ke maante hain, ve karm bandhan se mukt hote hain.

Sanskrit verse: ये त्वेतदभ्यसूयन्तो नानुतिष्ठन्ति मे मतम् सर्वज्ञानविमूढांस्तान्विद्धि नष्टानचेतसः
Translation (English): But those who, criticizing this teaching, do not follow it, know them to be deluded, devoid of all knowledge, and destined for ruin.
Hinglish (1): Lekin jo log is gyaan par sandeh karke aur ismein kamiyan nikaalkar ispar nahi chalte, ve har tarah ki samajh se bhatke hue hain. Unhein vivek-shunya (devoid of sense) hi maano.
Hinglish (2): Parantu jo log dvesh-bhaav se mere is updesh mein dosh nikaalte hain aur iska paalan nahi karte, un sabhi gyaan se bhatke hue vivek-heen logon ko nasht hua hi samjho.
Summary: Rejecting divine teaching leads to downfall.
message:
ये त्वेतदभ्यसूयन्तो नानुतिष्ठन्ति मे मतम् सर्वज्ञानविमूढांस्तान्विद्धि नष्टानचेतसः
But those who, criticizing this teaching, do not follow it, know them to be deluded, devoid of all knowledge, and destined for ruin.
Lekin jo log is gyaan par sandeh karke aur ismein kamiyan nikaalkar ispar nahi chalte, ve har tarah ki samajh se bhatke hue hain. Unhein vivek-shunya (devoid of sense) hi maano.

Sanskrit verse: सदृशं चेष्टते स्वस्याः प्रकृतेर्ज्ञानवानपि प्रकृतिं यान्ति भूतानि निग्रहः किं करिष्यति
Translation (English): Even the wise act according to their own nature; beings follow their nature—what will restraint accomplish?
Hinglish (1): Gyaani bhi apni prakriti anusar chalta hai; sabhi jeev apni prakriti se chalaye jaate hain; dabav se kya hoga?
Hinglish (2): Sabhi praani apni prakriti ke anusaar hi aacharan karte hain, yahan tak ki gyaani bhi. Jab sab apni prakriti ke vash mein hain, toh hath-dharmi se kya hoga?
message:
सदृशं चेष्टते स्वस्याः प्रकृतेर्ज्ञानवानपि प्रकृतिं यान्ति भूतानि निग्रहः किं करिष्यति
Even the wise act according to their own nature; beings follow their nature—what will restraint accomplish?
Gyaani bhi apni prakriti anusar chalta hai; sabhi jeev apni prakriti se chalaye jaate hain; dabav se kya hoga?

Sanskrit verse: इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्यवस्थितौ तयोर्न वशमागच्छेत्तौ ह्यस्य परिपन्थिनौ
Translation (English): Attachment and aversion for sense objects are fixed; one should not come under their sway, for they are enemies.
Hinglish (1): Har sense experience ke saath do automatic reactions jude hain—attraction (Raga) aur aversion (Dvesha). In automatic 'likes' aur 'dislikes' ke control mein mat aao, kyunki yeh tumhari shaanti ko loot te hain.
Hinglish (2): Har indriya aur uske vishay mein raag (attachment) aur dvesh (aversion) sthit hain. Manushya ko in dono ke vash mein nahi aana chahiye, kyunki yeh uske kalyan ke maarg mein shatru hain.
Summary: Warns against control by likes and dislikes.
message:
इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्यवस्थितौ तयोर्न वशमागच्छेत्तौ ह्यस्य परिपन्थिनौ
Attachment and aversion for sense objects are fixed; one should not come under their sway, for they are enemies.
Har sense experience ke saath do automatic reactions jude hain—attraction (Raga) aur aversion (Dvesha). In automatic 'likes' aur 'dislikes' ke control mein mat aao, kyunki yeh tumhari shaanti ko loot te hain.
tags: detachment, equanimity, how to control anger

Sanskrit verse: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् स्वधर्मे निधनं श्रेयः परधर्मो भयावहः
Translation (English): Better is one’s own dharma, though imperfect, than another’s well‑performed dharma; dying in one’s own dharma is better; another’s dharma is perilous.
Hinglish (1): Apne svabhavik karm (Swa-dharm) ko, bhale hi usmein kamiyan reh jaayein, nibhana behtar hai, bajaye iske ki kisi aur ke karm ko poori nipunata se kiya jaaye. Apni prakriti ke anusaar jeete hue mar jaana bhi kalyankari hai; kisi aur ki prakriti ko apnana bhayavah hai.
Hinglish (2): Apna svabhavik kaam (Swa-dharma) bhale hi imperfectly kiya jaaye, woh kisi doosre ke kaam ko perfectly karne se behtar hai. Apne Swa-dharma mein mar jaana bhi achha hai; kisi aur ka raasta apnana khatarnaak hota hai.
message:
श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् स्वधर्मे निधनं श्रेयः परधर्मो भयावहः
Better is one’s own dharma, though imperfect, than another’s well‑performed dharma; dying in one’s own dharma is better; another’s dharma is perilous.
Apne svabhavik karm (Swa-dharm) ko, bhale hi usmein kamiyan reh jaayein, nibhana behtar hai, bajaye iske ki kisi aur ke karm ko poori nipunata se kiya jaaye. Apni prakriti ke anusaar jeete hue mar jaana bhi kalyankari hai; kisi aur ki prakriti ko apnana bhayavah hai.
tags: Dharma, finding career purpose, job dissatisfaction, fear of failure

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच अथ केन प्रयुक्तोऽयं पापं चरति पूरुषः अनिच्छन्नपि वार्ष्णेय बलादिव नियोजितः
Translation (English): Arjuna said: O Krishna, by what is one impelled to commit sin, even unwillingly, as if forced?
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Hey Krishna, kaun vyakti ko paap karne ko majboor karta hai, chahe vah nahi chahta ho?
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne poocha: Hey Vrishni-vanshi, toh phir manushya na chahte hue bhi, jaise ki zabardasti dhakela gaya ho, kis se prerit hokar paap-karm karta hai?
Summary: Arjuna asks about the force behind wrongdoing.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच अथ केन प्रयुक्तोऽयं पापं चरति पूरुषः अनिच्छन्नपि वार्ष्णेय बलादिव नियोजितः
Arjuna said: O Krishna, by what is one impelled to commit sin, even unwillingly, as if forced?
Arjun bola: Hey Krishna, kaun vyakti ko paap karne ko majboor karta hai, chahe vah nahi chahta ho?

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच काम एष क्रोध एष रजोगुणसमुद्भवः महाशनो महापाप्मा विद्ध्येनमिह वैरिणम्
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: It is desire, it is anger, born of rajo‑guna, all‑devouring and the great sinner—recognize this as the enemy.
Hinglish (1): Shri Bhagwan ne kaha: Yeh Kaam (lust/craving) hi hai, jo Krodh (wrath) ka roop le leta hai. Yeh Rajo-gun se paida hota hai, iski bhookh kabhi nahi mit-ti (maha-shano) aur yeh maha-paapi hai. Ise hi tum is sansaar mein apna param shatru jaano.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Yeh 'Kaam' (desire/lust) hai, aur yahi 'Krodh' (anger) hai, jo Rajo-gun se paida hota hai. Iski bhookh kabhi nahi mit-ti aur yeh maha-paapi hai. Is duniya mein ise hi apna sabse bada dushman samjho.
Summary: Identifies desire and anger as chief foes.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच काम एष क्रोध एष रजोगुणसमुद्भवः महाशनो महापाप्मा विद्ध्येनमिह वैरिणम्
The Blessed Lord said: It is desire, it is anger, born of rajo‑guna, all‑devouring and the great sinner—recognize this as the enemy.
Shri Bhagwan ne kaha: Yeh Kaam (lust/craving) hi hai, jo Krodh (wrath) ka roop le leta hai. Yeh Rajo-gun se paida hota hai, iski bhookh kabhi nahi mit-ti (maha-shano) aur yeh maha-paapi hai. Ise hi tum is sansaar mein apna param shatru jaano.
tags: how to control anger, letting go of greed, Rajas

Sanskrit verse: धूमेनाव्रियते वन्हिर्यथादर्शो मलेन च यथोल्बेनावृतो गर्भस्तथा तेनेदमावृतम्
Translation (English): As fire is covered by smoke, a mirror by dust, and the embryo by the womb, so is knowledge covered by desire.
Hinglish (1): Jaise aag dhue se, darpan dhul se dhak jaata hai, waise gyaan kaam (vaasna) se dhak jaata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jaise dhuan aag ko, dhool sheeshe ko, aur garbh-jhilli garbh ko dhak leti hai, usi tarah kaam (desire) gyaan ko dhak leta hai.
message:
धूमेनाव्रियते वन्हिर्यथादर्शो मलेन च यथोल्बेनावृतो गर्भस्तथा तेनेदमावृतम्
As fire is covered by smoke, a mirror by dust, and the embryo by the womb, so is knowledge covered by desire.
Jaise aag dhue se, darpan dhul se dhak jaata hai, waise gyaan kaam (vaasna) se dhak jaata hai.
tags: letting go of greed, Jnana Yoga

Sanskrit verse: आवृतं ज्ञानमेतेन ज्ञानिनो नित्यवैरिणा कामरूपेण कौन्तेय दुष्पूरेणानलेन च
Translation (English): This constant enemy of the wise—desire—burns like insatiable fire, covering knowledge.
Hinglish (1): Hey Kaunteya, yeh kaam (vaasna) gyaani ka nitya shatru hai, jo kabhi na bujhne wali aag ki tarah jalta hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kunti-putra, gyaaniyon ke is nitya shatru, kaam-roopi kabhi na tript hone waali aag se gyaan dhaka rehta hai.
message:
आवृतं ज्ञानमेतेन ज्ञानिनो नित्यवैरिणा कामरूपेण कौन्तेय दुष्पूरेणानलेन च
This constant enemy of the wise—desire—burns like insatiable fire, covering knowledge.
Hey Kaunteya, yeh kaam (vaasna) gyaani ka nitya shatru hai, jo kabhi na bujhne wali aag ki tarah jalta hai.
tags: letting go of greed, negative thoughts

Sanskrit verse: इन्द्रियाणि मनो बुद्धिरस्याधिष्ठानमुच्यते एतैर्विमोहयत्येष ज्ञानमावृत्य देहिनम्
Translation (English): The senses, mind, and intellect are said to be its seat; through these it deludes the embodied soul, covering knowledge.
Hinglish (1): Kaam (desire) in teen jagahon par kabza karta hai: indriyon par, mann par, aur buddhi par. Inka istemaal karke, woh gyaan par parda daal deta hai aur insaan ko bhatka deta hai.
Hinglish (2): Indriyan, mann, aur buddhi is kaam (desire) ke nivaas-sthan kahe jaate hain. Inke dwara yeh gyaan ko dhakkar jeevatma ko mohit kar leta hai.
message:
इन्द्रियाणि मनो बुद्धिरस्याधिष्ठानमुच्यते एतैर्विमोहयत्येष ज्ञानमावृत्य देहिनम्
The senses, mind, and intellect are said to be its seat; through these it deludes the embodied soul, covering knowledge.
Kaam (desire) in teen jagahon par kabza karta hai: indriyon par, mann par, aur buddhi par. Inka istemaal karke, woh gyaan par parda daal deta hai aur insaan ko bhatka deta hai.
tags: how to control anger, lack of focus, letting go of greed

Sanskrit verse: तस्मात्त्वमिन्द्रियाण्यादौ नियम्य भरतर्षभ पापनं प्रजहि ह्येनं ज्ञानविज्ञाननाशनम्
Translation (English): Therefore, O best of the Bharatas, controlling the senses at the outset, kill this destroyer of knowledge and realization.
Hinglish (1): Pehle indriyaon ko niyantrit karke is gyaan-nashak kaam (desire) ko maaro.
Hinglish (2): Isliye, hey Bharat-shreshth, tum sabse pehle indriyon ko vash mein karke is gyaan aur vigyaan ko nasht karne waale maha-paapi kaam (desire) ka avashya hi vadh karo.
Summary: Calls for early control of desire.
message:
तस्मात्त्वमिन्द्रियाण्यादौ नियम्य भरतर्षभ पापनं प्रजहि ह्येनं ज्ञानविज्ञाननाशनम्
Therefore, O best of the Bharatas, controlling the senses at the outset, kill this destroyer of knowledge and realization.
Pehle indriyaon ko niyantrit karke is gyaan-nashak kaam (desire) ko maaro.
tags: Nishkama Karma, how to control anger, letting go of greed

Sanskrit verse: इन्द्रियाणि पराण्याहुरिन्द्रियेभ्यः परं मनः मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्यो बुद्धेः परतस्तु सः
Translation (English): The senses are said to be superior to the body, mind superior to the senses, intellect superior to the mind, and He beyond intellect is the Self.
Hinglish (1): Tumhari senses tumhari body se powerful hain. Tumhara mind tumhari senses se powerful hai. Tumhara intellect tumhare mind se powerful hai. Aur jo tumhare intellect se bhi upar hai, wahi tumhara true Self (Aatma) hai.
Hinglish (2): Sthool shareer se pare indriyan hain, indriyon se pare mann hai, mann se pare buddhi hai, aur jo buddhi se bhi pare hai, woh Aatma hai.
Summary: Hierarchy of control leading to the soul.
message:
इन्द्रियाणि पराण्याहुरिन्द्रियेभ्यः परं मनः मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्यो बुद्धेः परतस्तु सः
The senses are said to be superior to the body, mind superior to the senses, intellect superior to the mind, and He beyond intellect is the Self.
Tumhari senses tumhari body se powerful hain. Tumhara mind tumhari senses se powerful hai. Tumhara intellect tumhare mind se powerful hai. Aur jo tumhare intellect se bhi upar hai, wahi tumhara true Self (Aatma) hai.
tags: Atman, self-realization, Jnana Yoga, inner peace

Sanskrit verse: एवं बुद्धेः परं बुद्ध्वा संस्तभ्यात्मानमात्मना जहि शत्रुं महाबाहो कामरूपं दुरासदम्
Translation (English): Thus knowing the Self to be beyond intellect, steadying the mind by the mind, kill the enemy in the form of desire, O mighty‑armed.
Hinglish (1): Is tarah apni buddhi se bhi upar uthkar apne 'Self' ko pehchano! Apni isi shakti se mann ko kaabu mein karo, aur is kaam (desire)-roopi ziddi dushman ka ant kar do!
Hinglish (2): Hey Mahabahu, is prakaar buddhi se pare Aatma ko jaankar, aur apne mann ko aatma dwara sthir karke, is kaam-roopi durjay shatru ko maar daalo.
Summary: Ends with the supreme call to conquer desire through self‑knowledge.
message:
एवं बुद्धेः परं बुद्ध्वा संस्तभ्यात्मानमात्मना जहि शत्रुं महाबाहो कामरूपं दुरासदम्
Thus knowing the Self to be beyond intellect, steadying the mind by the mind, kill the enemy in the form of desire, O mighty‑armed.
Is tarah apni buddhi se bhi upar uthkar apne 'Self' ko pehchano! Apni isi shakti se mann ko kaabu mein karo, aur is kaam (desire)-roopi ziddi dushman ka ant kar do!

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच इमं विवस्वते योगं प्रोक्तवानहमव्ययम् विवस्वान्मनवे प्राह मनुरिक्ष्वाकवेऽब्रवीत्
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: I taught this imperishable yoga to the sun-god Vivasvan; Vivasvan taught it to Manu; Manu taught it to Ikshvaku.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Maine yeh avinaashi yoga surya dev Vivasvan ko diya, Vivasvan ne Manu ko, Manu ne Ikshvaku ko.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Maine is avinashi yog-vidya ka updesh surya-dev Vivasvan ko diya, Vivasvan ne manushyon ke pita Manu ko diya, aur Manu ne iska updesh Ikshvaku ko diya.
Summary: Krishna traces the ancient origin of yoga.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच इमं विवस्वते योगं प्रोक्तवानहमव्ययम् विवस्वान्मनवे प्राह मनुरिक्ष्वाकवेऽब्रवीत्
The Blessed Lord said: I taught this imperishable yoga to the sun-god Vivasvan; Vivasvan taught it to Manu; Manu taught it to Ikshvaku.
Shri Krishna bole: Maine yeh avinaashi yoga surya dev Vivasvan ko diya, Vivasvan ne Manu ko, Manu ne Ikshvaku ko.

Sanskrit verse: एवं परम्पराप्राप्तमिमं राजर्षयो विदुः स कालेनेह महता योगो नष्टः परन्तप
Translation (English): Thus, received through the disciplic succession, the royal sages knew it; over time, the yoga was lost, O scorcher of foes.
Hinglish (1): Yeh parampara se rajrishiyon ne jana, par samay ke saath yeh yoga kho gaya, hey shatrutap.
Hinglish (2): Hey shatru-vijeta, is prakaar parampara se prapt is gyaan ko rajarshiyon ne jaana. Kintu samay ke saath, woh yog is sansaar se lupt ho gaya.
Summary: Highlights loss of true knowledge over time.
message:
एवं परम्पराप्राप्तमिमं राजर्षयो विदुः स कालेनेह महता योगो नष्टः परन्तप
Thus, received through the disciplic succession, the royal sages knew it; over time, the yoga was lost, O scorcher of foes.
Yeh parampara se rajrishiyon ne jana, par samay ke saath yeh yoga kho gaya, hey shatrutap.

Sanskrit verse: स एवायं मया तेऽद्य योगः प्रोक्तः पुरातनः भक्तोऽसि मे सखा चेति रहस्यं ह्येतदुत्तमम्
Translation (English): The same ancient yoga is today told to you by Me, because you are My devotee and friend; this is the supreme secret.
Hinglish (1): Wahi purana yoga main aaj tumhe de raha hoon, kyun ki tum mere bhakt aur dost ho; yeh sarvottam rahasya hai.
Hinglish (2): Aaj wahi prachin yog main tumhein bata raha hoon, kyunki tum mere bhakt bhi ho aur mitra bhi. Yeh gyaan atyant uttam aur rahasyamay hai.
Summary: Krishna grants special grace to Arjuna.
message:
स एवायं मया तेऽद्य योगः प्रोक्तः पुरातनः भक्तोऽसि मे सखा चेति रहस्यं ह्येतदुत्तमम्
The same ancient yoga is today told to you by Me, because you are My devotee and friend; this is the supreme secret.
Wahi purana yoga main aaj tumhe de raha hoon, kyun ki tum mere bhakt aur dost ho; yeh sarvottam rahasya hai.

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच अपरं भवतो जन्म परं जन्म विवस्वतः कथमेतद्विजानीयां त्वमादौ प्रोक्तवानिति
Translation (English): Arjuna said: You were born recently; Vivasvan was born long ago. How am I to understand that You taught this in the beginning?
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Aap ka janm abhi ka hai, Vivasvan to bahut pehle hua; aapne shuru me kaise sikhaya?
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Surya-dev Vivasvan ka janm toh aapse bahut pehle hua tha. Main kaise samjhun ki shuruaat mein aapne hi unhe is yog ka updesh diya tha?
message:
अर्जुन उवाच अपरं भवतो जन्म परं जन्म विवस्वतः कथमेतद्विजानीयां त्वमादौ प्रोक्तवानिति
Arjuna said: You were born recently; Vivasvan was born long ago. How am I to understand that You taught this in the beginning?
Arjun bola: Aap ka janm abhi ka hai, Vivasvan to bahut pehle hua; aapne shuru me kaise sikhaya?

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परन्तप
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: Many births of Mine and yours have passed, O Arjuna; I know them all, but you do not, O scorcher of foes.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Mere aur tumhare anek janm beet gaye; main sab jaanta hoon, tum nahi.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Hey shatru-vijeta Arjun, mere aur tumhare anek janm ho chuke hain. Mujhe woh sab yaad hain, lekin tumhein yaad nahi hain.
Summary: Introduces concept of Krishna’s divine nature.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परन्तप
The Blessed Lord said: Many births of Mine and yours have passed, O Arjuna; I know them all, but you do not, O scorcher of foes.
Shri Krishna bole: Mere aur tumhare anek janm beet gaye; main sab jaanta hoon, tum nahi.

Sanskrit verse: अजोऽपि सन्नव्ययात्मा भूतानामीश्वरोऽपि सन् प्रकृतिं स्वामधिष्ठाय सम्भवाम्यात्ममायया
Translation (English): Though unborn and imperishable, and Lord of beings, I appear by controlling My own nature, through My divine potency.
Hinglish (1): Main ajanma, avinaashi aur praniyon ka ishwara hote huye bhi, apni prakriti par niyantran karke prakashit hota hoon.
Hinglish (2): Bhale hi main ajanma aur avinashi hoon, aur sabhi praaniyon ka Ishwar hoon, phir bhi main apni prakriti ko adheen karke, apni aatm-maya se is sansaar mein prakat hota hoon.
message:
अजोऽपि सन्नव्ययात्मा भूतानामीश्वरोऽपि सन् प्रकृतिं स्वामधिष्ठाय सम्भवाम्यात्ममायया
Though unborn and imperishable, and Lord of beings, I appear by controlling My own nature, through My divine potency.
Main ajanma, avinaashi aur praniyon ka ishwara hote huye bhi, apni prakriti par niyantran karke prakashit hota hoon.

Sanskrit verse: यदा यदाहि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदात्मानं सृजाम्यहम्
Translation (English): Whenever there is decline in dharma and rise of adharma, O Bharata, I manifest Myself.
Hinglish (1): Jab jab dharm me girawat aur adharma me vriddhi hoti hai, main apne aap ko prakat karta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, jab bhi aur jahan bhi dharm ka patan hota hai aur adharm badhne lagta hai, tab-tab main swayam avtaar leta hoon.
Summary: Krishna reveals His purpose of descent.
message:
यदा यदाहि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदात्मानं सृजाम्यहम्
Whenever there is decline in dharma and rise of adharma, O Bharata, I manifest Myself.
Jab jab dharm me girawat aur adharma me vriddhi hoti hai, main apne aap ko prakat karta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: परित्राणाय साधूनां विनाशाय च दुष्कृताम् धर्मसंस्थापनार्थाय सम्भवामि युगे युगे
Translation (English): For protecting the righteous, destroying the wicked, and establishing dharma, I appear millennium after millennium.
Hinglish (1): Bhakt janon ke raksha, dushton ka vinash aur dharm sthapna ke liye main yug-yug me aata hoon.
Hinglish (2): Saajnon ki raksha karne, dushton ka vinaash karne, aur dharm ki phir se sthapna karne ke liye, main har yug mein prakat hota hoon.
message:
परित्राणाय साधूनां विनाशाय च दुष्कृताम् धर्मसंस्थापनार्थाय सम्भवामि युगे युगे
For protecting the righteous, destroying the wicked, and establishing dharma, I appear millennium after millennium.
Bhakt janon ke raksha, dushton ka vinash aur dharm sthapna ke liye main yug-yug me aata hoon.

Sanskrit verse: जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यमेवं यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः त्यक्त्वा देहं पुनर्जन्म नैति मामेति सोऽर्जुन
Translation (English): One who knows in truth My divine birth and actions, upon leaving the body, is not born again but comes to Me, O Arjuna.
Hinglish (1): Jo mera janm aur karm ko sach me jaanta hai, sharir chhodne par mujhme milta hai, janm nahi leta.
Hinglish (2): Hey Arjun, jo mere is divya janm aur karm ko tattva se jaan leta hai, woh shareer tyagne ke baad punarjanm nahi leta, balki mujhe hi prapt hota hai.
Summary: Knowledge of divine nature leads to liberation.
message:
जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यमेवं यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः त्यक्त्वा देहं पुनर्जन्म नैति मामेति सोऽर्जुन
One who knows in truth My divine birth and actions, upon leaving the body, is not born again but comes to Me, O Arjuna.
Jo mera janm aur karm ko sach me jaanta hai, sharir chhodne par mujhme milta hai, janm nahi leta.

Sanskrit verse: वीतरागभयक्रोधा मन्मया मामुपाश्रिताः बहवो ज्ञानतपसा पूता मद्भावमागताः
Translation (English): Freed from attachment, fear and anger, absorbed in Me, many became purified through knowledge and attained My state.
Hinglish (1): Raag, bhay aur krodh se mukt, mujhme sthit aur gyaan tapasya se shudh hokar log mere gyaan me aaye.
Hinglish (2): Attachment, bhay aur krodh se mukt hokar, poori tarah mujhme sthit hokar, aur gyaan-roopi tap se pavitra hokar, bahut se logon ne mere divya prem ko prapt kiya hai.
message:
वीतरागभयक्रोधा मन्मया मामुपाश्रिताः बहवो ज्ञानतपसा पूता मद्भावमागताः
Freed from attachment, fear and anger, absorbed in Me, many became purified through knowledge and attained My state.
