Raag, bhay aur krodh se mukt, mujhme sthit aur gyaan tapasya se shudh hokar log mere gyaan me aaye.

Sanskrit verse: ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यहम् मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः
Translation (English): As they approach Me, I reciprocate with them accordingly; all people follow My path, O Partha.
Hinglish (1): Jo jaise mujhme aata hai, main bhi uski seva karta hoon; sab log mera marg apnate hain.
Hinglish (2): Jo jis bhaav se meri sharan leta hai, main usi ke anuroop use phal deta hoon. Hey Parth, sabhi manushya har prakaar se mere hi maarg ka anusaran karte hain.
message:
ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यहम् मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः
As they approach Me, I reciprocate with them accordingly; all people follow My path, O Partha.
Jo jaise mujhme aata hai, main bhi uski seva karta hoon; sab log mera marg apnate hain.

Sanskrit verse: काङ्क्षन्तः कर्मणां सिद्धिं यजन्त इह देवताः क्षिप्रं हि मानुषे लोके सिद्धिर्भवति कर्मजा
Translation (English): Those desiring success in action worship the gods; in the human world, success from work comes quickly.
Hinglish (1): Is duniya mein, jo log apne kaamo mein quick results chahte hain, ve alag-alag devtaon ko poojte hain. Aisa isliye hai, kyunki material actions se milne wali success yahan jaldi hi mil jaati hai.
Hinglish (2): Is duniya mein, jo log apne kaamo mein jaldi safalta chahte hain, ve devtaon ki pooja karte hain. Kyunki manushya lok mein karmon se milne waali safalta jaldi hi mil jaati hai.
Summary: Material desires lead to worship of lesser deities.
message:
काङ्क्षन्तः कर्मणां सिद्धिं यजन्त इह देवताः क्षिप्रं हि मानुषे लोके सिद्धिर्भवति कर्मजा
Those desiring success in action worship the gods; in the human world, success from work comes quickly.
Is duniya mein, jo log apne kaamo mein quick results chahte hain, ve alag-alag devtaon ko poojte hain. Aisa isliye hai, kyunki material actions se milne wali success yahan jaldi hi mil jaati hai.

Sanskrit verse: चातुर्वर्ण्यं मया सृष्टं गुणकर्मविभागशः तस्य कर्तारमपि मां विद्ध्यकर्तारमव्ययम्
Translation (English): The four varnas were created by Me according to guna and karma; though I am the creator, know Me as non‑doer, immutable.
Hinglish (1): Mainne chaar varna guna aur karm ke anusar banaye; main karta hoke bhi akarta aur avinaashi hoon.
Hinglish (2): Chaar varno (brahmin, kshatriya, vaishya, shudra) ki rachna maine gun aur karm ke vibhajan ke aadhar par ki hai. Bhale hi main is system ka creator hoon, par mujhe avinashi aur akarta (non-doer) hi jaano.
Summary: Krishna defines social order but maintains non‑attachment.
message:
चातुर्वर्ण्यं मया सृष्टं गुणकर्मविभागशः तस्य कर्तारमपि मां विद्ध्यकर्तारमव्ययम्
The four varnas were created by Me according to guna and karma; though I am the creator, know Me as non‑doer, immutable.
Mainne chaar varna guna aur karm ke anusar banaye; main karta hoke bhi akarta aur avinaashi hoon.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, Karma, Dharma

Sanskrit verse: न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा इति मां योऽभिजानाति कर्मभिर्न स बध्यते
Translation (English): Actions do not bind Me, nor do I desire fruits; one who knows this is not bound by actions.
Hinglish (1): Karm mujhe bandh nahi sakte, mujhe fal ki iccha nahi; jo mujhe jaanta hai, vo bandhan se mukt ho jaata hai.
Hinglish (2): Karm na toh mujhe lipt karte hain, aur na hi mujhe karm-phal ki koi ichha hai. Jo mujhe is tattva se jaan leta hai, woh bhi karmon ke bandhan mein nahi bandhta.
Summary: Non‑attachment to results frees from karma.
message:
न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा इति मां योऽभिजानाति कर्मभिर्न स बध्यते
Actions do not bind Me, nor do I desire fruits; one who knows this is not bound by actions.
Karm mujhe bandh nahi sakte, mujhe fal ki iccha nahi; jo mujhe jaanta hai, vo bandhan se mukt ho jaata hai.
tags: Nishkama Karma (selfless action), Karma Yoga, Moksha

Sanskrit verse: एवं ज्ञात्वा कृतं कर्म पूर्वैरपि मुमुक्षुभिः कुरु कर्मैव तस्मात्त्वं पूर्वैः पूर्वतरं कृतम्
Translation (English): Knowing this, the seekers of liberation in ancient times performed action; therefore you too should act, as they did before.
Hinglish (1): Is gyaan ko jaankar, purane muktichahi logon ne karm kiya; tum bhi vaisa hi karo.
Hinglish (2): Prachin kaal mein bhi moksh ki ichha rakhne waale sabhi logon ne isi gyaan ko samajhkar karm kiya. Isliye, tum bhi unhi purvajon ki tarah apne kartavya-karm karo.
message:
एवं ज्ञात्वा कृतं कर्म पूर्वैरपि मुमुक्षुभिः कुरु कर्मैव तस्मात्त्वं पूर्वैः पूर्वतरं कृतम्
Knowing this, the seekers of liberation in ancient times performed action; therefore you too should act, as they did before.
Is gyaan ko jaankar, purane muktichahi logon ne karm kiya; tum bhi vaisa hi karo.

Sanskrit verse: किं कर्म किमकर्मेति कवयोऽप्यत्र मोहिताः तत्ते कर्म प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात्
Translation (English): What is action and what is inaction? Even the wise are confused here. I will explain this to you, knowing which you will be freed from evil.
Hinglish (1): Kya hai karm aur kya hai akarm, isme gyaani bhi bhramit hain; main tumhe samjhata hoon, jisse tum paap se mukt ho jaoge.
Hinglish (2): Karm kya hai aur akarm kya hai, is vishay mein buddhiman log bhi mohit ho jaate hain. Main tumhein wahi karm-tattva samjhaunga, jise jaankar tum ashubh se mukt ho jaoge.
Summary: The subtlety of action requires divine explanation.
message:
किं कर्म किमकर्मेति कवयोऽप्यत्र मोहिताः तत्ते कर्म प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात्
What is action and what is inaction? Even the wise are confused here. I will explain this to you, knowing which you will be freed from evil.
Kya hai karm aur kya hai akarm, isme gyaani bhi bhramit hain; main tumhe samjhata hoon, jisse tum paap se mukt ho jaoge.

Sanskrit verse: कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मणः अकर्मणश्च बोद्धव्यं गहना कर्मणो गतिः
Translation (English): One should know what is action, wrong action, and inaction; the nature of action is difficult to understand.
Hinglish (1): Karm (Action), vikarm (wrong-action), aur akarm (inaction) ko samajhna zaroori hai; karm ka raasta bohot gahan hai.
Hinglish (2): Karm ke swaroop ko bhi jaanna chahiye, vikarm (galat karm) ke swaroop ko bhi jaanna chahiye, aur akarm (karm na karna) ke swaroop ko bhi jaanna chahiye. Kyunki karm ki gati atyant gahan hai.
message:
कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मणः अकर्मणश्च बोद्धव्यं गहना कर्मणो गतिः
One should know what is action, wrong action, and inaction; the nature of action is difficult to understand.
Karm (Action), vikarm (wrong-action), aur akarm (inaction) ko samajhna zaroori hai; karm ka raasta bohot gahan hai.

Sanskrit verse: कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्तः कृत्स्नकर्मकृत्
Translation (English): One who sees inaction in action and action in inaction is wise; such a person is a yogi and true performer of action.
Hinglish (1): Jo karm me akarm aur akarm me karm dekhta hai, vah gyaani aur yogi hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo manushya karm mein akarm (inaction) dekhta hai aur akarm mein karm (action) dekhta hai, wahi manushyon mein buddhiman hai. Wohi yogi hai aur sabhi karmon ko karne waala hai.
message:
कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्तः कृत्स्नकर्मकृत्
One who sees inaction in action and action in inaction is wise; such a person is a yogi and true performer of action.
Jo karm me akarm aur akarm me karm dekhta hai, vah gyaani aur yogi hai.
tags: Karma Yoga, Nishkama Karma (selfless action), self-realization

Sanskrit verse: यस्य सर्वे समारम्भाः कामसङ्कल्पवर्जिताः ज्ञानाग्निदग्धकर्माणं तमाहुः पण्डितं बुधाः
Translation (English): Whose undertakings are all devoid of desire and whose actions are burnt by the fire of knowledge, him the wise call learned.
Hinglish (1): Jiske kaam bina kaamna ke hote hain aur gyaan ki aag se karm jal gaye hain, use pandit kehte hain.
Hinglish (2): Jis vyakti ke sabhi karm kaamna aur sankalp se rahit hote hain, aur jiske saare karm gyaan-roopi agni se bhasm ho gaye hain, use gyaani log pandit kehte hain.
message:
यस्य सर्वे समारम्भाः कामसङ्कल्पवर्जिताः ज्ञानाग्निदग्धकर्माणं तमाहुः पण्डितं बुधाः
Whose undertakings are all devoid of desire and whose actions are burnt by the fire of knowledge, him the wise call learned.
Jiske kaam bina kaamna ke hote hain aur gyaan ki aag se karm jal gaye hain, use pandit kehte hain.
tags: Nishkama Karma (selfless action), self-realization, Jnana Yoga

Sanskrit verse: त्यक्त्वा कर्मफलासङ्गं नित्यतृप्तो निराश्रयः कर्मण्यभिप्रवृत्तोपि नैव किञ्चित्करोति सः
Translation (English): Abandoning attachment to results, ever content, independent—though engaged in work, he does nothing.
Hinglish (1): Fal ki asakti chhodkar, sada santusht aur swatantra vyakti karm karte hue bhi karm nahi karta.
Hinglish (2): Karm-phalon ke attachment ko tyagkar, jo hamesha tript aur kisi par ashrit nahi hai, woh sabhi prakaar ke karmon mein laga rehkar bhi vastav mein kuch nahi karta.
message:
त्यक्त्वा कर्मफलासङ्गं नित्यतृप्तो निराश्रयः कर्मण्यभिप्रवृत्तोपि नैव किञ्चित्करोति सः
Abandoning attachment to results, ever content, independent—though engaged in work, he does nothing.
Fal ki asakti chhodkar, sada santusht aur swatantra vyakti karm karte hue bhi karm nahi karta.
tags: detachment, inner peace, Nishkama Karma (selfless action)

Sanskrit verse: निर्वीर्यश्चित्ता यः सर्वं परित्यज्य कर्मणाम् अनिकेतः स्थिरबुद्धिर्न कर्मणोऽनुपश्यति
Translation (English): Without desire, controlling mind and possessions, residing anywhere, firmly rooted in knowledge, he does not get bound by work.
Hinglish (1): Ichha rahit, mann niyantrit, jaha rahta ho, gyaan me sthir, karm se bandhata nahi.
Hinglish (2): Jo aasha-rahit hai, jisne apne mann aur buddhi ko vash mein kar liya hai, aur sabhi prakaar ke swamitva ko tyag diya hai, aisa vyakti kewal shareer-nirvah ke liye karm karte hue paap ko prapt nahi hota.
message:
निर्वीर्यश्चित्ता यः सर्वं परित्यज्य कर्मणाम् अनिकेतः स्थिरबुद्धिर्न कर्मणोऽनुपश्यति
Without desire, controlling mind and possessions, residing anywhere, firmly rooted in knowledge, he does not get bound by work.
Ichha rahit, mann niyantrit, jaha rahta ho, gyaan me sthir, karm se bandhata nahi.
tags: detachment, mental peace, letting go of greed

Sanskrit verse: यदृच्छालाभसन्तुष्टो द्वन्द्वातीतो विमत्सरः समः सिद्धावसिद्धौ च कृत्वापि निबध्यते
Translation (English): Content with what comes by chance, beyond dualities, free from envy, steady in success or failure—he is not bound.
Hinglish (1): Jo jo milta hai usme santusht, sukh-dukh ke paar, irsha rahit aur jeet-har me samaan, vo bandhta nahi.
Hinglish (2): Jo apne aap prapt hui cheezon mein santusht rehta hai, jo dwandwon (dualities) se pare hai, jo dvesh nahi karta, aur jo safalta-asafalta mein samaan rehta hai, woh karm karte hue bhi nahi bandhta.
message:
यदृच्छालाभसन्तुष्टो द्वन्द्वातीतो विमत्सरः समः सिद्धावसिद्धौ च कृत्वापि निबध्यते
Content with what comes by chance, beyond dualities, free from envy, steady in success or failure—he is not bound.
Jo jo milta hai usme santusht, sukh-dukh ke paar, irsha rahit aur jeet-har me samaan, vo bandhta nahi.
tags: equanimity, inner peace, dealing with jealousy

Sanskrit verse: गतसङ्गस्य मुक्तस्य ज्ञानावस्थितचेतसः यज्ञायाचरतः कर्म समग्रं प्रविलीयते
Translation (English): For the unattached, liberated, mind fixed in knowledge, acting for sacrifice, all work dissolves.
Hinglish (1): Asakti chhodkar, gyaan me sthit man se yagya ke liye karm karne wale ka sab karm vilin ho jaata hai. (Pure motives remove karmic effect.)
Hinglish (2): Jo vyakti attachment se mukt hai, gyaan mein sthit hai, aur kewal yajna-bhaav se karm karta hai, uske saare karm poori tarah se vilin ho jaate hain.
message:
गतसङ्गस्य मुक्तस्य ज्ञानावस्थितचेतसः यज्ञायाचरतः कर्म समग्रं प्रविलीयते
For the unattached, liberated, mind fixed in knowledge, acting for sacrifice, all work dissolves.
Asakti chhodkar, gyaan me sthit man se yagya ke liye karm karne wale ka sab karm vilin ho jaata hai. (Pure motives remove karmic effect.)

Sanskrit verse: ब्रह्मार्पणं ब्रह्म हविर्ब्रह्माग्नौ ब्रह्मणा हुतम् ब्रह्मैव तेन गन्तव्यं ब्रह्मकर्मसमाधिना
Translation (English): Brahman is the offering, Brahman the oblation, poured by Brahman into the fire of Brahman; Brahman is the goal of such work.
Hinglish (1): Jo gyaani sabhi karmon mein Brahman (the absolute) ka hi darshan karta hai, uske liye: arpan ki kriya Brahman hai, arpan ki samagri Brahman hai, agni Brahman hai, aur arpan karne wala bhi Brahman hai. Nishchit roop se, uska antim lakshya bhi Brahman hi hota hai.
Hinglish (2): Jiske liye arpan Brahman hai, havi (offering) Brahman hai, agni Brahman hai, aur arpan karne waala bhi Brahman hai - us Brahman-karm mein samadhisth vyakti dwara prapt kiya jaane waala lakshya bhi Brahman hi hai.
Summary: Unity of all aspects of action in Brahman.
message:
ब्रह्मार्पणं ब्रह्म हविर्ब्रह्माग्नौ ब्रह्मणा हुतम् ब्रह्मैव तेन गन्तव्यं ब्रह्मकर्मसमाधिना
Brahman is the offering, Brahman the oblation, poured by Brahman into the fire of Brahman; Brahman is the goal of such work.
Jo gyaani sabhi karmon mein Brahman (the absolute) ka hi darshan karta hai, uske liye: arpan ki kriya Brahman hai, arpan ki samagri Brahman hai, agni Brahman hai, aur arpan karne wala bhi Brahman hai. Nishchit roop se, uska antim lakshya bhi Brahman hi hota hai.

Sanskrit verse: दैवमेवापरे यज्ञं योगिनः पर्युपासते ब्रह्माग्नावपरे यज्ञं यज्ञेनैवोपजुह्वति
Translation (English): Some yogis worship the gods for sacrifice; others offer sacrifice into the fire of Brahman alone.
Hinglish (1): Kuch yogi devtaon ko yajya arpan karte hain, kuch brahma agni me hi yagya dete hain.
Hinglish (2): Kuch yogi devtaon ki pooja roopi yajna karte hain, jabki kuch yogi Param-Brahman roopi agni mein yajna ke dwara hi yajna ka havan karte hain.
message:
दैवमेवापरे यज्ञं योगिनः पर्युपासते ब्रह्माग्नावपरे यज्ञं यज्ञेनैवोपजुह्वति
Some yogis worship the gods for sacrifice; others offer sacrifice into the fire of Brahman alone.
Kuch yogi devtaon ko yajya arpan karte hain, kuch brahma agni me hi yagya dete hain.

Sanskrit verse: श्रोत्रादीनिन्द्रियाण्यन्ये संयमाग्निषु जुह्वति शब्दादीन्विषयानन्ये इन्द्रियाग्निषु जुह्वति
Translation (English): Some offer the senses, like hearing, into the fire of restraint; others offer sense objects, like sound, into the fire of the senses.
Hinglish (1): Kuch log indriyon ko sanyam agni me, kuch vishayon ko indriya agni me arpan karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Kuch yogi shravan aadi indriyon ko sanyam roopi agni mein havan karte hain, toh kuch shabd aadi vishayon ko indriya roopi agni mein havan karte hain.
message:
श्रोत्रादीनिन्द्रियाण्यन्ये संयमाग्निषु जुह्वति शब्दादीन्विषयानन्ये इन्द्रियाग्निषु जुह्वति
Some offer the senses, like hearing, into the fire of restraint; others offer sense objects, like sound, into the fire of the senses.
Kuch log indriyon ko sanyam agni me, kuch vishayon ko indriya agni me arpan karte hain.

Sanskrit verse: सर्वाणीन्द्रियकर्माणि प्राणकर्माणि चापरे आत्मसंयमयोगाग्नौ जुह्वति ज्ञानदीपिते
Translation (English): Others offer all actions of the senses and of the vital force into the fire of yoga of self‑control kindled by knowledge.
Hinglish (1): Kuch log sabhi indriya aur prana karm ko atma sanyam ke yog ki agni me, jo gyaan se jalti hai, arpan karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Doosre yogi, jo aatm-sanyam mein sthit hain, apni sabhi indriyon ke karmon aur praan-vayu ke karmon ko gyaan se prajwalit aatm-sanyam roopi yog-agni mein havan karte hain.
message:
सर्वाणीन्द्रियकर्माणि प्राणकर्माणि चापरे आत्मसंयमयोगाग्नौ जुह्वति ज्ञानदीपिते
Others offer all actions of the senses and of the vital force into the fire of yoga of self‑control kindled by knowledge.
Kuch log sabhi indriya aur prana karm ko atma sanyam ke yog ki agni me, jo gyaan se jalti hai, arpan karte hain.
tags: Raja Yoga, Jnana Yoga, self-realization, ध्यान

Sanskrit verse: द्रव्ययज्ञास्तपोयज्ञा योगयज्ञास्तथापरे स्वाध्यायज्ञानयज्ञाश्च यतयः संशितव्रताः
Translation (English): Some perform sacrifice with material possessions; some with austerities; some with yoga; some with study and knowledge—strict in vows.
Hinglish (1): Kuch log dhan ka, kuch tap ka, kuch yoga ka, kuch swadhyaya aur gyaan ka yagya karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Kuch log dravya-yajna, kuch tapo-yajna, aur kuch yog-yajna karte hain. Jabki kuch kathor vrat waale swadhyay aur gyaan-yajna karte hain.
message:
द्रव्ययज्ञास्तपोयज्ञा योगयज्ञास्तथापरे स्वाध्यायज्ञानयज्ञाश्च यतयः संशितव्रताः
Some perform sacrifice with material possessions; some with austerities; some with yoga; some with study and knowledge—strict in vows.
Kuch log dhan ka, kuch tap ka, kuch yoga ka, kuch swadhyaya aur gyaan ka yagya karte hain.
tags: Karma Yoga, Jnana Yoga, Raja Yoga

Sanskrit verse: अपाने जुह्वति प्राणं प्राणेऽपानं तथापरे प्राणापानगती रुद्ध्वा प्राणायामपरायणाः
Translation (English): Others offer exhalation into inhalation, and inhalation into exhalation, restraining breath flow—engaged in pranayama.
Hinglish (1): Kuch prana ko apaan me, kuch apaan ko prana me mila dete hain, pranaayam me lage rehte hain.
Hinglish (2): Kuch yogi apaan vayu mein praan vayu ko aur praan vayu mein apaan vayu ko havan karte hain, is tarah praan aur apaan ki gati ko rokkar pranayam mein lage rehte hain.
message:
अपाने जुह्वति प्राणं प्राणेऽपानं तथापरे प्राणापानगती रुद्ध्वा प्राणायामपरायणाः
Others offer exhalation into inhalation, and inhalation into exhalation, restraining breath flow—engaged in pranayama.
Kuch prana ko apaan me, kuch apaan ko prana me mila dete hain, pranaayam me lage rehte hain.

Sanskrit verse: अपरे नियताहाराः प्राणान्प्राणेषु जुह्वति सर्वेऽप्येते यज्ञविदो यज्ञक्षपितकल्मषाः
Translation (English): Others, regulated in eating, offer prana into prana; all are knowers of sacrifice, purified of sin by sacrifice.
Hinglish (1): Kuch niyamit aahar le kar prana ko prana me arpan karte hain; yeh sab yagya ko jaante hain aur paap se mukt hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Kuch yogi niyamit aahar karke apne praano ko praano mein hi havan karte hain. Yeh sabhi yajna ko janne waale log, yajna ke dwara apne paapon ka naash karte hain.
message:
अपरे नियताहाराः प्राणान्प्राणेषु जुह्वति सर्वेऽप्येते यज्ञविदो यज्ञक्षपितकल्मषाः
Others, regulated in eating, offer prana into prana; all are knowers of sacrifice, purified of sin by sacrifice.
Kuch niyamit aahar le kar prana ko prana me arpan karte hain; yeh sab yagya ko jaante hain aur paap se mukt hote hain.

Sanskrit verse: यज्ञशिष्टामृतभुजो यान्ति ब्रह्म सनातनम् नायं लोकोऽस्त्ययज्ञस्य कुतोऽन्यः कुरुसत्तम
Translation (English): Those who partake of the nectar of sacrifice reach the eternal Brahman; for the non‑sacrificer, there is no happiness here or hereafter, O best of Kurus.
Hinglish (1): Jo log yajya ka shesh prasad khate hain, ve sanatan brahma ko paate hain; ayajya ke liye yahan ya baad me koi sukh nahi.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kuru-shreshth, yajna se bache hue amrit ko bhogne waale yogi sanatan Brahman ko prapt hote hain. Yajna na karne waale ke liye toh yeh lok bhi nahi hai, phir parlok kaise ho sakta hai?
message:
यज्ञशिष्टामृतभुजो यान्ति ब्रह्म सनातनम् नायं लोकोऽस्त्ययज्ञस्य कुतोऽन्यः कुरुसत्तम
Those who partake of the nectar of sacrifice reach the eternal Brahman; for the non‑sacrificer, there is no happiness here or hereafter, O best of Kurus.
Jo log yajya ka shesh prasad khate hain, ve sanatan brahma ko paate hain; ayajya ke liye yahan ya baad me koi sukh nahi.

Sanskrit verse: एवं बहुविधा यज्ञा वितता ब्रह्मणो मुखे कर्मजान्विद्धि तान्सर्वानेवं ज्ञात्वा विमोक्ष्यसे
Translation (English): Thus many kinds of yajnas are spread before the mouth of Brahman; know them all to be born of action, and knowing this, you will be liberated.
Hinglish (1): Is tarah ke anek yajya brahma ke mukh me prastut hain; ye sab karm se utpann hote hain, ise jaankar mukt ho jao.
Hinglish (2): Is prakaar, anek tarah ke yajna Vedon mein vistaar se bataye gaye hain. Un sabko tum karm se utpann hua jaano. Aisa jaankar tum mukt ho jaoge.
Summary: All sacrifices are forms of higher action.
message:
एवं बहुविधा यज्ञा वितता ब्रह्मणो मुखे कर्मजान्विद्धि तान्सर्वानेवं ज्ञात्वा विमोक्ष्यसे
Thus many kinds of yajnas are spread before the mouth of Brahman; know them all to be born of action, and knowing this, you will be liberated.
Is tarah ke anek yajya brahma ke mukh me prastut hain; ye sab karm se utpann hote hain, ise jaankar mukt ho jao.

Sanskrit verse: श्रेयान्द्रव्यमयाद्यज्ञाज्ज्ञानयज्ञः परन्तप सर्वं कर्माखिलं पार्थ ज्ञाने परिसमाप्यते
Translation (English): O scorcher of foes, knowledge‑sacrifice is superior to material sacrifice; all actions find completion in knowledge, O Partha.
Hinglish (1): Dravya yajya se gyaan yajya shreshtha hai; sabhi karm ant me gyaan me sama jaate hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey shatru-vijeta, dravya-yajna se gyaan-yajna shreshth hai. Hey Parth, sabhi karm antatah gyaan mein hi samapt ho jaate hain.
message:
श्रेयान्द्रव्यमयाद्यज्ञाज्ज्ञानयज्ञः परन्तप सर्वं कर्माखिलं पार्थ ज्ञाने परिसमाप्यते
O scorcher of foes, knowledge‑sacrifice is superior to material sacrifice; all actions find completion in knowledge, O Partha.
Dravya yajya se gyaan yajya shreshtha hai; sabhi karm ant me gyaan me sama jaate hain.

Sanskrit verse: तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः
Translation (English): Learn that knowledge by prostrating, questioning, and serving; the wise, who see the truth, will instruct you.
Hinglish (1): Yadi tum us satya ko jaanna chahte ho, toh guru ke paas vinamra bhaav (pranipaat) se jao, unse jigyaasa-purvak prashn (pariprashna) karo, aur unki seva karo. Aisa karne par, ve tatva-darshi mahatma tumhein gyaan pradaan karenge.
Hinglish (2): Us gyaan ko paane ke liye ek tatva-darshi guru ke paas jao. Unhe dandvat pranam karo, unse vinamrata se prashn poocho, aur unki seva karo. Aise gyaani mahatma tumhein gyaan ka updesh denge.
Summary: How to approach a guru for realization.
message:
तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः
Learn that knowledge by prostrating, questioning, and serving; the wise, who see the truth, will instruct you.
Yadi tum us satya ko jaanna chahte ho, toh guru ke paas vinamra bhaav (pranipaat) se jao, unse jigyaasa-purvak prashn (pariprashna) karo, aur unki seva karo. Aisa karne par, ve tatva-darshi mahatma tumhein gyaan pradaan karenge.

Sanskrit verse: यज्ज्ञात्वा न पुनर्मोहमेवं यास्यसि पाण्डव येन भूतान्यशेषेण द्रक्ष्यस्यात्मन्यथो मयि
Translation (English): Knowing this, you will not again fall into delusion, O Pandava, and by it you will see all beings in yourself and in Me.
Hinglish (1): Is gyaan se tum kabhi moh me nahi padoge; tum sabko apne aur mujhme dekhoge.
Hinglish (2): Hey Pandav, is gyaan ko prapt karke tum phir kabhi is prakaar moh mein nahi padoge. Is gyaan se tum sabhi praaniyon ko pehle apne aap mein aur phir mujhme dekhoge.
Summary: Unity of self and creation through knowledge.
message:
यज्ज्ञात्वा न पुनर्मोहमेवं यास्यसि पाण्डव येन भूतान्यशेषेण द्रक्ष्यस्यात्मन्यथो मयि
Knowing this, you will not again fall into delusion, O Pandava, and by it you will see all beings in yourself and in Me.
Is gyaan se tum kabhi moh me nahi padoge; tum sabko apne aur mujhme dekhoge.

Sanskrit verse: अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो सर्वं ज्ञानप्लवेनैव वृजिनं सन्तरिष्यसि
Translation (English): Even if you are the most sinful, you will cross over all sin by the boat of knowledge.
Hinglish (1): Agar tum bahut paapi bhi ho, to gyaan ki naav se paap paar kar jaoge.
Hinglish (2): Yadi tum sabhi paapiyon se bhi adhik paapi ho, tab bhi tum is gyaan-roopi naav se sabhi paapon ke saagar ko paar kar jaoge.
Summary: Knowledge as the cleanser of sin.
message:
अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो सर्वं ज्ञानप्लवेनैव वृजिनं सन्तरिष्यसि
Even if you are the most sinful, you will cross over all sin by the boat of knowledge.
Agar tum bahut paapi bhi ho, to gyaan ki naav se paap paar kar jaoge.

Sanskrit verse: यथैधांसि समिद्धोऽग्निर्भस्मसात्कुरुतेऽर्जुन ज्ञानाग्निः सर्वकर्माणि भस्मसात्कुरुते तथा
Translation (English): As blazing fire turns wood to ash, O Arjuna, so does the fire of knowledge turn all actions to ash.
Hinglish (1): Jaise aag lakdi ko bhasm bana deti hai, waise hi gyaan sab karmon ko bhasm kar deta hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Arjun, jaise prajwalit agni indhan ko bhasm kar deti hai, usi tarah gyaan-roopi agni sabhi karmon ko bhasm kar deti hai.
message:
यथैधांसि समिद्धोऽग्निर्भस्मसात्कुरुतेऽर्जुन ज्ञानाग्निः सर्वकर्माणि भस्मसात्कुरुते तथा
As blazing fire turns wood to ash, O Arjuna, so does the fire of knowledge turn all actions to ash.
Jaise aag lakdi ko bhasm bana deti hai, waise hi gyaan sab karmon ko bhasm kar deta hai.

Sanskrit verse: न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते तत्स्वयं योगसंसिद्धः कालेनात्मनि विन्दति
Translation (English): Nothing is as purifying as knowledge; in due course, one perfected in yoga finds this in the self.
Hinglish (1): Is sansaar me gyaan se pavitra kuch nahi; yog me siddh vyakti ise apne andar dhoondta hai.
Hinglish (2): Is sansaar mein gyaan ke samaan pavitra karne waala kuch bhi nahi hai. Jo yog mein siddh ho jaata hai, woh samay aane par is gyaan ko apni aatma mein anubhav karta hai.
message:
न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते तत्स्वयं योगसंसिद्धः कालेनात्मनि विन्दति
Nothing is as purifying as knowledge; in due course, one perfected in yoga finds this in the self.
Is sansaar me gyaan se pavitra kuch nahi; yog me siddh vyakti ise apne andar dhoondta hai.

Sanskrit verse: श्रद्धावान्लभते ज्ञानं तत्परः संयतेन्द्रियः ज्ञानं लब्ध्वा परां शान्तिमचिरेणाधिगच्छति
Translation (English): The faithful, devoted, and sense‑controlled attains knowledge, and with it, supreme peace quickly.
Hinglish (1): Jo shraddha-vaan (faithful), tatpar (dedicated), aur sanyamit-indriyon wala (master of his senses) hai, wahi gyaan ko prapt karta hai. Aur gyaan prapt karke, vah sheeghra hi param-shaanti ko prapt ho jaata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo shraddha-vaan (faithful), tatpar (dedicated), aur sanyamit-indriyon wala (master of his senses) hai, wahi gyaan ko prapt karta hai. Aur gyaan prapt karke, vah jald hi param-shaanti ko prapt ho jaata hai.
Summary: Faith and discipline lead to peace.
message:
श्रद्धावान्लभते ज्ञानं तत्परः संयतेन्द्रियः ज्ञानं लब्ध्वा परां शान्तिमचिरेणाधिगच्छति
The faithful, devoted, and sense‑controlled attains knowledge, and with it, supreme peace quickly.
Jo shraddha-vaan (faithful), tatpar (dedicated), aur sanyamit-indriyon wala (master of his senses) hai, wahi gyaan ko prapt karta hai. Aur gyaan prapt karke, vah sheeghra hi param-shaanti ko prapt ho jaata hai.
tags: Jnana Yoga, mental peace, inner peace, overcoming self-doubt

Sanskrit verse: अज्ञश्चाश्रद्दधानश्च संशयात्मा विनश्यति नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मनः
Translation (English): The ignorant, faithless, and doubting soul perishes; neither this world nor the next is for the doubter, nor happiness.
Hinglish (1): Jo agyaani hai, jismein faith ki kami hai, aur jiska mann hamesha doubt se bhara rehta hai—aise insaan ka patan ho jaata hai. Jiska mann doubt mein hi jeeta hai, uske liye na is duniya mein kuch hai, na aage, aur na hi kabhi khushi hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo agyaani hai, jismein shraddha ki kami hai, aur jiska mann hamesha sandeh se bhara rehta hai—aise insaan ka patan ho jaata hai. Sandeh mein jeene waale ke liye na is lok mein, na parlok mein, aur na hi kabhi sukh hai.
message:
अज्ञश्चाश्रद्दधानश्च संशयात्मा विनश्यति नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मनः
The ignorant, faithless, and doubting soul perishes; neither this world nor the next is for the doubter, nor happiness.
Jo agyaani hai, jismein faith ki kami hai, aur jiska mann hamesha doubt se bhara rehta hai—aise insaan ka patan ho jaata hai. Jiska mann doubt mein hi jeeta hai, uske liye na is duniya mein kuch hai, na aage, aur na hi kabhi khushi hai.
tags: doubting mind, negative thoughts, fear of failure, anxiety

Sanskrit verse: योगसंन्यस्तकर्माणं ज्ञानसञ्छिन्नसंशयम् आत्मवन्तं न कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय
Translation (English): O Dhananjaya, one whose actions are renounced in yoga, whose doubt is destroyed by knowledge, and who is self‑controlled—actions do not bind such a person.
Hinglish (1): Hey Dhananjaya, jo karm ko yoga me arpita karta hai, jiska sandeh gyaan se mita hai, aur jo aatmavash hai, uska karm bandhan nahi karta.
Hinglish (2): Hey Dhananjaya, jisne karm-yog se apne sabhi karmon ka tyag kar diya hai, jiske sandeh gyaan se nasht ho gaye hain, aur jo aatma mein sthit hai, use karm nahi baandhte.
message:
योगसंन्यस्तकर्माणं ज्ञानसञ्छिन्नसंशयम् आत्मवन्तं न कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय
O Dhananjaya, one whose actions are renounced in yoga, whose doubt is destroyed by knowledge, and who is self‑controlled—actions do not bind such a person.
Hey Dhananjaya, jo karm ko yoga me arpita karta hai, jiska sandeh gyaan se mita hai, aur jo aatmavash hai, uska karm bandhan nahi karta.
tags: Karma Yoga, Nishkama Karma, Moksha, self-realization

Sanskrit verse: तस्मादज्ञानसंभूतं हृत्स्थं ज्ञानासिनात्मनः छित्त्वैनं संशयं योगमातिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भारत
Translation (English): Therefore, with the sword of knowledge, cut this doubt born of ignorance in your heart. Stand up, O Bharata, and take to yoga.
Hinglish (1): Isliye gyaan talwar se apne hriday me baithe ise agyaan se upje sandeh ko kaat do; yoga grahan karo.
Hinglish (2): Isliye, apne hriday mein agyaan se utpann is sandeh ko gyaan ki talwaar se kaat do. Hey Bharat, yog mein sthit ho jao aur yuddh ke liye khade ho jao.
Summary: Final call to decisive action in knowledge.
message:
तस्मादज्ञानसंभूतं हृत्स्थं ज्ञानासिनात्मनः छित्त्वैनं संशयं योगमातिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भारत
Therefore, with the sword of knowledge, cut this doubt born of ignorance in your heart. Stand up, O Bharata, and take to yoga.
Isliye gyaan talwar se apne hriday me baithe ise agyaan se upje sandeh ko kaat do; yoga grahan karo.
tags: overcoming self-doubt, Jnana Yoga, Karma Yoga, confusion

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच संन्यासं कर्मणां कृष्ण पुनर्योगं च शंससि यच्छ्रेय एतयोरेकं तन्मे ब्रूहि सुनिश्चितम्
Translation (English): Arjuna said: O Krishna, You praise renunciation of actions and also yoga of action. Tell me decisively which of these is superior.
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Hey Krishna, aap kabhi karm sannyas ki, kabhi karmyog ki prashansa karte ho. Spasht batayein kaunsa behtar hai?
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Krishna, aap pehle karmon ke sannyas (tyag) ki prashansa karte hain, aur phir karm-yog ki. Kripya nishchit roop se bataiye ki in dono mein se kaun sa ek mere liye shreshth hai.
Summary: Arjuna seeks clarity on renunciation vs action.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच संन्यासं कर्मणां कृष्ण पुनर्योगं च शंससि यच्छ्रेय एतयोरेकं तन्मे ब्रूहि सुनिश्चितम्
Arjuna said: O Krishna, You praise renunciation of actions and also yoga of action. Tell me decisively which of these is superior.
Arjun bola: Hey Krishna, aap kabhi karm sannyas ki, kabhi karmyog ki prashansa karte ho. Spasht batayein kaunsa behtar hai?
tags: confusion, indecision, Karma Yoga, Jnana Yoga

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच संन्यासः कर्मयोगश्च निःश्रेयसकरावुभौ तयोस्तु कर्मसंन्यासात्कर्मयोगो विशिष्यते
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: Both renunciation and karma‑yoga lead to liberation, but karma‑yoga is superior to karma‑sannyasa.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Dono muktikarak hain, par karm se sannyas ke mukable karmyog behtar hai.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Karm-sannyas aur karm-yog, dono hi param kalyan ki or le jaate hain. Parantu, in dono mein karmon ke sannyas se karm-yog shreshth hai.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच संन्यासः कर्मयोगश्च निःश्रेयसकरावुभौ तयोस्तु कर्मसंन्यासात्कर्मयोगो विशिष्यते
The Blessed Lord said: Both renunciation and karma‑yoga lead to liberation, but karma‑yoga is superior to karma‑sannyasa.
Shri Krishna bole: Dono muktikarak hain, par karm se sannyas ke mukable karmyog behtar hai.
tags: Karma Yoga, Nishkama Karma, Jnana Yoga, Moksha

Sanskrit verse: ज्ञेयः स नित्यसंन्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न कांक्षति निर्द्वन्द्वो हि महाबाहो सुखं बन्धात्प्रमुच्यते
Translation (English): One who neither hates nor desires should be known as eternally renounced; free from dualities, O mighty‑armed, he is easily freed from bondage.
Hinglish (1): Jo na dvesh karta hai na ichha, vo nirdwand hai aur asaani se bandhan se mukt hota hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo vyakti na toh kisi se dvesh karta hai aur na hi kisi cheez ki kaamana karta hai, use nitya-sannyasi hi samajhna chahiye. Hey Mahabahu, dwandwon se mukt aisa vyakti sukh-poorvak bandhan se mukt ho jaata hai.
message:
ज्ञेयः स नित्यसंन्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न कांक्षति निर्द्वन्द्वो हि महाबाहो सुखं बन्धात्प्रमुच्यते
One who neither hates nor desires should be known as eternally renounced; free from dualities, O mighty‑armed, he is easily freed from bondage.
Jo na dvesh karta hai na ichha, vo nirdwand hai aur asaani se bandhan se mukt hota hai.

Sanskrit verse: साङ्ख्ययोगौ पृथग्बालाः प्रवदन्ति न पण्डिताः एकमप्यास्थितः सम्यगुभयोर्विन्दते फलम्
Translation (English): The ignorant, not the wise, speak of Sankhya (knowledge) and yoga (action) as different; one established in either attains the result of both.
Hinglish (1): Moorkh kehte hain ki sankhya aur yoga alag hain; gyaani ke liye dono ka phal ek hi hai.
Hinglish (2): Nadaan log hi gyaan (Sankhya) aur karm (Yog) ko alag-alag batate hain, pandit nahi. Inme se kisi ek mein bhi achhi tarah sthit hokar vyakti dono ka phal prapt kar leta hai.
message:
साङ्ख्ययोगौ पृथग्बालाः प्रवदन्ति न पण्डिताः एकमप्यास्थितः सम्यगुभयोर्विन्दते फलम्
The ignorant, not the wise, speak of Sankhya (knowledge) and yoga (action) as different; one established in either attains the result of both.
Moorkh kehte hain ki sankhya aur yoga alag hain; gyaani ke liye dono ka phal ek hi hai.

Sanskrit verse: यत्साङ्ख्यैः प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि गम्यते एकं साङ्ख्यं च योगं च यः पश्यति स पश्यति
Translation (English): The place reached by Sankhya is also reached by yoga; one who sees Sankhya and yoga as one truly sees.
Hinglish (1): Jo sankhya (gyaan) se milta hai, wahi yog (karm) se milta hai; jo dono ko ek samjhe, wahi vastav me dekhta hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo sthan gyaan-yogiyon ko prapt hota hai, wahi sthan karm-yogiyon ko bhi prapt hota hai. Isliye, jo gyaan aur karm ko ek roop mein dekhta hai, wahi vastav mein dekhta hai.
Summary: Equal goal of knowledge and action.
message:
यत्साङ्ख्यैः प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि गम्यते एकं साङ्ख्यं च योगं च यः पश्यति स पश्यति
The place reached by Sankhya is also reached by yoga; one who sees Sankhya and yoga as one truly sees.
Jo sankhya (gyaan) se milta hai, wahi yog (karm) se milta hai; jo dono ko ek samjhe, wahi vastav me dekhta hai.

Sanskrit verse: संन्यासस्तु महाबाहो दुःखमाप्तुमयोगतः योगयुक्तो मुनिर्ब्रह्म नचिरेणाधिगच्छति
Translation (English): Renunciation without yoga is hard to attain, O mighty‑armed; the sage engaged in yoga quickly attains Brahman.
Hinglish (1): Hey Mahabaahu, bina yog ke sannyas mushkil hai; yog se juda muni jaldi brahma ko paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Mahabahu, karm-yog ke bina sannyas prapt karna kathin hai. Jabki, karm-yog mein laga hua muni (sage) jald hi Brahman ko prapt kar leta hai.
message:
संन्यासस्तु महाबाहो दुःखमाप्तुमयोगतः योगयुक्तो मुनिर्ब्रह्म नचिरेणाधिगच्छति
Renunciation without yoga is hard to attain, O mighty‑armed; the sage engaged in yoga quickly attains Brahman.
Hey Mahabaahu, bina yog ke sannyas mushkil hai; yog se juda muni jaldi brahma ko paata hai.

Sanskrit verse: योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रियः सर्वभूतात्मभूतात्मा कुर्वन्नपि न लिप्यते
Translation (English): One engaged in yoga, pure in soul, self‑controlled, conquering the senses, seeing the Self in all beings, is not tainted even while acting.
Hinglish (1): Yogi pavitra atma, jitendriya aur sarvabhutatma hota hai; karm karte hue bhi bandhta nahi.
Hinglish (2): Jo yog-yukt hai, jiska mann vishuddh hai, jisne apne shareer aur indriyon ko jeet liya hai, aur sabhi praaniyon ki aatma ko apni aatma samajhta hai, woh karm karte hue bhi usmein lipt nahi hota.
message:
योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रियः सर्वभूतात्मभूतात्मा कुर्वन्नपि न लिप्यते
One engaged in yoga, pure in soul, self‑controlled, conquering the senses, seeing the Self in all beings, is not tainted even while acting.
Yogi pavitra atma, jitendriya aur sarvabhutatma hota hai; karm karte hue bhi bandhta nahi.
tags: self-realization, inner peace, Nishkama Karma (selfless action)

Sanskrit verse: नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्ववित् पश्यञ्श्रृण्वन्स्पृशञ्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपन्श्वसन्
Translation (English): One established in truth thinks, “I do nothing at all,” whether seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, eating, going, sleeping, or breathing.
Hinglish (1): Jo tattvadarshi hota hai, vo sochta hai “main kuch nahi karta,” chahe dekhe, sune, chhuye, khaye, chale, soye ya saans le.
Hinglish (2): Tattva ko janne waala yogi dekhte, sunte, sparsh karte, soonghte, khate, chalte, sote aur saans lete hue bhi yahi maanta hai ki "main vastav mein kuch nahi kar raha hoon."
message:
नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्ववित् पश्यञ्श्रृण्वन्स्पृशञ्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपन्श्वसन्
One established in truth thinks, “I do nothing at all,” whether seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, eating, going, sleeping, or breathing.
Jo tattvadarshi hota hai, vo sochta hai “main kuch nahi karta,” chahe dekhe, sune, chhuye, khaye, chale, soye ya saans le.

Sanskrit verse: प्रलپن्विसृजन्गृह्णन्नुनमिष्यन्निमिष्यन्नपि इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन्
Translation (English): Speaking, releasing, grasping, opening and closing eyes—realizing that senses operate among sense objects.
Hinglish (1): Baat karte, chhodte, pakadte, aankh kholte‑band karte samay bhi samajhta hai ki indriya indriya vishayon me karya kar rahe hain.
Hinglish (2): Bolte hue, tyagte hue, grahan karte hue, aur aankhein kholte-band karte hue bhi, woh yahi samajhta hai ki kewal indriyan hi apne vishayon mein kaam kar rahi hain.
message:
प्रलپن्विसृजन्गृह्णन्नुनमिष्यन्निमिष्यन्नपि इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन्
Speaking, releasing, grasping, opening and closing eyes—realizing that senses operate among sense objects.
Baat karte, chhodte, pakadte, aankh kholte‑band karte samay bhi samajhta hai ki indriya indriya vishayon me karya kar rahe hain.

Sanskrit verse: ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति यः लिप्यते न स पापेन पद्मपत्रमिवाम्भसा
Translation (English): One who acts by dedicating all deeds to Brahman, abandoning attachment, is not tainted by sin—just as a lotus leaf is untouched by water.
Hinglish (1): Jo karm brahma ko arpan kar ke, asakti chhodkar karta hai, vah paap se nahi lagta; kamal patte ki tarah paani se alag rehta hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo vyakti apne sabhi karmon ko Brahman ko arpit karke aur attachment ko tyag kar karm karta hai, woh paap se usi tarah lipt nahi hota jaise kamal ka patta paani se.
message:
ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति यः लिप्यते न स पापेन पद्मपत्रमिवाम्भसा
One who acts by dedicating all deeds to Brahman, abandoning attachment, is not tainted by sin—just as a lotus leaf is untouched by water.
Jo karm brahma ko arpan kar ke, asakti chhodkar karta hai, vah paap se nahi lagta; kamal patte ki tarah paani se alag rehta hai.
tags: detachment, Nishkama Karma, Brahman, mental peace

Sanskrit verse: कायेन मनसा बुद्ध्या केवलैरिन्द्रियैरपि योगिनः कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वाऽत्मशुद्धये
Translation (English): With body, mind, intellect, and even senses, yogis perform work, abandoning attachment, for purification of the self.
Hinglish (1): Sharir, mann, buddhi aur indriya se yogi karm karte hain, asakti chhodkar, atma shuddhi ke liye.
Hinglish (2): Yogi log attachment ko tyag kar, kewal shareer, mann, buddhi aur indriyon se, aatma-shuddhi ke liye hi karm karte hain.
message:
कायेन मनसा बुद्ध्या केवलैरिन्द्रियैरपि योगिनः कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वाऽत्मशुद्धये
With body, mind, intellect, and even senses, yogis perform work, abandoning attachment, for purification of the self.
Sharir, mann, buddhi aur indriya se yogi karm karte hain, asakti chhodkar, atma shuddhi ke liye.

Sanskrit verse: युक्तः कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति नैष्ठिकी अयुक्तः कामकारेण फले सक्तो निबध्यते
Translation (English): United with yoga, abandoning fruits, one attains peace; the ununited, attached to fruit through desire, becomes bound.
Hinglish (1): Yog me judkar fal tyag karne wala shanti paata hai; jo asakt hai, iccha se bandh jaata hai.
Hinglish (2): Karm-yogi karm-phalon ka tyag karke param shaanti ko prapt hota hai. Jabki, jo yog-yukt nahi hai, woh kaamnaon ke kaaran phal mein aasakt hokar bandh jaata hai.
message:
युक्तः कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति नैष्ठिकी अयुक्तः कामकारेण फले सक्तो निबध्यते
United with yoga, abandoning fruits, one attains peace; the ununited, attached to fruit through desire, becomes bound.
Yog me judkar fal tyag karne wala shanti paata hai; jo asakt hai, iccha se bandh jaata hai.
tags: mental peace, inner peace, Nishkama Karma, letting go of greed

Sanskrit verse: सर्वकर्माणि मनसा संन्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन्
Translation (English): Controlling, renouncing all actions mentally, the embodied dwells happily in the city of nine gates, neither acting nor causing action.
Hinglish (1): Mann se sab karm chhodkar, dehi nau dwaar wale sharir me sukh se rehta hai, na kuch karta hai na karwata hai.
Hinglish (2): Sanyami vyakti mann se sabhi karmon ka tyag karke, na kuch karte hue aur na karwate hue, is nau dwaaron waale shareer-roopi nagar mein sukh se nivaas karta hai.
Summary: Metaphor for body as a city.
message:
सर्वकर्माणि मनसा संन्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन्
Controlling, renouncing all actions mentally, the embodied dwells happily in the city of nine gates, neither acting nor causing action.
Mann se sab karm chhodkar, dehi nau dwaar wale sharir me sukh se rehta hai, na kuch karta hai na karwata hai.

Sanskrit verse: न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभुः न कर्मफलसंयोगं स्वभावस्तु प्रवर्तते
Translation (English): The Lord does not create agency, actions, or their union with fruits; nature acts.
Hinglish (1): Parmeshwar vyakti ko karta, karm ya karmfal ka karta nahi banata; prakriti hi karm chalati hai.
Hinglish (2): Ishwar na toh logon ka kartritva (doership), na karm, aur na hi karm-phalon ka sanyog rachte hain. Yeh sab toh prakriti ke guno dwara hi hota hai.
message:
न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभुः न कर्मफलसंयोगं स्वभावस्तु प्रवर्तते
The Lord does not create agency, actions, or their union with fruits; nature acts.
Parmeshwar vyakti ko karta, karm ya karmfal ka karta nahi banata; prakriti hi karm chalati hai.

Sanskrit verse: नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः अज्ञानेनावृतं ज्ञानं तेन मुह्यन्ति जन्तवः
Translation (English): The Lord does not take anyone’s sin or virtue; knowledge is covered by ignorance, and so beings are deluded.
Hinglish (1): Parmeshwar paap‑punya nahi leta; agyaan gyaan ko dhak leta hai, isliye prani bhramit hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Sarvavyapi Prabhu na toh kisi ke paap ko aur na hi punya ko grahan karte hain. Gyaan agyaan se dhaka hua hai, isi kaaran sabhi praani mohit ho jaate hain.
message:
नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः अज्ञानेनावृतं ज्ञानं तेन मुह्यन्ति जन्तवः
The Lord does not take anyone’s sin or virtue; knowledge is covered by ignorance, and so beings are deluded.
Parmeshwar paap‑punya nahi leta; agyaan gyaan ko dhak leta hai, isliye prani bhramit hote hain.

Sanskrit verse: जñानेन तु तदज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मनः तेषामादित्यवज्ज्ञानं प्रकाशयति तत्परम्
Translation (English): For those whose ignorance is destroyed by self‑knowledge, that knowledge, like the sun, reveals the supreme.
Hinglish (1): Jinka agyaan gyaan se mita hai, unka gyaan surya ki tarah param satya ko prakashit karta hai.
Hinglish (2): Parantu, jinka woh agyaan aatma ke gyaan se nasht ho jaata hai, unka woh gyaan surya ki tarah us Param-tattva (Brahman) ko prakashit kar deta hai.
message:
जñानेन तु तदज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मनः तेषामादित्यवज्ज्ञानं प्रकाशयति तत्परम्
For those whose ignorance is destroyed by self‑knowledge, that knowledge, like the sun, reveals the supreme.
Jinka agyaan gyaan se mita hai, unka gyaan surya ki tarah param satya ko prakashit karta hai.

Sanskrit verse: तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायणाः गच्छन्त्यपुनरावृत्तिं ज्ञाननिर्धूतकल्मषाः
Translation (English): Those whose intellect, self, devotion, and refuge are in That, with sins destroyed by knowledge, go to non‑return.
Hinglish (1): Jinka buddhi, atma, nishtha aur sharan usmein hai, gyaan se paap mitakar ve punarjanm se mukt hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Jinki buddhi Paramatma mein sthit hai, jinka mann Paramatma mein sthit hai, jinki nishtha Paramatma mein hai, aur jo Paramatma ke hi paraayan hain, ve gyaan se paapon ko nasht karke apunravritti (Moksha) ko prapt hote hain.
message:
तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायणाः गच्छन्त्यपुनरावृत्तिं ज्ञाननिर्धूतकल्मषाः
Those whose intellect, self, devotion, and refuge are in That, with sins destroyed by knowledge, go to non‑return.
Jinka buddhi, atma, nishtha aur sharan usmein hai, gyaan se paap mitakar ve punarjanm se mukt hote hain.

Sanskrit verse: विद्याविनयसंपन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः
Translation (English): The wise see equally a learned Brahman, a cow, an elephant, a dog, and a dog‑eater.
Hinglish (1): Gyaani pandit ek samdrishti se brahman, gai, hathi, kutta, aur chandala ko dekhta hai.
Hinglish (2): Gyaani pandit ek vidya-vinay-sampann Brahman, ek gaay, ek haathi, ek kutte aur ek chandal (dog-eater) ko samaan drishti se dekhte hain.
message:
विद्याविनयसंपन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः
The wise see equally a learned Brahman, a cow, an elephant, a dog, and a dog‑eater.
Gyaani pandit ek samdrishti se brahman, gai, hathi, kutta, aur chandala ko dekhta hai.

Sanskrit verse: इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मनः निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद्ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिताः
Translation (English): Even here, rebirth is conquered by those whose mind rests in equality; Brahman is flawless and equal—therefore they are established in Brahman.
Hinglish (1): Jinka man samdrishti me sthir hai, ve yahin janm‑mrityu se mukt hote hain; brahma ek samaan hai.
Hinglish (2): Jinka mann is samatva-bhaav mein sthit ho gaya hai, unhone isi jeevan mein sansaar ko jeet liya hai. Kyunki Brahman nirdosh aur samaan hai, isliye ve Brahman mein hi sthit hain.
message:
इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मनः निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद्ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिताः
Even here, rebirth is conquered by those whose mind rests in equality; Brahman is flawless and equal—therefore they are established in Brahman.
Jinka man samdrishti me sthir hai, ve yahin janm‑mrityu se mukt hote hain; brahma ek samaan hai.

Sanskrit verse: न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम् स्थिरबुद्धिरसंमूढो ब्रह्मविद्ब्रह्मणि स्थितः
Translation (English): One should neither rejoice on getting the pleasant nor grieve on the unpleasant; firm‑minded, unbewildered, knowing Brahman, established in it.
Hinglish (1): Sukh milne par ati‑prasann na ho, dukh milne par udveg na ho; brahma‑gyaani sthir rahta hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo Brahman ko janne waala, sthir-buddhi aur moh-rahit vyakti hai, woh na toh priya vastu paakar harshit hota hai aur na hi apriya vastu paakar udvign hota hai.
message:
न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम् स्थिरबुद्धिरसंमूढो ब्रह्मविद्ब्रह्मणि स्थितः
One should neither rejoice on getting the pleasant nor grieve on the unpleasant; firm‑minded, unbewildered, knowing Brahman, established in it.
Sukh milne par ati‑prasann na ho, dukh milne par udveg na ho; brahma‑gyaani sthir rahta hai.
tags: inner peace, mental peace, equanimity, detachment

Sanskrit verse: बाह्यस्पर्शेष्वसक्तात्मा विन्दत्यात्मनि यत्सुखम् स ब्रह्मयोगयुक्तात्मा सुखमक्षयमश्नुते
Translation (English): Detached from external contacts, finding joy in the Self, the self‑controlled reaches endless happiness through Brahman‑yoga.
Hinglish (1): Baahar ke sukh se asakta hokar atma me sukh paane wala akshay anand ko paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo baahari vishayon mein aasakt nahi hai aur apni aatma mein hi sukh ka anubhav karta hai, woh Brahman-yog mein sthit hokar akshay (endless) anand ko bhogta hai.
Summary: Inner joy is superior and lasting.
message:
बाह्यस्पर्शेष्वसक्तात्मा विन्दत्यात्मनि यत्सुखम् स ब्रह्मयोगयुक्तात्मा सुखमक्षयमश्नुते
Detached from external contacts, finding joy in the Self, the self‑controlled reaches endless happiness through Brahman‑yoga.
Baahar ke sukh se asakta hokar atma me sukh paane wala akshay anand ko paata hai.

Sanskrit verse: ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते आद्यन्तवन्तः कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुधः
Translation (English): Sense pleasures born of contact are wombs of sorrow; they have a beginning and end, O Kaunteya, so the wise do not delight in them.
Hinglish (1): Sparsh se utpann sukh dukh ka karan hai, aarambh‑ant wale hain; gyaani unme aanand nahi leta.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kunti-putra, jo bhog indriya-vishayon ke sanyog se utpann hote hain, ve nishchit roop se dukh ke hi kaaran hain. Unka aarambh aur ant hota hai, isliye buddhiman vyakti unmein nahi ramta.
message:
ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते आद्यन्तवन्तः कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुधः
Sense pleasures born of contact are wombs of sorrow; they have a beginning and end, O Kaunteya, so the wise do not delight in them.
Sparsh se utpann sukh dukh ka karan hai, aarambh‑ant wale hain; gyaani unme aanand nahi leta.
tags: letting go of greed, inner peace, detachment

Sanskrit verse: शक्नोतीहैव यः सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्तः स सुखी नरः
Translation (English): Who can tolerate here, before leaving the body, the force of desire and anger—that yogi is happy.
Hinglish (1): Jo sharir chhodne se pehle kaam‑krodh ka veg sah leta hai, vah yogi sukh paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo manushya isi jeevan mein, shareer ka naash hone se pehle, kaam (desire) aur krodh (anger) se utpann hone waale veg ko sehan karne mein saksham ho jaata hai, wahi yogi hai aur wahi sukhi hai.
message:
शक्नोतीहैव यः सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्तः स सुखी नरः
Who can tolerate here, before leaving the body, the force of desire and anger—that yogi is happy.
Jo sharir chhodne se pehle kaam‑krodh ka veg sah leta hai, vah yogi sukh paata hai.
tags: how to control anger, letting go of greed, mental peace

Sanskrit verse: योऽन्तःसुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तर्ज्योतिरेव यः स योगी ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं ब्रह्मभूतोऽधिगच्छति
Translation (English): One whose happiness, joy, and light are within is a yogi who attains Brahman‑nirvana, being one with Brahman.
Hinglish (1): Jiska sukh, anand, aur prakash andar hai, vo yogi brahma‑nirvana ko paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jiska sukh antarik hai, jiska anand antarik hai, aur jiska prakaash bhi antarik hai, wahi yogi Brahman-swaroop hokar Brahma-nirvan (Moksha) ko prapt karta hai.
message:
योऽन्तःसुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तर्ज्योतिरेव यः स योगी ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं ब्रह्मभूतोऽधिगच्छति
One whose happiness, joy, and light are within is a yogi who attains Brahman‑nirvana, being one with Brahman.
Jiska sukh, anand, aur prakash andar hai, vo yogi brahma‑nirvana ko paata hai.

Sanskrit verse: लबन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषयः क्षीणकल्मषाः छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मानः सर्वभूतहिते रताः
Translation (English): Sages with sins destroyed, doubts cut, controlled selves, and delighting in the welfare of all beings attain Brahman‑nirvana.
Hinglish (1): Jinka paap mita hai, sandeh katen, atma sanyami hai, aur jo sab ke kalyan me ruchi lete hain, ve brahma‑nirvana paate hain.
Hinglish (2): Jinke paap nasht ho gaye hain, jinke sandeh mit gaye hain, jo sanyami hain, aur jo sabhi praaniyon ke hit mein lage rehte hain, aise rishi Brahma-nirvan (Moksha) ko prapt karte hain.
Summary: Generosity combined with purity leads to liberation.
message:
लबन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषयः क्षीणकल्मषाः छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मानः सर्वभूतहिते रताः
Sages with sins destroyed, doubts cut, controlled selves, and delighting in the welfare of all beings attain Brahman‑nirvana.
Jinka paap mita hai, sandeh katen, atma sanyami hai, aur jo sab ke kalyan me ruchi lete hain, ve brahma‑nirvana paate hain.

Sanskrit verse: कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम् अभितो ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं वर्तते विदितात्मनाम्
Translation (English): For the dispassionate ascetics with controlled minds, free from desire and anger, Brahman‑nirvana exists all around.
Hinglish (1): Kaam‑krodh se mukt, man sanyami, atma gyaani yati ke liye brahma‑nirvana chaaro aur hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo kaam aur krodh se mukt hain, jinhone apne chitt ko jeet liya hai, aur jo aatm-gyaani hain, un sanyami-yoniyon ke liye sab taraf se Brahma-nirvan (Moksha) hi hai.
message:
कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम् अभितो ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं वर्तते विदितात्मनाम्
For the dispassionate ascetics with controlled minds, free from desire and anger, Brahman‑nirvana exists all around.
Kaam‑krodh se mukt, man sanyami, atma gyaani yati ke liye brahma‑nirvana chaaro aur hai.
tags: inner peace, mental peace, Moksha, self-realization

Sanskrit verse: स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्यक्षुश्चैवोन्तरे भ्रुवोः प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ
Translation (English): Shutting out external contacts, fixing gaze between the brows, equalizing prana and apana moving within the nostrils.
Hinglish (1): Baahar ke sparsh ko kaatkar, bhaon ke beech drishti lagakar, saans aur prana ko saman karo.
Hinglish (2): Baahari vishayon ko baahar karke, drishti ko bhrukuti ke beech sthir karke, aur naasika mein chalne waale praan aur apaan vayu ko samaan karke...
message:
स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्यक्षुश्चैवोन्तरे भ्रुवोः प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ
Shutting out external contacts, fixing gaze between the brows, equalizing prana and apana moving within the nostrils.
Baahar ke sparsh ko kaatkar, bhaon ke beech drishti lagakar, saans aur prana ko saman karo.

Sanskrit verse: यतेन्द्रियमनोबुद्धिर्मुनिर्मोक्षपरायणः विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो यः सदा मुक्त एव सः
Translation (English): The sage with controlled senses, mind, and intellect, devoted to liberation, free from desire, fear, and anger—is forever free.
Hinglish (1): Jiski indriya, mann, buddhi niyantrit hai, moksh me nishthavan aur iccha‑bhay‑krodh se mukt hai, vo sada mukt hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo muni (sage) apni indriyon, mann aur buddhi ko jeet kar, moksh ke liye hi tatpar rehta hai, aur ichha, bhay aur krodh se mukt ho jaata hai, woh sadaiv mukt hi hai.
message:
यतेन्द्रियमनोबुद्धिर्मुनिर्मोक्षपरायणः विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो यः सदा मुक्त एव सः
The sage with controlled senses, mind, and intellect, devoted to liberation, free from desire, fear, and anger—is forever free.
Jiski indriya, mann, buddhi niyantrit hai, moksh me nishthavan aur iccha‑bhay‑krodh se mukt hai, vo sada mukt hai.
tags: Moksha, inner peace, overcoming fear, Raja Yoga

Sanskrit verse: भोक्तारं यज्ञतपसां सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम् सुहृदं सर्वभूतानां ज्ञात्वा मां शान्तिमृच्छति
Translation (English): Knowing Me as the enjoyer of sacrifices and austerities, Lord of all worlds, and friend of all beings, one attains peace.
Hinglish (1): Mujhe yajya‑tap ke bhokta, sab lokon ke prabhu, aur sab praniyon ke suhrid jaan kar vyakti shanti paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Mujhe sabhi yajyon aur tapon ka bhokta, sabhi lokon ka mahaan Ishwar, aur sabhi praaniyon ka suhrid (friend) jaankar, manushya shaanti ko prapt karta hai.
Summary: Peace through recognizing God’s role and love.
message:
भोक्तारं यज्ञतपसां सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम् सुहृदं सर्वभूतानां ज्ञात्वा मां शान्तिमृच्छति
Knowing Me as the enjoyer of sacrifices and austerities, Lord of all worlds, and friend of all beings, one attains peace.
Mujhe yajya‑tap ke bhokta, sab lokon ke prabhu, aur sab praniyon ke suhrid jaan kar vyakti shanti paata hai.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, Moksha, mental peace, inner peace

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: One who performs prescribed duty without dependence on its fruits is a true renunciate and yogi, not one without fire or action.
Hinglish (1): Jo fal ki asha chhodke apna kartavya karta hai, vah sahi sannyasi aur yogi hai, na ki jo bina agni ya karm ke ho.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Jo vyakti karm-phal par aashrit hue bina apne kartavya-karm karta hai, wahi sannyasi hai aur wahi yogi hai; na ki woh jisne agni ka tyag kar diya hai ya jo karm nahi karta.
Summary: Renunciation is in detachment, not idleness.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः
The Blessed Lord said: One who performs prescribed duty without dependence on its fruits is a true renunciate and yogi, not one without fire or action.
Jo fal ki asha chhodke apna kartavya karta hai, vah sahi sannyasi aur yogi hai, na ki jo bina agni ya karm ke ho.
tags: Nishkama Karma (selfless action), Karma Yoga, self-realization

Sanskrit verse: यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव न ह्यसंन्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन
Translation (English): What is called renunciation, know it to be yoga, O Pandava; without giving up desires, no one becomes a yogi.
Hinglish (1): Jise sannyas kehte hain, use hi yoga samjho; ichha tyag bina koi yogi nahi ho sakta.
Hinglish (2): Hey Pandav, jise sannyas kehte hain, usi ko tum yog jaano. Kyunki sankalp (desires) ka tyag kiye bina koi bhi yogi nahi ban sakta.
Summary: Yoga and renunciation share the same essence.
message:
यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव न ह्यसंन्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन
What is called renunciation, know it to be yoga, O Pandava; without giving up desires, no one becomes a yogi.
Jise sannyas kehte hain, use hi yoga samjho; ichha tyag bina koi yogi nahi ho sakta.
tags: Nishkama Karma, Karma Yoga, Jnana Yoga

Sanskrit verse: आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शमः कारणमुच्यते
Translation (English): For the novice desiring to ascend yoga, action is the means; for the yoga‑aroodha (established), tranquility is the means.
Hinglish (1): Yog me chadhne wale ke liye karm jaruri hai; sthit yogi ke liye shanti jaruri hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo muni (sage) yog ke maarg par aage badhna chahta hai, uske liye karm karna saadhan hai. Aur jo yog mein sthit ho chuka hai, uske liye sham (shaanti) hi saadhan hai.
message:
आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शमः कारणमुच्यते
For the novice desiring to ascend yoga, action is the means; for the yoga‑aroodha (established), tranquility is the means.
Yog me chadhne wale ke liye karm jaruri hai; sthit yogi ke liye shanti jaruri hai.
tags: Raja Yoga, Karma Yoga, mental peace

Sanskrit verse: यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते सर्वसङ्कल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते
Translation (English): When one is not attached to sense objects or actions and has renounced all intentions, then he is said to be established in yoga.
Hinglish (1): Jo vishayon aur karmo me asakt na ho, sab sankalp chhod de, vo yogaaroodh hai.
Hinglish (2): Jab vyakti na toh indriya-vishayon mein aur na hi karmon mein aasakt hota hai, aur sabhi sankalpon (desires) ka tyagi ho jaata hai, tab use 'yogaaroodh' (yog mein sthit) kaha jaata hai.
message:
यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते सर्वसङ्कल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते
When one is not attached to sense objects or actions and has renounced all intentions, then he is said to be established in yoga.
Jo vishayon aur karmo me asakt na ho, sab sankalp chhod de, vo yogaaroodh hai.

Sanskrit verse: उद्धरेदात्मनाऽऽत्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः
Translation (English): One should elevate oneself by the self, not degrade oneself; the self is the friend and self is the enemy of the self.
Hinglish (1): Apne aap ko upar uthao, neeche mat girao; aatma apni dost bhi hai aur dushman bhi.
Hinglish (2): Manushya ko chahiye ki woh apne mann ke dwara apna uddhaar kare, aur apna patan na kare. Kyunki yeh mann hi aatma ka mitra hai aur yeh mann hi aatma ka shatru hai.
message:
उद्धरेदात्मनाऽऽत्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः
One should elevate oneself by the self, not degrade oneself; the self is the friend and self is the enemy of the self.
Apne aap ko upar uthao, neeche mat girao; aatma apni dost bhi hai aur dushman bhi.

Sanskrit verse: बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत्
Translation (English): For one who has conquered the self, the self is the best friend; for one who has not, the self remains like an enemy.
Hinglish (1): Jisne apne aap ko jeet liya, uska aatma dost hai; jisne nahi, uska aatma shatru jaisa hai.
Hinglish (2): Jisne apne mann ko jeet liya hai, uska mann uska sabse achha mitra hai. Parantu jisne apne mann ko nahi jeeta, uska mann hi uske sabse bade shatru ki tarah kaam karta hai.
message:
बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत्
For one who has conquered the self, the self is the best friend; for one who has not, the self remains like an enemy.
Jisne apne aap ko jeet liya, uska aatma dost hai; jisne nahi, uska aatma shatru jaisa hai.

Sanskrit verse: जितात्मनः प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहितः शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु तथा मानापमानयोः
Translation (English): The supreme soul is situated in one who has controlled the mind, remains peaceful, in cold, heat, pleasure, and pain, in honor and dishonor.
Hinglish (1): Jitendriya vyakti me paramatma sthit hota hai, jo sukh‑dukh, maan‑apmaan me samaan rahta hai.
Hinglish (2): Jisne apne mann ko jeet liya hai aur jo param shaant hai, uske liye sardi-garmi, sukh-dukh, aur maan-apmaan mein Paramatma hamesha sthit rehte hain.
message:
जितात्मनः प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहितः शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु तथा मानापमानयोः
The supreme soul is situated in one who has controlled the mind, remains peaceful, in cold, heat, pleasure, and pain, in honor and dishonor.
Jitendriya vyakti me paramatma sthit hota hai, jo sukh‑dukh, maan‑apmaan me samaan rahta hai.

Sanskrit verse: ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रियः युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः
Translation (English): The yogi satisfied with knowledge and realization, unshaken, with controlled senses, regards a clod, stone, and gold as equal.
Hinglish (1): Gyaan‑vijnan se tript aur sthir yogi mitti, patthar, sona samaan dekhta hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo yogi gyaan aur vigyaan se tript hai, jo avichal hai, jisne apni indriyon ko jeet liya hai, aur jo mitti, patthar aur sone ko samaan drishti se dekhta hai, use 'yukt' (yog mein sthit) kaha jaata hai.
message:
ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रियः युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः
The yogi satisfied with knowledge and realization, unshaken, with controlled senses, regards a clod, stone, and gold as equal.
Gyaan‑vijnan se tript aur sthir yogi mitti, patthar, sona samaan dekhta hai.

Sanskrit verse: सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते
Translation (English): One who is equal‑minded toward friend, companion, enemy, neutral, mediator, hater, relative, saint, or sinner excels.
Hinglish (1): Jo doston, shatruon, parichit, ajnabi, paapi aur sadharan sabko samaan dekhta hai, vah shreshth hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo suhrid (well-wishers), mitra, shatru, udaseen, madhyasth, dveshya, bandhu, sajjano aur paapiyon mein samaan buddhi rakhta hai, woh shreshth hai.
message:
सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते
One who is equal‑minded toward friend, companion, enemy, neutral, mediator, hater, relative, saint, or sinner excels.
Jo doston, shatruon, parichit, ajnabi, paapi aur sadharan sabko samaan dekhta hai, vah shreshth hai.

Sanskrit verse: योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थितः एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रहः
Translation (English): The yogi should always practice in seclusion, alone, controlling mind and body, free from desire and possessions.
Hinglish (1): Yogi nirjan me, akela, man‑indriya niyantrit, bina ichha aur sampatti ke yoga kare.
Hinglish (2): Yogi ko hamesha akele, ekant sthan par, apne mann aur shareer ko vash mein rakhte hue, aasha-rahit aur sangrah-rahit hokar, apni aatma ko Paramatma mein lagana chahiye.
message:
योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थितः एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रहः
The yogi should always practice in seclusion, alone, controlling mind and body, free from desire and possessions.
Yogi nirjan me, akela, man‑indriya niyantrit, bina ichha aur sampatti ke yoga kare.

Sanskrit verse: शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मनः नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम्
Translation (English): In a clean place, establish a firm seat—neither too high nor too low—with cloth, deer‑skin, and kusa grass one over another.
Hinglish (1): Shuddh sthal par sthir aasan banaye, na bahut ucha na neecha, kapda, mrigchhal, aur kush ke upar.
Hinglish (2): Ek saaf jagah par, na bahut ooncha aur na bahut neecha, kusha ghaas, mrig-chhaala aur vastra bichhakar apna sthir aasan sthapit kare.
message:
शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मनः नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम्
In a clean place, establish a firm seat—neither too high nor too low—with cloth, deer‑skin, and kusa grass one over another.
Shuddh sthal par sthir aasan banaye, na bahut ucha na neecha, kapda, mrigchhal, aur kush ke upar.

Sanskrit verse: तत्रैकाग्रं मनः कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रियः उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये
Translation (English): There, fixing the mind in concentration, controlling mind and senses, sit and practice yoga for self‑purification.
Hinglish (1): Wahan man ko ekagr karke, man‑indriya niyantrit karke, apne shuddhi ke liye baithkar yog kare.
Hinglish (2): Us aasan par baithkar, mann ko ekagra karke, aur chitt tatha indriyon ki kriyaon ko vash mein karke, aatma-shuddhi ke liye yog ka abhyaas kare.
message:
तत्रैकाग्रं मनः कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रियः उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये
There, fixing the mind in concentration, controlling mind and senses, sit and practice yoga for self‑purification.
Wahan man ko ekagr karke, man‑indriya niyantrit karke, apne shuddhi ke liye baithkar yog kare.

Sanskrit verse: समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिरः सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन्
Translation (English): Holding body, head, and neck erect, steady, not moving, gaze at the tip of the nose, not looking around.
Hinglish (1): Shareer, sir, gardan ko seedha rakhkar, na hilaate hue, naak ke agra par drishti tikaye, idhar‑udhar na dekhe.
Hinglish (2): Apne shareer, sir aur gardan ko ek samaan, achal aur sthir rakhte hue, apni naasika ke agle bhaag par drishti jamakar, aur anya dishaon mein na dekhte hue...
message:
समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिरः सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन्
Holding body, head, and neck erect, steady, not moving, gaze at the tip of the nose, not looking around.
Shareer, sir, gardan ko seedha rakhkar, na hilaate hue, naak ke agra par drishti tikaye, idhar‑udhar na dekhe.
tags: Raja Yoga, ધ્યાન, lack of focus

Sanskrit verse: प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थितः मनः संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः
Translation (English): With a peaceful self, free from fear, firm in celibacy, controlling the mind, meditating on Me, the yogi should be devoted to Me.
Hinglish (1): Shant aatma, nirbhay, brahmacharya vrat me sthir, man niyantrit karke mera dhyan kare.
Hinglish (2): Prashant-mann, bhay-rahit, brahmacharya vrat mein sthit hokar, aur mann ko sanyamit karke, chitt ko mujhme lagakar, mere paraayan hokar baithe.
message:
प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थितः मनः संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः
With a peaceful self, free from fear, firm in celibacy, controlling the mind, meditating on Me, the yogi should be devoted to Me.
Shant aatma, nirbhay, brahmacharya vrat me sthir, man niyantrit karke mera dhyan kare.
tags: Raja Yoga, ધ્યાન, Bhakti Yoga, mental peace

Sanskrit verse: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानसः शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मद्संस्थामधिगच्छति
Translation (English): Thus, ever harmonizing the self, the yogi of controlled mind attains peace—Nirvana in Me.
Hinglish (1): Is tarah yog karta hua, man niyantrit yogi mere mein sthit nirvana shanti ko paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Is prakaar hamesha apni aatma ko yog mein lagane waala, sanyamit mann waala yogi, mere mein sthit param nirvan-roopi shaanti ko prapt karta hai.
Summary: Final aim of meditation is union with Krishna.
message:
युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानसः शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मद्संस्थामधिगच्छति
Thus, ever harmonizing the self, the yogi of controlled mind attains peace—Nirvana in Me.
Is tarah yog karta hua, man niyantrit yogi mere mein sthit nirvana shanti ko paata hai.
tags: Moksha, inner peace, mental peace, Raja Yoga

Sanskrit verse: नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नतः न चाति स्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन
Translation (English): Yoga is not for one who eats too much or too little, nor for one who sleeps too much or too little, O Arjuna.
Hinglish (1): Yog uska nahi jo bahut zyada ya bahut kam khata hai, ya bahut sota ya jagta hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Arjun, yeh yog na toh bahut adhik khane waale ka, na bilkul na khane waale ka, na bahut adhik sone waale ka, aur na hi hamesha jaagne waale ka siddh hota hai.
message:
नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नतः न चाति स्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन
Yoga is not for one who eats too much or too little, nor for one who sleeps too much or too little, O Arjuna.
Yog uska nahi jo bahut zyada ya bahut kam khata hai, ya bahut sota ya jagta hai.
tags: work-life balance India, burnout at work

Sanskrit verse: युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दुःखहा
Translation (English): For one regulated in eating, recreation, work, and sleep and waking, yoga destroys sorrow.
Hinglish (1): Jo bhojan, manoranjan, karm, sone‑jaagne me sanyamit hai, uska yog dukh mita deta hai.
Hinglish (2): Jiska aahar-vihar yukt hai, karmon mein cheshta yukt hai, aur sona-jaagna yukt hai, uske liye yog dukhon ka naashak ban jaata hai.
Summary: Moderation in all aspects brings balance.
message:
युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दुःखहा
For one regulated in eating, recreation, work, and sleep and waking, yoga destroys sorrow.
Jo bhojan, manoranjan, karm, sone‑jaagne me sanyamit hai, uska yog dukh mita deta hai.
tags: work-life balance India, inner peace, mental peace

Sanskrit verse: यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते निःस्पृहः सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा
Translation (English): When the controlled mind rests in the Self alone, free from all desires, then one is said to be united.
Hinglish (1): Jab man niyantrit hokar sirf aatma me sthit ho, sab kaamon se mukt, tab use yogi kehte hain.
Hinglish (2): Jab poori tarah se vash mein kiya hua chitt aatma mein hi sthit ho jaata hai, aur manushya sabhi kaamnaon se mukt ho jaata hai, tab use 'yukt' (yog mein sthit) kaha jaata hai.
message:
यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते निःस्पृहः सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा
When the controlled mind rests in the Self alone, free from all desires, then one is said to be united.
Jab man niyantrit hokar sirf aatma me sthit ho, sab kaamon se mukt, tab use yogi kehte hain.

Sanskrit verse: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते sopamá स्मृता योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः
Translation (English): As a lamp in a windless place does not flicker, such is the simile for the yogi whose mind is controlled, engaged in yoga of the self.
Hinglish (1): Hawa rahit jagah me diye ki tarah, yogi ka sthir man hai.
Hinglish (2): Jaise bina hawa waali jagah par rakha deepak hilta nahi hai, waisi hi upma us yogi ke sanyamit chitt ki di jaati hai jo aatma ke yog ka abhyaas karta hai.
message:
यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते sopamá स्मृता योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः
As a lamp in a windless place does not flicker, such is the simile for the yogi whose mind is controlled, engaged in yoga of the self.
Hawa rahit jagah me diye ki tarah, yogi ka sthir man hai.
tags: Raja Yoga, ધ્યાન, mental peace, inner peace

Sanskrit verse: यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया यत्र चैवात्मनाऽऽत्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति
Translation (English): When the mind becomes calm by practice of yoga, and the self rejoices in the Self, seeing only the Self.
Hinglish (1): Jab yog se man shant ho jata hai aur aatma apne aap me sukh paati hai.
Hinglish (2): Jab yog ke abhyaas se nirodh hua chitt shaant ho jaata hai, aur jab yogi aatma ke dwara aatma ko dekhta hua aatma mein hi santusht rehta hai...
message:
यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया यत्र चैवात्मनाऽऽत्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति
When the mind becomes calm by practice of yoga, and the self rejoices in the Self, seeing only the Self.
Jab yog se man shant ho jata hai aur aatma apne aap me sukh paati hai.

Sanskrit verse: सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद्बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः
Translation (English): One experiences supreme happiness, grasped by the intellect, beyond the senses, in which one never departs from reality.
Hinglish (1): Is anubhav se buddhi hi samajh sakti hai, jo indriyon se pare hai, aur satya se kabhi door nahi hota.
Hinglish (2): Jab woh us anant sukh ka anubhav karta hai jo buddhi se grahan kiya ja sakta hai aur indriyon se pare hai, aur jismein sthit hokar woh tattva se vichlit nahi hota...
message:
सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद्बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः
One experiences supreme happiness, grasped by the intellect, beyond the senses, in which one never departs from reality.
Is anubhav se buddhi hi samajh sakti hai, jo indriyon se pare hai, aur satya se kabhi door nahi hota.

Sanskrit verse: यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः यस्मिन्स्थितो न दुःखेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते
Translation (English): Obtaining which, one thinks there is no greater gain, and established in which, one is not shaken even by great sorrow.
Hinglish (1): Us anubhav ko paane ke baad aur kuch behtar nahi lagta, aur koi bada dukh hila nahi sakta.
Hinglish (2): Jis laabh ko paakar woh usse bada koi aur laabh nahi maanta, aur jis sthiti mein sthit hokar woh bade se bade dukh se bhi vichlit nahi hota...
message:
यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः यस्मिन्स्थितो न दुःखेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते
Obtaining which, one thinks there is no greater gain, and established in which, one is not shaken even by great sorrow.
Us anubhav ko paane ke baad aur kuch behtar nahi lagta, aur koi bada dukh hila nahi sakta.
tags: mental peace, inner peace, dealing with grief

Sanskrit verse: तं विद्याद्दुःखसंयोगवियोगं योगसंज्ञितम् स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा
Translation (English): Know that state as yoga—the separation from union with sorrow; practice it with strong determination and unwavering mind.
Hinglish (1): Is dukh se doori ko yog ka naam do; ise dridh nischay se bina udasi ke karo.
Hinglish (2): Usi dukh-sanyog ke viyog ko yog naam se jaanna chahiye. Yeh yog dridh nishchay aur utsaah-poorn chitt se karna chahiye.
Summary: Yoga as the path out of suffering.
message:
तं विद्याद्दुःखसंयोगवियोगं योगसंज्ञितम् स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा
Know that state as yoga—the separation from union with sorrow; practice it with strong determination and unwavering mind.
Is dukh se doori ko yog ka naam do; ise dridh nischay se bina udasi ke karo.
tags: Raja Yoga, ધ્યાન, mental peace, dealing with grief

Sanskrit verse: सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषतः मनसैविन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्ततः
Translation (English): Abandoning all desires born of will, restraining the sense organs with the mind from all sides.
Hinglish (1): Sab ichhayein chhodkar, man se indriyon ko sab tarah se niyantrit karo.
Hinglish (2): Sankalp se utpann hone waali saari kaamnaon ko poori tarah tyagkar, aur mann se hi indriya-samuday ko sabhi taraf se rokkar...
message:
सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषतः मनसैविन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्ततः
Abandoning all desires born of will, restraining the sense organs with the mind from all sides.
Sab ichhayein chhodkar, man se indriyon ko sab tarah se niyantrit karo.
tags: Raja Yoga, ધ્યાન, letting go of greed, detachment

Sanskrit verse: शनैः शनैरुपरमेद्बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत्
Translation (English): Gradually, step by step, with intellect held firm, fix the mind in the Self and think of nothing else.
Hinglish (1): Dheere dheere, dhairya se, buddhi sthir karke, man ko aatma me laga do, aur kuch mat socho.
Hinglish (2): Dheerya-yukta buddhi se, dheere-dheere uparati ko prapt ho. Mann ko aatma mein sthit karke, aur kisi bhi cheez ka chintan na kare.
message:
शनैः शनैरुपरमेद्बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत्
Gradually, step by step, with intellect held firm, fix the mind in the Self and think of nothing else.
Dheere dheere, dhairya se, buddhi sthir karke, man ko aatma me laga do, aur kuch mat socho.
tags: Raja Yoga, ધ્યાન, inner peace, lack of focus

Sanskrit verse: यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत्
Translation (English): Whenever the restless mind wanders, bring it back under the control of the Self.
Hinglish (1): Jahan jahan chanchal man jaaye, use wapas aatma me le aao.
Hinglish (2): Jab bhi yeh chanchal aur asthir mann kahin bhi bhatke, use wahan se rokkar, baar-baar aatma ke hi vash mein laaye.
message:
यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत्
Whenever the restless mind wanders, bring it back under the control of the Self.
Jahan jahan chanchal man jaaye, use wapas aatma me le aao.
tags: Raja Yoga, ધ્યાન, lack of focus, negative thoughts

Sanskrit verse: प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम्
Translation (English): The yogi of peaceful mind, with passions calmed, stainless, becomes one with Brahman and attains supreme happiness.
Hinglish (1): Shant man wala, rajogun se mukt, nirdosh yogi brahma me ek ho jaata hai aur uttam sukh paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jiska mann param shaant hai, jiska rajo-gun shaant ho gaya hai, jo paap-rahit hai, aur jo Brahma-swaroop ho gaya hai, us yogi ko uttam sukh prapt hota hai.
message:
प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम्
The yogi of peaceful mind, with passions calmed, stainless, becomes one with Brahman and attains supreme happiness.
Shant man wala, rajogun se mukt, nirdosh yogi brahma me ek ho jaata hai aur uttam sukh paata hai.
tags: mental peace, inner peace, Brahman, Sattva

Sanskrit verse: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते
Translation (English): Thus harmonizing himself constantly, the sinless yogi easily enjoys infinite happiness from contact with Brahman.
Hinglish (1): Is prakaar sada yog karne wala, paap se mukt yogi, brahma se milan ka anant sukh paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Is prakaar, paap-rahit yogi, hamesha apni aatma ko yog mein lagaye rakhte hue, sukh-poorvak Brahman ke sampark se milne waale anant anand ka anubhav karta hai.
message:
युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते
Thus harmonizing himself constantly, the sinless yogi easily enjoys infinite happiness from contact with Brahman.
Is prakaar sada yog karne wala, paap se mukt yogi, brahma se milan ka anant sukh paata hai.
tags: inner peace, mental peace, Brahman, Moksha

Sanskrit verse: सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः
Translation (English): The yogi sees the Self in all beings and all beings in the Self—seeing equally everywhere.
Hinglish (1): Yogi sab praniyon me aatma ko aur aatma me sab praniyon ko dekhta hai; sab jagah saman drishti hoti hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo yog-yukt aatma hai, woh sab jagah samaan drishti rakhta hai. Woh apni aatma ko sabhi praaniyon mein aur sabhi praaniyon ko apni aatma mein dekhta hai.
message:
सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः
The yogi sees the Self in all beings and all beings in the Self—seeing equally everywhere.
Yogi sab praniyon me aatma ko aur aatma me sab praniyon ko dekhta hai; sab jagah saman drishti hoti hai.

Sanskrit verse: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति
Translation (English): One who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me, I am never lost to him, nor is he lost to Me.
