Hinglish (1): Jo mujhe har jagah dekhta hai aur sab kuch mujhme dekhta hai, main usse kabhi alag nahi, na vo mujhse.
Hinglish (2): Jo mujhe sab jagah dekhta hai aur sab kuch mujhme dekhta hai, uske liye na toh main adrishya hota hoon aur na hi woh mere liye adrishya hota hai.
Summary: Mutual inseparability of God and devotee.
message:
यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति
One who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me, I am never lost to him, nor is he lost to Me.
Jo mujhe har jagah dekhta hai aur sab kuch mujhme dekhta hai, main usse kabhi alag nahi, na vo mujhse.

Sanskrit verse: सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते
Translation (English): One who worships Me as present in all beings, established in oneness, lives in Me whatever he may be doing.
Hinglish (1): Jo mujhe sab praniyon me ek samajhkar bhajta hai, vo yogi mujh me rehta hai, chahe kuch bhi kar raha ho.
Hinglish (2): Jo yogi ekatva-bhaav mein sthit hokar, sabhi praaniyon mein sthit mujhko bhajta hai, woh har prakaar se vartmaan rehte hue bhi mujhme hi nivaas karta hai.
message:
सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते
One who worships Me as present in all beings, established in oneness, lives in Me whatever he may be doing.
Jo mujhe sab praniyon me ek samajhkar bhajta hai, vo yogi mujh me rehta hai, chahe kuch bhi kar raha ho.

Sanskrit verse: आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः
Translation (English): O Arjuna, the supreme yogi is one who judges others’ happiness and sorrow by the same standard as his own.
Hinglish (1): Hey Arjun, jo apne jaise hi doosron ka sukh‑dukh dekhta hai, vo shreshth yogi hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Arjun, jo yogi apni aatma ki tulna se sab jagah, chahe sukh ho ya dukh, samaan drishti se dekhta hai, wahi param yogi maana gaya hai.
message:
आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः
O Arjuna, the supreme yogi is one who judges others’ happiness and sorrow by the same standard as his own.
Hey Arjun, jo apne jaise hi doosron ka sukh‑dukh dekhta hai, vo shreshth yogi hai.

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम्
Translation (English): Arjuna said: O Madhusudan, this yoga of equality which You have described, I do not see as stable due to the restlessness of the mind.
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Hey Madhusudan, jo saman drishti wala yog aapne bataya, man ki chanchalta ke kaaran mujhe sthir lagta nahi.
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Madhusudan, aapne jo yeh samatva-roopi yog bataya hai, mann ke chanchal hone ke kaaran main iski sthir sthiti nahi dekh paa raha hoon.
Summary: Arjuna doubts his ability to maintain yoga.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम्
Arjuna said: O Madhusudan, this yoga of equality which You have described, I do not see as stable due to the restlessness of the mind.
Arjun bola: Hey Madhusudan, jo saman drishti wala yog aapne bataya, man ki chanchalta ke kaaran mujhe sthir lagta nahi.
tags: confusion, lack of focus, doubting mind

Sanskrit verse: चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद् दृढम् तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम्
Translation (English): The mind is restless, turbulent, strong, and obstinate; controlling it, I think, is as difficult as controlling the wind.
Hinglish (1): Man chanchal, shaktishaali, ziddi hai; ise rokna hawa ko rokne jaisa mushkil hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Krishna, yeh mann bahut chanchal, prabal, dridh aur balwaan hai. Main iska nigrahan (control) karna hawa ko rokne ke samaan atyant kathin maanta hoon.
message:
चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद् दृढम् तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम्
The mind is restless, turbulent, strong, and obstinate; controlling it, I think, is as difficult as controlling the wind.
Man chanchal, shaktishaali, ziddi hai; ise rokna hawa ko rokne jaisa mushkil hai.
tags: stress, anxiety, lack of focus, negative thoughts

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: Yoga is hard to attain for one who is uncontrolled, but by the self‑controlled, striving, it can be attained by proper means.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Asanyam (uncontrolled)i ke liye yog mushkil hai, par sanyami (controlled) ke liye sadhanon se sambhav hai.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Hey Mahabahu, nishchit roop se mann chanchal aur kathinai se vash mein hone waala hai. Parantu, hey Kunti-putra, abhyaas aur vairaagya se ise vash mein kiya ja sakta hai.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः
The Blessed Lord said: Yoga is hard to attain for one who is uncontrolled, but by the self‑controlled, striving, it can be attained by proper means.
Shri Krishna bole: Asanyam (uncontrolled)i ke liye yog mushkil hai, par sanyami (controlled) ke liye sadhanon se sambhav hai.
tags: Raja Yoga, ध्यान, detachment, overcoming self-doubt

Sanskrit verse: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्य एवमता हृत्संग्युतः
Translation (English): Yoga is indeed difficult for the uncontrolled mind, but can be achieved by one who strives and is detached.
Hinglish (1): Asanyami (uncontrolled) ke liye yog kathin hai, par sanyami aur asakta vyakti ise pa sakta hai.
Hinglish (2): Jiska mann sanyamit nahi hai, uske liye yog prapt karna kathin hai, yeh mera mat hai. Parantu, jo sanyami vyakti prayaas karta hai, woh upaayon se ise prapt kar sakta hai.
message:
असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्य एवमता हृत्संग्युतः
Yoga is indeed difficult for the uncontrolled mind, but can be achieved by one who strives and is detached.
Asanyami (uncontrolled) ke liye yog kathin hai, par sanyami aur asakta vyakti ise pa sakta hai.

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच अयतिः श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानसः अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति
Translation (English): Arjuna said: What is the destination of one who, with faith but lacking self‑control, falls from yoga, having not attained perfection in yoga?
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Hey Krishna, jo shraddhavan hai par sanyam rahit hai aur yog me sthir nahi ho saka, uska kya hota hai?
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Krishna, jo shraddha-vaan hai par sanyami nahi, aur jiska mann yog se vichlit ho gaya hai, woh yog-siddhi ko na prapt karke kis gati ko jaata hai?
Summary: Arjuna asks about the fate of the unsuccessful yogi.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच अयतिः श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानसः अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति
Arjuna said: What is the destination of one who, with faith but lacking self‑control, falls from yoga, having not attained perfection in yoga?
Arjun bola: Hey Krishna, jo shraddhavan hai par sanyam rahit hai aur yog me sthir nahi ho saka, uska kya hota hai?

Sanskrit verse: कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि
Translation (English): Is he not destroyed like a rent cloud, fallen from both worlds, without support, O Mahabah, deluded on the path of Brahman?
Hinglish (1): Kya vo beech me chhodkar, dono margo se vanchit ho, to naash ho jaata hai?
Hinglish (2): Hey Mahabahu, kya woh Brahman ke maarg se bhatka hua, aashray-heen, dono taraf se bhrasht hokar, chhinn-bhinn baadal ki tarah nasht toh nahi ho jaata?
Summary: Concern about losing both spiritual and material benefits.
message:
कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि
Is he not destroyed like a rent cloud, fallen from both worlds, without support, O Mahabah, deluded on the path of Brahman?
Kya vo beech me chhodkar, dono margo se vanchit ho, to naash ho jaata hai?
tags: fear of failure, feeling lost in life, confusion

Sanskrit verse: एतान्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषतः त्वदन्यः संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते
Translation (English): Please completely dispel this doubt of mine, Krishna; none but You can remove it entirely.
Hinglish (1): Mere is sandeh ko puri tarah dur karo; aapke sivay koi ise door nahi kar sakta.
Hinglish (2): Hey Krishna, mere is sandeh ko poori tarah se nasht karne ke liye aap hi yogy hain. Aapke alawa is sandeh ko door karne waala koi aur nahi ho sakta.
Summary: Arjuna’s total dependence on Krishna’s answer.
message:
एतान्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषतः त्वदन्यः संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते
Please completely dispel this doubt of mine, Krishna; none but You can remove it entirely.
Mere is sandeh ko puri tarah dur karo; aapke sivay koi ise door nahi kar sakta.
tags: confusion, doubting mind, feeling lost in life

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच पार्थ नैविह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: O Parth, there is no destruction for him either here or hereafter; one who does good, My dear, never goes to misfortune.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Hey Parth, uska yahaan ya aage koi naash nahi; koi bhi shubh karm karne wala durgati nahi paata.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Hey Parth, us vyakti ka na toh is lok mein aur na hi parlok mein vinaash hota hai. Kyunki, hey priya, kalyankari karm karne waala koi bhi vyakti durgati ko prapt nahi hota.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच पार्थ नैविह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति
The Blessed Lord said: O Parth, there is no destruction for him either here or hereafter; one who does good, My dear, never goes to misfortune.
Shri Krishna bole: Hey Parth, uska yahaan ya aage koi naash nahi; koi bhi shubh karm karne wala durgati nahi paata.
tags: Karma, Dharma, overcoming fear, inner peace

Sanskrit verse: प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते
Translation (English): The fallen yogi, after dwelling for long ages in the worlds of the virtuous, is born in a pure and prosperous family.
Hinglish (1): Yogbhrasht yogi punya lok me bahut samay rehkar shuddh aur samriddh parivar me janm leta hai.
Hinglish (2): Yog-bhrasht vyakti punya-karmiyon ke lokon ko prapt hokar, wahan anek varshon tak nivaas karke, phir shuddh aur samriddh parivaar mein janm leta hai.
message:
प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते
The fallen yogi, after dwelling for long ages in the worlds of the virtuous, is born in a pure and prosperous family.
Yogbhrasht yogi punya lok me bahut samay rehkar shuddh aur samriddh parivar me janm leta hai.

Sanskrit verse: अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमतामेतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम्
Translation (English): Or he takes birth in a family of wise yogis; such a birth is very rare in this world.
Hinglish (1): Ya phir gyani yogiyon ke ghar janm hota hai; aisa janm bahut durllabh hai.
Hinglish (2): Athva, woh buddhiman yogiyon ke hi kul mein janm leta hai. Is sansaar mein is prakaar ka janm nishchit roop se atyant durlabh hai.
message:
अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमतामेतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम्
Or he takes birth in a family of wise yogis; such a birth is very rare in this world.
Ya phir gyani yogiyon ke ghar janm hota hai; aisa janm bahut durllabh hai.

Sanskrit verse: तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन
Translation (English): There he regains the intellect connection of the previous body and strives again for perfection, O joy of the Kurus.
Hinglish (1): Wahan vah purve janm ka gyaan paata hai aur phir siddhi ke liye prayatna karta hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kurunandan, wahan usko poorva-deh se prapt hui buddhi-sanyog phir se mil jaata hai, aur woh uske aage siddhi prapt karne ke liye phir se prayaas karta hai.
message:
तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन
There he regains the intellect connection of the previous body and strives again for perfection, O joy of the Kurus.
Wahan vah purve janm ka gyaan paata hai aur phir siddhi ke liye prayatna karta hai.

Sanskrit verse: पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते
Translation (English): By that previous practice, he is carried forward, even unwillingly; the seeker of yoga goes beyond the Vedic rituals.
Hinglish (1): Purane abhyas se, chahe na chahe, vah aage badhta hai; yog ka jigyasu vedic karm se bhi pare ho jaata hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kurunandan, woh na chahte hue bhi, apne poorva abhyaas ke bal se hi aakarshit ho jaata hai. Yog ka jigyasu bhi shabd-brahma (vedic rituals) ko paar kar jaata hai.
message:
पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते
By that previous practice, he is carried forward, even unwillingly; the seeker of yoga goes beyond the Vedic rituals.
Purane abhyas se, chahe na chahe, vah aage badhta hai; yog ka jigyasu vedic karm se bhi pare ho jaata hai.

Sanskrit verse: प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संसिद्धिमाप्नुति किल्बिषः अनन्तरसंयोगेन जन्मान्तरानुभूतया
Translation (English): Striving with effort, purified of sin, and perfected through many births, the yogi reaches the supreme goal.
Hinglish (1): Mehnat karke, paap se mukta hokar aur kai janmon ke yog milan se, yogi param lakshya tak pahuchta hai.
Hinglish (2): Parantu, jo yogi prayaas-poorvak yatna karta hai, woh paapon se shuddh hokar, anek janmon ke abhyaas se siddhi prapt karke, param gati ko prapt hota hai.
message:
प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संसिद्धिमाप्नुति किल्बिषः अनन्तरसंयोगेन जन्मान्तरानुभूतया
Striving with effort, purified of sin, and perfected through many births, the yogi reaches the supreme goal.
Mehnat karke, paap se mukta hokar aur kai janmon ke yog milan se, yogi param lakshya tak pahuchta hai.

Sanskrit verse: तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन
Translation (English): The yogi is greater than ascetics, greater than the learned, greater than the ritualist; therefore be a yogi, O Arjuna.
Hinglish (1): Yogi tapasvi se, gyani se, aur karmkandi se shreshth hai; isliye yogi bano.
Hinglish (2): Yogi tapasviyon se shreshth hai, gyaaniyon se bhi shreshth maana gaya hai, aur karm-kandiyon se bhi shreshth hai. Isliye, hey Arjun, tum yogi bano.
message:
तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन
The yogi is greater than ascetics, greater than the learned, greater than the ritualist; therefore be a yogi, O Arjuna.
Yogi tapasvi se, gyani se, aur karmkandi se shreshth hai; isliye yogi bano.
tags: Raja Yoga, Jnana Yoga, Karma Yoga

Sanskrit verse: योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः
Translation (English): Of all yogis, the one with faith who worships Me, with the inner self merged in Me, is considered the highest yogi.
Hinglish (1): Sab yogiyo me, jo shraddhavan mujhme antarman se juda hai, vo sabse shreshth hai.
Hinglish (2): Sabhi yogiyon mein se bhi, jo shraddha-vaan yogi apne antar-aatma se mujhme sthit hokar mujhe bhajta hai, wahi mujhe param shreshth maanya hai.
message:
योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः
Of all yogis, the one with faith who worships Me, with the inner self merged in Me, is considered the highest yogi.
Sab yogiyo me, jo shraddhavan mujhme antarman se juda hai, vo sabse shreshth hai.

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, with mind attached to Me, practicing yoga under My shelter, hear how you will know Me completely, without doubt.
Hinglish (1): Hey Parth, mera ashray lekar man mujhme lagao aur yog karo; main kaise poori tarah jaane jaaunga, yeh suno.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Hey Parth, ab suno ki kaise tum mann ko mujhme aasakt karke aur meri sharan mein aakar, bina kisi sandeh ke, mujhe poorn roop se jaan sakoge.
Summary: Promising full knowledge to the devoted yogi.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु
The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, with mind attached to Me, practicing yoga under My shelter, hear how you will know Me completely, without doubt.
Hey Parth, mera ashray lekar man mujhme lagao aur yog karo; main kaise poori tarah jaane jaaunga, yeh suno.

Sanskrit verse: ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते
Translation (English): I shall declare to you this knowledge together with realization, completely; knowing it, nothing else remains to be known here.
Hinglish (1): Main tumhe gyaan aur vijnan poorn roop se bataunga; ise jaankar tumhe kuch aur jaane ki zaroorat nahi rahegi.
Hinglish (2): Main tumhein is gyaan ko vigyaan (realization) sahit poorn roop se bataunga, jise jaan lene ke baad is sansaar mein kuch aur jaanna shesh nahi reh jaata.
message:
ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते
I shall declare to you this knowledge together with realization, completely; knowing it, nothing else remains to be known here.
Main tumhe gyaan aur vijnan poorn roop se bataunga; ise jaankar tumhe kuch aur jaane ki zaroorat nahi rahegi.

Sanskrit verse: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः
Translation (English): Among thousands of men, rarely one strives for perfection; among those, even rarer is one who truly knows Me.
Hinglish (1): Hazaron me ek siddhi ke liye koshish karta hai; aur unme ek hi mujhe sach me jaanta hai.
Hinglish (2): Hazaaron manushyon mein se koi ek siddhi ke liye prayaas karta hai, aur un prayaas karne waale siddhon mein se bhi koi ek hi mujhe tattva se jaan paata hai.
message:
मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः
Among thousands of men, rarely one strives for perfection; among those, even rarer is one who truly knows Me.
Hazaron me ek siddhi ke liye koshish karta hai; aur unme ek hi mujhe sach me jaanta hai.

Sanskrit verse: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा
Translation (English): Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intellect, and ego—these eight constitute My separated material energies.
Hinglish (1): Bhumi, jal, agni, vayu, aakash, mann, buddhi, ahamkar—yeh meri alag‑alag aath prakritiyan hain.
Hinglish (2): Prithvi, jal, agni, vayu, aakash, mann, buddhi aur ahankar - yeh aath prakaar se vibhakt meri bhautik prakriti (material energy) hai.
message:
भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा
Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intellect, and ego—these eight constitute My separated material energies.
Bhumi, jal, agni, vayu, aakash, mann, buddhi, ahamkar—yeh meri alag‑alag aath prakritiyan hain.

Sanskrit verse: अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् जीवभूममहाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत्
Translation (English): This is My inferior nature; know My other nature, O mighty‑armed, as the living beings by which the universe is sustained.
Hinglish (1): Yeh meri nichli prakriti hai; upar wali prakriti jeev roop hai jo jagat ko dharan karta hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Mahabahu, is bhautik prakriti se pare meri ek aur paraa prakriti (spiritual energy) hai, jo ki jeev-swaroop hai. Usi ne is poore jagat ko dhaaran kar rakha hai.
message:
अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् जीवभूममहाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत्
This is My inferior nature; know My other nature, O mighty‑armed, as the living beings by which the universe is sustained.
Yeh meri nichli prakriti hai; upar wali prakriti jeev roop hai jo jagat ko dharan karta hai.

Sanskrit verse: एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा
Translation (English): Know that all beings are born from these two; I am the origin and dissolution of the entire universe.
Hinglish (1): Sab jeev in dono prakritiyon se utpann hain; main jagat ka prabhav aur pralay hoon.
Hinglish (2): Yeh samjho ki sabhi praani in dono prakritiyon se hi utpann hote hain. Aur main is sampoorn jagat ki utpatti aur pralay (dissolution) ka mool kaaran hoon.
Summary: Krishna as both source and end.
message:
एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा
Know that all beings are born from these two; I am the origin and dissolution of the entire universe.
Sab jeev in dono prakritiyon se utpann hain; main jagat ka prabhav aur pralay hoon.

Sanskrit verse: मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव
Translation (English): O Dhananjaya, there is nothing higher than Me; all this is strung on Me like gems on a thread.
Hinglish (1): Hey Dhananjaya, mujhse upar kuch nahi; sab mujhme motiyon ki mala jaise gutha hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Dhananjaya, mujhse shreshth aur koi satya nahi hai. Jaise moti ek dhaage mein piroye rehte hain, usi tarah sab kuch mujh par hi aashrit hai.
Summary: Illustrates unity of all existence in God.
message:
मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव
O Dhananjaya, there is nothing higher than Me; all this is strung on Me like gems on a thread.
Hey Dhananjaya, mujhse upar kuch nahi; sab mujhme motiyon ki mala jaise gutha hai.

Sanskrit verse: रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु
Translation (English): O Kaunteya, I am the taste in water, light in the moon and sun, Om in all the Vedas, sound in ether, and manliness in men.
Hinglish (1): Hey Kaunteya, main jal ka ras, surya‑chand ka prakash, vedon ka Om, aakash ka shabd, aur purushon ka purusharth hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kunti-putra, main jal mein ras (taste) hoon, chandrama aur surya mein prakaash hoon, sabhi Vedon mein 'Om' hoon, aakash mein shabd hoon, aur manushyon mein paurush (ability) hoon.
message:
रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु
O Kaunteya, I am the taste in water, light in the moon and sun, Om in all the Vedas, sound in ether, and manliness in men.
Hey Kaunteya, main jal ka ras, surya‑chand ka prakash, vedon ka Om, aakash ka shabd, aur purushon ka purusharth hoon.

Sanskrit verse: पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु
Translation (English): I am the pure fragrance in earth, the heat in fire, the life of all beings, and the penance of ascetics.
Hinglish (1): Main dharti ki shuddh sugandh, agni ka tej, sab ka jeevan, aur tapasvi ka tap hoon.
Hinglish (2): Main prithvi mein pavitra gandh hoon, agni mein tej (heat) hoon, sabhi praaniyon mein jeevan hoon, aur tapasviyon mein tap hoon.
Summary: Krishna present in elements and virtues.
message:
पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु
I am the pure fragrance in earth, the heat in fire, the life of all beings, and the penance of ascetics.
Main dharti ki shuddh sugandh, agni ka tej, sab ka jeevan, aur tapasvi ka tap hoon.

Sanskrit verse: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्
Translation (English): O Partha, know Me as the eternal seed of all beings; I am intelligence of the intelligent and splendor of the splendid.
Hinglish (1): Hey Parth, mujhe sab ka sanatan beej samjho; main gyaaniyon ka gyaan, tejस्वी ka tej hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, mujhe hi sabhi praaniyon ka sanatan (eternal) beej jaano. Main buddhimano ki buddhi hoon aur tejasviyon ka tej hoon.
message:
बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्
O Partha, know Me as the eternal seed of all beings; I am intelligence of the intelligent and splendor of the splendid.
Hey Parth, mujhe sab ka sanatan beej samjho; main gyaaniyon ka gyaan, tejस्वी ka tej hoon.

Sanskrit verse: बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ
Translation (English): O best of the Bharatas, I am strength free from desire and passion; I am desire not opposed to dharma.
Hinglish (1): Hey Bharatshreshtha, main asakti‑rahit bal hoon, aur dharm ke anukool iccha hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat-shreshth, main balwaano ka bal hoon jo kaamna aur aasakti se rahit hai. Aur main sabhi praaniyon mein woh kaam (desire) hoon jo dharm ke viruddh nahi hai.
Summary: Strength and righteous desire from Krishna.
message:
बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ
O best of the Bharatas, I am strength free from desire and passion; I am desire not opposed to dharma.
Hey Bharatshreshtha, main asakti‑rahit bal hoon, aur dharm ke anukool iccha hoon.

Sanskrit verse: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये मत्त एवं विद्धि तान्यहं न द्वेष्टि न प्रीयः
Translation (English): Know that all states—sattvic, rajasic, tamasic—arise from Me; I do not hate or favour them.
Hinglish (1): Sattvik, rajasic, tamasic sab mere se janme hain; main na unse dvesh rakhta, na prem.
Hinglish (2): Tum yeh jaano ki saattvik, raajasik aur taamasik, yeh sabhi avasthayein mujhse hi utpann hoti hain. Par main unmein nahi, balki ve mujhme sthit hain.
message:
ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये मत्त एवं विद्धि तान्यहं न द्वेष्टि न प्रीयः
Know that all states—sattvic, rajasic, tamasic—arise from Me; I do not hate or favour them.
Sattvik, rajasic, tamasic sab mere se janme hain; main na unse dvesh rakhta, na prem.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, Brahman

Sanskrit verse: त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत् मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम्
Translation (English): The world is deluded by these three modes, and does not know Me, who am beyond them and imperishable.
Hinglish (1): Yeh teen gun sabko moh lete hain; log mujhe nahi jaante jo unse pare aur avinashi hoon.
Hinglish (2): In teeno guno ke bhaavon se yeh saara sansaar mohit hai. Isliye, log mujhko, jo in guno se pare aur avinashi hai, nahi jaan paate.
Summary: Modes veil the truth about God.
message:
त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत् मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम्
The world is deluded by these three modes, and does not know Me, who am beyond them and imperishable.
Yeh teen gun sabko moh lete hain; log mujhe nahi jaante jo unse pare aur avinashi hoon.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, confusion, Moksha

Sanskrit verse: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते
Translation (English): This divine maya of guna is hard to overcome; those who surrender to Me cross over it.
Hinglish (1): Meri yeh gunmayi maya durjana hai; jo mujhme sharan lete hain ve ise paar karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Prakriti ke teen guno se bani meri yeh divya maya (shakti) ko paar karna atyant kathin hai. Parantu, jo log meri hi sharan mein aate hain, ve ise aasani se paar kar jaate hain.
Summary: Surrender as the escape from illusion.
message:
दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते
This divine maya of guna is hard to overcome; those who surrender to Me cross over it.
Meri yeh gunmayi maya durjana hai; jo mujhme sharan lete hain ve ise paar karte hain.

Sanskrit verse: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः
Translation (English): The wicked, deluded, lowest of men, whose knowledge is stolen by maya, take to demonic nature and do not surrender to Me.
Hinglish (1): Jinke gyaan ko maya ne le liya, jo dusht aur naradhama hain, ve mujhme sharan nahi lete.
Hinglish (2): Jo dushkarmi, moorkh aur manushyon mein neeche star ke log hain, jinka gyaan maya ne har liya hai, aur jo aasuri bhaav mein sthit hain, ve meri sharan mein nahi aate.
message:
न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः
The wicked, deluded, lowest of men, whose knowledge is stolen by maya, take to demonic nature and do not surrender to Me.
Jinke gyaan ko maya ne le liya, jo dusht aur naradhama hain, ve mujhme sharan nahi lete.

Sanskrit verse: चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ
Translation (English): Four kinds of virtuous men worship Me, O Arjuna: the distressed, the seeker of knowledge, the seeker of wealth, and the wise.
Hinglish (1): Hey Arjun, chaar prakar ke sukrit log mujhe bhajte hain — dukhi, jigyasu, dhan-icchu, aur gyani.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat-shreshth Arjun, chaar prakaar ke punya-karmi log meri bhakti karte hain: aart (dukhi), jigyasu (jaanne ka ichhuk), artharthi (dhan ki ichha waala), aur gyaani.
message:
चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ
Four kinds of virtuous men worship Me, O Arjuna: the distressed, the seeker of knowledge, the seeker of wealth, and the wise.
Hey Arjun, chaar prakar ke sukrit log mujhe bhajte hain — dukhi, jigyasu, dhan-icchu, aur gyani.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, dealing with grief, finding purpose

Sanskrit verse: तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते प्रियोहि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः
Translation (English): Of these, the wise one, ever steadfast, devoted to the One, excels; I am supremely dear to him, and he to Me.
Hinglish (1): Inme gyani, jo nitya ek bhakti me sthir hai, shreshth hai; main use prem karta hoon, vo mujhe.
Hinglish (2): Unmein se, jo gyaani hamesha mujhme sthit rehta hai aur ananya bhakti karta hai, wahi shreshth hai. Kyunki gyaani ko main atyant priya hoon, aur woh mujhe atyant priya hai.
Summary: Mutual love between God and realized devotee.
message:
तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते प्रियोहि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः
Of these, the wise one, ever steadfast, devoted to the One, excels; I am supremely dear to him, and he to Me.
Inme gyani, jo nitya ek bhakti me sthir hai, shreshth hai; main use prem karta hoon, vo mujhe.

Sanskrit verse: उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम्
Translation (English): All these are noble, but the wise one I regard as My very Self; steadfast, he attains Me alone as the supreme goal.
Hinglish (1): Sab udaar hain, par gyani mera atma samaan hai; vah mujhe hi param gati banata hai.
Hinglish (2): Yeh sabhi (chaaron prakaar ke bhakt) udaar hain, parantu gyaani ko toh main apna swaroop hi maanta hoon. Kyunki woh sthir-chitt hokar mujhko hi apni param gati maankar sthit hai.
Summary: The wise is closest to Krishna.
message:
उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम्
All these are noble, but the wise one I regard as My very Self; steadfast, he attains Me alone as the supreme goal.
Sab udaar hain, par gyani mera atma samaan hai; vah mujhe hi param gati banata hai.

Sanskrit verse: बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः
Translation (English): After many births, the man of knowledge takes refuge in Me, realizing, “Vasudeva is all”; such a great soul is very rare.
Hinglish (1): Bahut janmon ke baad gyani mujhme sharan leta hai, kehta hai “Vasudev sab hai”; aisa mahatma durllabh hai.
Hinglish (2): Anek janmon ke baad, jo vastav mein gyaani hai, woh 'Sab kuch Vasudev (Krishna) hi hai' yeh samajhkar meri sharan mein aata hai. Aisa mahatma atyant durlabh hota hai.
message:
बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः
After many births, the man of knowledge takes refuge in Me, realizing, “Vasudeva is all”; such a great soul is very rare.
Bahut janmon ke baad gyani mujhme sharan leta hai, kehta hai “Vasudev sab hai”; aisa mahatma durllabh hai.
tags: self-realization, Jnana Yoga, Bhakti Yoga, Moksha

Sanskrit verse: कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया
Translation (English): Those whose knowledge is carried away by desires surrender to other deities, following rules according to their nature.
Hinglish (1): Jinka gyaan kaam se chhin gaya, ve anya devtaon ki sharan lete hain, apni prakriti ke niyam se.
Hinglish (2): Jinka gyaan bhautik kaamnaon ne har liya hai, ve apni-apni prakriti ke anusaar, alag-alag niyamon ka paalan karte hue, anya devtaon ki sharan lete hain.
Summary: Desire diverts worship away from the Supreme.
message:
कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया
Those whose knowledge is carried away by desires surrender to other deities, following rules according to their nature.
Jinka gyaan kaam se chhin gaya, ve anya devtaon ki sharan lete hain, apni prakriti ke niyam se.

Sanskrit verse: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विधधाम्यहम्
Translation (English): Whatever form a devotee desires to worship with faith, I make that faith steady.
Hinglish (1): Jo bhakt jis devta ko shraddha se poojna chahta hai, uski shraddha main sthir kar deta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Jo bhi bhakt jis bhi devta-swaroop ko shraddha se poojna chahta hai, main us-uski shraddha ko usi devta ke prati sthir kar deta hoon.
message:
यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विधधाम्यहम्
Whatever form a devotee desires to worship with faith, I make that faith steady.
Jo bhakt jis devta ko shraddha se poojna chahta hai, uski shraddha main sthir kar deta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान्
Translation (English): Endowed with that faith, he worships and obtains his desires—these being granted by Me alone.
Hinglish (1): Us shraddha se, bhakt pooja karta hai aur apni iccha paata hai — par yeh main hi deta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Woh us shraddha se yukt hokar us devta ki aradhana karta hai aur apni kaamnaon ko poora karta hai, jo vastav mein mere dwara hi pradaan ki jaati hain.
Summary: Even other worship is empowered by Krishna.
message:
स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान्
Endowed with that faith, he worships and obtains his desires—these being granted by Me alone.
Us shraddha se, bhakt pooja karta hai aur apni iccha paata hai — par yeh main hi deta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि
Translation (English): But such fruit is temporary; men of small understanding go to the gods, My devotees come to Me.
Hinglish (1): Unka fal ant ka hota hai; chhoti buddhi wale devtaon tak jaate hain, mere bhakt mere paas aate hain.
Hinglish (2): Parantu, un alp-buddhi waalon ka woh phal seemit aur nashwar hota hai. Devtaon ko poojne waale devlok jaate hain, jabki mere bhakt mere param-dhaam ko prapt hote hain.
Summary: Duration of reward depends on worshipped.
message:
अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि
But such fruit is temporary; men of small understanding go to the gods, My devotees come to Me.
Unka fal ant ka hota hai; chhoti buddhi wale devtaon tak jaate hain, mere bhakt mere paas aate hain.
tags: Moksha, Karma, letting go of greed

Sanskrit verse: अव्यक्तं व्यक्‍तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तम्
Translation (English): The unintelligent think I was formless and have now taken a form, not knowing My supreme, imperishable nature.
Hinglish (1): Moorakh sochte hain main nirakar se akar bana; ve meri param, avinashi prakriti nahi jaante.
Hinglish (2): Buddhi-heen log, mere avinashi aur param bhaav ko na jaante hue, yeh maante hain ki main, avyakt, ab vyakti-roop mein prakat hua hoon.
message:
अव्यक्तं व्यक्‍तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तम्
The unintelligent think I was formless and have now taken a form, not knowing My supreme, imperishable nature.
Moorakh sochte hain main nirakar se akar bana; ve meri param, avinashi prakriti nahi jaante.

Sanskrit verse: नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम्
Translation (English): I am not manifest to all, being veiled by yoga‑maya; the deluded do not know Me, unborn and imperishable.
Hinglish (1): Main sabko prakat nahi hoon, yog‑maya se dhaka hoon; moorkh mujhe ajanma, avinashi nahi jaante.
Hinglish (2): Main apni yog-maya se dhaka hone ke kaaran sabke saamne prakat nahi hota. Isliye, yeh moorkh sansaar mujhe, ajanma aur avinashi, nahi jaan paata.
message:
नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम्
I am not manifest to all, being veiled by yoga‑maya; the deluded do not know Me, unborn and imperishable.
Main sabko prakat nahi hoon, yog‑maya se dhaka hoon; moorkh mujhe ajanma, avinashi nahi jaante.

Sanskrit verse: वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन
Translation (English): O Arjuna, I know all beings of the past, present, and future, but no one knows Me in truth.
Hinglish (1): Main sab ke bhoot, vartamaan, bhavishya ko jaanta hoon; par koi mujhe vastu roop se nahi jaanta.
Hinglish (2): Hey Arjun, main bhootkaal, vartmaan kaal aur bhavishya kaal ke sabhi praaniyon ko jaanta hoon, parantu mujhe koi nahi jaanta.
message:
वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन
O Arjuna, I know all beings of the past, present, and future, but no one knows Me in truth.
Main sab ke bhoot, vartamaan, bhavishya ko jaanta hoon; par koi mujhe vastu roop se nahi jaanta.

Sanskrit verse: इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत सर्वभूतानि संमोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप
Translation (English): O Bharata, by the delusion of duality arising from desire and aversion, all beings fall into confusion at birth.
Hinglish (1): Hey Bharat, kaamna‑dvesh se utpann dvandv se sab prani janm ke samay se hi mohit hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, ichha aur dvesh se utpann hone waale dwandwon ke moh se, sabhi praani janm se hi moh-grast ho jaate hain.
message:
इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत सर्वभूतानि संमोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप
O Bharata, by the delusion of duality arising from desire and aversion, all beings fall into confusion at birth.
Hey Bharat, kaamna‑dvesh se utpann dvandv se sab prani janm ke samay se hi mohit hote hain.

Sanskrit verse: येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः
Translation (English): Those whose sin has ended, who are engaged in pious deeds, free from delusion of duality, worship Me with firm vows.
Hinglish (1): Jinka paap samapt ho gaya, jo punya karm karte hain, vo dvandv moh se mukt ho mujhme bhakti karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Parantu, jin punya-karmiyon ke paap samapt ho gaye hain, ve dwandwon ke moh se mukt hokar, dridh nishchay ke saath meri bhakti karte hain.
message:
येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः
Those whose sin has ended, who are engaged in pious deeds, free from delusion of duality, worship Me with firm vows.
Jinka paap samapt ho gaya, jo punya karm karte hain, vo dvandv moh se mukt ho mujhme bhakti karte hain.

Sanskrit verse: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम्
Translation (English): Those who take refuge in Me and strive for liberation from old age and death, know Brahman, the self, and all karma.
Hinglish (1): Jo mujhse jarā‑mrityu se mukti chahte hain, ve brahma, adhyatma, aur poora karm jaante hain.
Hinglish (2): Jo log meri sharan lekar budhape aur mrityu se mukti ke liye prayaas karte hain, ve us Brahman ko, sampoorn adhyatm ko, aur sampoorn karm ko jaan jaate hain.
message:
जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम्
Those who take refuge in Me and strive for liberation from old age and death, know Brahman, the self, and all karma.
Jo mujhse jarā‑mrityu se mukti chahte hain, ve brahma, adhyatma, aur poora karm jaante hain.
tags: fear of death, reincarnation, Moksha, Brahman, Karma

Sanskrit verse: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः
Translation (English): Those who know Me as adhibhuta, adhidaiva, and adhiyajna, with steady mind, know Me also at death.
Hinglish (1): Jo mujhe adhibhoot, adhidaiv, adhiyagya ke roop me jaante hain, aur ant-samay me bhi mujhme lage hain, ve mujhe paate hain.
Hinglish (2): Jo log mujhe adhibhoot (bhautik jagat), adhidaiv (devtaon), aur adhiyajna (yajna) ke sahit jaante hain, ve sthir-chitt hokar mrityu ke samay bhi mujhe jaante hain (yaad rakhte hain).
message:
साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः
Those who know Me as adhibhuta, adhidaiva, and adhiyajna, with steady mind, know Me also at death.
Jo mujhe adhibhoot, adhidaiv, adhiyagya ke roop me jaante hain, aur ant-samay me bhi mujhme lage hain, ve mujhe paate hain.
tags: fear of death, Moksha, Brahman, Bhakti Yoga

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते
Translation (English): Arjuna said: O Supreme Person, what is Brahman? What is the self? What is karma? What is called adhibhuta? And what is called adhidaiva?
Hinglish (1): Arjun bole: Hey Purushottam, kya hai Brahma? Kya hai adhyatma? Kya hai karm? Adhibhoot kya hai? Adhidaiv kya hai?
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Purushottam, woh 'Brahman' kya hai? 'Adhyatma' kya hai? 'Karma' kya hai? 'Adhibhuta' kise kehte hain? Aur 'Adhidaiva' kya kehlata hai?
Summary: Arjuna asks for clear definitions of key terms.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते
Arjuna said: O Supreme Person, what is Brahman? What is the self? What is karma? What is called adhibhuta? And what is called adhidaiva?
Arjun bole: Hey Purushottam, kya hai Brahma? Kya hai adhyatma? Kya hai karm? Adhibhoot kya hai? Adhidaiv kya hai?
tags: confusion, what is the purpose of life, Brahman, Karma, Atman

Sanskrit verse: अधियज्ञः कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभिः
Translation (English): And who is adhiyajna here in this body, O Madhusudan? And how are You to be known at the time of death by the self‑controlled?
Hinglish (1): Aur adhiyagya kaun hai is shareer me, madhusudan? Aur ant samay me aapko kaise jaane yogya log jaante hain?
Hinglish (2): Hey Madhusudan, is shareer mein 'Adhiyajna' kaun hai aur kaise rehta hai? Aur sanyami log mrityu ke samay aapko kaise jaan paate hain?
Summary: Asking about God’s presence in body and at death.
message:
अधियज्ञः कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभिः
And who is adhiyajna here in this body, O Madhusudan? And how are You to be known at the time of death by the self‑controlled?
Aur adhiyagya kaun hai is shareer me, madhusudan? Aur ant samay me aapko kaise jaane yogya log jaante hain?

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यमात्ममुच्यते भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्गः कर्मसंज्ञितः
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: Brahman is the imperishable; adhyatma is the individual self; the creative force that brings beings into being is called karma.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Akshar Brahma hai, adhyatma vyakti aatma hai, jo praniyon ko janm deta hai, use karm kehte hain.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Param avinashi tattva hi 'Brahman' hai. Jeev ka apna mool swabhav hi 'Adhyatma' hai. Aur praaniyon ki utpatti karne waala visarg (creative force) hi 'Karma' kehlata hai.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यमात्ममुच्यते भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्गः कर्मसंज्ञितः
The Blessed Lord said: Brahman is the imperishable; adhyatma is the individual self; the creative force that brings beings into being is called karma.
Shri Krishna bole: Akshar Brahma hai, adhyatma vyakti aatma hai, jo praniyon ko janm deta hai, use karm kehte hain.

Sanskrit verse: अधिभूतं क्षरो भावः पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर
Translation (English): O best of the embodied, adhibhuta is the perishable nature; adhidaiva is the Cosmic Person; and I Myself am the adhiyajna in this body.
Hinglish (1): Hey dehidhari shreshth, adhibhoot kshar prakriti hai, adhidaiv purush hai, aur adhiyagya main swayam hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey dehdhariyon mein shreshth, nashwar bhautik jagat hi 'Adhibhuta' hai. Surya aadi devtaon ka samashti-roop (cosmic form) hi 'Adhidaiva' hai. Aur is shareer mein sthit main (Paramatma) hi 'Adhiyajna' hoon.
message:
अधिभूतं क्षरो भावः पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर
O best of the embodied, adhibhuta is the perishable nature; adhidaiva is the Cosmic Person; and I Myself am the adhiyajna in this body.
Hey dehidhari shreshth, adhibhoot kshar prakriti hai, adhidaiv purush hai, aur adhiyagya main swayam hoon.

Sanskrit verse: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः
Translation (English): And whoever, at the end of the body, departs remembering Me alone, attains My state—there is no doubt of this.
Hinglish (1): Jo ant samay me mujhe yaad karta hai, vah mujhme milta hai—isme koi sandeh nahi.
Hinglish (2): Aur jo koi bhi, mrityu ke samay, kewal mera smaran karte hue shareer ka tyag karta hai, woh mere hi swaroop ko prapt hota hai. Ismein koi sandeh nahi hai.
message:
अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः
And whoever, at the end of the body, departs remembering Me alone, attains My state—there is no doubt of this.
Jo ant samay me mujhe yaad karta hai, vah mujhme milta hai—isme koi sandeh nahi.
tags: fear of death, Moksha, Bhakti Yoga, reincarnation

Sanskrit verse: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः
Translation (English): O Kaunteya, whatever state of being one remembers at the end, always absorbed in it, that state one attains.
Hinglish (1): Hey Kaunteya, jo avastha ant me yaad hoti hai, wahi avastha milti hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kunti-putra, manushya ant samay mein jis-jis bhaav ka smaran karte hue shareer ka tyag karta hai, hamesha usi bhaav mein leen rehne ke kaaran, woh usi bhaav ko prapt hota hai.
Summary: State of mind at death shapes the next condition.
message:
यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः
O Kaunteya, whatever state of being one remembers at the end, always absorbed in it, that state one attains.
Hey Kaunteya, jo avastha ant me yaad hoti hai, wahi avastha milti hai.

Sanskrit verse: तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयम्
Translation (English): Therefore, remember Me at all times and fight; with mind and intellect offered to Me, you will surely come to Me.
Hinglish (1): Isliye hamesha mujhe yaad karo aur yudh karo; man‑buddhi mujhme arpit karke tum mujhme aaoge.
Hinglish (2): Isliye, har samay mera smaran karo aur apna kartavya (yuddh) bhi karo. Apne mann aur buddhi ko mujhe samarpit karke, tum nishchit roop se mujhe hi prapt karoge.
message:
तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयम्
Therefore, remember Me at all times and fight; with mind and intellect offered to Me, you will surely come to Me.
Isliye hamesha mujhe yaad karo aur yudh karo; man‑buddhi mujhme arpit karke tum mujhme aaoge.

Sanskrit verse: अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन्
Translation (English): With mind disciplined by yoga practice, not going elsewhere, meditating on the supreme divine Person, one attains Him, O Partha.
Hinglish (1): Yog abhyas se niyantrit man, anya kahin na jaaye, param purush ka dhyan karo aur usse pao.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, jo abhyaas-yog se yukt hai aur jiska chitt kahin aur nahi bhatakta, woh nirantar chintan karte hue us param divya Purush (Paramatma) ko hi prapt hota hai.
Summary: Single‑pointed meditation brings union with God.
message:
अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन्
With mind disciplined by yoga practice, not going elsewhere, meditating on the supreme divine Person, one attains Him, O Partha.
Yog abhyas se niyantrit man, anya kahin na jaaye, param purush ka dhyan karo aur usse pao.
tags: Raja Yoga, เชงเซ�เชฏเชพเชจ, Bhakti Yoga, Moksha

Sanskrit verse: कविं पुराणमनुशासितारमणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्यः सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूपम्
Translation (English): One should remember the Omniscient, ancient, ruler, subtler than the subtle, sustainer of all, of inconceivable form.
Hinglish (1): Us kavim, puran, niyamak, anor‑aniyan, sabka dhata, achintya swaroop ko yaad karo.
Hinglish (2): Manushya ko us sarvagya, anadi, sabke niyantrak, sookshm se bhi sookshm, sabke dhaarak, achintya-swaroop aur surya ke samaan tejasvi (Paramatma) ka smaran karna chahiye.
Summary: Attributes of the Supreme focus for meditation.
message:
कविं पुराणमनुशासितारमणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्यः सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूपम्
One should remember the Omniscient, ancient, ruler, subtler than the subtle, sustainer of all, of inconceivable form.
Us kavim, puran, niyamak, anor‑aniyan, sabka dhata, achintya swaroop ko yaad karo.

Sanskrit verse: प्रयाणकाले मनसाचल्येन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक्
Translation (English): At the time of departure, with mind unmoving in devotion, united with yoga power, fixing prana between the brows...
Hinglish (1): Ant samay me man atal bhakti me sthir, yog shakti se juda, prana ko bhru madhya me sthapit karo.
Hinglish (2): Mrityu ke samay, jo bhakti-yukta hokar aur yog-bal se, praano ko bhrukuti ke madhya mein sthit karke, achal mann se (Paramatma ka) smaran karta hai, woh us divya Purush ko hi prapt hota hai.
message:
प्रयाणकाले मनसाचल्येन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक्
At the time of departure, with mind unmoving in devotion, united with yoga power, fixing prana between the brows...
Ant samay me man atal bhakti me sthir, yog shakti se juda, prana ko bhru madhya me sthapit karo.
tags: Raja Yoga, เชงเซ�เชฏเชพเชจ, fear of death, Moksha

Sanskrit verse: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति...
Translation (English): The imperishable which the knowers of the Vedas speak of, into which enter the ascetics free from desire, seeking which they practice celibacy...
Hinglish (1): Wo akshar jo ved gyaani kehte hain, jisme vitaragi pravesh karte hain, jise paaane ko brahmacharya hota hai...
Hinglish (2): Ved ke gyata jise 'akshar' (avinashi) kehte hain, vairaagi sanyasi jismein pravesh karte hain, aur jiski ichha se log brahmacharya vrat ka paalan karte hain, us pad ko main tumhe sankshep mein batata hoon.
Summary: This verse sets up the meditative aim.
message:
यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति...
The imperishable which the knowers of the Vedas speak of, into which enter the ascetics free from desire, seeking which they practice celibacy...
Wo akshar jo ved gyaani kehte hain, jisme vitaragi pravesh karte hain, jise paaane ko brahmacharya hota hai...

Sanskrit verse: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च मूर्ध्न्याधायात्मनः प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम्
Translation (English): Closing all doors of the senses, fixing the mind in the heart, placing prana in the head, established in firm yoga...
Hinglish (1): Sab dvaar band karke, mann hriday me rakhkar, prana ko sir me sthapit karke yoga me sthir ho jao.
Hinglish (2): Sabhi indriya-dwaaron ko rokkar, mann ko hriday mein sthir karke, aur praano ko mastak mein sthapit karke, yog-dhaarana mein sthit ho.
message:
सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च मूर्ध्न्याधायात्मनः प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम्
Closing all doors of the senses, fixing the mind in the heart, placing prana in the head, established in firm yoga...
Sab dvaar band karke, mann hriday me rakhkar, prana ko sir me sthapit karke yoga me sthir ho jao.
tags: Raja Yoga, เชงเซ�เชฏเชพเชจ, Moksha, fear of death

Sanskrit verse: ॐ इत्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् यः प्रयाति त्यజन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम्
Translation (English): Uttering the single syllable **Om**, the Brahman, remembering Me—who departs thus leaves the body and attains the supreme goal.
Hinglish (1): Om ka ucharan karke, mujhe yaad karke, jo sharir chhodta hai vah param gati paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo 'Om' is ek-akshar Brahman ka uccharan karte hue aur mera smaran karte hue shareer ka tyag karta hai, woh param gati ko prapt hota hai.
Summary: Power of Om in final liberation.
message:
ॐ इत्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् यः प्रयाति त्यజन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम्
Uttering the single syllable **Om**, the Brahman, remembering Me—who departs thus leaves the body and attains the supreme goal.
Om ka ucharan karke, mujhe yaad karke, jo sharir chhodta hai vah param gati paata hai.
tags: Brahman, Moksha, fear of death, Raja Yoga

Sanskrit verse: अनन्यचेता सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः
Translation (English): O Partha, to the yogi who remembers Me always, without other thought, ever united, I am easily attainable.
Hinglish (1): Hey Parth, jo yogi hamesha mujhe yaad karta hai bina anya vichar ke, main use asaani se milta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, jo yogi ananya-chitt hokar hamesha mera smaran karta hai, us nitya-yukt yogi ke liye main sulabh hoon (aasani se prapt ho jaata hoon).
Summary: Assurance of accessibility to constant devotees.
message:
अनन्यचेता सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः
O Partha, to the yogi who remembers Me always, without other thought, ever united, I am easily attainable.
Hey Parth, jo yogi hamesha mujhe yaad karta hai bina anya vichar ke, main use asaani se milta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम् नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः
Translation (English): Great souls, having attained Me, do not take birth again in this place of sorrow, impermanent—they have reached ultimate perfection.
Hinglish (1): Mere milne ke baad mahatma is dukhmay, anitya jagat me punah janm nahi lete; ve param siddhi ko prapt hai.
Hinglish (2): Mujhe prapt karke, mahatma log is dukhon ke ghar, anitya sansaar mein punarjanm nahi lete, kyunki ve param siddhi ko prapt ho chuke hote hain.
message:
मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम् नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः
Great souls, having attained Me, do not take birth again in this place of sorrow, impermanent—they have reached ultimate perfection.
Mere milne ke baad mahatma is dukhmay, anitya jagat me punah janm nahi lete; ve param siddhi ko prapt hai.

Sanskrit verse: आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते
Translation (English): From the highest world of Brahma down, all worlds are subject to return; but reaching Me, O Kaunteya, there is no rebirth.
Hinglish (1): Brahma lok se bhi niche ke sab lok punah janm dete hain; mujhme milne par janm nahi hota.
Hinglish (2): Hey Arjun, Brahma-lok se lekar neeche ke sabhi lok punravarti (cycle of rebirth) waale hain. Parantu, hey Kunti-putra, mujhe prapt karke punarjanm nahi hota.
message:
आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते
From the highest world of Brahma down, all worlds are subject to return; but reaching Me, O Kaunteya, there is no rebirth.
Brahma lok se bhi niche ke sab lok punah janm dete hain; mujhme milne par janm nahi hota.

Sanskrit verse: सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद्ब्रह्मणो विदुः रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः
Translation (English): Those who know a day of Brahma lasts a thousand yugas, and his night also a thousand yugas, are the knowers of day and night.
Hinglish (1): Jo jaante hain ki Brahma ka din hazar yug ka hota hai aur raat bhi utni hi, ve hi sach  jaante hain.
Hinglish (2): Jo log Brahma ke ek din ko hazaar yug ki avadhi ka aur uski raat ko bhi hazaar yug ki avadhi ka jaante hain, ve hi vastav mein din aur raat ke tattva ko jaante hain.
message:
सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद्ब्रह्मणो विदुः रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः
Those who know a day of Brahma lasts a thousand yugas, and his night also a thousand yugas, are the knowers of day and night.
Jo jaante hain ki Brahma ka din hazar yug ka hota hai aur raat bhi utni hi, ve hi sach  jaante hain.

Sanskrit verse: अव्यक्ताद्व्यक्तयः सर्वाः प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसञ्ज्ञके
Translation (English): From the unmanifest, all manifest beings come forth at the arrival of day, and at night they dissolve back into the unmanifest.
Hinglish (1): Avyakt se sab vyakt jagat brahma ke din me banta hai, raat me avyakt me vilin ho jaata hai.
Hinglish (2): Brahma ka din aane par, sabhi praani avyakt se vyakt hote hain. Aur raat aane par, ve usi avyakt mein vilin ho jaate hain.
message:
अव्यक्ताद्व्यक्तयः सर्वाः प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसञ्ज्ञके
From the unmanifest, all manifest beings come forth at the arrival of day, and at night they dissolve back into the unmanifest.
Avyakt se sab vyakt jagat brahma ke din me banta hai, raat me avyakt me vilin ho jaata hai.

Sanskrit verse: भूतग्रामः स एवाहं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे
Translation (English): The same multitude of beings is born again and again, and helplessly dissolves at night, O Partha, and reappears in the day.
Hinglish (1): Wahi shrishti baar‑baar banti hai aur raat me vilin hoti hai; din me punah prakat hoti hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, wahi praani-samuday baar-baar utpann hokar, raat aane par vivash hokar vilin ho jaata hai, aur din aane par phir se utpann ho jaata hai.
message:
भूतग्रामः स एवाहं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे
The same multitude of beings is born again and again, and helplessly dissolves at night, O Partha, and reappears in the day.
Wahi shrishti baar‑baar banti hai aur raat me vilin hoti hai; din me punah prakat hoti hai.

Sanskrit verse: परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति
Translation (English): But beyond that unmanifest is yet another eternal unmanifest, which does not perish when all beings perish.
Hinglish (1): Is avyakt se pare ek aur sanatan avyakt hai, jo sab kuch nash hone par bhi nahi nash hota.
Hinglish (2): Parantu, us avyakt se bhi pare ek aur sanatan avyakt bhaav hai, jo sabhi praaniyon ke nasht hone par bhi nasht nahi hota.
message:
परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति
But beyond that unmanifest is yet another eternal unmanifest, which does not perish when all beings perish.
Is avyakt se pare ek aur sanatan avyakt hai, jo sab kuch nash hone par bhi nahi nash hota.

Sanskrit verse: अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम् यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम
Translation (English): That unmanifest is called the imperishable; attaining it, none returns—this is My supreme abode.
Hinglish (1): Woh avyakt akshar hai jo meri param gati hai; ise paa kar koi lautkar nahi aata.
Hinglish (2): Usi avyakt ko 'akshar' (avinashi) kaha gaya hai, aur usi ko param gati kaha gaya hai. Jise paakar koi wapas nahi laut'ta, wahi mera param dhaam hai.
message:
अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम् यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम
That unmanifest is called the imperishable; attaining it, none returns—this is My supreme abode.
Woh avyakt akshar hai jo meri param gati hai; ise paa kar koi lautkar nahi aata.

Sanskrit verse: पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया यस्यान्तःस्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम्
Translation (English): O Partha, that Supreme Person is attained by undivided devotion; all beings are within Him, and He pervades all.
Hinglish (1): Hey Parth, woh Param Purush ananya bhakti se milta hai; sab prani usme sthit hain, aur vah sabme vyaapt hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, woh Param Purush, jiske antargat sabhi praani hain aur jisse yeh saara sansaar vyaapt hai, ananya bhakti ke dwara hi prapt kiya ja sakta hai.
message:
पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया यस्यान्तःस्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम्
O Partha, that Supreme Person is attained by undivided devotion; all beings are within Him, and He pervades all.
Hey Parth, woh Param Purush ananya bhakti se milta hai; sab prani usme sthit hain, aur vah sabme vyaapt hai.

Sanskrit verse: यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ
Translation (English): O best of Bharatas, I shall tell you the time at which yogis departing do not return, and the time they return.
Hinglish (1): Hey Bharatshreshtha, main tumhe vo kaal bataunga jisme yogi lautkar nahi aate aur jis me aate hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat-shreshth, ab main tumhein woh kaal (samay) bataunga, jismein shareer tyag kar jaane waale yogi wapas laut'te hain ya nahi laut'te.
message:
यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ
O best of Bharatas, I shall tell you the time at which yogis departing do not return, and the time they return.
Hey Bharatshreshtha, main tumhe vo kaal bataunga jisme yogi lautkar nahi aate aur jis me aate hain.
tags: Moksha, reincarnation, Karma, fear of death

Sanskrit verse: अग्निर्ज्योतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मवितो जनाः
Translation (English): Fire, light, daytime, bright fortnight, six months of the northern course—departing then, knowers of Brahman go to Brahman.
Hinglish (1): Aag, prakash, din, shukla paksh, uttarayan ke chhe mahine—isse jaane wale brahmavedi brahma ko paate hain.
Hinglish (2): Agni, jyoti, din ka shukla-paksh, aur uttarayan ke chhah mahine - inmein shareer tyag kar jaane waale Brahma-gyaani log Brahman ko prapt hote hain.
message:
अग्निर्ज्योतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मवितो जनाः
Fire, light, daytime, bright fortnight, six months of the northern course—departing then, knowers of Brahman go to Brahman.
Aag, prakash, din, shukla paksh, uttarayan ke chhe mahine—isse jaane wale brahmavedi brahma ko paate hain.

Sanskrit verse: धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते
Translation (English): Smoke, night, dark fortnight, six months of the southern course—yogi going then attain lunar light and return.
Hinglish (1): Dhuaan, raat, krishna paksh, dakshinayan ke chhe mahine—isse jaane wale yogi chandralok jaake laut aate hain.
Hinglish (2): Dhuan, raat, krishna-paksh, aur dakshinayan ke chhah mahine - inmein shareer tyag kar jaane waala yogi chandrama ki jyoti ko prapt hokar (swarg-bhog ke baad) wapas laut aata hai.
message:
धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते
Smoke, night, dark fortnight, six months of the southern course—yogi going then attain lunar light and return.
Dhuaan, raat, krishna paksh, dakshinayan ke chhe mahine—isse jaane wale yogi chandralok jaake laut aate hain.

Sanskrit verse: शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मत्तः एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः
Translation (English): These bright and dark paths, eternal in the world, come from Me; one leads to non‑return, the other returns again.
Hinglish (1): Yeh shukla‑krishna gati mere se hi hai; ek se janm nahi hota, doosre se hota hai.
Hinglish (2): Yeh do maarg - shukla (prakaash) aur krishna (andhkaar) - jagat mein sanatan maane gaye hain. Ek se jaane par punarjanm nahi hota, jabki doosre se wapas aana padta hai.
Summary: Krishna as source of both paths.
message:
शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मत्तः एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः
These bright and dark paths, eternal in the world, come from Me; one leads to non‑return, the other returns again.
Yeh shukla‑krishna gati mere se hi hai; ek se janm nahi hota, doosre se hota hai.

Sanskrit verse: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्यन तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन
Translation (English): Knowing these paths, O Partha, no yogi is deluded; therefore, be steadfast in yoga at all times.
Hinglish (1): In margo ko jaankar yogi bhramit nahi hota; isliye hamesha yog me sthir raho.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, in dono maargo ko jaankar koi bhi yogi mohit nahi hota. Isliye, hey Arjun, tum har samay yog-yukt raho.
message:
नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्यन तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन
Knowing these paths, O Partha, no yogi is deluded; therefore, be steadfast in yoga at all times.
In margo ko jaankar yogi bhramit nahi hota; isliye hamesha yog me sthir raho.

Sanskrit verse: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम्
Translation (English): Knowing this, the yogi transcends the merit from Vedas, sacrifices, austerities, and gifts, and attains the supreme primal place.
Hinglish (1): Is gyaan se yogi ved, yagya, tap, daan se milne wale sab punya se pare hokar param sthan paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Is tattva ko jaankar yogi, Vedon, yajyon, tapon aur daanon se milne waale sabhi punya-phalon se upar uth jaata hai aur param aadi-sthan (supreme abode) ko prapt karta hai.
message:
वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम्
Knowing this, the yogi transcends the merit from Vedas, sacrifices, austerities, and gifts, and attains the supreme primal place.
Is gyaan se yogi ved, yagya, tap, daan se milne wale sab punya se pare hokar param sthan paata hai.
tags: Moksha, Karma, Bhakti Yoga, Jnana Yoga

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात्
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: To you, who are without envy, I shall declare this most secret knowledge, combined with realization, knowing which you will be freed from evil.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Hey Arjun, tum nirvaira ho, isliye main tumhe sabse gupt gyaan aur vijnan bataunga; ise jaankar tum ashubh se mukt ho jaoge.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Kyunki tum dvesh-rahit ho, main tumhein yeh sabse gupt gyaan vigyaan (realization) sahit bataunga, jise jaankar tum is sansaar ke dukhon se mukt ho jaoge.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात्
The Blessed Lord said: To you, who are without envy, I shall declare this most secret knowledge, combined with realization, knowing which you will be freed from evil.
Shri Krishna bole: Hey Arjun, tum nirvaira ho, isliye main tumhe sabse gupt gyaan aur vijnan bataunga; ise jaankar tum ashubh se mukt ho jaoge.

Sanskrit verse: राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुखं कर्तुमव्ययम्
Translation (English): This is the king of knowledge, king of secrets, supremely purifying, directly realizable, in accordance with dharma, joyfully performed, and imperishable.
Hinglish (1): Yeh gyaan gyaan ka raja, rahasya ka raja, pavitra, dharm-yukt, anant aur pratyaksh anubhav hai.
Hinglish (2): Yeh gyaan sabhi vidyaon ka raja hai, sabhi rahasyon ka raja hai, atyant pavitra hai, iska anubhav pratyaksh hota hai, yeh dharm-yukt, avinashi aur karne mein bahut sugam hai.
Summary: Declares the greatness of this teaching.
message:
राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुखं कर्तुमव्ययम्
This is the king of knowledge, king of secrets, supremely purifying, directly realizable, in accordance with dharma, joyfully performed, and imperishable.
Yeh gyaan gyaan ka raja, rahasya ka raja, pavitra, dharm-yukt, anant aur pratyaksh anubhav hai.

Sanskrit verse: अश्रद्धधानाः पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि
Translation (English): Men without faith in this dharma, O Parantapa, do not attain Me and return to the cycle of death and rebirth.
Hinglish (1): Hey Arjun, jo is dharm me shraddha nahi rakhte, ve mujhe paate nahi aur mrityu ke chakra me laut jaate hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey shatru-vijeta, jo log is dharm par shraddha nahi rakhte, ve mujhe prapt na karke is mrityu-roopi sansaar ke maarg par wapas laut aate hain.
message:
अश्रद्धधानाः पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि
Men without faith in this dharma, O Parantapa, do not attain Me and return to the cycle of death and rebirth.
Hey Arjun, jo is dharm me shraddha nahi rakhte, ve mujhe paate nahi aur mrityu ke chakra me laut jaate hain.
tags: doubting mind, fear of failure, reincarnation

Sanskrit verse: मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः
Translation (English): By Me, in My unmanifest form, all this universe is pervaded; beings are in Me, yet I am not in them.
Hinglish (1): Main apne avyakt roop me poore jagat me vyaapt hoon; sab mujhme hain, par main unme sthit nahi.
Hinglish (2): Main apne adrishya swaroop se is sampoorn jagat mein vyaapt hoon. Sabhi praani mujhme sthit hain, parantu main unmein sthit nahi hoon.
message:
मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः
By Me, in My unmanifest form, all this universe is pervaded; beings are in Me, yet I am not in them.
Main apne avyakt roop me poore jagat me vyaapt hoon; sab mujhme hain, par main unme sthit nahi.

Sanskrit verse: न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः
Translation (English): Nor do beings dwell in Me—behold My divine yoga! Sustaining beings and yet not dwelling in them, My Self is the source of beings.
Hinglish (1): Sab mere mein nahi—yeh meri aishwarya maya dekho! Main sabko rakhta hoon par unme sthit nahi.
Hinglish (2): Aur phir bhi, sabhi praani mujhme sthit nahi hain - yeh mera aishwarya-yog dekho! Main sabhi praaniyon ka paalan-poshan karne waala aur unhe utpann karne waala hokar bhi, unmein sthit nahi hoon.
message:
न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः
Nor do beings dwell in Me—behold My divine yoga! Sustaining beings and yet not dwelling in them, My Self is the source of beings.
Sab mere mein nahi—yeh meri aishwarya maya dekho! Main sabko rakhta hoon par unme sthit nahi.

Sanskrit verse: यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान् तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय
Translation (English): As the mighty wind, always moving, rests in space, so do all beings rest in Me.
Hinglish (1): Jaise vayu aakash me sthit rehkar chalti hai, waise hi sab prani mujhme sthit hain.
Hinglish (2): Jaise har jagah vicharne waali mahaan vayu hamesha aakash mein hi sthit rehti hai, usi prakaar yeh samjho ki sabhi praani mujhme hi sthit hain.
message:
यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान् तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय
As the mighty wind, always moving, rests in space, so do all beings rest in Me.
Jaise vayu aakash me sthit rehkar chalti hai, waise hi sab prani mujhme sthit hain.

Sanskrit verse: सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम्
Translation (English): All beings, O Kaunteya, enter My nature at the end of a kalpa; I send them forth again at the beginning of a kalpa.
Hinglish (1): Kalp ke ant me sab mere prakriti me vilin hote hain, shuru me main unhe phir rachta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kunti-putra, kalp ke ant mein sabhi praani meri prakriti mein vilin ho jaate hain, aur agle kalp ke aarambh mein main unhe phir se rachta hoon.
message:
सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम्
All beings, O Kaunteya, enter My nature at the end of a kalpa; I send them forth again at the beginning of a kalpa.
Kalp ke ant me sab mere prakriti me vilin hote hain, shuru me main unhe phir rachta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात्
Translation (English): Controlling My nature, I send forth again and again all this multitude of beings, helpless under nature’s rule.
Hinglish (1): Main apni prakriti se baar‑baar sab praniyon ki srishti karta hoon; ve prakriti ke adheen hain.
Hinglish (2): Apni bhautik prakriti ko adheen karke, main is praani-samuday ko, jo prakriti ke vash mein hone ke kaaran vivash hai, baar-baar rachta hoon.
message:
प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात्
Controlling My nature, I send forth again and again all this multitude of beings, helpless under nature’s rule.
Main apni prakriti se baar‑baar sab praniyon ki srishti karta hoon; ve prakriti ke adheen hain.

Sanskrit verse: न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु
Translation (English): These acts do not bind Me, O Dhananjaya, as I stand apart, unattached to those acts.
Hinglish (1): Hey Dhananjaya, yeh karm mujhe nahi bandh sakte; main udasin aur asakta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Dhananjaya, yeh karm mujhe nahi baandhte, kyunki main un karmon mein attachment-rahit aur udaseen ki tarah sthit rehta hoon.
message:
न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु
These acts do not bind Me, O Dhananjaya, as I stand apart, unattached to those acts.
Hey Dhananjaya, yeh karm mujhe nahi bandh sakte; main udasin aur asakta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: मयाऽध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम् हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते
Translation (English): Under My supervision, prakriti produces all moving and unmoving things; through this, O Kaunteya, the world revolves.
Hinglish (1): Mere adhyakshata me prakriti sab jagat banati hai; isi se sansaar chalta hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kunti-putra, meri adhyakshata mein prakriti char-achar sahit saare jagat ko rachti hai, aur isi kaaran se yeh sansaar chakra chalta rehta hai.
message:
मयाऽध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम् हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते
Under My supervision, prakriti produces all moving and unmoving things; through this, O Kaunteya, the world revolves.
Mere adhyakshata me prakriti sab jagat banati hai; isi se sansaar chalta hai.

Sanskrit verse: अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम्
Translation (English): Fools deride Me when I descend in human form, not knowing My higher nature as Lord of beings.
Hinglish (1): Moorakh mujhe manushya sharir me dekhkar avhelna karte hain, meri param prakriti ko nahi jaante.
Hinglish (2): Jab main manushya roop mein avtarit hota hoon, toh moorkh log mera upahas karte hain. Ve mere us param bhaav ko nahi jaante ki main sabhi praaniyon ka mahaan Ishwar hoon.
message:
अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम्
Fools deride Me when I descend in human form, not knowing My higher nature as Lord of beings.
Moorakh mujhe manushya sharir me dekhkar avhelna karte hain, meri param prakriti ko nahi jaante.

Sanskrit verse: मोगाशा मोगकर्माणो मोगज्ञाना विचेतसः राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः
Translation (English): Of vain hopes, actions, and knowledge, void of discrimination, they take refuge in delusive, demonic nature.
Hinglish (1): Jinke aasha, karm aur gyaan vyarth hain, ve mohkari asuri prakriti me sharan lete hain.
Hinglish (2): Jinki aashayein vyarth hain, jinke karm vyarth hain, aur jinka gyaan vyarth hai, ve vivek-heen log mohit karne waali aasuri aur raakshasi prakriti ka aashray lete hain.
message:
मोगाशा मोगकर्माणो मोगज्ञाना विचेतसः राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः
Of vain hopes, actions, and knowledge, void of discrimination, they take refuge in delusive, demonic nature.
Jinke aasha, karm aur gyaan vyarth hain, ve mohkari asuri prakriti me sharan lete hain.

Sanskrit verse: महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम्
Translation (English): But the great souls, O Partha, taking refuge in divine nature, worship Me with single mind, knowing Me as the imperishable source of beings.
Hinglish (1): Mahatma, jo daivi prakriti me sthit hote hain, mujhme ekagrata se bhakti karte hain, mujhe avyay aur sab kaadi jaante hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, parantu jo mahatma hain, ve daivi prakriti ka aashray lekar, mujhe sabhi praaniyon ka aadi aur avinashi srot jaankar, ananya-mann se meri bhakti karte hain.
message:
महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम्
But the great souls, O Partha, taking refuge in divine nature, worship Me with single mind, knowing Me as the imperishable source of beings.
Mahatma, jo daivi prakriti me sthit hote hain, mujhme ekagrata se bhakti karte hain, mujhe avyay aur sab kaadi jaante hain.

Sanskrit verse: सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते
Translation (English): Always chanting My glories, striving with firm vows, bowing to Me, ever‑steadfast, they worship Me with devotion.
Hinglish (1): Ve hamesha mera kirtan karte, dridh sankalp se mehnat karte, mujhe pranam karte, aur bhakti se upasana karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Ve dridh nishchay ke saath hamesha mera kirtan karte hain, prayaas karte hain, mujhe pranam karte hain, aur nitya-yukt hokar prem-poorvak meri upasana karte hain.
message:
सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते
Always chanting My glories, striving with firm vows, bowing to Me, ever‑steadfast, they worship Me with devotion.
Ve hamesha mera kirtan karte, dridh sankalp se mehnat karte, mujhe pranam karte, aur bhakti se upasana karte hain.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, Raja Yoga, เชงเซ�เชฏเชพเชจ

Sanskrit verse: ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम्
Translation (English): Others, performing the sacrifice of knowledge, worship Me as One, as distinct, and in various forms, facing in all directions.
Hinglish (1): Anya log gyaan yajya karke mujhe ek roop, alag roop, aur anek roop se poojte hain.
Hinglish (2): Doosre log gyaan-yajna ke dwara upasana karte hue, mujhe ek-roop mein, alag-alag roopon mein, aur vishwa-roop mein poojte hain.
Summary: Varieties of worship all directed to Krishna.
message:
ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम्
Others, performing the sacrifice of knowledge, worship Me as One, as distinct, and in various forms, facing in all directions.
Anya log gyaan yajya karke mujhe ek roop, alag roop, aur anek roop se poojte hain.

Sanskrit verse: अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाऽहमहमौषधम् मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम्
Translation (English): I am the ritual, the sacrifice, the offering to ancestors, the healing herb, the mantra, the ghee, the fire, and the offering.
Hinglish (1): Main hi yagya, havan, swadha, aushadhi, mantra, ghee, agni, aur ahuti hoon.
Hinglish (2): Main hi kratu (vaidik yajna) hoon, main hi yajna hoon, main hi swadha (pitaron ko arpan) hoon, main hi aushadhi hoon, main hi mantra hoon, main hi ghee hoon, main hi agni hoon aur main hi havan ki kriya hoon.
Summary: Krishna as essence of all rites.
message:
अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाऽहमहमौषधम् मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम्
I am the ritual, the sacrifice, the offering to ancestors, the healing herb, the mantra, the ghee, the fire, and the offering.
Main hi yagya, havan, swadha, aushadhi, mantra, ghee, agni, aur ahuti hoon.

Sanskrit verse: पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः वेद्यं पवित्रम oṃkāra ऋक् साम यजुरेव च
Translation (English): I am the father of this world, mother, supporter, grandsire; the object of knowledge, purifier, the syllable **Om**, and also the Rig, Sama, and Yajur Vedas.
Hinglish (1): Main is jagat ka pita, mata, dhata, pitamah, vedya vastu, pavitra, Om, aur Rig‑Sama‑Yajur ved hoon.
Hinglish (2): Main is jagat ka pita, maata, dhaarak aur pitamah (grandfather) hoon. Main jaanne yogy pavitra vastu, 'Om' akshar, aur Rigveda, Samaveda, Yajurveda bhi main hi hoon.
message:
पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः वेद्यं पवित्रम oṃkāra ऋक् साम यजुरेव च
I am the father of this world, mother, supporter, grandsire; the object of knowledge, purifier, the syllable **Om**, and also the Rig, Sama, and Yajur Vedas.
Main is jagat ka pita, mata, dhata, pitamah, vedya vastu, pavitra, Om, aur Rig‑Sama‑Yajur ved hoon.

Sanskrit verse: गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत् प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम्
Translation (English): I am the goal, sustainer, Lord, witness, abode, refuge, friend, origin, dissolution, foundation, and the imperishable seed.
Hinglish (1): Main gati, bharata, prabhu, sakshi, nivaas, sharan, suhrid, aarambh, ant, aadhar, aur avyay beej hoon.
Hinglish (2): Main hi sabki gati, paalan-karta, prabhu, saakshi, nivaas-sthan, sharan-sthal aur sabse priya mitra hoon. Main hi utpatti, pralay, aadhaar, nidhaan (treasure) aur avinashi beej hoon.
Summary: Krishna as the ultimate support of all.
message:
गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत् प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम्
I am the goal, sustainer, Lord, witness, abode, refuge, friend, origin, dissolution, foundation, and the imperishable seed.
Main gati, bharata, prabhu, sakshi, nivaas, sharan, suhrid, aarambh, ant, aadhar, aur avyay beej hoon.

Sanskrit verse: तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सत् असच्चाहमर्जुन
