Translation (English): I give heat, send and withhold rain; I am immortality and death, being and non‑being, O Arjuna.
Hinglish (1): Main garmi deta hoon, varsha lata hoon, rokta hoon; main amrit aur mrityu, sat aur asat hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Arjun, main hi garmi paida karta hoon, main hi varsha ko rokta aur barsata hoon. Main hi amrit hoon aur main hi mrityu hoon. Sat (spirit) aur asat (matter) bhi main hi hoon.
Summary: God as controller of nature and fate.
message:
तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सत् असच्चाहमर्जुन
I give heat, send and withhold rain; I am immortality and death, being and non‑being, O Arjuna.
Main garmi deta hoon, varsha lata hoon, rokta hoon; main amrit aur mrityu, sat aur asat hoon.

Sanskrit verse: त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोकमश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान्
Translation (English): Those versed in the three Vedas, drinkers of soma, purified of sin, worship Me through sacrifice, and seek heaven; attaining Indra’s world, they enjoy divine pleasures there.
Hinglish (1): Tin Vedo ka gyaan rakhne wale, somras peene wale, yagya karke swarg ki iccha rakhte hain; ve Indralok me dev sukh anubhav karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Jo teen vedon ko janne waale, somras peene waale, aur paapon se shuddh hokar, yajyon se meri pooja karke swarg ki prapti chahte hain, ve punya-phal-roop Indralok jaakar devtaon ke divya bhogon ko bhogte hain.
message:
त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोकमश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान्
Those versed in the three Vedas, drinkers of soma, purified of sin, worship Me through sacrifice, and seek heaven; attaining Indra’s world, they enjoy divine pleasures there.
Tin Vedo ka gyaan rakhne wale, somras peene wale, yagya karke swarg ki iccha rakhte hain; ve Indralok me dev sukh anubhav karte hain.
tags: Karma, reincarnation, letting go of greed

Sanskrit verse: ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति एवाद्री धर्मम अनुवर्तयन्तः कामकामः लभन्ते
Translation (English): After enjoying that vast heavenly world, when their merit is exhausted, they return to the mortal world; following Vedic rites, desiring pleasure, they attain going and return.
Hinglish (1): Swarg ka sukh karke, punya khatam hone par, martyalok laut aate hain; vedic karm karke sukh icchu hota hai.
Hinglish (2): Ve us vishaal swarglok ko bhogkar, punya ksheen hone par mrityu-lok mein wapas aa jaate hain. Is prakaar, vedon ke dharm ka paalan karte hue, bhog-kaamnaon se yukt log aane-jaane ke chakra mein fans jaate hain.
message:
ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति एवाद्री धर्मम अनुवर्तयन्तः कामकामः लभन्ते
After enjoying that vast heavenly world, when their merit is exhausted, they return to the mortal world; following Vedic rites, desiring pleasure, they attain going and return.
Swarg ka sukh karke, punya khatam hone par, martyalok laut aate hain; vedic karm karke sukh icchu hota hai.

Sanskrit verse: अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम्
Translation (English): Those who, thinking of Me alone, worship Me, ever steadfast, I carry what they lack and preserve what they have.
Hinglish (1): Jo log sirf mujhe sochkar bhakti karte hain, unka yogakshem main sambhalta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Jo log ananya-bhaav se kewal mera hi chintan karte hue meri upasana karte hain, un nitya-yukt bhakton ki zarooraton (yog) aur raksha (kshem) ka bhaar main swayam uthata hoon.
message:
अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम्
Those who, thinking of Me alone, worship Me, ever steadfast, I carry what they lack and preserve what they have.
Jo log sirf mujhe sochkar bhakti karte hain, unka yogakshem main sambhalta hoon.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, Moksha, inner peace, how to stop worrying

Sanskrit verse: येऽप्यन्यदेवताभक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम्
Translation (English): Even those who are devotees of other gods, worshiping with faith, actually worship Me, though not in the right way, O Kaunteya.
Hinglish (1): Jo anya devtaon ki bhakti karte hain, ve bhi mujhe hi poojte hain, par sahi vidhi se nahi.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kunti-putra, jo bhakt shraddha-poorvak anya devtaon ki pooja karte hain, ve bhi vastav mein avidhi-poorvak (indirectly) meri hi pooja karte hain.
message:
येऽप्यन्यदेवताभक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम्
Even those who are devotees of other gods, worshiping with faith, actually worship Me, though not in the right way, O Kaunteya.
Jo anya devtaon ki bhakti karte hain, ve bhi mujhe hi poojte hain, par sahi vidhi se nahi.

Sanskrit verse: अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते
Translation (English): I am the enjoyer and Lord of all sacrifices; those who do not know Me in truth fall back.
Hinglish (1): Main sab yagyoon ka bhokta aur prabhu hoon; jo mujhe nahi jaante, wo moolya kho dete hain.
Hinglish (2): Kyunki main hi sabhi yajyon ka bhokta aur swami hoon. Parantu, ve mujhe mere tattva-roop mein nahi jaante, isliye unka patan ho jaata hai.
Summary: Lack of true understanding causes downfall.
message:
अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते
I am the enjoyer and Lord of all sacrifices; those who do not know Me in truth fall back.
Main sab yagyoon ka bhokta aur prabhu hoon; jo mujhe nahi jaante, wo moolya kho dete hain.

Sanskrit verse: यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄन्यान्ति पितृव्रताः भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि
Translation (English): Those who worship gods go to gods; who worship ancestors go to ancestors; worshipers of spirits go to spirits; My devotees come to Me.
Hinglish (1): Dev pujak dev me, pitru pujak pitro me, bhut pujak bhuto me, aur mere bhakt mujhme aate hain.
Hinglish (2): Devtaon ko poojne waale devlok jaate hain, pitaron ko poojne waale pitralok jaate hain, bhoot-preton ko poojne waale unke lok jaate hain, aur mere bhakt mujhe hi prapt hote hain.
Summary: Destination follows the nature of worship.
message:
यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄन्यान्ति पितृव्रताः भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि
Those who worship gods go to gods; who worship ancestors go to ancestors; worshipers of spirits go to spirits; My devotees come to Me.
Dev pujak dev me, pitru pujak pitro me, bhut pujak bhuto me, aur mere bhakt mujhme aate hain.

Sanskrit verse: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः
Translation (English): Whoever offers Me a leaf, flower, fruit, or water with devotion, I accept that offered by the pure-minded.
Hinglish (1): Jo mujhe patra, pushp, phal, ya jal bhakti se deta hai, main use shuddh hriday se swikarta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Jo koi bhi mujhe prem se ek patta, ek phool, ek phal ya thoda jal bhi arpit karta hai, main us shuddh-chitt bhakt dwara prem se diye gaye bhent ko sweekar karta hoon.
Summary: Simple offerings with devotion are accepted.
message:
पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः
Whoever offers Me a leaf, flower, fruit, or water with devotion, I accept that offered by the pure-minded.
Jo mujhe patra, pushp, phal, ya jal bhakti se deta hai, main use shuddh hriday se swikarta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम्
Translation (English): Whatever you do, eat, offer, give, or perform as austerity—do that as an offering to Me, O Kaunteya.
Hinglish (1): Jo bhi tum karte, khate, dete, tap karte ho, use mera arpan karo.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kunti-putra, tum jo bhi karte ho, jo bhi khate ho, jo bhi havan karte ho, jo bhi daan dete ho, aur jo bhi tap karte ho, woh sab mujhe arpit karte hue karo.
message:
यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम्
Whatever you do, eat, offer, give, or perform as austerity—do that as an offering to Me, O Kaunteya.
Jo bhi tum karte, khate, dete, tap karte ho, use mera arpan karo.
tags: Nishkama Karma (selfless action), Karma Yoga, Bhakti Yoga

Sanskrit verse: शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि
Translation (English): In this way you will be freed from bondage of good and evil results; with the mind in renunciation‑yoga, liberated, you will come to Me.
Hinglish (1): Is prakaar tum karm ke phal ke bandhan se mukt ho jaoge; sannyas yog se mujhme aaoge.
Hinglish (2): Is prakaar, tum sannyas-yog mein sthit-chitt hokar, shubh aur ashubh phalon-roopi karm-bandhan se mukt ho jaoge aur mukt hokar mujhe hi prapt karoge.
message:
शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि
In this way you will be freed from bondage of good and evil results; with the mind in renunciation‑yoga, liberated, you will come to Me.
Is prakaar tum karm ke phal ke bandhan se mukt ho jaoge; sannyas yog se mujhme aaoge.

Sanskrit verse: समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम्
Translation (English): I am equal to all beings, neither hating nor favoring; but those who worship Me are in Me and I am in them.
Hinglish (1): Main sabke liye samaan hoon; par jo mujhme bhakti karte hain, main unme hoon, ve mujhme.
Hinglish (2): Main sabhi praaniyon ke liye samaan hoon. Na toh koi mujhe apriya hai aur na hi priya. Parantu, jo prem-poorvak meri bhakti karte hain, ve mujhme hain aur main unmein hoon.
message:
समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम्
I am equal to all beings, neither hating nor favoring; but those who worship Me are in Me and I am in them.
Main sabke liye samaan hoon; par jo mujhme bhakti karte hain, main unme hoon, ve mujhme.

Sanskrit verse: अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः
Translation (English): Even if a very ill‑conducted man worships Me exclusively, he is to be considered righteous, for he has rightly resolved.
Hinglish (1): Jo bahut durachari hote huye bhi mujhme bhakti karta hai, use sadhu maan lo—uska sankalp sahi hai.
Hinglish (2): Yadi koi atyant duraachari vyakti bhi ananya-bhaav se meri bhakti karta hai, toh use saadhu hi maanna chahiye, kyunki woh apne nishchay mein sthir hai.
message:
अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः
Even if a very ill‑conducted man worships Me exclusively, he is to be considered righteous, for he has rightly resolved.
Jo bahut durachari hote huye bhi mujhme bhakti karta hai, use sadhu maan lo—uska sankalp sahi hai.

Sanskrit verse: क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति कौन्तेय प्रति जानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति
Translation (English): Quickly he becomes righteous and attains lasting peace; know for certain, O Kaunteya, My devotee never perishes.
Hinglish (1): Woh jaldi dharmatma banta hai aur shanti paata hai; mera bhakt kabhi naasht nahi hota.
Hinglish (2): Woh jald hi dharmatma ban jaata hai aur shashvat shaanti ko prapt karta hai. Hey Kunti-putra, nishchit roop se jaano ki mere bhakt ka kabhi vinaash nahi hota.
message:
क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति कौन्तेय प्रति जानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति
Quickly he becomes righteous and attains lasting peace; know for certain, O Kaunteya, My devotee never perishes.
Woh jaldi dharmatma banta hai aur shanti paata hai; mera bhakt kabhi naasht nahi hota.
tags: Dharma, inner peace, Bhakti Yoga, Moksha

Sanskrit verse: मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम्
Translation (English): For taking refuge in Me, even those of sinful birth—women, vaisyas, and sudras—also attain the supreme goal.
Hinglish (1): Mere sharan lene par, stri, vaishya, shudra bhi param gati paate hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, jo bhi meri sharan leta hai, bhale hi woh paap-yoni ke, striyan, vaishya ya shudra kyu na ho, ve bhi param gati ko prapt karte hain.
message:
मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम्
For taking refuge in Me, even those of sinful birth—women, vaisyas, and sudras—also attain the supreme goal.
Mere sharan lene par, stri, vaishya, shudra bhi param gati paate hain.

Sanskrit verse: किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम्
Translation (English): How much more easily then the righteous brahmanas, devotees, and royal sages; having attained this impermanent, unhappy world, worship Me.
Hinglish (1): Punyee brahman, bhakt, rajrishi to aur bhi asaani se mujhe paate hain; is asukhmay jagat me mujhe bhajo.
Hinglish (2): Toh phir punya-karmi Brahmanon, bhakton aur rajarshiyon ki toh baat hi kya hai. Isliye, is anitya aur asukhi sansaar mein aakar, tum meri hi bhakti karo.
message:
किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम्
How much more easily then the righteous brahmanas, devotees, and royal sages; having attained this impermanent, unhappy world, worship Me.
Punyee brahman, bhakt, rajrishi to aur bhi asaani se mujhe paate hain; is asukhmay jagat me mujhe bhajo.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, Dharma, what is the purpose of life

Sanskrit verse: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु मामेवैष्यसि युक्तैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः
Translation (English): Think of Me, be devoted to Me, sacrifice to Me, bow to Me—thus united with Me, making Me your supreme goal, you will come to Me.
Hinglish (1): Mujhe socho, mere bhakt bano, mujhme yagya karo, mujhe pranam karo; mujhme judkar mujhme aao.
Hinglish (2): Hamesha apne mann ko mujhme lagao, mere bhakt bano, meri pooja karo, aur mujhe pranam karo. Is prakaar, aatma ko mujhme sthit karke, mujhe hi param lakshya maankar, tum mujhe hi prapt karoge.
message:
मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु मामेवैष्यसि युक्तैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः
Think of Me, be devoted to Me, sacrifice to Me, bow to Me—thus united with Me, making Me your supreme goal, you will come to Me.
Mujhe socho, mere bhakt bano, mujhme yagya karo, mujhe pranam karo; mujhme judkar mujhme aao.

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: Again, O mighty-armed, hear My supreme word, which I shall speak for your good, as you are dear to Me.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Hey Mahabaahu, tum mere priya ho, isliye tumhara kalyan chahte hue main tumhe apna param vachan sunaunga.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Hey Mahabahu, aage suno. Tum mere priya ho, isliye tumhare hit ki kaamna se main tumhe apne param vachan phir se kahunga.
Summary: Krishna begins revealing His divine opulences.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया
The Blessed Lord said: Again, O mighty-armed, hear My supreme word, which I shall speak for your good, as you are dear to Me.
Shri Krishna bole: Hey Mahabaahu, tum mere priya ho, isliye tumhara kalyan chahte hue main tumhe apna param vachan sunaunga.

Sanskrit verse: न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः
Translation (English): Neither the hosts of gods nor the great sages know My origin, for I am the source of the gods and sages in every way.
Hinglish (1): Devta aur maharishi mere utpatti ko nahi jaante, kyun ki main unka bhi aadi hoon.
Hinglish (2): Na toh devtaon ke samooh aur na hi maharshi meri utpatti (origin) ko jaante hain, kyunki main hi sab prakaar se devtaon aur maharshiyon ka bhi aadi (source) hoon.
message:
न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः
Neither the hosts of gods nor the great sages know My origin, for I am the source of the gods and sages in every way.
Devta aur maharishi mere utpatti ko nahi jaante, kyun ki main unka bhi aadi hoon.

Sanskrit verse: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् असम्मूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते
Translation (English): He who knows Me as unborn, without beginning, and the Lord of worlds, is undeluded and freed from all sins among mortals.
Hinglish (1): Jo mujhe ajanma, anaadi, aur jagat ka ishwara jaanta hai, vo mohmukt hokar sab paapon se mukt hota hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo manushya mujhe ajanma, anadi aur sabhi lokon ka mahaan Ishwar jaanta hai, woh moh-rahit hokar sabhi paapon se mukt ho jaata hai.
Summary: Knowledge of God’s nature brings liberation.
message:
यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् असम्मूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते
He who knows Me as unborn, without beginning, and the Lord of worlds, is undeluded and freed from all sins among mortals.
Jo mujhe ajanma, anaadi, aur jagat ka ishwara jaanta hai, vo mohmukt hokar sab paapon se mukt hota hai.

Sanskrit verse: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च
Translation (English): Intelligence, knowledge, freedom from delusion, forgiveness, truthfulness, control of the senses, tranquility, happiness, distress, birth, death, fear, and fearlessness...
Hinglish (1): Buddhi, gyaan, mohmukti, kshama, satya, dam, shanti, sukh, dukh, janm, mrityu, bhay, nirbhayta...
Hinglish (2): Buddhi, gyaan, moh-rahit hona, kshama, satya, indriya-sanyam, mann-sanyam, sukh, dukh, utpatti, abhaav, bhay aur abhay...
message:
बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च
Intelligence, knowledge, freedom from delusion, forgiveness, truthfulness, control of the senses, tranquility, happiness, distress, birth, death, fear, and fearlessness...
Buddhi, gyaan, mohmukti, kshama, satya, dam, shanti, sukh, dukh, janm, mrityu, bhay, nirbhayta...

Sanskrit verse: अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः
Translation (English): Nonviolence, equanimity, satisfaction, austerity, charity, fame and infamy—all these diverse states of beings arise from Me alone.
Hinglish (1): Ahimsa, samta, tripti, tap, daan, yasha, ayash sab mere se hi utpann hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Ahimsa, samata (equanimity), santosh, tap, daan, yash aur apayash - praaniyon ke yeh alag-alag prakaar ke bhaav mujhse hi utpann hote hain.
Summary: Krishna as the source of virtues and states.
message:
अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः
Nonviolence, equanimity, satisfaction, austerity, charity, fame and infamy—all these diverse states of beings arise from Me alone.
Ahimsa, samta, tripti, tap, daan, yasha, ayash sab mere se hi utpann hote hain.

Sanskrit verse: महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः
Translation (English): The seven great sages and the four Manus of old, whose descendants populate this world, were born of My mind.
Hinglish (1): Saat maharishi aur chaar purva manu mere man se utpann hue, jinse sab log aaye.
Hinglish (2): Saat maharshi, unse bhi pehle ke chaar (Sanak aadi), aur sabhi Manu - yeh sab mere mann se utpann hue hain, aur inhi se sansaar ki saari praja utpann hui hai.
message:
महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः
The seven great sages and the four Manus of old, whose descendants populate this world, were born of My mind.
Saat maharishi aur chaar purva manu mere man se utpann hue, jinse sab log aaye.

Sanskrit verse: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः
Translation (English): He who knows truly this glory and yoga of Mine is united in unwavering yoga—there is no doubt.
Hinglish (1): Jo meri vibhooti aur yog ko sach me jaanta hai, vo avikamp yog me lagta hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo manushya meri is vibhuti (opulence) aur yog-shakti ko tattva se jaanta hai, woh avichal bhakti-yog se yukt ho jaata hai, ismein koi sandeh nahi hai.
Summary: Knowledge of divine glories strengthens devotion.
message:
एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः
He who knows truly this glory and yoga of Mine is united in unwavering yoga—there is no doubt.
Jo meri vibhooti aur yog ko sach me jaanta hai, vo avikamp yog me lagta hai.

Sanskrit verse: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः
Translation (English): I am the source of all; from Me everything proceeds. The wise, knowing this, worship Me with devotion.
Hinglish (1): Main sabka prabhav hoon, mujhse sab chalta hai; gyaani yeh jaankar mujhme bhakti karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Main hi sabki utpatti ka kaaran hoon, aur sab kuch mujhse hi pravartit (originate) hota hai. Aisa samajhkar, buddhiman log prem-bhaav se meri bhakti karte hain.
message:
अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः
I am the source of all; from Me everything proceeds. The wise, knowing this, worship Me with devotion.
Main sabka prabhav hoon, mujhse sab chalta hai; gyaani yeh jaankar mujhme bhakti karte hain.

Sanskrit verse: मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम् कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च
Translation (English): Their minds in Me, their lives given to Me, enlightening one another, they speak of Me always and delight in Me.
Hinglish (1): Jinka man mujhme, pran mujhme lage hain, jo ek‑dusre ko mera gyaan dete aur mere katha me anandit hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Jinka chitt mujhme sthit hai, jinke praan mujhme arpit hain, ve hamesha ek-doosre ko mera bodh karate hue aur meri katha kehte hue santusht rehte hain aur anandit hote hain.
Summary: Devotees’ mutual joy in sharing Krishna.
message:
मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम् कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च
Their minds in Me, their lives given to Me, enlightening one another, they speak of Me always and delight in Me.
Jinka man mujhme, pran mujhme lage hain, jo ek‑dusre ko mera gyaan dete aur mere katha me anandit hote hain.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, inner peace, mental peace

Sanskrit verse: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते
Translation (English): To those ever‑devoted, worshiping Me with love, I give the yoga of wisdom by which they come to Me.
Hinglish (1): Main sada judhe bhakton ko buddhi yog deta hoon jisse ve mujhme aate hain.
Hinglish (2): Un hamesha yukt aur prem-poorvak bhajne waale bhakton ko main woh buddhi-yog pradaan karta hoon, jisse ve mujhe prapt kar lete hain.
message:
तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते
To those ever‑devoted, worshiping Me with love, I give the yoga of wisdom by which they come to Me.
Main sada judhe bhakton ko buddhi yog deta hoon jisse ve mujhme aate hain.

Sanskrit verse: तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भारत
Translation (English): Out of compassion, I destroy the darkness born of ignorance in them, dwelling in their hearts, with the lamp of knowledge.
Hinglish (1): Main daya se unke hriday me sthit agyaan ka andhkaar gyaan deep se mita deta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Un par anukampa karne ke liye, main unke hriday mein sthit hokar, gyaan ke prakaashmay deepak se agyaan-roopi andhkaar ko nasht kar deta hoon.
message:
तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भारत
Out of compassion, I destroy the darkness born of ignorance in them, dwelling in their hearts, with the lamp of knowledge.
Main daya se unke hriday me sthit agyaan ka andhkaar gyaan deep se mita deta hoon.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, Jnana Yoga, inner peace

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम्
Translation (English): Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, supreme abode, supreme purifier, eternal divine person, primal God, unborn, great.
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Aap param brahma, parampad, pavitra, shaashvat purush, pratham dev, ajanma, vibhu hain.
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Aap param Brahman, param dhaam aur param pavitra hain. Aap shaashvat, divya Purush, aadi-dev, ajanma aur sarvavyapi hain.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम्
Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, supreme abode, supreme purifier, eternal divine person, primal God, unborn, great.
Arjun bola: Aap param brahma, parampad, pavitra, shaashvat purush, pratham dev, ajanma, vibhu hain.

Sanskrit verse: आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे
Translation (English): All sages, like Devarshi Narada, Asita, Devala, and Vyasa, declare You so; and now You tell me so Yourself.
Hinglish (1): Narad, Asit, Deval, Vyas aadi rishi bhi aapko aise batate hain; ab aap bhi keh rahe ho.
Hinglish (2): Sabhi rishi, jaise Devarshi Narad, Asita, Devala aur Vyasa, aapke baare mein yahi kehte hain, aur ab aap swayam bhi mujhse yahi keh rahe hain.
Summary: Supporting authority of saints and scripture.
message:
आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे
All sages, like Devarshi Narada, Asita, Devala, and Vyasa, declare You so; and now You tell me so Yourself.
Narad, Asit, Deval, Vyas aadi rishi bhi aapko aise batate hain; ab aap bhi keh rahe ho.

Sanskrit verse: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव न हि ते भगवन् व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः
Translation (English): I believe all that You say, O Keshava; neither gods nor demons know Your true manifestation.
Hinglish (1): Main aapki sab baat sach maanta hoon; devta-danav aapki asliyat nahi jaante.
Hinglish (2): Hey Keshav, aap mujhse jo kuch bhi keh rahe hain, main us sabko satya maanta hoon. Hey Bhagavan, aapke swaroop ko na toh devta jaante hain aur na hi daanav.
Summary: Arjuna’s full faith in Krishna’s words.
message:
सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव न हि ते भगवन् व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः
I believe all that You say, O Keshava; neither gods nor demons know Your true manifestation.
Main aapki sab baat sach maanta hoon; devta-danav aapki asliyat nahi jaante.

Sanskrit verse: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते
Translation (English): O Purushottama, Creator of beings, Lord of beings, God of gods, Lord of the world, You know Yourself by Yourself alone.
Hinglish (1): Hey Purushottam, aap swayan ko sirf swayan jaante ho; aap bhutbhavan, bhutesh, devdeva, jagatpati ho.
Hinglish (2): Hey Purushottam, hey praaniyon ke utpatti-karta, hey praaniyon ke Ishwar, hey devon ke dev, hey jagat ke swami! Aap swayam hi apne aap ko jaante hain.
message:
स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते
O Purushottama, Creator of beings, Lord of beings, God of gods, Lord of the world, You know Yourself by Yourself alone.
Hey Purushottam, aap swayan ko sirf swayan jaante ho; aap bhutbhavan, bhutesh, devdeva, jagatpati ho.

Sanskrit verse: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि
Translation (English): Please tell me in full Your divine glories by which You pervade and dwell in all these worlds.
Hinglish (1): Apni divya vibhutiyan batao, jinse aap sab lok me vyaapt hain.
Hinglish (2): Aap hi apni un divya vibhutiyon (opulences) ka poorn roop se varnan karne mein samarth hain, jin vibhutiyon se aap in sabhi lokon mein vyaapt hokar sthit hain.
message:
वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि
Please tell me in full Your divine glories by which You pervade and dwell in all these worlds.
Apni divya vibhutiyan batao, jinse aap sab lok me vyaapt hain.

Sanskrit verse: कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया
Translation (English): How shall I know You, O Yogi, by constantly meditating on You? In which forms or aspects should I meditate?
Hinglish (1): Main aapko kaise sada yaad rakhu aur kaunse roopon me dhyan karu?
Hinglish (2): Hey Yogi, main kaise nirantar aapka chintan karte hue aapko jaanoon? Hey Bhagavan, mujhe किन-किन bhaavon (forms) mein aapka chintan karna chahiye?
Summary: Seeks practical modes for meditation on God.
message:
कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया
How shall I know You, O Yogi, by constantly meditating on You? In which forms or aspects should I meditate?
Main aapko kaise sada yaad rakhu aur kaunse roopon me dhyan karu?
tags: Raja Yoga, ધ્યાન, Bhakti Yoga, confusion

Sanskrit verse: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि श्रवणस्य ममास्ति ते
Translation (English): O Janardana, tell me again in detail of Your yoga and glories, for I never tire of hearing Your nectar‑like words.
Hinglish (1): Hey Janardan, apna yog aur vibhuti phir se vistaar se batao; main aapki amrit baatein sunke kabhi nahi thakta.
Hinglish (2): Hey Janardan, apne yog aur vibhutiyon ko phir se vistaar se bataiye, kyunki aapke amrit-may vachano ko sunte hue meri tripti nahi ho rahi hai.
message:
विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि श्रवणस्य ममास्ति ते
O Janardana, tell me again in detail of Your yoga and glories, for I never tire of hearing Your nectar‑like words.
Hey Janardan, apna yog aur vibhuti phir se vistaar se batao; main aapki amrit baatein sunke kabhi nahi thakta.

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः प्रमुखतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: Very well, I shall tell you My principal divine glories, O best of the Kurus; for there is no end to My extent.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Hey Kurushreshtha, main apni mukhya divya vibhutiyan bataunga; meri mahima ka koi ant nahi.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Theek hai, hey Kuru-shreshth! Main tumhein apni mukhya divya vibhutiyan bataunga, kyunki mere vistaar ka koi ant nahi hai.
Summary: Krishna prepares to list His manifestations.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः प्रमुखतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे
The Blessed Lord said: Very well, I shall tell you My principal divine glories, O best of the Kurus; for there is no end to My extent.
Shri Krishna bole: Hey Kurushreshtha, main apni mukhya divya vibhutiyan bataunga; meri mahima ka koi ant nahi.

Sanskrit verse: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च
Translation (English): O Gudakesha, I am the Self seated in the hearts of all beings; I am the beginning, middle, and end of all beings.
Hinglish (1): Hey Gudakesh, main sabke hriday me sthit atma hoon; main sabka aadi, madhya, aur ant hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Gudakesh (Arjun), main sabhi praaniyon ke hriday mein sthit Aatma hoon. Main hi sabhi praaniyon ka aadi (shuruaat), madhya (beech), aur ant (end) hoon.
message:
अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च
O Gudakesha, I am the Self seated in the hearts of all beings; I am the beginning, middle, and end of all beings.
Hey Gudakesh, main sabke hriday me sthit atma hoon; main sabka aadi, madhya, aur ant hoon.

Sanskrit verse: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान् मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी
Translation (English): Among the Adityas, I am Vishnu; among lights, I am the radiant Sun; among the Maruts, I am Marichi; among stars, I am the Moon.
Hinglish (1): Aditya me main Vishnu, jyotiyo me surya, marut me marichi, nakshatron me chand hoon.
Hinglish (2): Adityon mein main Vishnu hoon, jyotiyon mein kirnon waala Surya hoon, Maruton mein main Marichi hoon, aur nakshatron mein main Chandrama hoon.
message:
आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान् मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी
Among the Adityas, I am Vishnu; among lights, I am the radiant Sun; among the Maruts, I am Marichi; among stars, I am the Moon.
Aditya me main Vishnu, jyotiyo me surya, marut me marichi, nakshatron me chand hoon.

Sanskrit verse: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना
Translation (English): Among the Vedas, I am the Sama Veda; among gods, I am Indra; among senses, I am the mind; among beings, I am consciousness.
Hinglish (1): Vedon me main Sama ved, devtaon me Indra, indriyon me mann, praniyo me chetna hoon.
Hinglish (2): Vedon mein main Samaveda hoon, devtaon mein Indra hoon, indriyon mein mann hoon, aur praaniyon mein chetna (consciousness) hoon.
Summary: Krishna as essence of knowledge, leadership, and awareness.
message:
वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना
Among the Vedas, I am the Sama Veda; among gods, I am Indra; among senses, I am the mind; among beings, I am consciousness.
Vedon me main Sama ved, devtaon me Indra, indriyon me mann, praniyo me chetna hoon.

Sanskrit verse: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम्
Translation (English): Among Rudras, I am Shankara; among Yakshas and Rakshasas, I am Kubera; among Vasus, I am Agni; among mountains, I am Meru.
Hinglish (1): Rudron me main Shankar, yaksha-rakshas me Kuber, vasuon me Agni, parvaton me Meru hoon.
Hinglish (2): Rudron mein main Shankar hoon, Yakshon aur Rakshason mein Kuber (dhan ka devta) hoon, Vasuon mein main Agni (aag) hoon, aur parvaton mein main Meru hoon.
Summary: Glories across divine and natural realms.
message:
रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम्
Among Rudras, I am Shankara; among Yakshas and Rakshasas, I am Kubera; among Vasus, I am Agni; among mountains, I am Meru.
Rudron me main Shankar, yaksha-rakshas me Kuber, vasuon me Agni, parvaton me Meru hoon.

Sanskrit verse: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः
Translation (English): O Partha, among priests, I am Brihaspati; among army chiefs, I am Skanda; among bodies of water, I am the ocean.
Hinglish (1): Purohiton me Brihaspati, senapati me Skand, jaltaron me sagar hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, purohiton mein mukhya Brihaspati mujhe jaano. Senapatiyon mein main Skanda (Kartikeya) hoon, aur jalaashayon mein main saagar hoon.
message:
पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः
O Partha, among priests, I am Brihaspati; among army chiefs, I am Skanda; among bodies of water, I am the ocean.
Purohiton me Brihaspati, senapati me Skand, jaltaron me sagar hoon.

Sanskrit verse: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः
Translation (English): Among great sages, I am Bhrigu; among utterances, I am the single syllable Om; among sacrifices, I am japa‑yajna; among immovables, I am the Himalayas.
Hinglish (1): Maharshiyo me Bhrigu, vachano me Om, yaggya me japa, sthir vastu me Himalaya hoon.
Hinglish (2): Maharshiyon mein main Bhrigu hoon, vaaniyon mein ek-akshar 'Om' hoon, yajyon mein japa-yajna hoon, aur sthir vastuon mein Himalaya hoon.
message:
महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः
Among great sages, I am Bhrigu; among utterances, I am the single syllable Om; among sacrifices, I am japa‑yajna; among immovables, I am the Himalayas.
Maharshiyo me Bhrigu, vachano me Om, yaggya me japa, sthir vastu me Himalaya hoon.

Sanskrit verse: अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः
Translation (English): Among trees, I am the Ashvattha; among divine sages, Narada; among Gandharvas, Chitraratha; among Siddhas, Kapila.
Hinglish (1): Vrikshon me Ashvattha, devrishiyon me Narad, gandharvon me Chitrarath, siddhon me Kapil hoon.
Hinglish (2): Sabhi vrikshon mein main Ashvattha (peepal) ka vriksh hoon, Devarshiyon mein Narad hoon, Gandharvon mein Chitraratha hoon, aur Siddhon mein Kapila muni hoon.
message:
अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः
Among trees, I am the Ashvattha; among divine sages, Narada; among Gandharvas, Chitraratha; among Siddhas, Kapila.
Vrikshon me Ashvattha, devrishiyon me Narad, gandharvon me Chitrarath, siddhon me Kapil hoon.

Sanskrit verse: उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम् ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम्
Translation (English): Among horses, know Me as Ucchaisravas, born of nectar; among elephants, Airavata; among men, the king.
Hinglish (1): Godon me Ucchashrava, hathi me Airavat, insano me raja hoon.
Hinglish (2): Ghodon mein, amrit-manthan se utpann Ucchaishravas mujhe jaano. Haathiyon mein Airavata aur manushyon mein raja mujhe jaano.
message:
उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम् ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम्
Among horses, know Me as Ucchaisravas, born of nectar; among elephants, Airavata; among men, the king.
Godon me Ucchashrava, hathi me Airavat, insano me raja hoon.

Sanskrit verse: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः
Translation (English): Among weapons, I am the thunderbolt; among cows, Kamadhenu; among procreators, I am Kandarpa; among serpents, Vasuki.
Hinglish (1): Shastron me vajra, gayon me Kamadhenu, santan denewalo me Kandarpa, saapon me Vasuki hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hathiyaron mein main vajra hoon, gaayon mein Kamadhenu hoon, prajanan ke kaaranon mein Kamdev hoon, aur sarpon mein Vasuki hoon.
message:
आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः
Among weapons, I am the thunderbolt; among cows, Kamadhenu; among procreators, I am Kandarpa; among serpents, Vasuki.
Shastron me vajra, gayon me Kamadhenu, santan denewalo me Kandarpa, saapon me Vasuki hoon.

Sanskrit verse: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम्
Translation (English): Among Nagas, I am Ananta; among water beings, Varuna; among ancestors, Aryama; among controllers, Yama.
Hinglish (1): Nagon me Anant, jala jeevon me Varuna, pitron me Aryama, niyantrak me Yamraj hoon.
Hinglish (2): Naagon mein main Ananta (Sheshnag) hoon, jal-charon mein Varuna hoon, Pitaron (ancestors) mein Aryama hoon, aur shasan karne waalon mein Yamraj hoon.
message:
अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम्
Among Nagas, I am Ananta; among water beings, Varuna; among ancestors, Aryama; among controllers, Yama.
Nagon me Anant, jala jeevon me Varuna, pitron me Aryama, niyantrak me Yamraj hoon.

Sanskrit verse: प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम् मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम्
Translation (English): Among Daityas, I am Prahlada; among measurers, I am time; among beasts, I am the lion; among birds, Garuda.
Hinglish (1): Daityon me Prahlad, naapne walon me Kaal, pashuon me sher, pakshiyon me Garuda hoon.
Hinglish (2): Daityon mein main Prahlad hoon, ganana karne waalon mein Kaal (samay) hoon, pashuon mein main sher hoon, aur pakshiyon mein main Garuda hoon.
message:
प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम् मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम्
Among Daityas, I am Prahlada; among measurers, I am time; among beasts, I am the lion; among birds, Garuda.
Daityon me Prahlad, naapne walon me Kaal, pashuon me sher, pakshiyon me Garuda hoon.

Sanskrit verse: पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम् झषाणामकुलीरश्च स्रौतसामस्मि जाह्नवी
Translation (English): Among purifiers, I am wind; among warriors, I am Rama; among fishes, I am Makara; among rivers, I am Ganga.
Hinglish (1): Pavitra karne walon me Vayu, yoddhaon me Ram, machhliyon me Makara, nadiyon me Ganga hoon.
Hinglish (2): Pavitra karne waalon mein main Vayu (pawan) hoon, shastra-dhaariyon mein main Shri Ram hoon, machhliyon mein main Magar hoon, aur nadiyon mein main Ganga hoon.
message:
पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम् झषाणामकुलीरश्च स्रौतसामस्मि जाह्नवी
Among purifiers, I am wind; among warriors, I am Rama; among fishes, I am Makara; among rivers, I am Ganga.
Pavitra karne walon me Vayu, yoddhaon me Ram, machhliyon me Makara, nadiyon me Ganga hoon.

Sanskrit verse: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन अध्यात्मविद्याविद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम्
Translation (English): O Arjuna, of creations I am beginning, end, and middle; of sciences, the science of the self; among debates, I am the logical conclusion.
Hinglish (1): Main srishti ka aadi, ant, madhya hoon; vidya me adhyatma vidya; vachalon me tatva vad hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Arjun, srishtiyon ka aadi, ant aur madhya bhi main hi hoon. Vidyaon mein main adhyatm-vidya (science of the self) hoon, aur tark karne waalon ka vaad (logical conclusion) bhi main hi hoon.
message:
सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन अध्यात्मविद्याविद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम्
O Arjuna, of creations I am beginning, end, and middle; of sciences, the science of the self; among debates, I am the logical conclusion.
Main srishti ka aadi, ant, madhya hoon; vidya me adhyatma vidya; vachalon me tatva vad hoon.

Sanskrit verse: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताऽहं विश्वतोमुखः
Translation (English): Among letters, I am A; among compound words, the dvandva; I am imperishable time; I am the dispenser facing all sides.
Hinglish (1): Varnon me A, samas me dvandva, main akshay kaal, sabka data hoon.
Hinglish (2): Aksharon mein main 'A' kaar hoon, aur samason mein dvandva samaas hoon. Main hi akshay (eternal) kaal hoon, aur main hi sabka paalan-poshan karne waala, vishwa-mukh waala (Brahma) hoon.
message:
अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताऽहं विश्वतोमुखः
Among letters, I am A; among compound words, the dvandva; I am imperishable time; I am the dispenser facing all sides.
Varnon me A, samas me dvandva, main akshay kaal, sabka data hoon.

Sanskrit verse: मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम् कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा
Translation (English): I am all‑destroying death and the origin of those to be; among feminine qualities, I am fame, fortune, speech, memory, intelligence, firmness, forgiveness.
Hinglish (1): Main sab kuch lene wala mrityu, aane walon ka aarambh, aur nari gunon me kirti, shri, vani, smriti, buddhi, dhriti, kshama hoon.
Hinglish (2): Main sabka haran karne waali mrityu hoon aur bhavishya mein utpann hone waalon ka utpatti-sthan bhi. Naariyon mein main Kirti, Shri, Vaani, Smriti, Medha, Dhriti aur Kshama hoon.
Summary: All stages of life and virtue.
message:
मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम् कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा
I am all‑destroying death and the origin of those to be; among feminine qualities, I am fame, fortune, speech, memory, intelligence, firmness, forgiveness.
Main sab kuch lene wala mrityu, aane walon ka aarambh, aur nari gunon me kirti, shri, vani, smriti, buddhi, dhriti, kshama hoon.

Sanskrit verse: बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः
Translation (English): Among hymns, I am the Brihatsama; among meters, the Gayatri; among months, I am Margashirsha; among seasons, the flowery spring.
Hinglish (1): Samn me Brihatsama, chhandon me Gayatri, mahino me Margashirsh, rituon me vasant hoon.
Hinglish (2): Saamaveda ke geeton mein main Brihatsama hoon, chhandon mein Gayatri chhand hoon, mahinon mein Margashirsha hoon, aur rituon mein phoolon se bhari Vasant ritu hoon.
message:
बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः
Among hymns, I am the Brihatsama; among meters, the Gayatri; among months, I am Margashirsha; among seasons, the flowery spring.
Samn me Brihatsama, chhandon me Gayatri, mahino me Margashirsh, rituon me vasant hoon.

Sanskrit verse: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम्
Translation (English): Among deceits, I am gambling; of the splendid, I am splendor; I am victory, I am resolve; I am the goodness of the good.
Hinglish (1): Chhal me jua, tejwale me tej, main vijay, main dridhta, main satto gun ka saar hoon.
Hinglish (2): Chhal karne waalon mein main jua hoon, tejasviyon ka tej hoon, main hi vijay hoon, main hi nishchay hoon, aur sattva-guniyon ka sattva (goodness) bhi main hi hoon.
Summary: Even forceful skills are part of God.
message:
द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम्
Among deceits, I am gambling; of the splendid, I am splendor; I am victory, I am resolve; I am the goodness of the good.
Chhal me jua, tejwale me tej, main vijay, main dridhta, main satto gun ka saar hoon.

Sanskrit verse: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जयः मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः
Translation (English): Among Vrishnis, I am Vasudeva; among Pandavas, I am Arjuna; among sages, I am Vyasa; among poets, Ushanas.
Hinglish (1): Vrishni me Vasudev, Pandav me Arjun, rishi me Vyasa, kavi me Ushana hoon.
Hinglish (2): Vrishni-vanshiyon mein main Vasudev (Krishna) hoon, Pandavon mein Dhananjay (Arjun) hoon, muniyon mein main Vyasa hoon, aur kaviyon mein Ushana kavi hoon.
Summary: Krishna includes Himself in His glories.
message:
वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जयः मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः
Among Vrishnis, I am Vasudeva; among Pandavas, I am Arjuna; among sages, I am Vyasa; among poets, Ushanas.
Vrishni me Vasudev, Pandav me Arjun, rishi me Vyasa, kavi me Ushana hoon.

Sanskrit verse: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम्
Translation (English): Among rulers, I am the rod of punishment; among those seeking victory, I am polity; among secrets, I am silence; among the wise, I am knowledge.
Hinglish (1): Sasakon me dand, jeet chahne walon me niti, rahasyon me maun, gyaaniyon me gyaan hoon.
Hinglish (2): Daman karne waalon ka dand (punishment) main hoon, jeetne ki ichha rakhne waalon ki neeti main hoon, rahasyon mein maun main hoon, aur gyaanvaano ka gyaan bhi main hi hoon.
Summary: Aspects of order, wisdom, and discretion.
message:
दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम्
Among rulers, I am the rod of punishment; among those seeking victory, I am polity; among secrets, I am silence; among the wise, I am knowledge.
Sasakon me dand, jeet chahne walon me niti, rahasyon me maun, gyaaniyon me gyaan hoon.

Sanskrit verse: यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम्
Translation (English): O Arjuna, I am the seed of all beings; nothing moving or unmoving can exist without Me.
Hinglish (1): Hey Arjun, main sabka beej hoon; mere bina kuchh bhi nahi hai.
Hinglish (2): Aur hey Arjun, jo sabhi praaniyon ka beej hai, woh main hi hoon. Aisa koi char ya achar praani nahi hai jo mere bina astitva mein reh sake.
Summary: Krishna as root cause of existence.
message:
यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम्
O Arjuna, I am the seed of all beings; nothing moving or unmoving can exist without Me.
Hey Arjun, main sabka beej hoon; mere bina kuchh bhi nahi hai.

Sanskrit verse: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतīnां परंतप एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया
Translation (English): O Parantapa, there is no end to My divine manifestations; what I have described is only a brief statement.
Hinglish (1): Hey Parantap, meri vibhutiyon ka ant nahi; yeh sirf ek udaharan tha.
Hinglish (2): Hey shatru-vijeta, meri divya vibhutiyon ka koi ant nahi hai. Maine toh apni vibhutiyon ka yeh vistaar kewal sankshep mein kaha hai.
message:
नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतīnां परंतप एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया
O Parantapa, there is no end to My divine manifestations; what I have described is only a brief statement.
Hey Parantap, meri vibhutiyon ka ant nahi; yeh sirf ek udaharan tha.

Sanskrit verse: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसम्भवम्
Translation (English): Whatever being is glorious, prosperous, or powerful, know that to be born of a fragment of My splendor.
Hinglish (1): Jo kuch shresth, shakti-shali, samriddh hai, use mera tej ka ansh samjho.
Hinglish (2): Jo bhi vastu vibhuti-yukta (glorious), shrimad (prosperous) ya urjit (powerful) hai, tum us-us ko mere tej ke ansh se hi utpann hua jaano.
message:
यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसम्भवम्
Whatever being is glorious, prosperous, or powerful, know that to be born of a fragment of My splendor.
Jo kuch shresth, shakti-shali, samriddh hai, use mera tej ka ansh samjho.

Sanskrit verse: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जागतः
Translation (English): But what need is there for all this detailed knowledge, O Arjuna? I sustain this whole universe with a single fragment of Myself.
Hinglish (1): Itna vistaar jaankari ka kya kaam, Arjun? Main sirf ek ans se poore jagat ko sambhalta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Athva, hey Arjun, is bahut saare gyaan se tumhein kya laabh? Main is sampoorn jagat ko apne ek ansh-maatra se dhaaran karke sthit hoon.
Summary: All creation is an infinitesimal part of God.
message:
अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जागतः
But what need is there for all this detailed knowledge, O Arjuna? I sustain this whole universe with a single fragment of Myself.
Itna vistaar jaankari ka kya kaam, Arjun? Main sirf ek ans se poore jagat ko sambhalta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसंज्ञितम् यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम
Translation (English): Arjuna said: By the supreme, secret teaching of the self You have spoken from compassion for me, my delusion is removed.
Hinglish (1): Arjun bole: Aapke kripa se diya gya gupt adhyatma gyaan meri moh ko mita chuka hai.
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Mujh par anugrah karne ke liye aapne jo yeh param gupt adhyatmik gyaan kaha hai, us vachan se mera yeh moh nasht ho gaya hai.
Summary: Arjuna expresses clarity after hearing Krishna’s teachings.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसंज्ञितम् यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम
Arjuna said: By the supreme, secret teaching of the self You have spoken from compassion for me, my delusion is removed.
Arjun bole: Aapke kripa se diya gya gupt adhyatma gyaan meri moh ko mita chuka hai.
tags: overcoming self-doubt, inner peace, Jnana Yoga

Sanskrit verse: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम्
Translation (English): I have heard from You in detail of the origin and dissolution of beings, O lotus‑eyed, and also of Your imperishable greatness.
Hinglish (1): Mainne aapse sab prani ke utpatti aur laya, aur aapki avyay mahima detail me suni hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey kamal-nayan, maine aapse praaniyon ki utpatti aur pralay ke baare mein vistaar se suna hai, aur aapki avinashi mahima ko bhi jaana hai.
Summary: Knowledge of creation and Krishna’s greatness.
message:
भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम्
I have heard from You in detail of the origin and dissolution of beings, O lotus‑eyed, and also of Your imperishable greatness.
Mainne aapse sab prani ke utpatti aur laya, aur aapki avyay mahima detail me suni hai.

Sanskrit verse: एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर । द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम
Translation (English): O Supreme Lord, as You have described Yourself, so it is; I wish to see Your divine form, O Purushottama.
Hinglish (1): Hey Param Ishwar, aapne jo apna aishwarya roop bataya, use main dekhna chahta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parameshwar, jaisa aapne apne baare mein kaha hai, woh bilkul waisa hi hai. Parantu, hey Purushottam, main aapke us aishwarya-roop ko pratyaksh dekhna chahta hoon.
message:
एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर । द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम
O Supreme Lord, as You have described Yourself, so it is; I wish to see Your divine form, O Purushottama.
Hey Param Ishwar, aapne jo apna aishwarya roop bataya, use main dekhna chahta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: यदि मे त्वमनुग्राह्यं तत्त्वमद्य दर्शनम् योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम्
Translation (English): If You think me able to behold It, O Lord of Yoga, then show me Your imperishable Self.
Hinglish (1): Agar aap mujhe yogya samjho, toh apna avyay roop dikhaiye.
Hinglish (2): Hey Yogeshwar, yadi aap maante hain ki main us roop ko dekhne mein samarth hoon, toh kripya mujhe apne us avinashi swaroop ka darshan karaiye.
Summary: Seeks Krishna’s permission to witness the universal form.
message:
यदि मे त्वमनुग्राह्यं तत्त्वमद्य दर्शनम् योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम्
If You think me able to behold It, O Lord of Yoga, then show me Your imperishable Self.
Agar aap mujhe yogya samjho, toh apna avyay roop dikhaiye.

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: Behold, O Partha, My hundreds and thousands of divine forms, of various colors and shapes.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Hey Parth, mere shat-shat, sahastra-sahastra divya roop, rang-birange, akar-bhed wale dekho.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Hey Parth, ab tum mere saikdon-hazaaron, alag-alag prakaar ke, alag-alag rangon aur aakrutiyon waale divya roopon ko dekho.
Summary: Krishna offers vision of infinite variety.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च
The Blessed Lord said: Behold, O Partha, My hundreds and thousands of divine forms, of various colors and shapes.
Shri Krishna bole: Hey Parth, mere shat-shat, sahastra-sahastra divya roop, rang-birange, akar-bhed wale dekho.

Sanskrit verse: पश्यादित्यान्वसून्रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत
Translation (English): Behold the Adityas, Vasus, Rudras, Ashvins, and Maruts—many wonders never seen before, O Bharata.
Hinglish (1): Aditya, Vasu, Rudra, Ashwini Kumaron, Marut, aur anek adbhut roop dekho.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, tum Adityon, Vasuon, Rudron, Ashwini Kumaron aur Maruton ko dekho. Aur un bahut se aashcharyon ko dekho jo pehle kabhi nahi dekhe gaye.
Summary: Universal form holds all celestial beings.
message:
पश्यादित्यान्वसून्रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत
Behold the Adityas, Vasus, Rudras, Ashvins, and Maruts—many wonders never seen before, O Bharata.
Aditya, Vasu, Rudra, Ashwini Kumaron, Marut, aur anek adbhut roop dekho.

Sanskrit verse: इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम् मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि
Translation (English): Here in My body, O Gudakesha, behold at once the whole universe, moving and unmoving, and anything else you wish to see.
Hinglish (1): Mere sharir me ek sath poora char‑achar jagat dekho, jo bhi tum dekhna chaho.
Hinglish (2): Hey Gudakesh, aaj is mere shareer mein, ek hi sthan par sthit char-achar sahit sampoorn jagat ko dekho, aur jo kuch bhi aur dekhna chahte ho, woh bhi dekho.
message:
इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम् मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि
Here in My body, O Gudakesha, behold at once the whole universe, moving and unmoving, and anything else you wish to see.
Mere sharir me ek sath poora char‑achar jagat dekho, jo bhi tum dekhna chaho.

Sanskrit verse: न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्
Translation (English): But you cannot see Me with your own eyes; I give you divine sight—behold My divine yoga.
Hinglish (1): Tum mujhe apni aakhon se nahi dekh sakte; main tumhe divya drishti deta hoon, mere yog ka adbhut roop dekho.
Hinglish (2): Parantu, tum mujhe apni in aankhon se nahi dekh sakte. Main tumhein divya drishti deta hoon. Ab mere aishwarya-yog ko dekho.
Summary: Divine vision is needed to perceive God’s glory.
message:
न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्
But you cannot see Me with your own eyes; I give you divine sight—behold My divine yoga.
Tum mujhe apni aakhon se nahi dekh sakte; main tumhe divya drishti deta hoon, mere yog ka adbhut roop dekho.

Sanskrit verse: सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरिः दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम्
Translation (English): Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus, O King, Hari, the great Lord of Yoga, showed to Partha His supreme, divine form.
Hinglish (1): Sanjay bola: Krishna ne ye kehkar Arjun ko apna param, aishwarya roop dikhaya.
Hinglish (2): Sanjay ne kaha: Hey Rajan, aisa kehkar, maha-yogeshwar Hari (Shri Krishna) ne Parth (Arjun) ko apna param aishwarya-roop dikhaya.
message:
सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरिः दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम्
Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus, O King, Hari, the great Lord of Yoga, showed to Partha His supreme, divine form.
Sanjay bola: Krishna ne ye kehkar Arjun ko apna param, aishwarya roop dikhaya.

Sanskrit verse: अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम् अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम्
Translation (English): With many faces and eyes, many marvelous sights, adorned with many divine ornaments, many divine weapons upraised…
Hinglish (1): Anant mukh, netra, adbhut darshan, anek divya aabhushan, anek divya shastra.
Hinglish (2): Us vishwa-roop ke anek mukh aur netra the, anek adbhut darshan the, usne anek divya aabhushan pehne hue the aur anek divya shastra uthaye hue the.
message:
अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम् अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम्
With many faces and eyes, many marvelous sights, adorned with many divine ornaments, many divine weapons upraised…
Anant mukh, netra, adbhut darshan, anek divya aabhushan, anek divya shastra.

Sanskrit verse: दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम् सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम्
Translation (English): Wearing divine garlands and garments, anointed with divine scents, wondrous, infinite, all‑faced God.
Hinglish (1): Divya mala, vastra, sugandhit, adbhut, anant, sab or mukh wale Bhagwan.
Hinglish (2): Usne divya maalaayein aur vastra dhaaran kiye hue the, divya gandh ka lep lagaya hua tha. Woh sarva-aashcharyamay, anant aur sarvato-mukh (jiske har taraf mukh ho) dev tha.
message:
दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम् सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम्
Wearing divine garlands and garments, anointed with divine scents, wondrous, infinite, all‑faced God.
Divya mala, vastra, sugandhit, adbhut, anant, sab or mukh wale Bhagwan.

Sanskrit verse: दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः
Translation (English): If a thousand suns were to rise in the sky at once, their radiance might resemble that of that great soul.
Hinglish (1): Agar ek hi samay me hazar surya ugte, to unka tej us paramatma ke tej ke samaan hota.
Hinglish (2): Yadi aakash mein hazaaron surya ek saath uday ho jaayein, toh unka prakaash shayad us mahatma ke tej ke samaan ho sakta hai.
message:
दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः
If a thousand suns were to rise in the sky at once, their radiance might resemble that of that great soul.
Agar ek hi samay me hazar surya ugte, to unka tej us paramatma ke tej ke samaan hota.

Sanskrit verse: तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा
Translation (English): Then the son of Pandu saw the entire universe, divided into many parts, standing in one place within the body of the God of gods.
Hinglish (1): Arjun ne ek jagah me bhagwan ke sharir me sab jagat ke anek roop dekhe.
Hinglish (2): Us samay Pandu-putra Arjun ne, devon ke dev ke us shareer mein, anek prakaar se vibhakt sampoorn jagat ko ek hi sthan par sthit dekha.
Summary: All of reality seen within God.
message:
तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा
Then the son of Pandu saw the entire universe, divided into many parts, standing in one place within the body of the God of gods.
Arjun ne ek jagah me bhagwan ke sharir me sab jagat ke anek roop dekhe.

Sanskrit verse: ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जयः नमस्कृत्वा शिरा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत
Translation (English): Then, astonished, his hair standing on end, Dhananjaya bowed his head to the God and spoke with folded hands.
Hinglish (1): Arjun vismay se bhare, romanchit, pranam karke, hath jodkar bole.
Hinglish (2): Tab, aashcharya se chakit aur romanchit hokar, Dhananjay (Arjun) ne dev ko sir jhukakar pranam kiya aur haath jodkar bola.
message:
ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जयः नमस्कृत्वा शिरा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत
Then, astonished, his hair standing on end, Dhananjaya bowed his head to the God and spoke with folded hands.
Arjun vismay se bhare, romanchit, pranam karke, hath jodkar bole.

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच पश्यामि देवांस्तव देवे देहे सर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसङ्घान् ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थमृषींश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान्
Translation (English): O God, I see in Your body all the gods, various hosts of beings, Brahma on his lotus seat, and all sages and divine serpents.
Hinglish (1): Hey Dev, main aapke sharir me sab devta, prani, kamal par baithe Brahma, rishiyon aur divya nag ko dekh raha hoon.
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Dev, main aapke shareer mein sabhi devtaon ko, vibhinn praaniyon ke samoohon ko, kamal-aasan par sthit Brahma ji ko, sabhi rishiyon ko aur divya sarpon ko dekh raha hoon.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच पश्यामि देवांस्तव देवे देहे सर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसङ्घान् ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थमृषींश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान्
O God, I see in Your body all the gods, various hosts of beings, Brahma on his lotus seat, and all sages and divine serpents.
Hey Dev, main aapke sharir me sab devta, prani, kamal par baithe Brahma, rishiyon aur divya nag ko dekh raha hoon.

Sanskrit verse: अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रं पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम् नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिं पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप
Translation (English): O Lord of the universe, I see You with countless arms, bellies, faces, eyes, endless on all sides; I see no end, no middle, no beginning.
Hinglish (1): Main aapko anek bahu, mukh, netra, udar ke sath har jagah dekh raha hoon; koi aadi‑madhya‑ant nahi.
Hinglish (2): Hey Vishweshwar, hey Vishwa-roop! Main aapko har taraf se anek bhujaon, peton, mukhon aur netron waala, anant-roop mein dekh raha hoon. Mujhe na toh aapka ant, na madhya, aur na hi aadi dikhayi de raha hai.
message:
अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रं पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम् नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिं पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप
O Lord of the universe, I see You with countless arms, bellies, faces, eyes, endless on all sides; I see no end, no middle, no beginning.
Main aapko anek bahu, mukh, netra, udar ke sath har jagah dekh raha hoon; koi aadi‑madhya‑ant nahi.

Sanskrit verse: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं च तेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तम् पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ताद्दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिम्
Translation (English): I see You crowned, with mace and discus, mass of radiance, shining everywhere, blazing like fire and sun, hard to behold.
Hinglish (1): Main aapko mukut, gada, chakra, tej ka sanchay, agni‑surya jaise tej se lapetay dekhta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Main aapko mukut, gada aur chakra dhaaran kiye hue, har taraf se prakaashmaan tej-raashi ke roop mein dekh raha hoon. Aapki jwala agni aur surya ke samaan hai aur aapko dekhna atyant kathin hai.
message:
किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं च तेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तम् पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ताद्दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिम्
I see You crowned, with mace and discus, mass of radiance, shining everywhere, blazing like fire and sun, hard to behold.
Main aapko mukut, gada, chakra, tej ka sanchay, agni‑surya jaise tej se lapetay dekhta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् त्वमव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे
Translation (English): You are the imperishable, to be known as the Supreme; You are the supreme resting place, the eternal upholder of dharma; I think You are the eternal Person.
Hinglish (1): Aap akshar, param gyaani, param sthan, dharm ke rakshak, sanatan purush hain.
Hinglish (2): Aap hi akshar (avinashi), janne yogy param tattva hain. Aap hi is vishwa ke param aashray hain. Aap hi avyaya, shaashvat-dharm ke rakshak aur sanatan Purush hain, aisa mera mat hai.
message:
त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् त्वमव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे
You are the imperishable, to be known as the Supreme; You are the supreme resting place, the eternal upholder of dharma; I think You are the eternal Person.
Aap akshar, param gyaani, param sthan, dharm ke rakshak, sanatan purush hain.

Sanskrit verse: अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्यमनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम् पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम्
Translation (English): I see You without beginning, middle, or end, infinite in power, with sun and moon as eyes, blazing fire in mouth, scorching the universe with Your radiance.
Hinglish (1): Main aapko anaadi, amadhya, anant shakti wala, surya‑chandra netra, agni mukh, tej se jagat tapate dekhta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Main aapko aadi, madhya aur ant se rahit, anant veerya waala, anant bhujaon waala, chandrama aur surya roopi netron waala, prajwalit agni roopi mukh waala aur apne tej se is vishwa ko tapta hua dekh raha hoon.
message:
अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्यमनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम् पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम्
I see You without beginning, middle, or end, infinite in power, with sun and moon as eyes, blazing fire in mouth, scorching the universe with Your radiance.
Main aapko anaadi, amadhya, anant shakti wala, surya‑chandra netra, agni mukh, tej se jagat tapate dekhta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हि व्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वाः दृष्ट्वाऽद्भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदं लोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितम्
Translation (English): This space between heaven and earth, all directions, is pervaded by You alone; seeing Your wondrous and terrible form, the three worlds are troubled.
Hinglish (1): Aapne swarg‑prithvi ke beech, sab dishaon ko vyapit kar rakha hai; aapke adbhut bhayanak roop se teenon lok kamp rahe hain.
Hinglish (2): Swarg aur prithvi ke beech ka yeh sampoorn aakash aur sabhi dishaayein kewal aapse hi vyaapt hain. Aapke is adbhut aur ugra roop ko dekhkar teeno lok atyant vyathit ho rahe hain.
Summary: Reveals fear and wonder at divine magnitude.
message:
द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हि व्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वाः दृष्ट्वाऽद्भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदं लोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितम्
This space between heaven and earth, all directions, is pervaded by You alone; seeing Your wondrous and terrible form, the three worlds are troubled.
Aapne swarg‑prithvi ke beech, sab dishaon ko vyapit kar rakha hai; aapke adbhut bhayanak roop se teenon lok kamp rahe hain.

Sanskrit verse: अमी हि त्वां सुरसङ्घा विशन्ति केचिद्भीताः प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसङ्घाः स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभिः पुष्कलाभिः
Translation (English): Indeed, hosts of gods enter into You; some, fearful, praise You with folded hands, saying “Svasti!”. Great sages and Siddhas laud You with abundant hymns.
Hinglish (1): Devgan aapme pravesh kar rahe hain; kuch bhay se pranam karke “Svasti” keh rahe hain; rishi-siddh stuti kar rahe hain.
Hinglish (2): Devtaon ke samooh aapmein pravesh kar rahe hain. Kuch bhaybheet hokar haath jode aapki stuti kar rahe hain. Maharshi aur siddhon ke samooh 'Kalyan ho' kehkar uttam stotron se aapki stuti kar rahe hain.
Summary: Mixed awe and reverence among celestial beings.
message:
अमी हि त्वां सुरसङ्घा विशन्ति केचिद्भीताः प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसङ्घाः स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभिः पुष्कलाभिः
Indeed, hosts of gods enter into You; some, fearful, praise You with folded hands, saying “Svasti!”. Great sages and Siddhas laud You with abundant hymns.
Devgan aapme pravesh kar rahe hain; kuch bhay se pranam karke “Svasti” keh rahe hain; rishi-siddh stuti kar rahe hain.

Sanskrit verse: रुद्रादित्यावसवो ये च साध्या विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घाः वीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे
Translation (English): Rudras, Adityas, Vasus, Sadhyas, Vishvadevas, Ashvins, Maruts, Ushmapas, Gandharvas, Yakshas, Asuras, Siddhas—all gaze at You, amazed.
Hinglish (1): Rudra, Aditya, Vasu, Sadhya, Vishvadeva, Ashwin, Marut, Ushmapa, Gandharva, Yaksha, Asur, Siddh—sab aapko chakit hokar dekhte hain.
Hinglish (2): Rudra, Aditya, Vasu, Sadhya, Vishwedeva, Ashwini Kumar, Marut, Pitar, Gandharva, Yaksha, Asur aur Siddhon ke samooh - sabhi vismit hokar aapko dekh rahe hain.
Summary: All celestial categories witness the form.
message:
रुद्रादित्यावसवो ये च साध्या विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घाः वीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे
Rudras, Adityas, Vasus, Sadhyas, Vishvadevas, Ashvins, Maruts, Ushmapas, Gandharvas, Yakshas, Asuras, Siddhas—all gaze at You, amazed.
Rudra, Aditya, Vasu, Sadhya, Vishvadeva, Ashwin, Marut, Ushmapa, Gandharva, Yaksha, Asur, Siddh—sab aapko chakit hokar dekhte hain.

Sanskrit verse: रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रं महाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम् बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालं दृष्ट्वा लोकाः प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम्
Translation (English): Great‑armed One, seeing Your vast form with many mouths, eyes, many arms, thighs, feet, many stomachs, many terrible tusks—worlds are shaken, and so am I.
Hinglish (1): Hey Mahabaahu, aapke anant mukh-netra, bahu-hast-paad, pet, bhayanak daanton se main aur lok dare hue hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Mahabahu, aapke is mahaan roop ko, jismein anek mukh, netra, bhujaayein, janghayein, pair, pet aur bhayanak daantein hain, dekhkar sabhi lok vyathit hain aur main bhi vyathit hoon.
message:
रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रं महाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम् बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालं दृष्ट्वा लोकाः प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम्
Great‑armed One, seeing Your vast form with many mouths, eyes, many arms, thighs, feet, many stomachs, many terrible tusks—worlds are shaken, and so am I.
Hey Mahabaahu, aapke anant mukh-netra, bahu-hast-paad, pet, bhayanak daanton se main aur lok dare hue hain.

Sanskrit verse: नभःस्पृशं दीप्तमनेकवर्णं व्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम् दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्मा धृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो
Translation (English): O Vishnu, touching the sky, blazing in many colors, with gaping mouths, great flaming eyes—seeing You my heart trembles, I find no courage, no peace.
Hinglish (1): Aapke aakash-spershi roop, rang-birange tej, khule mukh, jwalant netra dekh kar mera man kamp raha hai; mujhe dhairya nahi.
Hinglish (2): Hey Vishnu, aakash ko sparsh karte hue, prajwalit, anek rangon waale, faile hue mukhon aur vishaal prajwalit netron waale aapko dekhkar, mera antahkaran bhaybheet hai. Main na toh dhairya dhaaran kar paa raha hoon aur na hi shaanti.
message:
नभःस्पृशं दीप्तमनेकवर्णं व्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम् दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्मा धृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो
O Vishnu, touching the sky, blazing in many colors, with gaping mouths, great flaming eyes—seeing You my heart trembles, I find no courage, no peace.
Aapke aakash-spershi roop, rang-birange tej, khule mukh, jwalant netra dekh kar mera man kamp raha hai; mujhe dhairya nahi.

Sanskrit verse: दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानि दृष्ट्वैव कालानलसन्निभानि दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म प्रसाददेवेश जगन्निवास
Translation (English): O Lord of gods, abode of the world, seeing Your tusked mouths like the fires of annihilation, I know not the directions, and find no peace.
Hinglish (1): Hey Devnath, jagatnivas, aapke kalagni jaise mukh dekhkar mujhe disha dikh nahi rahi, shanti nahi mil rahi.
Hinglish (2): Pralay-kaal ki agni ke samaan aapke bhayanak daanton waale mukhon ko dekhkar, main dishaon ko nahi jaan paa raha hoon aur mujhe shaanti nahi mil rahi. Hey Devesh, hey Jagannivas, kripya prasann hoiye.
message:
दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानि दृष्ट्वैव कालानलसन्निभानि दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म प्रसाददेवेश जगन्निवास
O Lord of gods, abode of the world, seeing Your tusked mouths like the fires of annihilation, I know not the directions, and find no peace.
Hey Devnath, jagatnivas, aapke kalagni jaise mukh dekhkar mujhe disha dikh nahi rahi, shanti nahi mil rahi.

Sanskrit verse: अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राः सर्वे सहैवावनीपलसङ्घैः भीष्मो द्रोणः सूतपुत्रस्तथासौ सहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यैः
Translation (English): These sons of Dhritarashtra with all their allied kings, Bhishma, Drona, Karna, with also our chief warriors...
Hinglish (1): Yeh Dhritarashtra ke putra, unke mitra raja, Bhishma, Drona, Karna, aur hamare pramukh yoddha...
Hinglish (2): Dhritarashtra ke ve sabhi putra, rajaon ke samoohon sahit, Bheeshma, Drona, woh Soot-putra Karna, aur humare bhi pramukh yoddhaon sahit...
Summary: Arjuna recognizes figures in the cosmic vision.
message:
अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राः सर्वे सहैवावनीपलसङ्घैः भीष्मो द्रोणः सूतपुत्रस्तथासौ सहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यैः
These sons of Dhritarashtra with all their allied kings, Bhishma, Drona, Karna, with also our chief warriors...
Yeh Dhritarashtra ke putra, unke mitra raja, Bhishma, Drona, Karna, aur hamare pramukh yoddha...

Sanskrit verse: वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणाः विशन्ति दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषु सन्दृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गैः
Translation (English): Hastening, they enter Your terrible tusked mouths; some, with heads crushed between the teeth, are seen caught there.
Hinglish (1): Woh aapke bhayanak daanton me ghus rahe hain; kuchke sir kuchal kar daanton me atke dikhen.
Hinglish (2): Tezi se aapke bhayanak daanton waale mukhon mein pravesh kar rahe hain. Kuch toh, kuchle hue siron ke saath, aapke daanton ke beech fanse hue dikhayi de rahe hain.
message:
वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणाः विशन्ति दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषु सन्दृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गैः
Hastening, they enter Your terrible tusked mouths; some, with heads crushed between the teeth, are seen caught there.
Woh aapke bhayanak daanton me ghus rahe hain; kuchke sir kuchal kar daanton me atke dikhen.

Sanskrit verse: यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगाः समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति तथा तवामी नरलोकवीरा विशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति
Translation (English): As rivers, many in their torrents, flow to the sea, so these heroes of mankind enter Your flaming mouths.
Hinglish (1): Jaise nadiyan samudra me girti hain, waise yeh veer aapke jwalant mukh me ja rahe hain.
Hinglish (2): Jaise nadiyon ki anek jal-dhaaraayein samudra ki or hi daudti hain, usi prakaar yeh nar-lok ke veer aapke prajwalit mukhon mein pravesh kar rahe hain.
message:
यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगाः समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति तथा तवामी नरलोकवीरा विशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति
As rivers, many in their torrents, flow to the sea, so these heroes of mankind enter Your flaming mouths.
Jaise nadiyan samudra me girti hain, waise yeh veer aapke jwalant mukh me ja rahe hain.

Sanskrit verse: यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गा विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोकास्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः
Translation (English): As moths rush with great speed into a blazing fire to perish, so do these worlds with rapidity enter Your mouths to their destruction.
Hinglish (1): Jaise patange aag me girkar jal jaate hain, waise log aapke mukh me pravesh kar rahe hain.
Hinglish (2): Jaise patange nasht hone ke liye teevra gati se prajwalit agni mein pravesh karte hain, usi prakaar yeh sabhi log nasht hone ke liye teevra gati se aapke mukhon mein pravesh kar rahe hain.
message:
यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गा विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोकास्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः
As moths rush with great speed into a blazing fire to perish, so do these worlds with rapidity enter Your mouths to their destruction.
Jaise patange aag me girkar jal jaate hain, waise log aapke mukh me pravesh kar rahe hain.

Sanskrit verse: लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमानः समन्ताल्लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भिः तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रं भासस्तवोग्राः प्रतपन्ति विष्णो
Translation (English): You lick up all worlds on every side with your flaming mouths, devouring completely; your fierce radiance scorches the universe, O Vishnu.
Hinglish (1): Aap har disha se sab lok nigal rahe hain; aapka tej poore jagat ko jala raha hai.
Hinglish (2): Aap apne prajwalit mukhon se sabhi lokon ko har taraf se nigalte hue chaat rahe hain. Hey Vishnu, aapka ugra prakaash sampoorn jagat ko tej se bhar kar tapta kar raha hai.
message:
लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमानः समन्ताल्लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भिः तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रं भासस्तवोग्राः प्रतपन्ति विष्णो
You lick up all worlds on every side with your flaming mouths, devouring completely; your fierce radiance scorches the universe, O Vishnu.
Aap har disha se sab lok nigal rahe hain; aapka tej poore jagat ko jala raha hai.

Sanskrit verse: आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्माद्यं न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम्
Translation (English): Tell me who You are, of this terrible form; O best of gods, obeisance to You! Be gracious. I wish to know You, the origin, for I do not comprehend Your intent.
Hinglish (1): Hey ugra roop wale prabhu, pranam, kripya batayein aap kaun hain; main aapke uddeshya ko nahi samajh pa raha.
Hinglish (2): Kripya mujhe bataiye ki ugra-roop waale aap kaun hain? Hey Deva-shreshth, aapko namaskar ho, prasann hoiye. Main aap aadi-purush ko jaanna chahta hoon, kyunki main aapki is pravritti ko nahi samajh paa raha hoon.
Summary: Inquiry born of fear and devotion.
message:
आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्माद्यं न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम्
Tell me who You are, of this terrible form; O best of gods, obeisance to You! Be gracious. I wish to know You, the origin, for I do not comprehend Your intent.
Hey ugra roop wale prabhu, pranam, kripya batayein aap kaun hain; main aapke uddeshya ko nahi samajh pa raha.
tags: fear, confusion, what is the purpose of life

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृद्धः ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: I am Time, destroyer of worlds, engaged in devouring all people; not even without you will any of the warriors in opposing armies survive.
Hinglish (1): Main kaal hoon, lokon ka naashak; yeh sab yoddha bina tumhare bhi nahi bachenge.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Main lokon ka naash karne waala, badha hua Kaal (samay) hoon. Main yahan in logon ka sanhaar karne ke liye pravritt hua hoon. Tumhare bina bhi, vipakshi sena mein sthit koi bhi yoddha jeevit nahi bachega.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृद्धः ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः
The Blessed Lord said: I am Time, destroyer of worlds, engaged in devouring all people; not even without you will any of the warriors in opposing armies survive.
Main kaal hoon, lokon ka naashak; yeh sab yoddha bina tumhare bhi nahi bachenge.
tags: fear of death, Karma, what is the purpose of life

Sanskrit verse: तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व जित्वा शत्रून् भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समये मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन्
Translation (English): Therefore arise, win glory, conquer enemies, enjoy the kingdom; they have already been slain by Me—be merely the instrument, O Savyasachi.
Hinglish (1): Utho, vijay pao, rajya bhogo; shatru mere dwara pehle hi mare gaye hain, tum bas nimit bano.
Hinglish (2): Isliye, tum utho aur yash prapt karo. Shatruon ko jeetkar samriddh rajya ka bhog karo. Yeh sab mere dwara pehle hi maare ja chuke hain. Hey Savyasachi (Arjun), tum kewal nimitt-maatra bano.
Summary: Krishna urges Arjuna to act as His instrument.
message:
तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व जित्वा शत्रून् भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समये मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन्
Therefore arise, win glory, conquer enemies, enjoy the kingdom; they have already been slain by Me—be merely the instrument, O Savyasachi.
Utho, vijay pao, rajya bhogo; shatru mere dwara pehle hi mare gaye hain, tum bas nimit bano.
tags: Dharma, Karma, Nishkama Karma, finding purpose

Sanskrit verse: द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान्मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा युध्यस्व जेतासि रणेऽस्पृतः
Translation (English): Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna, and other brave warriors slain by Me—kill them; do not be distressed; fight—you will conquer the foe.
Hinglish (1): Drona, Bhishma, Jayadrath, Karna aur anya veer mere dwara mare gaye—tum unhe maaro, chinta na karo, vijay tumhari hai.
Hinglish (2): Drona, Bheeshma, Jayadratha, Karna aur anya bhi mahaan yoddhaon ko, jo mere dwara maare ja chuke hain, tum maaro. Vyathit mat ho. Yuddh karo, tum nishchit roop se ran mein shatruon ko jeetoge.
message:
द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान्मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा युध्यस्व जेतासि रणेऽस्पृतः
Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna, and other brave warriors slain by Me—kill them; do not be distressed; fight—you will conquer the foe.
Drona, Bhishma, Jayadrath, Karna aur anya veer mere dwara mare gaye—tum unhe maaro, chinta na karo, vijay tumhari hai.
tags: fear of failure, overcoming self-doubt, Dharma

Sanskrit verse: सञ्जय उवाच एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्य कृताञ्जलिर्वेपमानः किरीटी नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णं गद्गदं भावभीतः
