Translation (English): Sanjaya said: Hearing this from Keshava, the crowned Arjuna, trembling, bowed down with folded hands, and fearfully, faltering, spoke to Krishna again.
Hinglish (1): Krishna ke vachan sunkar, kampte Arjun ne pranam kiya aur bhay-poorn swar me bola.
Hinglish (2): Sanjay ne kaha: Keshav ke is vachan ko sunkar, mukut-dhaari Arjun kaanpte hue, haath jodkar, pranam karke, phir se atyant bhaybheet hokar, gadgad swar mein Krishna se bola.
message:
सञ्जय उवाच एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्य कृताञ्जलिर्वेपमानः किरीटी नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णं गद्गदं भावभीतः
Sanjaya said: Hearing this from Keshava, the crowned Arjuna, trembling, bowed down with folded hands, and fearfully, faltering, spoke to Krishna again.
Krishna ke vachan sunkar, kampte Arjun ne pranam kiya aur bhay-poorn swar me bola.

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या जगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्ति सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसङ्घाः
Translation (English): Arjuna said: It is fitting, O Hrishikesha, that the world rejoices and is attached to Your glory; demons flee in fear to all directions, and all hosts of Siddhas bow to You.
Hinglish (1): Hey Hrishikesha, aapki prashansa se jagat anandit hota hai; rakshas bhag jaate hain, siddh pranam karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Hrishikesh, yeh uchit hi hai ki aapke kirtan se jagat harshit ho raha hai aur anurakt ho raha hai. Bhaybheet rakshas dishaon mein bhaag rahe hain aur sabhi siddh-samooh aapko pranam kar rahe hain.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या जगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्ति सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसङ्घाः
Arjuna said: It is fitting, O Hrishikesha, that the world rejoices and is attached to Your glory; demons flee in fear to all directions, and all hosts of Siddhas bow to You.
Hey Hrishikesha, aapki prashansa se jagat anandit hota hai; rakshas bhag jaate hain, siddh pranam karte hain.

Sanskrit verse: कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन् गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत्
Translation (English): Why should they not bow to You, O great soul, greater than Brahma, primal creator, infinite, God of gods, abode of the world, imperishable, beyond being and non‑being?
Hinglish (1): Hey Mahatma, aap Brahma se bade, anant, devon ke dev, jagat ke nivas, akshar, sat-asat se pare hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Mahatma, aap Brahma ke bhi aadi-karta hain, aapse bhi shreshth hain, toh ve aapko pranam kyun na karein? Hey Anant, hey Devesh, hey Jagannivas! Aap hi akshar (avinashi) hain, sat aur asat se bhi pare hain.
message:
कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन् गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत्
Why should they not bow to You, O great soul, greater than Brahma, primal creator, infinite, God of gods, abode of the world, imperishable, beyond being and non‑being?
Hey Mahatma, aap Brahma se bade, anant, devon ke dev, jagat ke nivas, akshar, sat-asat se pare hain.

Sanskrit verse: त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराणस्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं धाम त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप
Translation (English): O primal God, ancient Person, You are the supreme resting place of this universe; You are the knower and the knowable, the supreme abode; by You the universe is pervaded.
Hinglish (1): Aap pratham dev, puratan purush, jagat ka param sthan, gyaata, gyaeya, param dham, aap anant roop me jagat me vyapit hain.
Hinglish (2): Aap aadi-dev, sanatan Purush hain. Aap is vishwa ke param aashray hain. Aap hi janne waale, janne yogy aur param dhaam hain. Hey anant-roop, aapse hi yeh vishwa vyaapt hai.
message:
त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराणस्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं धाम त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप
O primal God, ancient Person, You are the supreme resting place of this universe; You are the knower and the knowable, the supreme abode; by You the universe is pervaded.
Aap pratham dev, puratan purush, jagat ka param sthan, gyaata, gyaeya, param dham, aap anant roop me jagat me vyapit hain.

Sanskrit verse: वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुणः शशांकः प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्वः पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते
Translation (English): You are Vayu, Yama, Agni, Varuna, moon, Prajapati, and great‑grandfather; salutation to You a thousand times, again and again salutations!
Hinglish (1): Aap Vayu, Yam, Agni, Varun, Chandra, Prajapati, pitamah ke bhi pitamah hain; sau-sau baar pranam.
Hinglish (2): Aap Vayu, Yama, Agni, Varuna, Chandrama, Prajapati aur prapitamah (great-grandfather) hain. Aapko hazaar baar namaskar, phir se baar-baar namaskar.
message:
वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुणः शशांकः प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्वः पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते
You are Vayu, Yama, Agni, Varuna, moon, Prajapati, and great‑grandfather; salutation to You a thousand times, again and again salutations!
Aap Vayu, Yam, Agni, Varun, Chandra, Prajapati, pitamah ke bhi pitamah hain; sau-sau baar pranam.

Sanskrit verse: नमः पुरस्तादनु प्रृष्टथोऽस्तु नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वं सर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्वः
Translation (English): Salutations before, behind, and on all sides; O infinite in valor and power, You pervade all, therefore You are all.
Hinglish (1): Aage, peeche, chaaro or pranam; anant shakti-shali, veer, aap sabme vyapit ho, isliye aap sab kuch ho.
Hinglish (2): Aapko aage se, peeche se, aur sabhi dishaon se namaskar ho! Hey Sarva! Aap anant veerya aur amit parakram waale hain. Aap sab mein vyaapt hain, isliye aap hi sab kuch hain.
Summary: Final sweeping salutation to the cosmic form.
message:
नमः पुरस्तादनु प्रृष्टथोऽस्तु नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वं सर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्वः
Salutations before, behind, and on all sides; O infinite in valor and power, You pervade all, therefore You are all.
Aage, peeche, chaaro or pranam; anant shakti-shali, veer, aap sabme vyapit ho, isliye aap sab kuch ho.

Sanskrit verse: सखेत्यन्यमन्यं समसमूढचित्ता त्वा प्रसाध्यायथेदं मया प्रमादात् यच्युक्तं चाहास्यहितं प्रविष्टं मया प्रभूत्वं महाद्भुतरूपम्
Translation (English): In thinking of You as a friend, rashly and in affection, I may have addressed You casually as “O Krishna,” “O Yadava,” “O friend,” without knowing this greatness of Yours—please forgive me.
Hinglish (1): Tumhe dost maankar maine “Krishna”, “Yadava”, “Sakha” kehkar jo ajnaana vash kaha, mujhe kshama karo.
Hinglish (2): Aapki is mahima ko na jaante hue, maine pramaad-vash ya prem-vash aapko 'Hey Krishna', 'Hey Yadav', 'Hey Sakha' kehkar jo bhi sambodhit kiya, uske liye kshama chahta hoon.
message:
सखेत्यन्यमन्यं समसमूढचित्ता त्वा प्रसाध्यायथेदं मया प्रमादात् यच्युक्तं चाहास्यहितं प्रविष्टं मया प्रभूत्वं महाद्भुतरूपम्
In thinking of You as a friend, rashly and in affection, I may have addressed You casually as “O Krishna,” “O Yadava,” “O friend,” without knowing this greatness of Yours—please forgive me.
Tumhe dost maankar maine “Krishna”, “Yadava”, “Sakha” kehkar jo ajnaana vash kaha, mujhe kshama karo.

Sanskrit verse: यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसि विहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षं तत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम्
Translation (English): And whatever disrespect I showed You in jest while playing, resting, sitting, eating, alone or in company—O Achyuta, immeasurable One—please forgive that.
Hinglish (1): Khelte, baithte, khate, akelay ya sabke saamne jo maine anadar kiya, uske liye kshama chahta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Aur hey Achyuta, vihar, shaiyya, aasan ya bhojan ke samay, akele ya doston ke saamne, maine parihas mein aapka jo bhi apmaan kiya ho, us apramey (immeasurable) ke liye main aapse kshama maangta hoon.
message:
यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसि विहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षं तत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम्
And whatever disrespect I showed You in jest while playing, resting, sitting, eating, alone or in company—O Achyuta, immeasurable One—please forgive that.
Khelte, baithte, khate, akelay ya sabke saamne jo maine anadar kiya, uske liye kshama chahta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्य त्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुरगरीयान। न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिकः कुतोऽन्यो लोकत्रयेप्यप्रतिमप्रभावः
Translation (English): You are the father of the moving and unmoving world, worthy of worship, the supreme teacher; no one equals You, how then another superior, in the three worlds, O unequaled power?
Hinglish (1): Aap charachar jagat ke pita, pujya guru hain, aapke barabar koi nahi, phir badhkar to koi ho hi nahi sakta.
Hinglish (2): Aap is char-achar lok ke pita, poojniya aur sabse bade guru hain. Hey apratim-prabhav, teeno lokon mein aapke samaan koi nahi hai, toh aapse adhik kaun ho sakta hai?
message:
पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्य त्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुरगरीयान। न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिकः कुतोऽन्यो लोकत्रयेप्यप्रतिमप्रभावः
You are the father of the moving and unmoving world, worthy of worship, the supreme teacher; no one equals You, how then another superior, in the three worlds, O unequaled power?
Aap charachar jagat ke pita, pujya guru hain, aapke barabar koi nahi, phir badhkar to koi ho hi nahi sakta.

Sanskrit verse: तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायं प्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम। पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्युः प्रियः प्रियायार्हसी देव सोढुम्
Translation (English): Therefore, bowing my body, I seek Your grace, Lord worthy of praise; as a father forgives a son, a friend a friend, or a lover a beloved, please bear with me.
Hinglish (1): Isliye sharir jhukaakar main aapka prasada mangta hoon; pita‑putra, mitra‑mitra, priya‑priya ki tarah mujhe kshama karein.
Hinglish (2): Isliye, main apne shareer ko jhukakar, pranam karke, aap poojniya Ishwar se kripa ki yaachana karta hoon. Hey Dev, jaise pita putra ke, mitra mitra ke, aur priyatam priyatama ke aparaadh ko sehan kar leta hai, waise hi aap bhi kripya sehan karein.
message:
तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायं प्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम। पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्युः प्रियः प्रियायार्हसी देव सोढुम्
Therefore, bowing my body, I seek Your grace, Lord worthy of praise; as a father forgives a son, a friend a friend, or a lover a beloved, please bear with me.
Isliye sharir jhukaakar main aapka prasada mangta hoon; pita‑putra, mitra‑mitra, priya‑priya ki tarah mujhe kshama karein.

Sanskrit verse: अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वा भयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे तत्समसित्वं रूपमदार्शय त्वं प्रसादये देव जगन्निवास
Translation (English): O God, having seen what was never seen before, I rejoice, yet my mind trembles with fear; show me again Your former form, O abode of the universe.
Hinglish (1): Main anupam roop dekh kar anandit hoon, par bhay bhi laga; kripya apna purana roop dikhaiye.
Hinglish (2): Pehle kabhi na dekhe gaye aapke is roop ko dekhkar main harshit hoon, par mera mann bhay se vyathit bhi hai. Hey Dev, hey Jagannivas, kripya prasann hokar mujhe apna wahi (chaturbhuj) roop dikhaiye.
Summary: Arjuna requests return to gentle form.
message:
अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वा भयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे तत्समसित्वं रूपमदार्शय त्वं प्रसादये देव जगन्निवास
O God, having seen what was never seen before, I rejoice, yet my mind trembles with fear; show me again Your former form, O abode of the universe.
Main anupam roop dekh kar anandit hoon, par bhay bhi laga; kripya apna purana roop dikhaiye.

Sanskrit verse: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्तं इच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते
Translation (English): I wish to see You as before, crowned, bearing a mace and discus, in that same four‑armed form, O thousand‑armed, universal form.
Hinglish (1): Main apko mukut, gada, chakra, chaturbhuj roop me dekhna chahta hoon, he sahastrabahu.
Hinglish (2): Main aapko waisa hi mukut-dhaari, gada aur chakra haath mein liye hue dekhna chahta hoon. Hey Vishwa-moorte, hey Sahasra-bahu, kripya apne usi chaturbhuj roop mein prakat hoiye.
message:
किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्तं इच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते
I wish to see You as before, crowned, bearing a mace and discus, in that same four‑armed form, O thousand‑armed, universal form.
Main apko mukut, gada, chakra, chaturbhuj roop me dekhna chahta hoon, he sahastrabahu.

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदं रूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात् तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यम्
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: Out of grace, I have shown to you, Arjuna, through My own yoga, this supreme, radiant, infinite, primal universal form.
Hinglish (1): Mainne apne yog se tumhe kripa karke yeh tejomay, anant, aadi vishwaroop dikhaya hai.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Hey Arjun, maine prasann hokar, apni aatm-yog-shakti se tumhein apna yeh param, tejomay, anant, aadi vishwa-roop dikhaya hai.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदं रूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात् तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यम्
The Blessed Lord said: Out of grace, I have shown to you, Arjuna, through My own yoga, this supreme, radiant, infinite, primal universal form.
Mainne apne yog se tumhe kripa karke yeh tejomay, anant, aadi vishwaroop dikhaya hai.

Sanskrit verse: न वेद yajñādhyayanैर् नैव दानैर् न च क्रियाभिः न च तपोभिरुग्रैः एवंरूपः शक्य अहं लोके दृष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर
Translation (English): Not by study of Vedas, sacrifice, gifts, rituals, or severe austerities can I be seen in this form by anyone here except you, O hero of Kurus.
Hinglish (1): Vedadhyayan, yajya, daan, kriya, kathor tap se koi is roop ko nahi dekh sakta tumhare sivay.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kuru-praver, is manushya-lok mein tumhare alawa, na toh Ved, na yajna, na adhyayan, na daan, na kriyaon aur na hi ugra tap se, main is roop mein dekha ja sakta hoon.
message:
न वेद yajñādhyayanैर् नैव दानैर् न च क्रियाभिः न च तपोभिरुग्रैः एवंरूपः शक्य अहं लोके दृष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर
Not by study of Vedas, sacrifice, gifts, rituals, or severe austerities can I be seen in this form by anyone here except you, O hero of Kurus.
Vedadhyayan, yajya, daan, kriya, kathor tap se koi is roop ko nahi dekh sakta tumhare sivay.

Sanskrit verse: मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो दृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम् व्यपेतभीः प्रीतिमान्भव पुनस्त्वं तद्रूपमेदं प्रपश्य मे त्वम्
Translation (English): Do not be afraid or bewildered on seeing this terrible form of Mine; freed from fear and with gladness, behold again My former form.
Hinglish (1): Mere bhayanak roop se na ghabrao, na bhramit ho; bina bhay ke mera purana roop dekho.
Hinglish (2): Mere is prakaar ke ghor roop ko dekhkar tumhein na toh vyatha honi chahiye aur na hi moh. Bhay-mukt aur prasann-chitt hokar, tum mere us (chaturbhuj) roop ko phir se dekho.
message:
मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो दृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम् व्यपेतभीः प्रीतिमान्भव पुनस्त्वं तद्रूपमेदं प्रपश्य मे त्वम्
Do not be afraid or bewildered on seeing this terrible form of Mine; freed from fear and with gladness, behold again My former form.
Mere bhayanak roop se na ghabrao, na bhramit ho; bina bhay ke mera purana roop dekho.
tags: overcoming fear, mental peace, inner peace

Sanskrit verse: सञ्जय उवाच इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वा स्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूयः आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनं भूत्वा पुनः सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा
Translation (English): Sanjaya said: Speaking thus to Arjuna, Vasudeva again showed His own form, and the great soul, becoming gentle again, comforted the frightened one.
Hinglish (1): Krishna ne apna pehle wala roop dikhaya aur saumya swaroop me Arjun ko shant kiya.
Hinglish (2): Sanjay ne kaha: Vasudev ne Arjun se is prakaar kehkar, phir se apna (chaturbhuj) roop dikhaya. Aur phir, us mahatma ne saumya roop dhaaran karke us bhaybheet Arjun ko aashvasan diya.
Summary: Return to the gentle human form.
message:
सञ्जय उवाच इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वा स्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूयः आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनं भूत्वा पुनः सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा
Sanjaya said: Speaking thus to Arjuna, Vasudeva again showed His own form, and the great soul, becoming gentle again, comforted the frightened one.
Krishna ne apna pehle wala roop dikhaya aur saumya swaroop me Arjun ko shant kiya.

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन इदानीमस्मि संवृत्तः सचेताः प्रकृतिं गतः
Translation (English): I see now Your gentle human form, O Janardana; I have regained composure and my nature is restored.
Hinglish (1): Hey Janardan, ab aapke manushya roop se main shant hua hoon, svabhaav me laut aaya hoon.
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Janardan, aapke is atyant saumya manushya-roop ko dekhkar, ab mera chitt sthir ho gaya hai aur main apni svaabhavik avastha mein aa gaya hoon.
Summary: Relieved at return to the familiar.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन इदानीमस्मि संवृत्तः सचेताः प्रकृतिं गतः
I see now Your gentle human form, O Janardana; I have regained composure and my nature is restored.
Hey Janardan, ab aapke manushya roop se main shant hua hoon, svabhaav me laut aaya hoon.

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम देवाः अपि ह्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: This form of Mine which you have seen is very difficult to behold; even the gods constantly desire to see it.
Hinglish (1): Mera roop, jo tumne dekha, devta bhi sada dekhne ki ichha rakhte hain, par mushkil hai.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Mera yeh roop, jise tumne dekha hai, atyant durlabh-darshan hai. Devta bhi hamesha is roop ke darshan ki aakanksha rakhte hain.
Summary: Stresses the rarity of the vision.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम देवाः अपि ह्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः
The Blessed Lord said: This form of Mine which you have seen is very difficult to behold; even the gods constantly desire to see it.
Mera roop, jo tumne dekha, devta bhi sada dekhne ki ichha rakhte hain, par mushkil hai.

Sanskrit verse: नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानैर्न चेज्यया शक्य एवंविधो दृष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा
Translation (English): I cannot be seen in this form through Vedas, austerity, gifts, or worship as you have seen Me now.
Hinglish (1): Ved, tap, dan, yajna—kisi se bhi mujhe is roop me nahi dekha ja sakta jaise tumne dekha.
Hinglish (2): Na toh Vedon se, na tap se, na daan se, aur na hi yajna se, main is roop mein dekha ja sakta hoon, jaisa tumne mujhe dekha hai.
Summary: Rejects common ritual as path to this vision.
message:
नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानैर्न चेज्यया शक्य एवंविधो दृष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा
I cannot be seen in this form through Vedas, austerity, gifts, or worship as you have seen Me now.
Ved, tap, dan, yajna—kisi se bhi mujhe is roop me nahi dekha ja sakta jaise tumne dekha.

Sanskrit verse: भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन ज्ञातुं दृष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप
Translation (English): But by undivided devotion I can be truly known, seen in this form, and entered into, O Parantapa.
Hinglish (1): Par ananya bhakti se mujhe jaanna, dekhna, aur pravesh karna sambhav hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey shatru-vijeta Arjun, kewal ananya bhakti ke dwara hi mujhe is roop mein tattva se jaana, dekha aur mujhme pravesh kiya ja sakta hai.
message:
भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन ज्ञातुं दृष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप
But by undivided devotion I can be truly known, seen in this form, and entered into, O Parantapa.
Par ananya bhakti se mujhe jaanna, dekhna, aur pravesh karna sambhav hai.

Sanskrit verse: मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव
Translation (English): He who works for Me, makes Me the supreme goal, is devoted to Me, free from attachment, without enmity to any being—that person comes to Me, O Pandava.
Hinglish (1): Jo mera karm kare, mujhe param maaney, mujhme bhakt ho, asakta ho, bina vair ke rahe, vah mujhme milta hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Pandav, jo mere liye karm karta hai, mujhe hi param lakshya maanta hai, mera bhakt hai, attachment-rahit hai, aur sabhi praaniyon se dvesh-rahit hai - wahi mujhe prapt karta hai.
Summary: Final prescription of karma‑bhakti for union with Krishna.
message:
मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव
He who works for Me, makes Me the supreme goal, is devoted to Me, free from attachment, without enmity to any being—that person comes to Me, O Pandava.
Jo mera karm kare, mujhe param maaney, mujhme bhakt ho, asakta ho, bina vair ke rahe, vah mujhme milta hai.
tags: Nishkama Karma, Bhakti Yoga, Moksha, detachment

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच एवં सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमाः
Translation (English): Arjuna said: Those devotees who are ever engaged in worshiping You, and those who worship the imperishable unmanifest—which of them are better versed in yoga?
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Jo aapka bhajan karte hain aur jo akshar avyakt ka poojan karte hain—inhme kaun yog me shreshth hai?
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Jo bhakt hamesha aapki bhakti mein lage rehte hain aur jo avinashi, avyakt (nirakaar) Brahman ki upasana karte hain - un dono mein se kaun behtar yogi hai?
Summary: Arjuna asks about personal vs. impersonal worship.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच एवં सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमाः
Arjuna said: Those devotees who are ever engaged in worshiping You, and those who worship the imperishable unmanifest—which of them are better versed in yoga?
Arjun bola: Jo aapka bhajan karte hain aur jo akshar avyakt ka poojan karte hain—inhme kaun yog me shreshth hai?
tags: Bhakti Yoga, Jnana Yoga, confusion, indecision

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मताः
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: Those who, fixing their mind on Me, ever steadfast, worship Me with supreme faith, are considered by Me the best yogis.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Jo man mujhme lagakar, nitya yukta ho, shraddha se pooja kare, vah sabse shreshth yogi hai.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Jo log apne mann ko mujhme sthir karke, hamesha yukt hokar, param shraddha se meri upasana karte hain, ve mere mat mein param shreshth yogi hain.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मताः
The Blessed Lord said: Those who, fixing their mind on Me, ever steadfast, worship Me with supreme faith, are considered by Me the best yogis.
Shri Krishna bole: Jo man mujhme lagakar, nitya yukta ho, shraddha se pooja kare, vah sabse shreshth yogi hai.

Sanskrit verse: ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यं च कूटस्थमचलं ध्रुवम्
Translation (English): But those who worship the imperishable, indescribable, unmanifest, all-pervading, inconceivable, fixed, immovable, and constant...
Hinglish (1): Jo akshar, anirdeshya, avyakt, sarvavyapi, achintya, sthir, achal ko poojte hain...
Hinglish (2): Parantu jo log avinashi, anirdeshya, avyakt, sarvavyapi, achintya, avichal, sthir aur nitya (Brahman) ki upasana karte hain...
Summary: Describes qualities of the impersonal Absolute.
message:
ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यं च कूटस्थमचलं ध्रुवम्
But those who worship the imperishable, indescribable, unmanifest, all-pervading, inconceivable, fixed, immovable, and constant...
Jo akshar, anirdeshya, avyakt, sarvavyapi, achintya, sthir, achal ko poojte hain...

Sanskrit verse: संनियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धयः ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रताः
Translation (English): Restraining all senses, even-minded everywhere, engaged in the welfare of all beings—they too come to Me.
Hinglish (1): Indriya sanyam, sama buddhi, sarvahit me lage huye, yeh log bhi mujhme aate hain.
Hinglish (2): ...apni sabhi indriyon ko sanyamit karke, sab jagah samaan buddhi rakhte hue, aur sabhi praaniyon ke hit mein lage rehte hain, ve bhi antatah mujhe hi prapt karte hain.
Summary: Impersonal worshippers can also reach God.
message:
संनियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धयः ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रताः
Restraining all senses, even-minded everywhere, engaged in the welfare of all beings—they too come to Me.
Indriya sanyam, sama buddhi, sarvahit me lage huye, yeh log bhi mujhme aate hain.

Sanskrit verse: क्लेशोऽधिकतरस्तेषामव्यक्तासक्तचेतसाम् अव्यक्ता हि गतिर्दुःखं देहवद्भिरवाप्यते
Translation (English): But greater is the difficulty for those whose minds are attached to the unmanifest; for the embodied, the unmanifest path is arduous.
Hinglish (1): Dehdharion ke liye avyakt upasana mushkil hai.
Hinglish (2): Jinke mann avyakt (nirakaar) mein aasakt hain, unke liye klesh adhik hota hai. Kyunki dehdhaari jeevon ke liye avyakt gati (nirakaar maarg) dukh-poorvak hi prapt hoti hai.
Summary: Personal devotion is easier for most.
message:
क्लेशोऽधिकतरस्तेषामव्यक्तासक्तचेतसाम् अव्यक्ता हि गतिर्दुःखं देहवद्भिरवाप्यते
But greater is the difficulty for those whose minds are attached to the unmanifest; for the embodied, the unmanifest path is arduous.
Dehdharion ke liye avyakt upasana mushkil hai.

Sanskrit verse: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्पराः अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते
Translation (English): But those who surrender all works to Me, regarding Me as supreme, and worship Me with exclusive meditation...
Hinglish (1): Jo karm mujhme arpit kar, mujhe param maankar, ananya yog se mujhe dhyate hain...
Hinglish (2): Parantu jo log apne sabhi karmon ko mujhe arpit karke, mere paraayan hokar, ananya yog se mera hi dhyan aur upasana karte hain...
message:
ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्पराः अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते
But those who surrender all works to Me, regarding Me as supreme, and worship Me with exclusive meditation...
Jo karm mujhme arpit kar, mujhe param maankar, ananya yog se mujhe dhyate hain...

Sanskrit verse: तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात् भवामि नचिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम्
Translation (English): For them, whose mind is fixed on Me, O Partha, I quickly become the deliverer from the ocean of birth and death.
Hinglish (1): Jinka man mujhme sthir hai, unhe main janm-mrityu sagar se nikalta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, unka, jinka chitt mujhme sthit hai, main is mrityu-roopi sansaar-saagar se shighra hi uddhaar karne waala ban jaata hoon.
Summary: God’s swift grace to true devotees.
message:
तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात् भवामि नचिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम्
For them, whose mind is fixed on Me, O Partha, I quickly become the deliverer from the ocean of birth and death.
Jinka man mujhme sthir hai, unhe main janm-mrityu sagar se nikalta hoon.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, Moksha, fear of death, reincarnation

Sanskrit verse: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः
Translation (English): Fix your mind in Me alone, place your intellect in Me; thus you will live in Me hereafter, without doubt.
Hinglish (1): Apna man-buddhi sirf mujhme lagao; aage tum mujhme hi rahoge.
Hinglish (2): Apne mann ko kewal mujhme hi sthir karo aur apni buddhi ko mujhme hi lagao. Iske baad, tum nishchit roop se mujhme hi nivaas karoge, ismein koi sandeh nahi.
message:
मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः
Fix your mind in Me alone, place your intellect in Me; thus you will live in Me hereafter, without doubt.
Apna man-buddhi sirf mujhme lagao; aage tum mujhme hi rahoge.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, Raja Yoga, ध्यान, Moksha

Sanskrit verse: अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम् अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्तुं धनञ्जय
Translation (English): But if you cannot steadily fix the mind in Me, then seek to reach Me by the practice of yoga, O Dhananjaya.
Hinglish (1): Agar man sthir nahi hota, toh abhyas yog ke zariye mujhe prapt karo.
Hinglish (2): Hey Dhananjaya, yadi tum apne chitt ko mujhme sthir nahi kar sakte, toh abhyaas-yog ke dwara mujhe prapt karne ki ichha karo.
message:
अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम् अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्तुं धनञ्जय
But if you cannot steadily fix the mind in Me, then seek to reach Me by the practice of yoga, O Dhananjaya.
Agar man sthir nahi hota, toh abhyas yog ke zariye mujhe prapt karo.
tags: Raja Yoga, ધ્યાન, lack of focus, Bhakti Yoga

Sanskrit verse: अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव मदर्थमपि कर्माणि कुर्वन्सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि
Translation (English): If you are incapable of practice, be intent on working for Me; even doing actions for My sake, you shall attain perfection.
Hinglish (1): Agar abhyas bhi na ho, mere liye karm karo; isse siddhi milegi.
Hinglish (2): Yadi tum abhyaas karne mein bhi asamarth ho, toh mere liye hi karm karne ke paraayan ho jao. Mere liye karm karte hue bhi tum siddhi ko prapt karoge.
message:
अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव मदर्थमपि कर्माणि कुर्वन्सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि
If you are incapable of practice, be intent on working for Me; even doing actions for My sake, you shall attain perfection.
Agar abhyas bhi na ho, mere liye karm karo; isse siddhi milegi.

Sanskrit verse: अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रितः सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं ततः कुरु यतात्मवान्
Translation (English): If you cannot do even this, then, resorting to My yoga, renounce the fruits of all action with self-control.
Hinglish (1): Agar ye bhi na ho, to mere yog ka ashray le aur karmfal ka tyag karo.
Hinglish (2): Yadi tum yeh bhi karne mein asamarth ho, toh mere yog ke aashrit hokar, sanyami-bhaav se sabhi karmon ke phal ka tyag kar do.
message:
अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रितः सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं ततः कुरु यतात्मवान्
If you cannot do even this, then, resorting to My yoga, renounce the fruits of all action with self-control.
Agar ye bhi na ho, to mere yog ka ashray le aur karmfal ka tyag karo.

Sanskrit verse: श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं विशिष्यते ध्यानात्कर्मफलत्यागस्त्यागाच्छान्तिरनन्तरम्
Translation (English): Better than practice is knowledge; better than knowledge is meditation; better than meditation is renunciation of results—peace follows renunciation.
Hinglish (1): Abhyas se gyaan behtar, gyaan se dhyan behtar, dhyan se karmfal tyag shreshth hai—isse shanti milti hai.
Hinglish (2): Abhyaas se gyaan shreshth hai, gyaan se dhyan shreshth hai, aur dhyan se karm-phalon ka tyag shreshth hai. Kyunki tyag se turant shaanti prapt hoti hai.
message:
श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं विशिष्यते ध्यानात्कर्मफलत्यागस्त्यागाच्छान्तिरनन्तरम्
Better than practice is knowledge; better than knowledge is meditation; better than meditation is renunciation of results—peace follows renunciation.
Abhyas se gyaan behtar, gyaan se dhyan behtar, dhyan se karmfal tyag shreshth hai—isse shanti milti hai.
tags: Jnana Yoga, Raja Yoga, ધ્યાન, Nishkama Karma, mental peace

Sanskrit verse: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी
Translation (English): He who has no hatred for any being, is friendly and compassionate, free from possessiveness and ego, equal in pain and pleasure, and forgiving...
Hinglish (1): Jo kisi se dvesh na kare, sabse mitra, dayalu, niroposhak, nirahankari, sukh-dukh me samaan, kshamashil hai...
Hinglish (2): Jo kisi praani se dvesh nahi karta, jo sabka mitra aur karunaamay hai, jo mamta aur ahankar se rahit hai, jo sukh-dukh mein samaan rehta hai, aur jo kshamaavaan hai...
message:
अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी
He who has no hatred for any being, is friendly and compassionate, free from possessiveness and ego, equal in pain and pleasure, and forgiving...
Jo kisi se dvesh na kare, sabse mitra, dayalu, niroposhak, nirahankari, sukh-dukh me samaan, kshamashil hai...

Sanskrit verse: सन्तुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः
Translation (English): Content always, self-controlled, firm in resolve, with mind and intellect dedicated to Me—such a devotee is dear to Me.
Hinglish (1): Hamesha santusht, yogi, sanyami, dridhnishchayi, man-buddhi mujhme arpit—aisa bhakt mujhe priya hai.
Hinglish (2): Aisa hamesha santusht yogi, jo dridh nishchay ke saath apne mann aur buddhi ko mujhe arpit kar chuka hai, woh bhakt mujhe priya hai.
message:
सन्तुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः
Content always, self-controlled, firm in resolve, with mind and intellect dedicated to Me—such a devotee is dear to Me.
Hamesha santusht, yogi, sanyami, dridhnishchayi, man-buddhi mujhme arpit—aisa bhakt mujhe priya hai.

Sanskrit verse: यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च यः हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः
Translation (English): One who does not disturb others, nor is disturbed by others, who is free from joy, anger, fear, and agitation—is dear to Me.
Hinglish (1): Jo na kisi ko pareshan kare na khud pareshan ho, hansi-ros-bhay-udhveg se mukt ho—vo mujhe priya hai.
Hinglish (2): Jisse na toh koi lok udvign hota hai aur na hi jo swayam kisi lok se udvign hota hai, aur jo harsh, amarsh (jealousy), bhay aur udveg se mukt hai, woh mujhe priya hai.
message:
यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च यः हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः
One who does not disturb others, nor is disturbed by others, who is free from joy, anger, fear, and agitation—is dear to Me.
Jo na kisi ko pareshan kare na khud pareshan ho, hansi-ros-bhay-udhveg se mukt ho—vo mujhe priya hai.
tags: mental peace, inner peace, how to stay calm

Sanskrit verse: अनपेक्षः शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथः सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः
Translation (English): Free from dependence, pure, able, unconcerned, free from distress, renouncing all undertakings—such a devotee is dear to Me.
Hinglish (1): Swatantra, pavitra, kushal, udasin, vyatharahit, sab arambh tyag karne wala—vo mujhe priya hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo apeksha-rahit, pavitra, daksh (skilled), udaseen (impartial), vyatha-rahit aur sabhi aarambhon ka tyagi hai, woh bhakt mujhe priya hai.
message:
अनपेक्षः शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथः सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः
Free from dependence, pure, able, unconcerned, free from distress, renouncing all undertakings—such a devotee is dear to Me.
Swatantra, pavitra, kushal, udasin, vyatharahit, sab arambh tyag karne wala—vo mujhe priya hai.

Sanskrit verse: यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्षति शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्यः स मे प्रियः
Translation (English): One who neither rejoices nor hates, neither grieves nor desires, renouncing both good and evil, and devoted—is dear to Me.
Hinglish (1): Jo na khushi me uchhalta, na dvesh karta, na shok karta, na iccha karta, shubh-ashubh tyag kar deta hai—vo priya hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo na toh kabhi harshit hota hai, na dvesh karta hai, na shok karta hai, na kaamna karta hai, aur jo shubh aur ashubh dono ka tyagi hai, woh bhakti-yukta manushya mujhe priya hai.
message:
यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्षति शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्यः स मे प्रियः
One who neither rejoices nor hates, neither grieves nor desires, renouncing both good and evil, and devoted—is dear to Me.
Jo na khushi me uchhalta, na dvesh karta, na shok karta, na iccha karta, shubh-ashubh tyag kar deta hai—vo priya hai.

Sanskrit verse: समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु समः सङ्गविवर्जितः
Translation (English): Equal towards friend and foe, in honor and dishonor, in heat and cold, pleasure and pain, free from attachment...
Hinglish (1): Mitra-shatru, maan-apmaan, garmi-thand, sukh-dukh me samaan, asakta...
Hinglish (2): Jo shatru aur mitra mein, maan aur apmaan mein samaan hai, jo sardi-garmi aur sukh-dukh mein samaan hai, aur jo attachment se poori tarah mukt hai...
message:
समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु समः सङ्गविवर्जितः
Equal towards friend and foe, in honor and dishonor, in heat and cold, pleasure and pain, free from attachment...
Mitra-shatru, maan-apmaan, garmi-thand, sukh-dukh me samaan, asakta...

Sanskrit verse: तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येनकेनचित् अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः
Translation (English): Equal in blame and praise, silent, content with whatever comes, without home, firm in mind, and devoted—such a man is dear to Me.
Hinglish (1): Ninda-stuti me samaan, mauni, jo milta hai usme santusht, aniket, sthir man, bhakt—vo mujhe priya hai.
Hinglish (2): ...jo ninda aur stuti ko samaan samajhta hai, jo maun rehta hai, jo jaisa bhi mil jaaye usmein santusht rehta hai, jo nivaas-sthan mein mamta-rahit hai, aur jiski buddhi sthir hai, woh bhakti-maan manushya mujhe priya hai.
message:
तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येनकेनचित् अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः
Equal in blame and praise, silent, content with whatever comes, without home, firm in mind, and devoted—such a man is dear to Me.
Ninda-stuti me samaan, mauni, jo milta hai usme santusht, aniket, sthir man, bhakt—vo mujhe priya hai.
tags: equanimity, inner peace, mental peace, detachment

Sanskrit verse: ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते श्रद्धधानाः मत्परमाः भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रियाः
Translation (English): Those faithful devotees who follow this nectar of dharma as described, making Me supreme, are exceedingly dear to Me.
Hinglish (1): Is dharm roop amrit ko shraddha se apnane wale, mujhe param maanne wale bhakt—mujhe bahut priya hain.
Hinglish (2): Parantu, jo shraddha-vaan log mere paraayan hokar is dharm-may amrit ka, jaisa maine kaha hai, paalan karte hain, ve bhakt mujhe atyant priya hain.
Summary: Krishna ends with praise for true bhaktas.
message:
ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते श्रद्धधानाः मत्परमाः भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रियाः
Those faithful devotees who follow this nectar of dharma as described, making Me supreme, are exceedingly dear to Me.
Is dharm roop amrit ko shraddha se apnane wale, mujhe param maanne wale bhakt—mujhe bahut priya hain.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, Moksha, Dharma, inner peace

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव
Translation (English): Arjuna said: O Keshava, I wish to know about nature and the person, the field and the knower of the field, as well as knowledge and the knowable.
Hinglish (1): Arjun bole: Hey Keshav, main prakriti, purush, kshetra, kshetragya, gyaan aur gyaeya ko jaanna chahta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Keshav, main Prakriti (nature), Purusha (enjoyer), Kshetra (field), Kshetrajna (knower of the field), Gyaan (knowledge) aur Jneya (object of knowledge) ke baare mein jaanna chahta hoon.
Summary: Arjuna seeks definitions of key philosophical terms.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव
Arjuna said: O Keshava, I wish to know about nature and the person, the field and the knower of the field, as well as knowledge and the knowable.
Arjun bole: Hey Keshav, main prakriti, purush, kshetra, kshetragya, gyaan aur gyaeya ko jaanna chahta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: This body, O Kaunteya, is called the field; one who knows this is called the knower of the field by the wise.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Hey Kaunteya, yeh sharir kshetra hai; jo ise jaanta hai, use kshetragya kehte hain.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Hey Kaunteya, is shareer ko 'Kshetra' (field) kaha jaata hai. Aur jo is Kshetra ko jaanta hai, use tattva-darshi log 'Kshetrajna' (knower of the field) kehte hain.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः
The Blessed Lord said: This body, O Kaunteya, is called the field; one who knows this is called the knower of the field by the wise.
Shri Krishna bole: Hey Kaunteya, yeh sharir kshetra hai; jo ise jaanta hai, use kshetragya kehte hain.

Sanskrit verse: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम
Translation (English): Know Me as the knower of all fields, O Bharata; knowledge of field and knower is true knowledge in My view.
Hinglish (1): Main sab kshetron ka gyaata hoon; kshetra‑kshetragya ka gyaan hi sahi gyaan hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, tum sabhi Kshetron mein Kshetrajna mujhe hi jaano. Kshetra aur Kshetrajna ka gyaan hi, mere mat mein, vastavik gyaan hai.
message:
क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम
Know Me as the knower of all fields, O Bharata; knowledge of field and knower is true knowledge in My view.
Main sab kshetron ka gyaata hoon; kshetra‑kshetragya ka gyaan hi sahi gyaan hai.

Sanskrit verse: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु
Translation (English): What the field is, its changes, whence it is, what it is like, and its influences—hear briefly from Me.
Hinglish (1): Kshetra kya hai, kaise badalta hai, kahan se hai, iska prakriti—mujhse sankshep me suno.
Hinglish (2): Ab mujhse sankshep mein suno ki woh Kshetra kya hai, kaisa hai, iske vikaar (modifications) kya hain, yeh kahan se utpann hota hai, woh Kshetrajna kaun hai, aur uska prabhav kya hai.
message:
तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु
What the field is, its changes, whence it is, what it is like, and its influences—hear briefly from Me.
Kshetra kya hai, kaise badalta hai, kahan se hai, iska prakriti—mujhse sankshep me suno.

Sanskrit verse: ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक् ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितैः
Translation (English): It has been sung in many ways by the sages, in various Vedic hymns, and in well-reasoned, definitive aphorisms of Brahmasutras.
Hinglish (1): Yeh rishiyon ne ved-mantron, aur Brahmasutra ke tarkyukt sutron me bataya hai.
Hinglish (2): Is vishay ko rishiyon ne anek prakaar se gaaya hai, alag-alag vaidik mantron mein varnan kiya hai, aur Brahmasutra ke tark-yukt, nishchit padon mein bhi samjhaya hai.
message:
ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक् ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितैः
It has been sung in many ways by the sages, in various Vedic hymns, and in well-reasoned, definitive aphorisms of Brahmasutras.
Yeh rishiyon ne ved-mantron, aur Brahmasutra ke tarkyukt sutron me bataya hai.

Sanskrit verse: महाभूतान्यहङ्कारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः
Translation (English): The great elements, ego, intellect, unmanifest, ten senses plus one, and the five sense objects...
Hinglish (1): Mahabhoot, ahamkar, buddhi, avyakt, das indriya aur ek mann, paanch vishay...
Hinglish (2): Paanch maha-bhoot (earth, water, etc.), ahankar, buddhi, avyakt (unmanifested prakriti), das indriyan aur ek mann, aur paanch indriya-vishay...
message:
महाभूतान्यहङ्कारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः
The great elements, ego, intellect, unmanifest, ten senses plus one, and the five sense objects...
Mahabhoot, ahamkar, buddhi, avyakt, das indriya aur ek mann, paanch vishay...

Sanskrit verse: इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं संघातश्चेतना धृतिः एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम्
Translation (English): Desire, aversion, pleasure, pain, body mass, consciousness, and resolve—thus briefly the field with modifications is described.
Hinglish (1): Iccha, dvesh, sukh, dukh, deh, chetna, dhriti—ye kshetra ke gun hain.
Hinglish (2): Ichha, dvesh, sukh, dukh, sanghaat (body), chetna (consciousness) aur dhriti (fortitude) - is prakaar, yeh Kshetra apne vikaron sahit sankshep mein bataya gaya hai.
message:
इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं संघातश्चेतना धृतिः एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम्
Desire, aversion, pleasure, pain, body mass, consciousness, and resolve—thus briefly the field with modifications is described.
Iccha, dvesh, sukh, dukh, deh, chetna, dhriti—ye kshetra ke gun hain.

Sanskrit verse: अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः
Translation (English): Humility, unpretentiousness, non-violence, forgiveness, uprightness, service to the teacher, purity, steadfastness, and self-control...
Hinglish (1): Amaanitva, adambhitva, ahimsa, kshama, arjava, guru seva, shauch, sthirata, atma sanyam...
Hinglish (2): Amaanitva (humility), adambhitva (unpretentiousness), ahimsa, kshama, saralta, guru-seva, pavitrata, sthirata aur aatm-sanyam...
message:
अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः
Humility, unpretentiousness, non-violence, forgiveness, uprightness, service to the teacher, purity, steadfastness, and self-control...
Amaanitva, adambhitva, ahimsa, kshama, arjava, guru seva, shauch, sthirata, atma sanyam...

Sanskrit verse: इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहङ्कार एव च जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम्
Translation (English): Detachment from sense objects, absence of ego; contemplation on the evil of birth, death, old age, and disease.
Hinglish (1): Vishayon se asakti rahit, ahamkar rahit, janm-mrityu-jara-rog ke dukh ka vivek.
Hinglish (2): Indriya-vishayon se vairaagya, ahankar ka abhaav, aur janm, mrityu, budhape aur rog ke dukh-roopi dosh ko baar-baar dekhna...
message:
इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहङ्कार एव च जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम्
Detachment from sense objects, absence of ego; contemplation on the evil of birth, death, old age, and disease.
Vishayon se asakti rahit, ahamkar rahit, janm-mrityu-jara-rog ke dukh ka vivek.

Sanskrit verse: असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु
Translation (English): Non‑attachment, absence of clinging to son, wife, home, and constant even‑mindedness towards gain and loss.
Hinglish (1): Putra, patni, ghar me asakti na ho, sukh-dukh me samaan rahe.
Hinglish (2): Putra, patni, ghar aadi mein aasakti aur mamta ka abhaav, aur priya ya apriya ki prapti par hamesha chitt ka samaan rehna...
message:
असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु
Non‑attachment, absence of clinging to son, wife, home, and constant even‑mindedness towards gain and loss.
Putra, patni, ghar me asakti na ho, sukh-dukh me samaan rahe.

Sanskrit verse: मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि
Translation (English): Unswerving devotion to Me in single‑minded yoga, preference for solitude, disinterest in crowds.
Hinglish (1): Mujhme ananya yog se avichal bhakti, akelapan ka priya, bheed se virakti.
Hinglish (2): Mujhme ananya-yog ke dwara avyabhicharini (unwavering) bhakti, ekant sthan mein rehne ka swabhav, aur jan-samuday mein arati (disinterest)...
message:
मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि
Unswerving devotion to Me in single‑minded yoga, preference for solitude, disinterest in crowds.
Mujhme ananya yog se avichal bhakti, akelapan ka priya, bheed se virakti.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, Raja Yoga, ધ્યાન, loneliness

Sanskrit verse: अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा
Translation (English): Persistence in spiritual knowledge, seeing the aim of truth—this is declared knowledge; what is otherwise is ignorance.
Hinglish (1): Nitya adhyatma gyaan, tattva gyaan ka uddeshya samajhna—yeh hi gyaan hai; baaki agyaan.
Hinglish (2): Adhyatmik gyaan mein nityata aur tattva-gyaan ke arth-roop (Paramatma) ka darshan - yeh sab 'gyaan' kaha gaya hai. Iske vipreet jo hai, woh 'agyaan' hai.
message:
अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा
Persistence in spiritual knowledge, seeing the aim of truth—this is declared knowledge; what is otherwise is ignorance.
Nitya adhyatma gyaan, tattva gyaan ka uddeshya samajhna—yeh hi gyaan hai; baaki agyaan.

Sanskrit verse: ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वाऽमृतमश्नुते अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते
Translation (English): I will speak of the knowable, knowing which one enjoys immortality: the beginningless supreme Brahman, said to be neither being nor non‑being.
Hinglish (1): Main tumhe gyaeya bataunga jo janne par amrit milta hai—anaadi brahma jo sat-asat se pare hai.
Hinglish (2): Ab main us Jneya (jaanne yogy) ko bataunga, jise jaankar amritatva prapt hota hai. Woh anadi, param Brahman na toh 'sat' kaha jaata hai aur na hi 'asat'.
message:
ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वाऽमृतमश्नुते अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते
I will speak of the knowable, knowing which one enjoys immortality: the beginningless supreme Brahman, said to be neither being nor non‑being.
Main tumhe gyaeya bataunga jo janne par amrit milta hai—anaadi brahma jo sat-asat se pare hai.

Sanskrit verse: सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति
Translation (English): With hands and feet everywhere, eyes, heads, and faces everywhere, hearing everywhere, It stands pervading all.
Hinglish (1): Uske haath-pair, aankh, sir, mukh, kaan har jagah hain; vah sab me vyapt hai.
Hinglish (2): Uske haath, pair, aankhein, sir, mukh aur kaan sabhi dishaon mein hain. Is prakaar, woh sansaar mein sab kuch vyaapt karke sthit hai.
message:
सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति
With hands and feet everywhere, eyes, heads, and faces everywhere, hearing everywhere, It stands pervading all.
Uske haath-pair, aankh, sir, mukh, kaan har jagah hain; vah sab me vyapt hai.

Sanskrit verse: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निरगुणं गुणभोक्तृ च
Translation (English): Shining through functions of all senses, yet without senses; unattached, supporting all, beyond qualities, yet experiencing qualities.
Hinglish (1): Sab indriyon ke kaam me chamakta, par bina indriyon ka, asakta, sabko dharan karne wala, guna se pare, par gun bhokta.
Hinglish (2): Woh sabhi indriyon ke guno ka prakaashak hai, par swayam indriya-rahit hai. Woh aasakti-rahit hokar bhi sabka dhaarak hai, aur nirgun hokar bhi guno ka bhokta hai.
message:
सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निरगुणं गुणभोक्तृ च
Shining through functions of all senses, yet without senses; unattached, supporting all, beyond qualities, yet experiencing qualities.
Sab indriyon ke kaam me chamakta, par bina indriyon ka, asakta, sabko dharan karne wala, guna se pare, par gun bhokta.

Sanskrit verse: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत्
Translation (English): Outside and inside beings, unmoving and moving; subtle, unknowable, far yet near.
Hinglish (1): Praniyon ke bahar-bheetar, sthir- chanchal dono, sukshma, door bhi, paas bhi.
Hinglish (2): Woh praaniyon ke baahar aur bheetar, char aur achar, sab roop mein hai. Atyant sookshm hone ke kaaran, woh avijneya (unknowable) hai. Woh atyant door bhi hai aur atyant sameep bhi.
message:
बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत्
Outside and inside beings, unmoving and moving; subtle, unknowable, far yet near.
Praniyon ke bahar-bheetar, sthir- chanchal dono, sukshma, door bhi, paas bhi.

Sanskrit verse: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च
Translation (English): Undivided among beings, yet seeming divided; It sustains, destroys, and creates beings.
Hinglish (1): Praniyon me ek hokar bhi alag sa dikhta, palan, vinash, srishti karta.
Hinglish (2): Woh praaniyon mein avibhakt hokar bhi vibhakt ki tarah sthit hai. Woh jaanne yogy tattva praaniyon ka paalan-poshan karne waala, sanhaar karne waala aur utpann karne waala hai.
message:
अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च
Undivided among beings, yet seeming divided; It sustains, destroys, and creates beings.
Praniyon me ek hokar bhi alag sa dikhta, palan, vinash, srishti karta.

Sanskrit verse: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम्
Translation (English): The light of lights, beyond darkness; knowledge, the knowable, and the goal of knowledge—seated in the heart of all.
Hinglish (1): Ujwal ka bhi ujwal, andhkaar se pare, gyaan, gyaeya, gyaan ka lakshya—sabke hriday me sthit.
Hinglish (2): Woh jyotiyon ki bhi jyoti hai aur andhkaar se pare kaha jaata hai. Woh gyaan hai, gyaan ka vishay hai, aur gyaan se prapt hone waala lakshya hai. Woh sabke hriday mein sthit hai.
Summary: Describes Brahman as the inner light.
message:
ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम्
The light of lights, beyond darkness; knowledge, the knowable, and the goal of knowledge—seated in the heart of all.
Ujwal ka bhi ujwal, andhkaar se pare, gyaan, gyaeya, gyaan ka lakshya—sabke hriday me sthit.

Sanskrit verse: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते
Translation (English): Thus the field, knowledge, and the knowable have been briefly described; My devotee, knowing this, attains My state.
Hinglish (1): Is prakar kshetra, gyaan aur gyaeya bata diye; jo bhakt ise jaanta hai, mere swaroop ko paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Is prakaar, Kshetra, Gyaan aur Jneya ko sankshep mein kaha gaya hai. Mera bhakt isko jaankar mere bhaav (swaroop) ko prapt hone ke yogy ho jaata hai.
message:
इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते
Thus the field, knowledge, and the knowable have been briefly described; My devotee, knowing this, attains My state.
Is prakar kshetra, gyaan aur gyaeya bata diye; jo bhakt ise jaanta hai, mere swaroop ko paata hai.

Sanskrit verse: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान्
Translation (English): Know that both nature and spirit are beginningless; know also that modifications and the qualities are born of nature.
Hinglish (1): Prakriti aur purush dono anaadi hai; vikaar aur gun prakriti se utpann hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Prakriti aur Purusha, in dono ko tum anadi jaano. Sabhi vikaaron (modifications) aur guno ko tum prakriti se hi utpann hua jaano.
message:
प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान्
Know that both nature and spirit are beginningless; know also that modifications and the qualities are born of nature.
Prakriti aur purush dono anaadi hai; vikaar aur gun prakriti se utpann hote hain.

Sanskrit verse: कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते
Translation (English): Nature is said to be the cause of cause and effect; the person is said to be the cause in the experience of pleasure and pain.
Hinglish (1): Prakriti karya-karan ki kaaran hai; purush sukh-dukh ka bhokta hai.
Hinglish (2): Kaarya (shareer) aur kaaran (indriyan) ko utpann karne mein prakriti hetu hai. Jabki Purusha (jeevatma) sukh aur dukh ke bhog mein hetu hai.
message:
कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते
Nature is said to be the cause of cause and effect; the person is said to be the cause in the experience of pleasure and pain.
Prakriti karya-karan ki kaaran hai; purush sukh-dukh ka bhokta hai.

Sanskrit verse: पुरুষः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु
Translation (English): The person, situated in nature, experiences the qualities born of nature; attachment to the gunas causes birth in good and evil wombs.
Hinglish (1): Purush prakriti me rahkar guna bhogta hai; asakti janm ka kaaran hai.
Hinglish (2): Prakriti mein sthit Purusha hi prakriti se utpann hue guno ko bhogta hai. In guno ka sang (association) hi is jeevatma ke achhi-buri yoniyon mein janm lene ka kaaran hai.
message:
पुरুষः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु
The person, situated in nature, experiences the qualities born of nature; attachment to the gunas causes birth in good and evil wombs.
Purush prakriti me rahkar guna bhogta hai; asakti janm ka kaaran hai.

Sanskrit verse: उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः
Translation (English): In this body, the Supreme is described as the overseer, permitter, supporter, enjoyer, great Lord, and supreme Self.
Hinglish (1): Is sharir me paramatma updrashta, anumanta, bharta, bhokta, Ishwar, paramatma hai.
Hinglish (2): Is deha mein sthit hote hue bhi ek anya param Purusha hai, jise upadrashta (witness), anumanta (permitter), bharta (supporter), bhokta (enjoyer), Maheshwar aur Paramatma kaha gaya hai.
message:
उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः
In this body, the Supreme is described as the overseer, permitter, supporter, enjoyer, great Lord, and supreme Self.
Is sharir me paramatma updrashta, anumanta, bharta, bhokta, Ishwar, paramatma hai.

Sanskrit verse: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह स सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते
Translation (English): He who thus knows the person and nature with the qualities is not born again, in whatever state he may be.
Hinglish (1): Jo purush, prakriti aur gun ko jaanta hai, uska punarjanm nahi hota.
Hinglish (2): Jo is prakaar Purusha ko aur Prakriti ko guno sahit jaanta hai, woh har prakaar se vartmaan rehte hue bhi, punah janm nahi leta.
message:
य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह स सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते
He who thus knows the person and nature with the qualities is not born again, in whatever state he may be.
Jo purush, prakriti aur gun ko jaanta hai, uska punarjanm nahi hota.

Sanskrit verse: ध्यानानेकभ्यस्त्वान्ये साङ्ख्येन योगेन चापरे कर्मयोगेन चापरे अन्ये
Translation (English): Some see this (Self) by meditation, others by Sankhya, others by karma-yoga.
Hinglish (1): Kuch dhyan se, kuch sankhya se, kuch karmyog se ise dekhte hain.
Hinglish (2): Kuch log aatma ko dhyan se, kuch gyaan-yog se, aur kuch karm-yog se apne bheetar dekhte hain.
message:
ध्यानानेकभ्यस्त्वान्ये साङ्ख्येन योगेन चापरे कर्मयोगेन चापरे अन्ये
Some see this (Self) by meditation, others by Sankhya, others by karma-yoga.
Kuch dhyan se, kuch sankhya se, kuch karmyog se ise dekhte hain.
tags: Raja Yoga, ધ્યાન, Jnana Yoga, Karma Yoga

Sanskrit verse: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वाऽन्येभ्य उपासते तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः
Translation (English): Others, not knowing thus, worship after hearing from others; even they, devoted to hearing, cross over death.
Hinglish (1): Jo ise na jaankar sunakar bhakti karte hain, ve bhi mrityu se paar kar jaate hain.
Hinglish (2): Kuch anya log, is prakaar na jaante hue bhi, doosron se sunkar upasana karte hain. Ve shruti-paraayan log bhi mrityu ko nishchit roop se paar kar jaate hain.
message:
अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वाऽन्येभ्य उपासते तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः
Others, not knowing thus, worship after hearing from others; even they, devoted to hearing, cross over death.
Jo ise na jaankar sunakar bhakti karte hain, ve bhi mrityu se paar kar jaate hain.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, fear of death, Moksha

Sanskrit verse: यावत्संजायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजंगमम् क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ
Translation (English): Whatever being is born, moving or unmoving, know it to be from the union of field and knower, O Bharata.
Hinglish (1): Jo bhi jeev janm le, sthir ya chanchal, vo kshetra-kshetragya ke yog se hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat-shreshth, jo kuch bhi char ya achar praani utpann hota hai, us sabko tum Kshetra aur Kshetrajna ke sanyog se hi utpann hua jaano.
Summary: Life as union of matter and consciousness.
message:
यावत्संजायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजंगमम् क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ
Whatever being is born, moving or unmoving, know it to be from the union of field and knower, O Bharata.
Jo bhi jeev janm le, sthir ya chanchal, vo kshetra-kshetragya ke yog se hai.

Sanskrit verse: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति
Translation (English): He sees who sees the Supreme Lord equally present in all beings, the imperishable within the perishable.
Hinglish (1): Jo sab me ek ishwara ko dekhta hai, jo nashvant me bhi anashvar hai, wahi sach me dekhta hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo vyakti sabhi nashwar praaniyon mein sthit Parameshwar ko samaan roop se aur avinashi dekhta hai, wahi vastav mein sahi dekhta hai.
message:
समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति
He sees who sees the Supreme Lord equally present in all beings, the imperishable within the perishable.
Jo sab me ek ishwara ko dekhta hai, jo nashvant me bhi anashvar hai, wahi sach me dekhta hai.

Sanskrit verse: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् न हिनास्त्यात्मना आत्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम्
Translation (English): Seeing the Lord equally everywhere, one does not harm oneself by the self, and thus attains the supreme goal.
Hinglish (1): Sab me sama ishwara dekhkar, apne aap se apne ko hani nahi deta, aur param gati paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Kyunki sab jagah samaan roop se sthit Ishwar ko dekhta hua, woh apne aap dwara apna naash nahi karta, aur is prakaar param gati ko prapt hota hai.
message:
समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् न हिनास्त्यात्मना आत्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम्
Seeing the Lord equally everywhere, one does not harm oneself by the self, and thus attains the supreme goal.
Sab me sama ishwara dekhkar, apne aap se apne ko hani nahi deta, aur param gati paata hai.

Sanskrit verse: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः यः पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति
Translation (English): He sees truly who sees all actions as done by nature alone, and the self as non-doer.
Hinglish (1): Jo sab karm prakriti ke dwara hote dekhkar, aatma ko akarta dekhta hai, wahi dekh raha hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo vyakti sabhi karmon ko har prakaar se prakriti dwara hi kiya jaata hua dekhta hai aur aatma ko akarta (non-doer) dekhta hai, wahi sahi dekhta hai.
message:
प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः यः पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति
He sees truly who sees all actions as done by nature alone, and the self as non-doer.
Jo sab karm prakriti ke dwara hote dekhkar, aatma ko akarta dekhta hai, wahi dekh raha hai.

Sanskrit verse: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा
Translation (English): When one sees the variety of beings as resting in the One and spreading forth from That, one attains Brahman.
Hinglish (1): Jo anek jeev ko ek me sthit aur wahin se viksit dekhta hai, vo brahma ko paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jab woh praaniyon ke alag-alag bhaavon ko ek hi (Prakriti) mein sthit dekhta hai aur usi se sabka vistaar dekhta hai, tab woh Brahman ko prapt hota hai.
message:
यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा
When one sees the variety of beings as resting in the One and spreading forth from That, one attains Brahman.
Jo anek jeev ko ek me sthit aur wahin se viksit dekhta hai, vo brahma ko paata hai.

Sanskrit verse: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते
Translation (English): Being without beginning and beyond the gunas, the imperishable Supreme Self, though dwelling in the body, does not act nor is tainted.
Hinglish (1): Anaadi, nirguna, avyay paramatma shareer me hote hue bhi kuch nahi karta, na uska dosh lagta hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kaunteya, anadi hone ke kaaran aur nirgun hone ke kaaran, yeh avinashi Paramatma shareer mein sthit hote hue bhi na toh kuch karta hai aur na hi lipt hota hai.
message:
अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते
Being without beginning and beyond the gunas, the imperishable Supreme Self, though dwelling in the body, does not act nor is tainted.
Anaadi, nirguna, avyay paramatma shareer me hote hue bhi kuch nahi karta, na uska dosh lagta hai.

Sanskrit verse: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते तथा सर्वगतं लोके शरीरस्थो नोपलिप्यते
Translation (English): As space, pervading all, by subtlety is not tainted, so the Self, pervading all bodies, is not tainted.
Hinglish (1): Jaise aakash sab me hoke bhi asuddh nahi hota, waise hi aatma shareer me hoke bhi asuddh nahi hoti.
Hinglish (2): Jaise sarvavyapi aakash sookshm hone ke kaaran lipt nahi hota, usi prakaar sabhi dehon mein sthit aatma bhi lipt nahi hoti.
message:
यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते तथा सर्वगतं लोके शरीरस्थो नोपलिप्यते 
As space, pervading all, by subtlety is not tainted, so the Self, pervading all bodies, is not tainted.
Jaise aakash sab me hoke bhi asuddh nahi hota, waise hi aatma shareer me hoke bhi asuddh nahi hoti.

Sanskrit verse: यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत
Translation (English): As the one sun illumines the whole world, so does the knower of the field illumine the whole field, O Bharata.
Hinglish (1): Jaise ek surya poore jagat ko roshan karta hai, waise hi kshetragya kshetra ko.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, jaise ek hi surya is sampoorn lok ko prakaashit karta hai, usi prakaar Kshetri (aatma) sampoorn Kshetra (shareer) ko prakaashit karta hai.
message:
यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत
As the one sun illumines the whole world, so does the knower of the field illumine the whole field, O Bharata.
Jaise ek surya poore jagat ko roshan karta hai, waise hi kshetragya kshetra ko.

Sanskrit verse: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवं अन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम्
Translation (English): Those who, with the eye of knowledge, understand the distinction between field and knower, and the liberation from nature, reach the Supreme.
Hinglish (1): Jo gyaan ki drishti se kshetra-kshetragya ke antar ko, aur prakriti se mukti ko jaante hain, ve param pad paate hain.
Hinglish (2): Jo log gyaan-chakshuon se Kshetra aur Kshetrajna ke is antar ko, aur bhautik prakriti se mukti ki prakriya ko jaante hain, ve param ko prapt hote hain.
message:
क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवं अन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम्
Those who, with the eye of knowledge, understand the distinction between field and knower, and the liberation from nature, reach the Supreme.
Jo gyaan ki drishti se kshetra-kshetragya ke antar ko, aur prakriti se mukti ko jaante hain, ve param pad paate hain.

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच परं भूयः प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम् यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: Again I shall declare to you the supreme knowledge, the best of all knowledge, knowing which all sages have attained supreme perfection.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Main tumhe phir gyaan ka gyaan, jo sabse uttam hai, batane wala hoon; ise jaankar rishi param siddhi pa gaye.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Ab main phir se us param gyaan ko kahunga, jo sabhi gyaanon mein uttam hai, jise jaankar sabhi muniyon ne is sansaar se param siddhi prapt ki hai.
Summary: Introduction to the topic of the three gunas.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच परं भूयः प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम् यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः
The Blessed Lord said: Again I shall declare to you the supreme knowledge, the best of all knowledge, knowing which all sages have attained supreme perfection.
Shri Krishna bole: Main tumhe phir gyaan ka gyaan, jo sabse uttam hai, batane wala hoon; ise jaankar rishi param siddhi pa gaye.

Sanskrit verse: इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागताः सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च
Translation (English): By taking refuge in this knowledge, they attain My supreme state and are not born at creation nor disturbed at dissolution.
Hinglish (1): Is gyaan ka ashray lekar, ve meri sthiti me pahunchte hain aur srishti-pralay me janm-maran nahi lete.
Hinglish (2): Is gyaan ka aashray lekar, jo mere swaroop ko prapt ho jaate hain, ve na toh srishti ke samay utpann hote hain aur na hi pralay ke samay vyathit hote hain.
message:
इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागताः सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च
By taking refuge in this knowledge, they attain My supreme state and are not born at creation nor disturbed at dissolution.
Is gyaan ka ashray lekar, ve meri sthiti me pahunchte hain aur srishti-pralay me janm-maran nahi lete.

Sanskrit verse: मम योनिर्महद्ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् सम्भवः सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत
Translation (English): My womb is the great Brahman; into it I place the seed, from which comes the birth of all beings, O Bharata.
Hinglish (1): Mera yoni mahabrahma hai; main beej rakhta hoon; isse sab prani paida hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, meri mahat-brahma roopi yoni (prakriti) hai, jismein main garbh sthapit karta hoon. Usi se sabhi praaniyon ki utpatti hoti hai.
message:
मम योनिर्महद्ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् सम्भवः सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत
My womb is the great Brahman; into it I place the seed, from which comes the birth of all beings, O Bharata.
Mera yoni mahabrahma hai; main beej rakhta hoon; isse sab prani paida hote hain.

Sanskrit verse: सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तयः सम्मभवन्ति याः तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रदः पिता
Translation (English): O Kaunteya, whatever forms are produced in all wombs, the great Brahman is their womb, and I am the seed‑giving father.
Hinglish (1): Hey Kaunteya, sab yoni me jo roop hote hain, unka yoni mahabrahma hai, aur beej dene wala main hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kaunteya, sabhi yoniyon mein jo bhi moortiyan (shareer) utpann hoti hain, un sabki yoni mahat-brahma (prakriti) hai aur main beej sthapit karne waala pita hoon.
message:
सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तयः सम्मभवन्ति याः तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रदः पिता
O Kaunteya, whatever forms are produced in all wombs, the great Brahman is their womb, and I am the seed‑giving father.
Hey Kaunteya, sab yoni me jo roop hote hain, unka yoni mahabrahma hai, aur beej dene wala main hoon.

Sanskrit verse: सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणाः प्रकृतिसम्भवाः निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम्
Translation (English): Sattva, rajas, and tamas—the qualities born of nature—bind the imperishable embodied in the body, O great‑armed.
Hinglish (1): Sattva, rajas aur tamas prakriti se utpann gun hain jo sharir me aatma ko bandh dete hain.
Hinglish (2): Sattva, Rajas aur Tamas - yeh teen gun Prakriti se utpann hote hain. Hey Mahabahu, yeh avinashi jeevatma ko shareer mein baandh dete hain.
message:
सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणाः प्रकृतिसम्भवाः निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम्
Sattva, rajas, and tamas—the qualities born of nature—bind the imperishable embodied in the body, O great‑armed.
Sattva, rajas aur tamas prakriti se utpann gun hain jo sharir me aatma ko bandh dete hain.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, Karma

Sanskrit verse: तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ
Translation (English): Of these, sattva, being pure, is illuminating and free from disease; it binds by attachment to happiness and knowledge, O sinless one.
Hinglish (1): Sattva nirmal hai, prakash deta hai, rograhit hai, aur sukh aur gyaan ki asakti se bandhata hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey nishpaap Arjun, unmein se Sattva gun nirmal hone ke kaaran prakaashak aur vikaar-rahit hai. Woh jeev ko sukh aur gyaan ke attachment se baandhta hai.
message:
तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ
Of these, sattva, being pure, is illuminating and free from disease; it binds by attachment to happiness and knowledge, O sinless one.
Sattva nirmal hai, prakash deta hai, rograhit hai, aur sukh aur gyaan ki asakti se bandhata hai.

Sanskrit verse: रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम् तत्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम्
Translation (English): Know rajas to be of the nature of passion, born of craving and attachment; it binds by attachment to action, O Kaunteya.
Hinglish (1): Rajas raga se bhara, trishna-asakti se upajta hai, aur karm ki asakti se bandhata hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kaunteya, Rajas gun ko raag (passion) roop jaano, jo trishna (craving) aur aasakti (attachment) se utpann hota hai. Woh jeevatma ko karmon ke attachment se baandhta hai.
message:
रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम् तत्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम्
Know rajas to be of the nature of passion, born of craving and attachment; it binds by attachment to action, O Kaunteya.
Rajas raga se bhara, trishna-asakti se upajta hai, aur karm ki asakti se bandhata hai.
tags: Rajas, three gunas, letting go of greed, Karma

Sanskrit verse: तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम् प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत
Translation (English): Know tamas to be born of ignorance, deluding all embodied beings; it binds by negligence, laziness, and sleep, O Bharata.
Hinglish (1): Tamas agyaan se paida hota, sabko mohit karta hai, aur pramaad, aalas, neend se bandhata hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, Tamas gun ko agyaan se utpann hua jaano, jo sabhi dehdhariyon ko mohit karta hai. Woh pramaad (negligence), aalasya aur nidra se baandhta hai.
message:
तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम् प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत
Know tamas to be born of ignorance, deluding all embodied beings; it binds by negligence, laziness, and sleep, O Bharata.
Tamas agyaan se paida hota, sabko mohit karta hai, aur pramaad, aalas, neend se bandhata hai.
tags: Tamas, three gunas, depression, lack of focus

Sanskrit verse: सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रजः कर्मणि भारत ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तमः प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत
Translation (English): Sattva leads to happiness, rajas to action, tamas covering knowledge leads to negligence.
Hinglish (1): Sattva sukh me, rajas karm me, tamas agyaan se pramaad me le jata hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, Sattva gun sukh mein lagaata hai, Rajas gun karm mein lagaata hai, jabki Tamas gun gyaan ko dhakkar pramaad (negligence) mein lagaata hai.
message:
सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रजः कर्मणि भारत ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तमः प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत
Sattva leads to happiness, rajas to action, tamas covering knowledge leads to negligence.
Sattva sukh me, rajas karm me, tamas agyaan se pramaad me le jata hai.

Sanskrit verse: रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा
Translation (English): Overcoming rajas and tamas, sattva prevails; rajas overcomes sattva and tamas; tamas overcomes sattva and rajas.
Hinglish (1): Kabhi sattva raj-tamas ko haraata hai; kabhi rajas, kabhi tamas jeetata hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, kabhi Sattva gun Rajas aur Tamas ko dabaakar badh jaata hai, kabhi Rajas Sattva aur Tamas ko, aur kabhi Tamas Sattva aur Rajas ko dabaakar badh jaata hai.
message:
रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा
Overcoming rajas and tamas, sattva prevails; rajas overcomes sattva and tamas; tamas overcomes sattva and rajas.
Kabhi sattva raj-tamas ko haraata hai; kabhi rajas, kabhi tamas jeetata hai.

Sanskrit verse: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत
Translation (English): When in all the gates of the body, light arises, knowledge is increased—this you should know as the increased sattva.
Hinglish (1): Sharir ke sab dwaar par prakash hone par, gyaan badhta hai—yeh sattva ke badhne ka lakshan hai.
Hinglish (2): Jab is deha ke sabhi dwaaron (senses) mein gyaan ka prakaash utpann hota hai, tab yeh jaanna chahiye ki Sattva gun badha hua hai.
message:
सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत
When in all the gates of the body, light arises, knowledge is increased—this you should know as the increased sattva.
Sharir ke sab dwaar par prakash hone par, gyaan badhta hai—yeh sattva ke badhne ka lakshan hai.

Sanskrit verse: लोभः प्रवृत्तिरारम्भः कर्मणामशमः स्पृहा रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ
Translation (English): Greed, activity, undertaking of works, restlessness, and craving—these arise when rajas increases, O best of Bharatas.
Hinglish (1): Lobh, pravritti, shuruwaat, ashanti, iccha—yeh sab rajas ke badhne par hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat-shreshth, jab Rajas gun badhta hai, tab lobh, pravritti (activity), karmon ka aarambh, ashanti aur laalsa - yeh sab utpann hote hain.
message:
लोभः प्रवृत्तिरारम्भः कर्मणामशमः स्पृहा रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ
Greed, activity, undertaking of works, restlessness, and craving—these arise when rajas increases, O best of Bharatas.
Lobh, pravritti, shuruwaat, ashanti, iccha—yeh sab rajas ke badhne par hote hain.

Sanskrit verse: अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन
Translation (English): Darkness, inertia, negligence, and delusion—these arise when tamas increases, O joy of the Kurus.
Hinglish (1): Andhkaar, akarmanta, pramaad, moha—yeh tamas ke badhne ke lakshan hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kurunandan, jab Tamas gun badhta hai, tab aprakaash (darkness), apravritti (inertia), pramaad (negligence) aur moh - yeh sab utpann hote hain.
message:
अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन
Darkness, inertia, negligence, and delusion—these arise when tamas increases, O joy of the Kurus.
Andhkaar, akarmanta, pramaad, moha—yeh tamas ke badhne ke lakshan hain.

Sanskrit verse: यदि सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते
Translation (English): If embodied life ends when sattva prevails, one attains the pure worlds of the knowers of the highest.
Hinglish (1): Agar mrityu sattva ke prabhaav me hoti hai, to uttam vidwan ke shuddh log milte hain.
Hinglish (2): Yadi dehdhaari Sattva gun ke badhne par mrityu ko prapt hota hai, toh woh uttam gyaaniyon ke nirmal lokon ko prapt hota hai.
Summary: Death in sattva leads to higher realms.
message:
यदि सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते
If embodied life ends when sattva prevails, one attains the pure worlds of the knowers of the highest.
Agar mrityu sattva ke prabhaav me hoti hai, to uttam vidwan ke shuddh log milte hain.
tags: fear of death, reincarnation, Karma, Sattva

Sanskrit verse: रजसि प्रवृत्तं च जगत्कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते तदा कर्मणां परिणामे दु:खमीहते
Translation (English): The one who dies in rajas is born among those attached to action; and when tamas prevails, one is born in the wombs of the deluded.
Hinglish (1): Rajas me marne wala karmasakti logon me janm leta hai; tamas me marne wala moorkh yoni me.
Hinglish (2): Rajas gun ke badhne par marne waala karm-aasakt logon mein janm leta hai. Aur Tamas gun ke badhne par marne waala moodh-yoniyon (irrational species) mein janm leta hai.
message:
रजसि प्रवृत्तं च जगत्कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते तदा कर्मणां परिणामे दु:खमीहते
The one who dies in rajas is born among those attached to action; and when tamas prevails, one is born in the wombs of the deluded.
Rajas me marne wala karmasakti logon me janm leta hai; tamas me marne wala moorkh yoni me.
tags: fear of death, reincarnation, Karma, Rajas, Tamas

Sanskrit verse: कर्मणः सुकृतस्याहुः सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम् रजसस्तु फलं दुःखमज्ञानं तमसः फलम्
Translation (English): The fruit of good action is declared to be pure and sattvic; the fruit of rajas is pain; the fruit of tamas is ignorance.
Hinglish (1): Sattvik karm ka fal nirmal hai; rajas ka fal dukh; tamas ka fal agyaan hai.
Hinglish (2): Punya-karm ka phal saattvik aur nirmal hota hai, raajasik karm ka phal dukh hota hai, aur taamasik karm ka phal agyaan hota hai.
message:
कर्मणः सुकृतस्याहुः सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम् रजसस्तु फलं दुःखमज्ञानं तमसः फलम्
The fruit of good action is declared to be pure and sattvic; the fruit of rajas is pain; the fruit of tamas is ignorance.
Sattvik karm ka fal nirmal hai; rajas ka fal dukh; tamas ka fal agyaan hai.
tags: Karma, three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas

Sanskrit verse: सत्त्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च
Translation (English): From sattva arises knowledge, from rajas comes greed, from tamas—negligence and delusion, and indeed ignorance.
Hinglish (1): Sattva se gyaan, rajas se lobh, tamas se pramaad, moha, aur agyaan hota hai.
Hinglish (2): Sattva se gyaan utpann hota hai, Rajas se lobh utpann hota hai, aur Tamas se pramaad, moh aur agyaan hi utpann hote hain.
message:
सत्त्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च
From sattva arises knowledge, from rajas comes greed, from tamas—negligence and delusion, and indeed ignorance.
Sattva se gyaan, rajas se lobh, tamas se pramaad, moha, aur agyaan hota hai.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, Jnana Yoga

Sanskrit verse: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्टन्ति राजसाः जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसाः
Translation (English): Those established in sattva go upward; the rajasic remain in the middle; those in the lowest guna of tamas go downward.
Hinglish (1): Sattva wale upar chadhte, rajas wale madhya me rehte, tamas wale neeche girte.
Hinglish (2): Sattva-gun mein sthit log oordhva-lokon (higher realms) ko jaate hain, Rajo-guni madhya (earthly realm) mein rehte hain, aur Jघन्य Tamo-gun mein sthit log adho-gati (lower realms) ko jaate hain.
message:
