ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्टन्ति राजसाः जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसाः
Those established in sattva go upward; the rajasic remain in the middle; those in the lowest guna of tamas go downward.
Sattva wale upar chadhte, rajas wale madhya me rehte, tamas wale neeche girte.

Sanskrit verse: नान्यं गुणेभ्यः कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति
Translation (English): When the seer perceives no doer other than the gunas, and knows Me as higher than the gunas, he attains My being.
Hinglish (1): Jo gun ke alawa koi kartapan nahi dekhta aur mujhe gun se upar jaanta hai, vo mere swaroop ko paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jab drashta (seer) in teen guno ke alawa kisi aur ko karta nahi dekhta, aur guno se pare, mujhe tattva se jaanta hai, tab woh mere divya swaroop ko prapt hota hai.
Summary: Detachment from gunas leads to divine union.
message:
नान्यं गुणेभ्यः कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति
When the seer perceives no doer other than the gunas, and knows Me as higher than the gunas, he attains My being.
Jo gun ke alawa koi kartapan nahi dekhta aur mujhe gun se upar jaanta hai, vo mere swaroop ko paata hai.
tags: self-realization, Moksha, three gunas, Jnana Yoga

Sanskrit verse: गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्यदेही देहसमुद्भवान् जन्ममृत्युजरादुःखैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्नुते
Translation (English): The embodied, having gone beyond these three gunas which cause the body, is freed from birth, death, old age, and sorrow, and attains immortality.
Hinglish (1): Jo in teen gunon se upar uthta hai, vo janm‑mrityu‑jara‑dukh se mukt hokar amrit paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Dehdhaari jeev, shareer ko utpann karne waale in teen guno ko paar karke, janm, mrityu, budhape aur dukhon se mukt hokar amritatva ka anubhav karta hai.
message:
गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्यदेही देहसमुद्भवान् जन्ममृत्युजरादुःखैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्नुते
The embodied, having gone beyond these three gunas which cause the body, is freed from birth, death, old age, and sorrow, and attains immortality.
Jo in teen gunon se upar uthta hai, vo janm‑mrityu‑jara‑dukh se mukt hokar amrit paata hai.
tags: Moksha, self-realization, fear of death, reincarnation

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच कैरलिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो किमाचारः कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते
Translation (English): Arjuna said: By what marks is one who has gone beyond these three gunas recognized, O Lord? What is his conduct, and how does he go beyond them?
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Kaise pehchanein ki koi teen gun se upar hai? Uska acharan kya hota hai, aur vo kaise unhe paar karta hai?
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Prabhu, in teen guno se pare hue vyakti ke kya lakshan hote hain? Uska aacharan kaisa hota hai, aur woh in teen guno ko kaise paar karta hai?
Summary: Asks for signs and method of transcendence.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच कैरलिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो किमाचारः कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते
Arjuna said: By what marks is one who has gone beyond these three gunas recognized, O Lord? What is his conduct, and how does he go beyond them?
Arjun bola: Kaise pehchanein ki koi teen gun se upar hai? Uska acharan kya hota hai, aur vo kaise unhe paar karta hai?

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव न द्वेष्टि संप्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: O Pandava, he who neither hates illumination, activity, or delusion when they appear, nor desires them when they disappear...
Hinglish (1): Jo prakash, pravritti, moha ke aane‑jaane par na dvesh karta, na iccha karta...
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Hey Pandav, jo prakaash (Sattva), pravritti (Rajas) aur moh (Tamas) ke aane par na toh unse dvesh karta hai aur na hi unke chale jaane par unki aakanksha karta hai...
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव न द्वेष्टि संप्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति
The Blessed Lord said: O Pandava, he who neither hates illumination, activity, or delusion when they appear, nor desires them when they disappear...
Jo prakash, pravritti, moha ke aane‑jaane par na dvesh karta, na iccha karta...

Sanskrit verse: उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येव योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते
Translation (English): Remaining as one unconcerned, not disturbed by the gunas, thinking “the gunas act,” and standing firm, unmoved...
Hinglish (1): Jo udasin rahta hai, gun se na hilta, aur keval gunon ki kriya dekhkar sthir rehta hai...
Hinglish (2): ...jo udaseen ki tarah sthit rehta hai, guno se vichlit nahi hota, aur 'gun hi guno mein barat rahe hain' yeh samajhkar sthir rehta hai aur hilta nahi...
message:
उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येव योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते
Remaining as one unconcerned, not disturbed by the gunas, thinking “the gunas act,” and standing firm, unmoved...
Jo udasin rahta hai, gun se na hilta, aur keval gunon ki kriya dekhkar sthir rehta hai...

Sanskrit verse: समदुःखसुखः स्वस्थः समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुतिः
Translation (English): Equal in pain and pleasure, steady, regarding a clod, stone, and gold as the same; equal in pleasant and unpleasant, in blame and praise...
Hinglish (1): Sukh‑dukh me samaan, mitti‑pathar‑sona samaan dekhta, prem‑nafrat, ninda‑prashansa me samaan...
Hinglish (2): ...jo dukh aur sukh mein samaan rehta hai, jo swasth hai, jo mitti, patthar aur sone ko samaan dekhta hai, jo priya aur apriya mein, ninda aur stuti mein samaan hai, aur jo dheeryavaan hai...
message:
समदुःखसुखः स्वस्थः समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुतिः
Equal in pain and pleasure, steady, regarding a clod, stone, and gold as the same; equal in pleasant and unpleasant, in blame and praise...
Sukh‑dukh me samaan, mitti‑pathar‑sona samaan dekhta, prem‑nafrat, ninda‑prashansa me samaan...

Sanskrit verse: मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयोः सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीतः स उच्यते
Translation (English): Equal in honor and dishonor, towards friend and foe, abandoning all undertakings—such a one is said to have transcended the gunas.
Hinglish (1): Maan‑apmaan, mitra‑shatru me ek samaan, sab arambh chhodne wala—gunaatit kehlata hai.
Hinglish (2): ...jo maan aur apmaan mein, mitra aur shatru paksh mein samaan hai, aur jisne sabhi aarambhon ka tyag kar diya hai - wahi 'gunatit' (guno se pare) kehlata hai.
message:
मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयोः सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीतः स उच्यते
Equal in honor and dishonor, towards friend and foe, abandoning all undertakings—such a one is said to have transcended the gunas.
Maan‑apmaan, mitra‑shatru me ek samaan, sab arambh chhodne wala—gunaatit kehlata hai.

Sanskrit verse: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते
Translation (English): He who serves Me with unwavering devotion in yoga, transcends these gunas and is fit for becoming Brahman.
Hinglish (1): Jo mujhme avyabhichar bhakti yog karta hai, vo in gunon se upar uthkar brahma swaroop ho jata hai.
Hinglish (2): Aur jo avyabhicharini bhakti-yog (unwavering devotion) ke dwara meri seva karta hai, woh in teeno guno ko poori tarah se paar karke, Brahma-pad ke yogy ho jaata hai.
message:
मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते
He who serves Me with unwavering devotion in yoga, transcends these gunas and is fit for becoming Brahman.
Jo mujhme avyabhichar bhakti yog karta hai, vo in gunon se upar uthkar brahma swaroop ho jata hai.

Sanskrit verse: ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च
Translation (English): I am the foundation of imperishable Brahman, of immortality, of eternal dharma, and of absolute bliss.
Hinglish (1): Main akshar brahma, amrit, shashwat dharm, aur ekant sukh ka aadhar hoon.
Hinglish (2): Kyunki main hi us avinashi Brahman ka, amritatva ka, shaashvat dharm ka aur aikantik (absolute) sukh ka aashray (foundation) hoon.
Summary: Krishna as the ultimate base of all reality.
message:
ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च
I am the foundation of imperishable Brahman, of immortality, of eternal dharma, and of absolute bliss.
Main akshar brahma, amrit, shashwat dharm, aur ekant sukh ka aadhar hoon.

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच ऊर्ध्वमूलमधःशाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम् छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित्
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: They speak of an imperishable Ashvattha tree with roots above and branches below; its leaves are the Vedic hymns; he who knows this tree is a knower of the Vedas.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Upar jad wala, neeche shakha wala avyay Ashvattha vriksh, jiske patte ved mantra hain—jo ise jaanta, vo vedvit hai.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Is sansaar ko ek avinashi Ashvattha (banyan) vriksh kaha gaya hai, jiski jadein upar ki or aur shaakhayein neeche ki or hain. Vedic mantra iske patte hain. Jo is vriksh ko jaanta hai, wahi Vedon ka gyata hai.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच ऊर्ध्वमूलमधःशाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम् छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित्
The Blessed Lord said: They speak of an imperishable Ashvattha tree with roots above and branches below; its leaves are the Vedic hymns; he who knows this tree is a knower of the Vedas.
Shri Krishna bole: Upar jad wala, neeche shakha wala avyay Ashvattha vriksh, jiske patte ved mantra hain—jo ise jaanta, vo vedvit hai.
tags: Jnana Yoga, Moksha, what is the purpose of life

Sanskrit verse: अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखा गुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवालाः अधश्च मूलान्यनुसन्ततानि कर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके
Translation (English): Its branches spread upward and downward, nourished by the gunas, sense objects as shoots; roots spread downward into human society bound by karma.
Hinglish (1): Iski shakha upar‑neeche phaili hai, guna se poshit, vishay uske naaye patte; mul neeche karm mein bichi hain.
Hinglish (2): Is vriksh ki shaakhayein guno se poshit hokar upar aur neeche phaili hain, aur indriya-vishay iski kopalein (shoots) hain. Iski jadein bhi neeche ki or phaili hain, jo manushya-lok mein karmon ke bandhan ka kaaran hain.
message:
अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखा गुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवालाः अधश्च मूलान्यनुसन्ततानि कर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके
Its branches spread upward and downward, nourished by the gunas, sense objects as shoots; roots spread downward into human society bound by karma.
Iski shakha upar‑neeche phaili hai, guna se poshit, vishay uske naaye patte; mul neeche karm mein bichi hain.

Sanskrit verse: न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यते नान्तो न चादिर्न च संप्रतिष्ठा अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूलं असङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्वा
Translation (English): Its form is not here perceived as such, neither its end, beginning, nor foundation; cutting this deep-rooted Ashvattha with the firm sword of detachment…
Hinglish (1): Is vriksh ka roop, aadi‑ant, sthiti nahi samajh aata; isse asangata talwar se kaat do.
Hinglish (2): Is sansaar-roopi vriksh ka vastavik swaroop yahan samajh nahi aata; na iska aadi hai, na ant, aur na hi sthiti. Is gehri jadon waale vriksh ko dridh vairaagya-roopi shastra se kaatna hoga.
message:
न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यते नान्तो न चादिर्न च संप्रतिष्ठा अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूलं असङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्वा
Its form is not here perceived as such, neither its end, beginning, nor foundation; cutting this deep-rooted Ashvattha with the firm sword of detachment…
Is vriksh ka roop, aadi‑ant, sthiti nahi samajh aata; isse asangata talwar se kaat do.
tags: detachment, Moksha, self-realization, feeling lost in life

Sanskrit verse: ततः पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यं यस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूयः तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्ये यतः प्रवृत्तिः प्रसृता पुराणी
Translation (English): Then seek that place from which having gone, none return; I seek refuge in that primal Person from whom ancient activity flows.
Hinglish (1): Phir use padya ko khojo jahan se lautna nahi hota; us pratham Purush ka sharan lo.
Hinglish (2): Uske baad, us เคชเคฐเคฎ เคชเคฆ ko khojna chahiye, jahan jaakar koi wapas nahi laut'ta. 'Main usi aadi Purush ki sharan mein hoon, jisse is sanatan srishti ka vistaar hua hai' - aisa nishchay karna chahiye.
message:
ततः पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यं यस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूयः तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्ये यतः प्रवृत्तिः प्रसृता पुराणी
Then seek that place from which having gone, none return; I seek refuge in that primal Person from whom ancient activity flows.
Phir use padya ko khojo jahan se lautna nahi hota; us pratham Purush ka sharan lo.

Sanskrit verse: निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषा अध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामाः द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ताः सुखदुःखसंज्ञैर् गच्छन्त्यमूढाः पदमव्ययं तत्
Translation (English): Free from pride and delusion, having conquered attachment, dwelling in the self, desires ended, freed from dualities of pleasure and pain—they go to that imperishable place.
Hinglish (1): Ahankar‑moha se mukt, asakti jeetne wale, adhyatma nitya, kaamna rahit, sukh‑dukh se pare—vo avyay pad ko paate hain.
Hinglish (2): Jo maan aur moh se mukt hain, jinhone aasakti-roopi dosh ko jeet liya hai, jo adhyatmik gyaan mein sthit hain, jinki kaamnaayein poori tarah shaant ho chuki hain, aur jo sukh-dukh roopi dwandwon se mukt hain - aise moh-rahit log us avinashi pad ko prapt karte hain.
message:
निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषा अध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामाः द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ताः सुखदुःखसंज्ञैर् गच्छन्त्यमूढाः पदमव्ययं तत्
Free from pride and delusion, having conquered attachment, dwelling in the self, desires ended, freed from dualities of pleasure and pain—they go to that imperishable place.
Ahankar‑moha se mukt, asakti jeetne wale, adhyatma nitya, kaamna rahit, sukh‑dukh se pare—vo avyay pad ko paate hain.

Sanskrit verse: न तद्भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावकः यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम
Translation (English): Neither sun, moon, nor fire illumines that—having gone there, they return not—that is My supreme abode.
Hinglish (1): Na surya, na chandra, na agni usse prakaashit karte; vahan jaakar lautna nahi—vo mera param dham hai.
Hinglish (2): Woh mera param dhaam na toh surya se, na chandrama se, aur na hi agni se prakaashit hota hai. Jahan jaakar koi wapas nahi laut'ta, wahi mera param dhaam hai.
message:
न तद्भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावकः यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम
Neither sun, moon, nor fire illumines that—having gone there, they return not—that is My supreme abode.
Na surya, na chandra, na agni usse prakaashit karte; vahan jaakar lautna nahi—vo mera param dham hai.

Sanskrit verse: ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूतः सनातनः मनःषष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति
Translation (English): The eternal jiva in this world is My own fragment, which draws the mind and the six senses from nature.
Hinglish (1): Mera sanatan ans jiva, mann aur chhah indriya ko prakriti se kheenchta hai.
Hinglish (2): Is bhautik jagat mein sabhi jeev mere hi sanatan ansh hain. Ve mann sahit chhah indriyon ke saath prakriti mein sangharsh karte hain.
Summary: Definition of the soul as part of God.
message:
ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूतः सनातनः मनःषष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति
The eternal jiva in this world is My own fragment, which draws the mind and the six senses from nature.
Mera sanatan ans jiva, mann aur chhah indriya ko prakriti se kheenchta hai.

Sanskrit verse: शरीरं यदवाप्नोति यच्चाप्युत्क्रामतीश्वरः गृहित्वैतानि संयाति वायुर्गन्धानिवाशयात्
Translation (English): When the Lord obtains a body, and when He leaves it, He takes these (senses, mind) along, just as the wind carries scents from places.
Hinglish (1): Jab ishwar sharir leta ya chhodta hai, to indriya‑mann le jaata hai jaise hawa gandh le jaati hai.
Hinglish (2): Jaise vayu gandh ko uske sthan se grahan karke le jaati hai, usi tarah shareer ka swami (jeevatma) jab ek shareer chhodkar doosre shareer mein jaata hai, toh mann-buddhi-indriyon ko saath le jaata hai.
message:
शरीरं यदवाप्नोति यच्चाप्युत्क्रामतीश्वरः गृहित्वैतानि संयाति वायुर्गन्धानिवाशयात्
When the Lord obtains a body, and when He leaves it, He takes these (senses, mind) along, just as the wind carries scents from places.
Jab ishwar sharir leta ya chhodta hai, to indriya‑mann le jaata hai jaise hawa gandh le jaati hai.

Sanskrit verse: श्रोत्रं चक्षुः स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च आधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते
Translation (English): Using ear, eye, touch, taste, and smell, and the mind, it enjoys sense objects.
Hinglish (1): Kaan, aankh, sparsh, rasna, ghrana, aur mann se vishayon ka anubhav karta hai.
Hinglish (2): Yeh jeevatma kaan, aankh, twacha, jeebh aur naak, aur saath hi mann ka aashray lekar hi indriya-vishayon ka bhog karta hai.
Summary: Senses as instruments of the soul.
message:
श्रोत्रं चक्षुः स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च आधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते
Using ear, eye, touch, taste, and smell, and the mind, it enjoys sense objects.
Kaan, aankh, sparsh, rasna, ghrana, aur mann se vishayon ka anubhav karta hai.

Sanskrit verse: उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वापि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम् विमूढा नानुपश्यन्ति पश्यन्ति ज्ञानचक्षुषः
Translation (English): The deluded do not see the soul departing, staying, or enjoying, bound to the gunas; those with the eye of knowledge see.
Hinglish (1): Moorkh atma ko jaate, rehte, bhogte nahi dekhte; gyaan drishti wale dekhte hain.
Hinglish (2): Moorkh log na toh shareer chhodte hue, na shareer mein sthit, aur na hi guno ko bhogte hue is jeevatma ko dekh paate hain. Kewal gyaan-chakshu waale hi ise dekh paate hain.
message:
उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वापि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम् विमूढा नानुपश्यन्ति पश्यन्ति ज्ञानचक्षुषः
The deluded do not see the soul departing, staying, or enjoying, bound to the gunas; those with the eye of knowledge see.
Moorkh atma ko jaate, rehte, bhogte nahi dekhte; gyaan drishti wale dekhte hain.

Sanskrit verse: यतन्तो योगिनश्चैनं पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् यतन्तोऽप्यकृतात्मानो नैनं पश्यन्त्यचेतसः
Translation (English): Striving yogis see it established in the self; the unrefined, though striving, do not see it, being without understanding.
Hinglish (1): Yogi ise apne andar dekhte hain; akrit atma ise nahi dekh pate.
Hinglish (2): Prayatna-sheel yogi is aatma ko apne bheetar sthit dekhte hain. Parantu, jinka antahkaran shuddh nahi hai, ve prayaas karte hue bhi ise nahi dekh paate.
message:
यतन्तो योगिनश्चैनं पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् यतन्तोऽप्यकृतात्मानो नैनं पश्यन्त्यचेतसः
Striving yogis see it established in the self; the unrefined, though striving, do not see it, being without understanding.
Yogi ise apne andar dekhte hain; akrit atma ise nahi dekh pate.

Sanskrit verse: यद्यद्भूतप्रभवोत्त्पन्नं विविधं सर्वमेधसाम् तस्याहं मूलं तद्विद्धि नाश्ति त्रैलोक्यादिप्रकाशितम्
Translation (English): Know that the splendor of all that is born of beings—whether of sun, moon, or fire—comes from Me.
Hinglish (1): Surya, chandra, agni ka prakash mujhse aata hai.
Hinglish (2): Surya ka tej jo saare sansaar ko prakaashit karta hai, jo tej chandrama mein hai aur jo agni mein hai, us sab tej ko tum mera hi jaano.
Summary: God as source of all light.
message:
यद्यद्भूतप्रभवोत्त्पन्नं विविधं सर्वमेधसाम् तस्याहं मूलं तद्विद्धि नाश्ति त्रैलोक्यादिप्रकाशितम्
Know that the splendor of all that is born of beings—whether of sun, moon, or fire—comes from Me.
Surya, chandra, agni ka prakash mujhse aata hai.

Sanskrit verse: गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा पुष्णामि चौषधीः सर्वाः सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मकः
Translation (English): Entering the earth, I sustain beings by My energy; becoming Soma, I nourish all plants.
Hinglish (1): Main prithvi me pravesh karke sabko dharan karta hoon; Somras ban kar sab ausadhi ko poshta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Main hi prithvi mein pravesh karke apni shakti se sabhi praaniyon ko dhaaran karta hoon, aur ras-swaroop chandrama bankar sabhi vanaspatiyon ka poshan karta hoon.
message:
गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा पुष्णामि चौषधीः सर्वाः सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मकः
Entering the earth, I sustain beings by My energy; becoming Soma, I nourish all plants.
Main prithvi me pravesh karke sabko dharan karta hoon; Somras ban kar sab ausadhi ko poshta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: अहं वैश्वानरो भूत्वा प्राणिनां देहमाश्रितः प्राणापानसमायुक्तः पचाम्यन्नं चतुर्विधम्
Translation (English): Becoming the digestive fire, I dwell in bodies of living beings, joined with prana and apana, digesting the four kinds of food.
Hinglish (1): Main prani ke sharir me agni ban kar, prana‑apana ke saath, chaar prakaar ke bhojan ko pachata hoon.
Hinglish (2): Main hi sabhi praaniyon ke shareer mein sthit hokar vaishvanar agni (fire of digestion) ke roop mein, praan aur apaan vayu se yukt hokar, chaar prakaar ke ann ko pachaata hoon.
message:
अहं वैश्वानरो भूत्वा प्राणिनां देहमाश्रितः प्राणापानसमायुक्तः पचाम्यन्नं चतुर्विधम्
Becoming the digestive fire, I dwell in bodies of living beings, joined with prana and apana, digesting the four kinds of food.
Main prani ke sharir me agni ban kar, prana‑apana ke saath, chaar prakaar ke bhojan ko pachata hoon.

Sanskrit verse: सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टो मत्तः स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्यो वेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम्
Translation (English): I am seated in the heart of all; from Me come memory, knowledge, and forgetfulness; I am to be known by all the Vedas; I am the author and knower of the Vedas.
Hinglish (1): Main sabke hriday me hoon; smriti, gyaan, vismriti mujhse hai; mujhe ved jaante hain; main vedanta karta aur janata hoon.
Hinglish (2): Main sabhi praaniyon ke hriday mein sthit hoon. Mujhse hi smriti, gyaan aur apohan (forgetfulness) hota hai. Main hi sabhi Vedon dwara jaanne yogy hoon. Main hi Vedanta ka karta aur Vedon ka gyata hoon.
message:
सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टो मत्तः स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्यो वेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम्
I am seated in the heart of all; from Me come memory, knowledge, and forgetfulness; I am to be known by all the Vedas; I am the author and knower of the Vedas.
Main sabke hriday me hoon; smriti, gyaan, vismriti mujhse hai; mujhe ved jaante hain; main vedanta karta aur janata hoon.
tags: Atman, Brahman, Jnana Yoga, Bhakti Yoga

Sanskrit verse: द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च क्षरः सर्वाणि भूतानि कूटस्थोऽक्षर उच्यते
Translation (English): There are two Purushas in the world: the perishable and the imperishable; the perishable are all beings, the unchanging is called the imperishable.
Hinglish (1): Duniya me do purush hain—kshar (sab prani) aur akshar (sthir).
Hinglish (2): Is sansaar mein do prakaar ke Purush hain - Kshara (nashwar) aur Akshara (avinashi). Sabhi bhautik shareer Kshara hain, jabki jeevatma Akshara kehlata hai.
message:
द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च क्षरः सर्वाणि भूतानि कूटस्थोऽक्षर उच्यते
There are two Purushas in the world: the perishable and the imperishable; the perishable are all beings, the unchanging is called the imperishable.
Duniya me do purush hain—kshar (sab prani) aur akshar (sthir).

Sanskrit verse: उत्तमः पुरुषस्त्वन्यः परमात्मेत्युदाहृतः यो लोकत्रयमाविश्य बिभर्त्यव्यय ईश्वरः
Translation (English): Another, the highest Purusha, is the Supreme Self, the imperishable Lord who pervades and sustains the three worlds.
Hinglish (1): Ek teesra purush uttam hai—paramatma jo teenon lokon me vyapt hai.
Hinglish (2): In dono se uttam ek anya Purush hai, jise 'Paramatma' kaha jaata hai. Wahi avinashi Ishwar hai jo teeno lokon mein pravesh karke sabka paalan-poshan karta hai.
message:
उत्तमः पुरुषस्त्वन्यः परमात्मेत्युदाहृतः यो लोकत्रयमाविश्य बिभर्त्यव्यय ईश्वरः
Another, the highest Purusha, is the Supreme Self, the imperishable Lord who pervades and sustains the three worlds.
Ek teesra purush uttam hai—paramatma jo teenon lokon me vyapt hai.

Sanskrit verse: यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तमः अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथितः पुरुषोत्तमः
Translation (English): Because I am beyond perishable and even imperishable, I am celebrated in the world and in the Vedas as the Supreme Person.
Hinglish (1): Main kshar-akshar se upar hoon; isliye main vedon me Purushottam kaha gaya hoon.
Hinglish (2): Kyunki main nashwar (Kshara) se pare hoon aur avinashi (Akshara) se bhi uttam hoon, isliye lok aur Vedon mein main 'Purushottam' (Supreme Person) ke naam se prasiddh hoon.
message:
यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तमः अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथितः पुरुषोत्तमः
Because I am beyond perishable and even imperishable, I am celebrated in the world and in the Vedas as the Supreme Person.
Main kshar-akshar se upar hoon; isliye main vedon me Purushottam kaha gaya hoon.
tags: Brahman, self-realization, Jnana Yoga, Bhakti Yoga

Sanskrit verse: यो मामेवमसम्मूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम् स सर्वविद्भजति मां सर्वभावेन भारत
Translation (English): He who knows Me thus, without delusion, as the Supreme Person, knows all and worships Me with all his being, O Bharata.
Hinglish (1): Jo mujhe Purushottam jaanta hai, vo sab janta hai aur mujhe poore bhav se bhajta hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, jo moh-rahit hokar mujhe is prakaar Purushottam jaanta hai, woh sarvagya (knower of everything) hokar poorn bhaav se meri bhakti karta hai.
Summary: Faith in Supreme Person leads to full devotion.
message:
यो मामेवमसम्मूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम् स सर्वविद्भजति मां सर्वभावेन भारत
He who knows Me thus, without delusion, as the Supreme Person, knows all and worships Me with all his being, O Bharata.
Jo mujhe Purushottam jaanta hai, vo sab janta hai aur mujhe poore bhav se bhajta hai.

Sanskrit verse: इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयाऽनघ एतद्बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत
Translation (English): Thus this most secret teaching is declared by Me, O sinless one; understanding this, a man becomes wise and fulfills all that is to be done.
Hinglish (1): Hey Anagh, mainne tumhe yeh guhyatam shastra bata diya; ise samajhkar vyakti buddhiwan aur kirtarth hota hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey nishpaap Arjun, is prakaar yeh sabse gupt shastra mere dwara kaha gaya hai. Ise samajhkar, manushya buddhiman ho jaata hai aur uske sabhi kartavya poorn ho jaate hain.
message:
इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयाऽनघ एतद्बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत
Thus this most secret teaching is declared by Me, O sinless one; understanding this, a man becomes wise and fulfills all that is to be done.
Hey Anagh, mainne tumhe yeh guhyatam shastra bata diya; ise samajhkar vyakti buddhiwan aur kirtarth hota hai.

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम्
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: Fearlessness, purity of heart, steadfastness in the yoga of knowledge, charity, control of the senses, sacrifice, study of the scriptures, austerity, and uprightness...
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Nirbhayta, hriday ki shuddhi, gyaan yog me sthirta, daan, indriya dam, yajya, swadhyaya, tap, aur imaandari...
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Nirbhayata, antahkaran ki shuddhi, gyaan-yog mein sthirta, daan, indriya-sanyam, yajna, swadhyay, tap aur saralta...
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम्
The Blessed Lord said: Fearlessness, purity of heart, steadfastness in the yoga of knowledge, charity, control of the senses, sacrifice, study of the scriptures, austerity, and uprightness...
Shri Krishna bole: Nirbhayta, hriday ki shuddhi, gyaan yog me sthirta, daan, indriya dam, yajya, swadhyaya, tap, aur imaandari...
tags: Dharma, Sattva, inner peace, mental peace

Sanskrit verse: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम् दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम्
Translation (English): Non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, peace, absence of slander, compassion for beings, freedom from greed, gentleness, modesty, and steadiness...
Hinglish (1): Ahimsa, satya, krodh rahit, tyag, shanti, ninda rahit, daya, lalach rahit, komalta, lajja, sthirta...
Hinglish (2): ...Ahimsa, satya, krodh-rahit hona, tyag, shaanti, ninda na karna, sabhi praaniyon par daya, lobh-rahit hona, komalta, lajja aur sthirta...
message:
अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम् दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम्
Non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, peace, absence of slander, compassion for beings, freedom from greed, gentleness, modesty, and steadiness...
Ahimsa, satya, krodh rahit, tyag, shanti, ninda rahit, daya, lalach rahit, komalta, lajja, sthirta...
tags: how to control anger, how to stay calm, detachment

Sanskrit verse: तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता भवन्ति संपदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत
Translation (English): Vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, purity, freedom from hatred, absence of over-pride—these are the marks of one born to the divine nature, O Bharata.
Hinglish (1): Tej, kshama, dhairya, shauch, dvesh rahit, atimaan rahit—ye daivi prakriti ke lakshan hain.
Hinglish (2): ...Tej, kshama, dhairya, pavitrata, dvesh-rahit hona aur abhimaan-rahit hona - hey Bharat, yeh sab daivi sampada ke saath janme vyakti ke lakshan hain.
message:
तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता भवन्ति संपदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत
Vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, purity, freedom from hatred, absence of over-pride—these are the marks of one born to the divine nature, O Bharata.
Tej, kshama, dhairya, shauch, dvesh rahit, atimaan rahit—ye daivi prakriti ke lakshan hain.

Sanskrit verse: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ संपदामासुरीम्
Translation (English): Hypocrisy, arrogance, self-conceit, anger, harshness, and ignorance are the marks of one born to the demonic nature, O Partha.
Hinglish (1): Dambh, darp, abhimaan, krodh, kathorata, agyaan—ye asuri prakriti ke lakshan hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, paakhand, ahankaar, abhimaan, krodh, kathorta aur agyaan - yeh sab aasuri sampada ke saath janme vyakti ke lakshan hain.
message:
दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ संपदामासुरीम्
Hypocrisy, arrogance, self-conceit, anger, harshness, and ignorance are the marks of one born to the demonic nature, O Partha.
Dambh, darp, abhimaan, krodh, kathorata, agyaan—ye asuri prakriti ke lakshan hain.

Sanskrit verse: दैवी संपद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता मा शुचः संपदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव
Translation (English): The divine nature is deemed for liberation, the demonic for bondage; grieve not, O Pandava, you are born with divine qualities.
Hinglish (1): Daivi prakriti moksha deti hai; asuri prakriti bandhan deti hai; tum daivi sampad wale ho.
Hinglish (2): Daivi sampada mukti ke liye aur aasuri sampada bandhan ke liye maani jaati hai. Hey Pandav, tum shok mat karo, kyunki tum daivi sampada ke saath janme ho.
message:
दैवी संपद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता मा शुचः संपदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव
The divine nature is deemed for liberation, the demonic for bondage; grieve not, O Pandava, you are born with divine qualities.
Daivi prakriti moksha deti hai; asuri prakriti bandhan deti hai; tum daivi sampad wale ho.

Sanskrit verse: द्वौ भू‍तसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे श्रृणु
Translation (English): There are two kinds of created beings in this world—the divine and the demonic; I have described the divine—now hear from Me of the demonic, O Partha.
Hinglish (1): Duniya me do prakriti hain—daivi aur asuri; daivi bata di, ab asuri suno.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, is sansaar mein do prakaar ke praani hain - daivi aur aasuri. Daivi ka varnan maine vistaar se kar diya hai, ab mujhse aasuri ke baare mein suno.
message:
द्वौ भू‍तसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे श्रृणु
There are two kinds of created beings in this world—the divine and the demonic; I have described the divine—now hear from Me of the demonic, O Partha.
Duniya me do prakriti hain—daivi aur asuri; daivi bata di, ab asuri suno.

Sanskrit verse: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते
Translation (English): The demonic know not what to do or refrain from; they have neither purity, proper conduct, nor truth.
Hinglish (1): Asuri log ko na kartavya ka gyaan hai na viram ka; unme shauch, achar, satya nahi.
Hinglish (2): Aasuri swabhav ke log yeh nahi jaante ki kya karna chahiye aur kya nahi karna chahiye. Unmein na toh baahari-bheetari pavitrata hoti hai, na sadachar, aur na hi satya.
message:
प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते
The demonic know not what to do or refrain from; they have neither purity, proper conduct, nor truth.
Asuri log ko na kartavya ka gyaan hai na viram ka; unme shauch, achar, satya nahi.

Sanskrit verse: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहेतुकम्
Translation (English): They say: the world is unreal, without basis, without God, born of mutual union, nothing else but desire’s cause.
Hinglish (1): Vah kehte hain: jagat asatya hai, aadhar rahit, ishwar rahit, keval kaamna se bana.
Hinglish (2): Ve kehte hain ki yeh jagat asatya hai, iska koi aadhaar nahi hai, koi Ishwar nahi hai. Yeh kewal kaam (lust) se, stri-purush ke sanyog se utpann hua hai, iske alawa aur kya kaaran ho sakta hai?
message:
असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहेतुकम्
They say: the world is unreal, without basis, without God, born of mutual union, nothing else but desire’s cause.
Vah kehte hain: jagat asatya hai, aadhar rahit, ishwar rahit, keval kaamna se bana.
tags: what is the purpose of life, confusion, negative thoughts

Sanskrit verse: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः
Translation (English): Holding this view, lost souls of little understanding, engaged in fierce acts, are born for the destruction of the world.
Hinglish (1): Is drishti se asuri log ugra karm karte hain, jagat ke nash ke liye upasthit hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Is drishti ko apnakar, ve nasht-aatma, alp-buddhi waale, ugra karm karne waale aur jagat ke shatru, sansaar ke naash ke liye hi utpann hote hain.
message:
एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः
Holding this view, lost souls of little understanding, engaged in fierce acts, are born for the destruction of the world.
Is drishti se asuri log ugra karm karte hain, jagat ke nash ke liye upasthit hote hain.

Sanskrit verse: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः मोहाद्गृहित्वाऽसद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः
Translation (English): Clinging to insatiable desire, full of hypocrisy, pride, arrogance, in delusion they hold false notions, acting with impure vows.
Hinglish (1): Kaamna, dambh, maan, mad se bhare, asatya vichar pakad kar, ashuddh vrat lete hain.
Hinglish (2): Ve kabhi na poori hone waali kaamnaon ka aashray lekar, paakhand, maan aur mad se yukt hokar, moh-vash galat siddhanton ko grahan karke, ashuddh vraton ke saath kaam karte hain.
message:
काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः मोहाद्गृहित्वाऽसद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः
Clinging to insatiable desire, full of hypocrisy, pride, arrogance, in delusion they hold false notions, acting with impure vows.
Kaamna, dambh, maan, mad se bhare, asatya vichar pakad kar, ashuddh vrat lete hain.
tags: letting go of greed, negative thoughts, guilt

Sanskrit verse: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः
Translation (English): With immeasurable anxiety ending only at death, considering sense enjoyment as life’s highest goal.
Hinglish (1): Mrityu tak chinta, vishay sukh ko hi sab kuch maana.
Hinglish (2): Ve mrityu tak anant chintaon ke aashrit rehte hain. Unke liye kaam-bhog hi sabse bada lakshya hai, aur ve 'itna hi sukh hai' aisa nishchay kar lete hain.
message:
चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः
With immeasurable anxiety ending only at death, considering sense enjoyment as life’s highest goal.
Mrityu tak chinta, vishay sukh ko hi sab kuch maana.
tags: anxiety, stress, what is the purpose of life

Sanskrit verse: आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान्
Translation (English): Bound by hundreds of cords of hope, devoted to desire and anger, they seek wealth unjustly for sense enjoyment.
Hinglish (1): Aasha ke rassi se baddhe, kaam-krodh me lage, anyaay se dhan kamate hain.
Hinglish (2): Ve aasha ke saikdon paashon (bandhano) se bandhe, kaam aur krodh ke paraayan hokar, kaam-bhog ke liye anyaay-poorvak dhan-sangrah karne ki cheshta karte hain.
message:
आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान्
Bound by hundreds of cords of hope, devoted to desire and anger, they seek wealth unjustly for sense enjoyment.
Aasha ke rassi se baddhe, kaam-krodh me lage, anyaay se dhan kamate hain.
tags: letting go of greed, how to control anger, anxiety

Sanskrit verse: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम्
Translation (English): This I have gained today, and this desire I shall obtain; this is mine, and more shall also be mine in future.
Hinglish (1): Aaj yeh mila, yeh pa lunga; yeh mera hai, aur aage bhi mera hoga.
Hinglish (2): (Ve sochte hain) 'Aaj maine yeh prapt kar liya, ab main is manorth ko prapt karunga. Itna dhan mere paas hai, aur bhavishya mein aur bhi hoga.'
message:
इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम्
This I have gained today, and this desire I shall obtain; this is mine, and more shall also be mine in future.
Aaj yeh mila, yeh pa lunga; yeh mera hai, aur aage bhi mera hoga.
tags: letting go of greed, negative thoughts

Sanskrit verse: असौ मया हतशत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी
Translation (English): I have slain that enemy, and will slay others too; I am the lord, I enjoy, I am perfect, powerful, and happy.
Hinglish (1): Maine shatru mara, aur marunga; main ishwar hoon, anandi, siddh, balwaan hoon.
Hinglish (2): Us shatru ko maine maar diya, aur doosre shatruon ko bhi maar dunga. Main hi Ishwar hoon, main hi bhokta hoon. Main siddh, balwaan aur sukhi hoon.'
message:
असौ मया हतशत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी
I have slain that enemy, and will slay others too; I am the lord, I enjoy, I am perfect, powerful, and happy.
Maine shatru mara, aur marunga; main ishwar hoon, anandi, siddh, balwaan hoon.
tags: letting go of greed, how to control anger

Sanskrit verse: आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्ये इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः
Translation (English): I am wealthy, high-born; who is equal to me? I will sacrifice, give, enjoy—thus deluded by ignorance.
Hinglish (1): Main dhanwan, uchch kul me janma; koi mera saman nahi; main yagya karunga, dunga, mauj karunga.
Hinglish (2): Main dhanvaan aur bade kul waala hoon. Mere samaan aur kaun hai? Main yajna karunga, daan dunga aur anandit hounga.' - is prakaar ve agyaan se mohit rehte hain.
message:
आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्ये इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः
I am wealthy, high-born; who is equal to me? I will sacrifice, give, enjoy—thus deluded by ignorance.
Main dhanwan, uchch kul me janma; koi mera saman nahi; main yagya karunga, dunga, mauj karunga.

Sanskrit verse: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ताः मोहजालसमावृताः प्रसक्ताः कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ
Translation (English): Bewildered by many thoughts, caught in the net of delusion, strongly addicted to sense enjoyment, they fall into foul hell.
Hinglish (1): Bahut soch me confuse, moha ke jaal me phanse, vishay bhog me asakt, nark me girte hain.
Hinglish (2): Anek prakaar se chitt ke bhatakne, moh ke jaal mein fanse hone, aur kaam-bhogon mein atyant aasakt hone ke kaaran, ve ashuddh narak mein girte hain.
message:
अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ताः मोहजालसमावृताः प्रसक्ताः कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ
Bewildered by many thoughts, caught in the net of delusion, strongly addicted to sense enjoyment, they fall into foul hell.
Bahut soch me confuse, moha ke jaal me phanse, vishay bhog me asakt, nark me girte hain.
tags: anxiety, confusion, fear of death, Karma

Sanskrit verse: आत्मसम्भाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम्
Translation (English): Self-conceited, stubborn, filled with pride of wealth, they perform sacrifices for name’s sake, without following proper rules.
Hinglish (1): Ahankari, ziddi, dhan ke ghamand wale, naam ke liye vidhi-rahit yagya karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Ve apne aap ko hi shreshth maanne waale, ziddi, aur dhan ke maan aur mad se yukt hokar, kewal naam-maatra ke yajyon se, paakhand-poorvak aur avidhi-poorvak yajna karte hain.
message:
आत्मसम्भाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम्
Self-conceited, stubborn, filled with pride of wealth, they perform sacrifices for name’s sake, without following proper rules.
Ahankari, ziddi, dhan ke ghamand wale, naam ke liye vidhi-rahit yagya karte hain.

Sanskrit verse: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः ममान्यपरेषु द्वेषोऽभ्यसूयासु संवृताः
Translation (English): Possessed by ego, strength, pride, desire, and anger, they become envious and hateful towards others.
Hinglish (1): Ahankar, bal, maan, kaam, krodh se bhare, doosron se jalan aur dvesh karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Ahankaar, bal, ghamand, kaam aur krodh ka aashray lekar, ve doosron se dvesh karne waale log apne aur doosron ke shareer mein sthit mujhse (Paramatma se) dvesh karte hain.
message:
अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः ममान्यपरेषु द्वेषोऽभ्यसूयासु संवृताः
Possessed by ego, strength, pride, desire, and anger, they become envious and hateful towards others.
Ahankar, bal, maan, kaam, krodh se bhare, doosron se jalan aur dvesh karte hain.
tags: how to control anger, dealing with jealousy, negative thoughts

Sanskrit verse: तानहं द्विषतः क्रुरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु
Translation (English): Those hateful, cruel, worst of men, I hurl into demonic wombs in samsara again and again.
Hinglish (1): Main un naradhama, krur, dveshbhari aatmaon ko baar-baar asuri yoni me dalta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Un dvesh karne waale, kroor, sansaar mein neeche star ke paapi manushyon ko main hamesha aasuri yoniyon mein hi giraata hoon.
message:
तानहं द्विषतः क्रुरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु
Those hateful, cruel, worst of men, I hurl into demonic wombs in samsara again and again.
Main un naradhama, krur, dveshbhari aatmaon ko baar-baar asuri yoni me dalta hoon.

Sanskrit verse: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम्
Translation (English): Entering demonic wombs, deluded birth after birth, without attaining Me, they go to the lowest state.
Hinglish (1): Asuri yoni me janm lete hue, mujhme na milkar, neech gati me jaate hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kaunteya, janm-janmantar tak aasuri yoniyon ko prapt hue ve moorkh log, mujhe na prapt hokar, usse bhi adham gati ko prapt hote hain.
message:
आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम्
Entering demonic wombs, deluded birth after birth, without attaining Me, they go to the lowest state.
Asuri yoni me janm lete hue, mujhme na milkar, neech gati me jaate hain.

Sanskrit verse: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत्
Translation (English): Desire, anger, and greed—these three are the gates to hell, destructive of the self; therefore, one should abandon them.
Hinglish (1): Kaam, krodh, lobh nark ke teen dwar hain; inhe chhod do.
Hinglish (2): Kaam (Lust), Krodh (Anger) aur Lobh (Greed) - yeh teen narak ke dwaar hain, jo aatma ka naash karte hain. Isliye, in teeno ka tyag kar dena chahiye.
Summary: Warning against the threefold gate to ruin.
message:
त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत्
Desire, anger, and greed—these three are the gates to hell, destructive of the self; therefore, one should abandon them.
Kaam, krodh, lobh nark ke teen dwar hain; inhe chhod do.
tags: letting go of greed, how to control anger, guilt

Sanskrit verse: एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम्
Translation (English): Free from these three gates of darkness, a man acts for self-betterment and thus goes to the supreme goal.
Hinglish (1): In teenon dwar se mukt hokar, vyakti apna kalyan karta hai aur param gati paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kaunteya, jo manushya in teen andhkaar ke dwaaron se mukt ho jaata hai, woh apni aatma ke kalyan ka aacharan karta hai aur is prakaar param gati ko prapt hota hai.
message:
एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम्
Free from these three gates of darkness, a man acts for self-betterment and thus goes to the supreme goal.
In teenon dwar se mukt hokar, vyakti apna kalyan karta hai aur param gati paata hai.

Sanskrit verse: यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम्
Translation (English): He who disregards the injunctions of scripture and acts by desire attains neither perfection, nor happiness, nor supreme goal.
Hinglish (1): Jo shastra-vidhi chhodkar kaamna se chalta hai, vo na siddhi, na sukh, na param gati paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo shastron ke vidhi-vidhaan ko tyagkar apni kaamnaon ke anusaar aacharan karta hai, woh na toh siddhi, na sukh aur na hi param gati ko prapt karta hai.
message:
यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम्
He who disregards the injunctions of scripture and acts by desire attains neither perfection, nor happiness, nor supreme goal.
Jo shastra-vidhi chhodkar kaamna se chalta hai, vo na siddhi, na sukh, na param gati paata hai.

Sanskrit verse: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि
Translation (English): Therefore, let scripture be your authority in determining what is to be done and not to be done; knowing this, you should act here.
Hinglish (1): Isliye shastra ko apna pramaan banao; kya karna aur kya nahi, iske anusaar chalo.
Hinglish (2): Isliye, kartavya aur akartavya ki vyavastha mein, tumhare liye shaastra hi pramaan hain. Shaastron ke vidhi-vidhaan ko jaankar hi, tumhein is sansaar mein karm karna chahiye.
message:
तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि
Therefore, let scripture be your authority in determining what is to be done and not to be done; knowing this, you should act here.
Isliye shastra ko apna pramaan banao; kya karna aur kya nahi, iske anusaar chalo.

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः
Translation (English): Arjuna said: Those who, setting aside the scriptures, perform sacrifice with faith—what is their condition, O Krishna? Is it sattva, rajas, or tamas?
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Jo shastra vidhi chhodkar shraddha se yagya karte hain, unki sthiti kaunsi hai—sattvik, rajasic ya tamasic?
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Krishna, jo log shastron ke vidhi-vidhaan ko tyagkar, par shraddha se yukt hokar pooja karte hain, unki nishtha (faith) kaisi hoti hai - Sattva, Rajas, ya Tamas?
Summary: Asks about faith outside scriptural rule.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः
Arjuna said: Those who, setting aside the scriptures, perform sacrifice with faith—what is their condition, O Krishna? Is it sattva, rajas, or tamas?
Arjun bola: Jo shastra vidhi chhodkar shraddha se yagya karte hain, unki sthiti kaunsi hai—sattvik, rajasic ya tamasic?
tags: confusion, Dharma, three gunas, doubting mind

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: Faith in embodied beings is of three kinds, born of their nature: sattvic, rajasic, and tamasic—hear of it.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Dehधारी की श्रद्धा तीन प्रकार की होती है—सात्त्विक, राजस और तामस—ध्यान से सुनो.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Dehdhaariyon ki shraddha unke swabhav se utpann hoti hai aur teen prakaar ki hoti hai - Saattviki, Raajasi aur Taamasi. Uske baare mein suno.
Summary: Introduces the threefold division of faith.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु
The Blessed Lord said: Faith in embodied beings is of three kinds, born of their nature: sattvic, rajasic, and tamasic—hear of it.
Shri Krishna bole: Dehधारी की श्रद्धा तीन प्रकार की होती है—सात्त्विक, राजस और तामस—ध्यान से सुनो.

Sanskrit verse: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः
Translation (English): O Bharata, faith conforms to the nature of each; man is made of faith; as is his faith, so is he.
Hinglish (1): Hey Bharat, vyakti ki shraddha uske swabhav ke anuroop hoti hai; jo jaisi shraddha rakhta hai, waise hi hota hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, sabhi ki shraddha unke antahkaran ke anuroop hoti hai. Yeh purush shraddha-may hai, isliye jo jaisi shraddha waala hai, wahi uska swaroop hai.
message:
सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः
O Bharata, faith conforms to the nature of each; man is made of faith; as is his faith, so is he.
Hey Bharat, vyakti ki shraddha uske swabhav ke anuroop hoti hai; jo jaisi shraddha rakhta hai, waise hi hota hai.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, Jnana Yoga

Sanskrit verse: यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसाः प्रेतान्भूतगणांस्तांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जनाः
Translation (English): The sattvic worship the gods, the rajasic worship yakshas and rakshasas, the tamasic worship ghosts and spirits.
Hinglish (1): Sattvik devtaon ki, rajasic yaksh-rakshas ki, tamasic bhoot-preton ki puja karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Saattvik log devtaon ko poojte hain, Raajasik log Yakshon aur Rakshason ko poojte hain, aur Taamasik log Preton aur Bhoot-ganon ko poojte hain.
Summary: Objects of worship differ by guna.
message:
यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसाः प्रेतान्भूतगणांस्तांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जनाः
The sattvic worship the gods, the rajasic worship yakshas and rakshasas, the tamasic worship ghosts and spirits.
Sattvik devtaon ki, rajasic yaksh-rakshas ki, tamasic bhoot-preton ki puja karte hain.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, Bhakti Yoga

Sanskrit verse: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः दम्भाहंकारसंयुक्ताः कामरागबलान्विताः
Translation (English): Those who perform severe austerities not enjoined by scripture, filled with hypocrisy, ego, and attachment to desire and pride...
Hinglish (1): Jo shastra-viruddh kathor tap karte hain, dambh, ahankar, kaamna, maan se bhare hote hain...
Hinglish (2): Jo log paakhand aur ahankaar se yukt hokar, kaamna aur aasakti ke bal se, shastron mein nahi batayi gayi ghor tapasya karte hain...
message:
अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः दम्भाहंकारसंयुक्ताः कामरागबलान्विताः
Those who perform severe austerities not enjoined by scripture, filled with hypocrisy, ego, and attachment to desire and pride...
Jo shastra-viruddh kathor tap karte hain, dambh, ahankar, kaamna, maan se bhare hote hain...

Sanskrit verse: कर्षयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः मां चैवान्तःशरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान्
Translation (English): Tormenting the aggregated elements in the body, and Me dwelling within, know them to be of demonic resolve.
Hinglish (1): Jo apne sharir ke tattvon ko, aur mujhme antarvasit atma ko klesh dete hain, ve asuri sankalp wale hain.
Hinglish (2): ...ve aviveki log shareer mein sthit bhoot-samuday (elements) ko aur mujhe (antahsthit Paramatma ko) bhi kasht dete hain. Unhe tum aasuri nishchay waala jaano.
message:
कर्षयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः मां चैवान्तःशरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान्
Tormenting the aggregated elements in the body, and Me dwelling within, know them to be of demonic resolve.
Jo apne sharir ke tattvon ko, aur mujhme antarvasit atma ko klesh dete hain, ve asuri sankalp wale hain.

Sanskrit verse: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं ते प्रवेक्ष्याम्यशेषतः
Translation (English): Food also is dear to each according to the threefold division, as are sacrifice, austerity, and charity—hear of them fully.
Hinglish (1): Aahar, yajya, tap, daan bhi teen guna se bante hain—suno.
Hinglish (2): Sabko priya aahar bhi teen prakaar ka hota hai, aur usi tarah yajna, tap aur daan bhi. Unke is bhed ko suno.
Summary: Extends the threefold division to daily acts.
message:
आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं ते प्रवेक्ष्याम्यशेषतः
Food also is dear to each according to the threefold division, as are sacrifice, austerity, and charity—hear of them fully.
Aahar, yajya, tap, daan bhi teen guna se bante hain—suno.

Sanskrit verse: आयुःसत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्याः आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः
Translation (English): Foods that promote life, vitality, strength, health, happiness, and satisfaction—juicy, oily, stable, and agreeable—are dear to the sattvic.
Hinglish (1): Jeevan, satva, bal, aarogya, sukh, priti badhane wale, rasile, snigdha, sthir, hridya aahar sattvik ko priya hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo aahar aayu, buddhi, bal, aarogya, sukh aur preeti ko badhaate hain, aur jo rasile, chikne, sthir rehne waale aur mann ko bhaane waale hote hain, ve saattvik logon ko priya hote hain.
message:
आयुःसत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्याः आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः
Foods that promote life, vitality, strength, health, happiness, and satisfaction—juicy, oily, stable, and agreeable—are dear to the sattvic.
Jeevan, satva, bal, aarogya, sukh, priti badhane wale, rasile, snigdha, sthir, hridya aahar sattvik ko priya hai.

Sanskrit verse: कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयरप्रदाः
Translation (English): Bitter, sour, salty, very hot, pungent, dry, burning foods are dear to the rajasic, producing pain, grief, and disease.
Hinglish (1): Kadwe, khatte, namkeen, bahut garam, teekhe, sookhe, jalan wale aahar rajasic ko priya, par dukh, rog dete hain.
Hinglish (2): Jo aahar atyant kadwe, khatte, namkeen, garam, teekhe, rookhe aur jalan paida karne waale hote hain, ve raajasik logon ko priya hote hain aur dukh, shok aur rog utpann karte hain.
message:
कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयरप्रदाः
Bitter, sour, salty, very hot, pungent, dry, burning foods are dear to the rajasic, producing pain, grief, and disease.
Kadwe, khatte, namkeen, bahut garam, teekhe, sookhe, jalan wale aahar rajasic ko priya, par dukh, rog dete hain.

Sanskrit verse: यातायामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम्
Translation (English): Stale, tasteless, putrid, decomposed, unclean, and leftover food is dear to the tamasic.
Hinglish (1): Basi, be-swaad, sadi-gali, asuddh, bacha khucha bhojan tamasic ko priya hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo bhojan adhpaka, ras-rahit, durgandh-yukt, baasi, uchhisht (jootha) aur apavitra hai, woh taamasik logon ko priya hota hai.
message:
यातायामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम्
Stale, tasteless, putrid, decomposed, unclean, and leftover food is dear to the tamasic.
Basi, be-swaad, sadi-gali, asuddh, bacha khucha bhojan tamasic ko priya hai.

Sanskrit verse: अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः
Translation (English): The sacrifice performed according to rule, by those without desire for reward, with the mind fixed on “it ought to be done,” is sattvic.
Hinglish (1): Jo yajya vidhi se, bina fal ki iccha, keval kartavya ke liye hota hai, vo sattvik hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo yajna phal ki ichha na rakhne waale logon dwara, shaastra-vidhi se, kewal kartavya samajhkar mann ko samadhaan karke kiya jaata hai, woh saattvik hai.
message:
अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः
The sacrifice performed according to rule, by those without desire for reward, with the mind fixed on “it ought to be done,” is sattvic.
Jo yajya vidhi se, bina fal ki iccha, keval kartavya ke liye hota hai, vo sattvik hai.

Sanskrit verse: अभिसंधाय तु फलं दंभार्थमपि चैव यत् इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम्
Translation (English): That sacrifice performed for reward or for show is rajasic, O best of the Bharatas.
Hinglish (1): Jo yajya fal ya pradarshan ke liye ho, vo rajasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Parantu, hey Bharat-shreshth, jo yajna phal ki drishti se ya paakhand (show-off) ke liye kiya jaata hai, us yajna ko tum raajasik jaano.
message:
अभिसंधाय तु फलं दंभार्थमपि चैव यत् इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम्
That sacrifice performed for reward or for show is rajasic, O best of the Bharatas.
Jo yajya fal ya pradarshan ke liye ho, vo rajasic hai.

Sanskrit verse: विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते
Translation (English): Sacrifice without rules, without food offered, without mantras, without gifts, without faith is declared tamasic.
Hinglish (1): Vidhi, ahuti, mantra, dakshina, shraddha ke bina yajya tamasic hota hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo yajna shaastra-vidhi se heen, ann-daan se rahit, mantron se rahit, dakshina se rahit aur shraddha se rahit hota hai, use taamasik yajna kehte hain.
message:
विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते
Sacrifice without rules, without food offered, without mantras, without gifts, without faith is declared tamasic.
Vidhi, ahuti, mantra, dakshina, shraddha ke bina yajya tamasic hota hai.

Sanskrit verse: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते
Translation (English): Worship of gods, brahmanas, teachers, and wise; purity, uprightness, celibacy, and non-violence—these are bodily austerity.
Hinglish (1): Dev, brahman, guru, gyani ka poojan, shauch, imaandari, brahmacharya, ahimsa sharirik tap hai.
Hinglish (2): Devtaon, Brahmanon, guruon aur gyaaniyon ka poojan, pavitrata, saralta, brahmacharya aur ahimsa - yeh shareer ki tapasya kehlati hai.
message:
देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते
Worship of gods, brahmanas, teachers, and wise; purity, uprightness, celibacy, and non-violence—these are bodily austerity.
Dev, brahman, guru, gyani ka poojan, shauch, imaandari, brahmacharya, ahimsa sharirik tap hai.

Sanskrit verse: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यमप्रियहितं च यत् स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते
Translation (English): Words that do not offend, are truthful, pleasant, and beneficial, and study of scriptures—this is austerity of speech.
Hinglish (1): Jo vachan kisi ko udveg na de, satya, priya, hitkar ho; swadhyaya—ye vaani ka tap hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo vachan udveg paida na kare, jo satya, priya aur hitkar ho, aur swadhyay ka abhyaas - yeh vaani ki tapasya kehlati hai.
message:
अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यमप्रियहितं च यत् स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते
Words that do not offend, are truthful, pleasant, and beneficial, and study of scriptures—this is austerity of speech.
Jo vachan kisi ko udveg na de, satya, priya, hitkar ho; swadhyaya—ye vaani ka tap hai.
tags: Sattva, mental peace, how to stay calm

Sanskrit verse: मनःप्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते
Translation (English): Cheerfulness, gentleness, silence, self-control, and purity of feeling—these are austerity of mind.
Hinglish (1): Mann ki prasannata, komalta, maun, atma sanyam, bhav shuddhi—ye maanasik tap hai.
Hinglish (2): Mann ki prasannata, saumyata, maun, aatm-sanyam aur bhaav-shuddhi - yeh mann ki tapasya kehlati hai.
message:
मनःप्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते
Cheerfulness, gentleness, silence, self-control, and purity of feeling—these are austerity of mind.
Mann ki prasannata, komalta, maun, atma sanyam, bhav shuddhi—ye maanasik tap hai.
tags: Sattva, inner peace, mental peace, ध्यान

Sanskrit verse: श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्त्रिविधं नरैः अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते
Translation (English): Threefold austerity performed with supreme faith, without desire for fruit, by steadfast men is called sattvic.
Hinglish (1): Uttam shraddha se, bina fal ki iccha, sthir man se kiya tap sattvik hai.
Hinglish (2): Phal ki ichha na rakhne waale yukt manushyon dwara, param shraddha se ki gayi yeh teen prakaar ki tapasya saattvik kehlati hai.
message:
श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्त्रिविधं नरैः अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते
Threefold austerity performed with supreme faith, without desire for fruit, by steadfast men is called sattvic.
Uttam shraddha se, bina fal ki iccha, sthir man se kiya tap sattvik hai.

Sanskrit verse: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम्
Translation (English): Austerity done for honor, reverence, or respect, or out of hypocrisy is said to be rajasic, unstable and insecure.
Hinglish (1): Samman, maan, puja, ya dambh ke liye kiya tap rajasic hai, asthir hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo tapasya satkaar, maan aur pooja ke liye ya paakhand se ki jaati hai, woh is sansaar mein anishchit aur kshanik hone ke kaaran raajasik kahi gayi hai.
message:
सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम्
Austerity done for honor, reverence, or respect, or out of hypocrisy is said to be rajasic, unstable and insecure.
Samman, maan, puja, ya dambh ke liye kiya tap rajasic hai, asthir hai.

Sanskrit verse: मूढग्रहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्
Translation (English): Austerity performed with foolish obstinacy, causing self-torture, or for harming others, is declared tamasic.
Hinglish (1): Jo moorkhata se, apni ya doosron ki peeda ke liye ho, vo tamasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo tapasya moorkhta-vash, mann-vachan-shareer ko peeda dekar ya doosre ka anisht karne ke liye ki jaati hai, woh taamasik kehlati hai.
message:
मूढग्रहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्
Austerity performed with foolish obstinacy, causing self-torture, or for harming others, is declared tamasic.
Jo moorkhata se, apni ya doosron ki peeda ke liye ho, vo tamasic hai.

Sanskrit verse: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम्
Translation (English): That gift given to one who does no return, at the right place, time, and to a worthy person, is sattvic.
Hinglish (1): Jo daan sahi jagah-samay par, patra ko, bina wapas lene ki iccha ke diya jaye, vo sattvik hai.
Hinglish (2): Daan dena kartavya hai' - is bhaav se jo daan desh, kaal aur paatra (sahi jagah, samay aur vyakti) ko, anupkari (jisse badle ki apeksha na ho) ko diya jaata hai, woh saattvik maana gaya hai.
message:
दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम्
That gift given to one who does no return, at the right place, time, and to a worthy person, is sattvic.
Jo daan sahi jagah-samay par, patra ko, bina wapas lene ki iccha ke diya jaye, vo sattvik hai.

Sanskrit verse: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम्
Translation (English): That gift made with a view to a return, or with a result in mind, reluctantly is regarded as rajasic.
Hinglish (1): Jo daan wapas lene ya fal ke liye, man me kasak ke diya jaye, vo rajasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Parantu jo daan pratyupkar (badle) ke liye ya phal ki apeksha se, ya klesh-poorvak (reluctantly) diya jaata hai, woh raajasik kaha gaya hai.
message:
यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम्
That gift made with a view to a return, or with a result in mind, reluctantly is regarded as rajasic.
Jo daan wapas lene ya fal ke liye, man me kasak ke diya jaye, vo rajasic hai.

Sanskrit verse: अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्
Translation (English): That gift given at wrong place or time, to unworthy persons, without respect or with contempt, is declared tamasic.
Hinglish (1): Galat jagah-samay par, apatra ko, asamman se diya daan tamasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo daan galat sthan, galat samay par, kupaatra (unworthy) logon ko, bina satkaar ke aur tiraskaar-poorvak diya jaata hai, woh taamasik kehlata hai.
message:
अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्
That gift given at wrong place or time, to unworthy persons, without respect or with contempt, is declared tamasic.
Galat jagah-samay par, apatra ko, asamman se diya daan tamasic hai.

Sanskrit verse: ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा
Translation (English): Om Tat Sat is declared as the threefold designation of Brahman; by that, the brahmanas, Vedas, and sacrifices were created in the past.
Hinglish (1): ‘Om Tat Sat’ Brahman ka teen guna naam hai; isse brahman, ved, yajya bane.
Hinglish (2): Om Tat Sat' - is prakaar Brahman ka teen-gun-may nirdesh maana gaya hai. Prachin kaal mein usi se Brahman, Ved aur Yajna rache gaye the.
message:
ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा
Om Tat Sat is declared as the threefold designation of Brahman; by that, the brahmanas, Vedas, and sacrifices were created in the past.
‘Om Tat Sat’ Brahman ka teen guna naam hai; isse brahman, ved, yajya bane.

Sanskrit verse: तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवद्भिः
Translation (English): Therefore, uttering "Om," the acts of sacrifice, gift, and austerity as enjoined begin always by those who follow Brahman.
Hinglish (1): Isliye ‘Om’ kehkar yajya, daan, tap shuru karte hain brahmavadi log.
Hinglish (2): Isliye, Brahma-vaadi log shaastron mein batayi gayi yajna, daan aur tap ki kriyaon ka aarambh hamesha 'Om' ka uccharan karke karte hain.
message:
तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवद्भिः
Therefore, uttering "Om," the acts of sacrifice, gift, and austerity as enjoined begin always by those who follow Brahman.
Isliye ‘Om’ kehkar yajya, daan, tap shuru karte hain brahmavadi log.

Sanskrit verse: तदित्यनभिसंधाय फलं यज्ञतपःक्रियाः दानक्रियाश्च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभिः
Translation (English): With "Tat," acts of sacrifice, austerity, and various gifts are performed without aiming at fruit, by seekers of liberation.
Hinglish (1): Tat bolkar moksha chahnewale fal-tyag se yajya, tap, daan karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Moksh ki ichha rakhne waale log phal ki ichha na rakhte hue, 'Tat' shabd ka uccharan karke yajna, tap aur daan ki anek kriyaayein karte hain.
message:
तदित्यनभिसंधाय फलं यज्ञतपःक्रियाः दानक्रियाश्च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभिः
With "Tat," acts of sacrifice, austerity, and various gifts are performed without aiming at fruit, by seekers of liberation.
Tat bolkar moksha chahnewale fal-tyag se yajya, tap, daan karte hain.

Sanskrit verse: सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते
Translation (English): The word "Sat" is used in the sense of reality and goodness; and also for auspicious acts, O Partha.
Hinglish (1): Sat sachchai, sadhuta, aur shubh karm ke liye bola jaata hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, 'Sat' is shabd ka prayog satya-bhaav mein aur shreshth-bhaav mein kiya jaata hai. Aur prashansaneeya karm mein bhi 'Sat' shabd ka prayog hota hai.
message:
सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते
The word "Sat" is used in the sense of reality and goodness; and also for auspicious acts, O Partha.
Sat sachchai, sadhuta, aur shubh karm ke liye bola jaata hai.

Sanskrit verse: यज्ञतपःक्रियादानेषु सत् इत्युच्यते चान्वयः कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते
Translation (English): In sacrifice, austerity, and gift, the word "Sat" is used, and also for action done for such purposes—this is so declared.
Hinglish (1): Yajya, tap, daan me "Sat" bola jaata hai; unke sambandhit karm me bhi.
Hinglish (2): Yajna, tap aur daan mein jo sthiti hoti hai, woh bhi 'Sat' kehlati hai. Aur us Parmatma ke liye kiya gaya karm bhi 'Sat' hi kehlata hai.
message:
यज्ञतपःक्रियादानेषु सत् इत्युच्यते चान्वयः कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते
In sacrifice, austerity, and gift, the word "Sat" is used, and also for action done for such purposes—this is so declared.
Yajya, tap, daan me "Sat" bola jaata hai; unke sambandhit karm me bhi.

Sanskrit verse: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह
Translation (English): Sacrifice, gift, or austerity done without faith is called "Asat"—worthless here or hereafter, O Partha.
Hinglish (1): Bina shraddha ke kiya yajya, daan, tap—yahan ya aage bekaar hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, bina shraddha ke kiya gaya havan, diya gaya daan, aur kiya gaya tap - 'Asat' kehlata hai. Iska na toh is lok mein koi laabh hai aur na hi parlok mein.
Summary: Faith is essential for spiritual value.
message:
अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह
Sacrifice, gift, or austerity done without faith is called "Asat"—worthless here or hereafter, O Partha.
Bina shraddha ke kiya yajya, daan, tap—yahan ya aage bekaar hai.

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच संन्यासस्य महाबाहो तत्त्वमिच्छामि वेदितुम् त्यागस्य च हृषीकेश पृथक्केशिनिषूदन
Translation (English): Arjuna said: O mighty-armed, I wish to know the truth of renunciation and also of abandonment, O Hrishikesha, O Slayer of Kesi.
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Hey Mahabaahu, main sannyas aur tyag ka tattva jaanna chahta hoon.
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Mahabahu, Hey Hrishikesh, Hey Keshi-nishudan! Main sannyas (renunciation of action) aur tyag (renunciation of fruits) ke tattva ko alag-alag jaanna chahta hoon.
Summary: Asks to clarify difference between sannyasa and tyaga.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच संन्यासस्य महाबाहो तत्त्वमिच्छामि वेदितुम् त्यागस्य च हृषीकेश पृथक्केशिनिषूदन
Arjuna said: O mighty-armed, I wish to know the truth of renunciation and also of abandonment, O Hrishikesha, O Slayer of Kesi.
Arjun bola: Hey Mahabaahu, main sannyas aur tyag ka tattva jaanna chahta hoon.
tags: confusion, indecision, Karma Yoga, Jnana Yoga

Sanskrit verse: श्रीभगवानुवाच काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं संन्यासं कवयो विदुः सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं प्राहुस्त्यागं विचक्षणाः
Translation (English): The Blessed Lord said: The sages understand sannyasa as the giving up of actions for desire; the wise call tyaga the renunciation of the fruits of all actions.
Hinglish (1): Shri Krishna bole: Rishiyon kehte sannyas kaamna wale karm ka tyag hai; gyani kehte tyag karmfal ka tyag hai.
Hinglish (2): Shri Krishna ne kaha: Kuch vidwan kaamya karmon (desire-based actions) ke tyag ko 'sannyas' kehte hain, jabki doosre vidwan sabhi karmon ke phal ke tyag ko 'tyag' kehte hain.
message:
श्रीभगवानुवाच काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं संन्यासं कवयो विदुः सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं प्राहुस्त्यागं विचक्षणाः
The Blessed Lord said: The sages understand sannyasa as the giving up of actions for desire; the wise call tyaga the renunciation of the fruits of all actions.
Shri Krishna bole: Rishiyon kehte sannyas kaamna wale karm ka tyag hai; gyani kehte tyag karmfal ka tyag hai.
tags: Nishkama Karma, detachment, Karma Yoga, Jnana Yoga

Sanskrit verse: त्याज्यं दोषवदित्येके कर्म प्राहुर्मनीषिणः यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यमिति चापरे
Translation (English): Some declare action should be abandoned as evil; others say acts of sacrifice, gift, and austerity should not be abandoned.
Hinglish (1): Kuch kehte hain karm dosh yukta hai isliye tyag karo; kuch kehte yajya, daan, tap ka tyag nahi.
Hinglish (2): Kuch manishi kehte hain ki sabhi karmon ko dosh-yukt samajhkar tyag dena chahiye. Jabki, kuch anya kehte hain ki yajna, daan aur tap roopi karmon ko kabhi nahi tyagna chahiye.
message:
त्याज्यं दोषवदित्येके कर्म प्राहुर्मनीषिणः यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यमिति चापरे
Some declare action should be abandoned as evil; others say acts of sacrifice, gift, and austerity should not be abandoned.
Kuch kehte hain karm dosh yukta hai isliye tyag karo; kuch kehte yajya, daan, tap ka tyag nahi.

Sanskrit verse: निश्चयं शृणु मे तत्र त्यागे भरतसत्तम त्यागो ह्यश्रद्दया कर्तुर्मयोऽयं त्रिविधः स्मृतः
Translation (English): Hear from Me the final truth about abandonment, O best of Bharatas; abandonment is declared to be of three kinds.
Hinglish (1): Hey Bharatshreshtha, tyag teen prakaar ka hota hai—suno.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat-shreshth, tyag ke vishay mein mera nishchay suno. Tyag bhi teen prakaar ka kaha gaya hai.
message:
निश्चयं शृणु मे तत्र त्यागे भरतसत्तम त्यागो ह्यश्रद्दया कर्तुर्मयोऽयं त्रिविधः स्मृतः
Hear from Me the final truth about abandonment, O best of Bharatas; abandonment is declared to be of three kinds.
Hey Bharatshreshtha, tyag teen prakaar ka hota hai—suno.

Sanskrit verse: यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यं कार्यमेव तत् यज्ञो दानं तपश्चैव पावनानि मनीषिणाम्
Translation (English): Acts of sacrifice, gift, and austerity should not be abandoned but should indeed be done; these purify the wise.
Hinglish (1): Yajya, daan, tap ka tyag na kare; yeh gyani ko pavitra karte hain.
Hinglish (2): Yajna, daan aur tap roopi karmon ko kabhi nahi tyagna chahiye, balki unhe avashya karna chahiye. Kyunki yajna, daan aur tap buddhiman logon ko bhi pavitra karte hain.
message:
यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यं कार्यमेव तत् यज्ञो दानं तपश्चैव पावनानि मनीषिणाम्
Acts of sacrifice, gift, and austerity should not be abandoned but should indeed be done; these purify the wise.
Yajya, daan, tap ka tyag na kare; yeh gyani ko pavitra karte hain.

Sanskrit verse: एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च कर्तव्यानि इति मे पार्थ निश्चितम्
Translation (English): Even these actions should be done, abandoning attachment and the fruits—this is My certain and best opinion, O Partha.
Hinglish (1): Inka bhi karm karo par asakti aur fal tyag do—yeh mera pakka vichar hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, in karmon ko bhi attachment aur phalon ki ichha ko tyagkar hi karna chahiye, yeh mera nishchit aur uttam mat hai.
message:
एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च कर्तव्यानि इति मे पार्थ निश्चितम्
Even these actions should be done, abandoning attachment and the fruits—this is My certain and best opinion, O Partha.
Inka bhi karm karo par asakti aur fal tyag do—yeh mera pakka vichar hai.
tags: Nishkama Karma (selfless action), detachment, Karma Yoga

Sanskrit verse: नियतस्य तु संन्यासः कर्मणो नोपपद्यते मोहात्तस्य परित्यागस्तामसः परिकीर्तितः
Translation (English): Abandoning obligatory duty is not proper; such renunciation from delusion is declared tamasic.
Hinglish (1): Niyat karm ka tyag uchit nahi; moha se kiya tyag tamasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Niyat karmon (prescribed duties) ka tyag karna uchit nahi hai. Moh-vash unka tyag kar dena 'taamasik tyag' kaha gaya hai.
message:
नियतस्य तु संन्यासः कर्मणो नोपपद्यते मोहात्तस्य परित्यागस्तामसः परिकीर्तितः
Abandoning obligatory duty is not proper; such renunciation from delusion is declared tamasic.
Niyat karm ka tyag uchit nahi; moha se kiya tyag tamasic hai.

Sanskrit verse: दुःखमित्येव यत्कर्म कायक्लेशभयात्त्यजेत् स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत्
Translation (English): He who gives up action because it is painful or from fear of bodily trouble—does rajasic renunciation, and does not gain its fruit.
Hinglish (1): Dukh ya sharirik kasht ke dar se kiya tyag rajasic hai; iska phal nahi milta.
Hinglish (2): Jo vyakti 'karm dukh-roop hai' aisa samajhkar ya shaareerik klesh ke bhay se karmon ka tyag kar deta hai, woh 'raajasik tyag' karke tyag ke phal ko prapt nahi hota.
message:
दुःखमित्येव यत्कर्म कायक्लेशभयात्त्यजेत् स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत्
He who gives up action because it is painful or from fear of bodily trouble—does rajasic renunciation, and does not gain its fruit.
Dukh ya sharirik kasht ke dar se kiya tyag rajasic hai; iska phal nahi milta.

Sanskrit verse: कार्यमित्येव यत्कर्म नियतं क्रियतेऽर्जुन सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलं चैव स त्यागः सात्त्विको मतः
Translation (English): When obligatory action is performed only because it should be done, abandoning attachment and fruit—that tyaga is sattvic.
Hinglish (1): Kartavya ke liye, asakti aur fal tyag kar ke kiya karm sattvik tyag hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Arjun, jab niyat karm ko 'kartavya hai' aisa samajhkar, attachment aur phal ki ichha ko tyagkar kiya jaata hai, toh woh tyag 'saattvik' maana gaya hai.
message:
कार्यमित्येव यत्कर्म नियतं क्रियतेऽर्जुन सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलं चैव स त्यागः सात्त्विको मतः
When obligatory action is performed only because it should be done, abandoning attachment and fruit—that tyaga is sattvic.
Kartavya ke liye, asakti aur fal tyag kar ke kiya karm sattvik tyag hai.

Sanskrit verse: न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्जते त्यागी सत्त्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशयः
Translation (English): The renouncer, full of sattva, wise, and free from doubt, neither hates unpleasant work nor clings to pleasant work.
Hinglish (1): Sattva se bhara, gyaani tyagi kushal-akushal karm me na asakti rakhe na dvesh kare.
Hinglish (2): Jo tyagi sattva-gun mein sthit, buddhiman aur sandeh-rahit hai, woh na toh akushal karm se dvesh karta hai aur na hi kushal karm mein aasakt hota hai.
message:
न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्जते त्यागी सत्त्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशयः
The renouncer, full of sattva, wise, and free from doubt, neither hates unpleasant work nor clings to pleasant work.
Sattva se bhara, gyaani tyagi kushal-akushal karm me na asakti rakhe na dvesh kare.

Sanskrit verse: न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागीत्यभिधीयते
Translation (English): For the embodied, it is not possible to renounce all action entirely; he who renounces the fruits is called a true renouncer.
Hinglish (1): Jeevdhari poore karm nahi chhod sakta; jo karmphal chhodta hai wahi saccha tyagi hai.
Hinglish (2): Dehdhaari praani ke liye sampoorn karmon ka tyag karna sambhav nahi hai. Isliye, jo karm-phalon ka tyagi hai, wahi vastav mein 'tyagi' kehlata hai.
message:
न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागीत्यभिधीयते
For the embodied, it is not possible to renounce all action entirely; he who renounces the fruits is called a true renouncer.
Jeevdhari poore karm nahi chhod sakta; jo karmphal chhodta hai wahi saccha tyagi hai.

Sanskrit verse: अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मणः फलम् भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु संन्यासिनां क्वचित्
Translation (English): Unpleasant, pleasant, and mixed—threefold fruits of action accrue after death to the non-renouncer, but never to the renouncer.
Hinglish (1): Anisht, isht, misra—ye teen phal atyagi ko milte hain, tyagi ko nahi.
Hinglish (2): Karm-phal ka tyag na karne waalon ko marne ke baad anisht (unpleasant), isht (pleasant) aur mishrit - teen prakaar ke phal milte hain. Parantu, sannyasiyon ko kabhi nahi.
message:
अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मणः फलम् भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु संन्यासिनां क्वचित्
Unpleasant, pleasant, and mixed—threefold fruits of action accrue after death to the non-renouncer, but never to the renouncer.
Anisht, isht, misra—ye teen phal atyagi ko milte hain, tyagi ko nahi.

Sanskrit verse: पञ्चैतानि महाबाहो कारणानि निबोध मे सांख्ये कृतान्ते प्रोक्तानि सिद्धये सर्वकर्मणाम्
Translation (English): Know from Me, O mighty‑armed, the five causes declared in Sankhya for the accomplishment of all actions.
Hinglish (1): Hey Mahabaahu, sankhya shastra ke anusaar, karm ke paanch kaaran hain—suno.
Hinglish (2): Hey Mahabahu, ab mujhse Sankhya siddhant mein bataye gaye, sabhi karmon ki siddhi ke liye in paanch kaaranon ko jaano.
message:
पञ्चैतानि महाबाहो कारणानि निबोध मे सांख्ये कृतान्ते प्रोक्तानि सिद्धये सर्वकर्मणाम्
Know from Me, O mighty‑armed, the five causes declared in Sankhya for the accomplishment of all actions.
Hey Mahabaahu, sankhya shastra ke anusaar, karm ke paanch kaaran hain—suno.

Sanskrit verse: अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम् विविधाश्च पृथक्चेष्टा देवं चैवात्र पञ्चमम्
Translation (English): The body, the doer, the various instruments, the various kinds of activity, and the divine as the fifth.
Hinglish (1): Sharir, karta, indriya, vivid gati, aur devta paanch kaaran hain.
Hinglish (2): Adhishthan (shareer), karta (jeevatma), alag-alag prakaar ke karan (senses), anek prakaar ki cheshtayein (efforts), aur paanchva daiv (destiny).
message:
अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम् विविधाश्च पृथक्चेष्टा देवं चैवात्र पञ्चमम्
The body, the doer, the various instruments, the various kinds of activity, and the divine as the fifth.
Sharir, karta, indriya, vivid gati, aur devta paanch kaaran hain.

Sanskrit verse: शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत्कर्म प्रारभते नरः न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतवः
