Translation (English): Whatever action a man performs with body, speech, and mind—right or wrong—these five are its causes.
Hinglish (1): Sharir, vaani, mann se kiya koi bhi karm—ye paanch uske kaaran hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Manushya apne shareer, vaani ya mann se jo bhi karm - nyaay-yukt ya anyaay-yukt - aarambh karta hai, uske yeh paanch hi kaaran hote hain.
message:
शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत्कर्म प्रारभते नरः न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतवः
Whatever action a man performs with body, speech, and mind—right or wrong—these five are its causes.
Sharir, vaani, mann se kiya koi bhi karm—ye paanch uske kaaran hote hain.

Sanskrit verse: तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु यः पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान्न स पश्यति दुर्मतिः
Translation (English): Thus, one who sees the Self alone as the doer, due to unrefined understanding, does not see truly—his mind is unwise.
Hinglish (1): Jo aatma ko akela karta maanta hai, vo agyaan se andha hai.
Hinglish (2): Aisa hone par bhi, jo ashuddh buddhi ke kaaran kewal shuddh aatma ko hi karta maanta hai, woh dur-buddhi vastav mein kuch nahi dekhta.
message:
तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु यः पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान्न स पश्यति दुर्मतिः
Thus, one who sees the Self alone as the doer, due to unrefined understanding, does not see truly—his mind is unwise.
Jo aatma ko akela karta maanta hai, vo agyaan se andha hai.

Sanskrit verse: यस्य नाहङ्कृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते हत्वाऽपि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते
Translation (English): He whose ego is not active and whose intellect is not tainted, though he kills, he does not kill nor is bound.
Hinglish (1): Jiska ahankar nahi, buddhi pavitra hai, vo maar kar bhi nahi maarta.
Hinglish (2): Jiske mann mein 'main karta hoon' ka bhaav nahi hai aur jiski buddhi lipt nahi hoti, woh in sab logon ko maarkar bhi na toh maarta hai aur na hi bandhta hai.
message:
यस्य नाहङ्कृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते हत्वाऽपि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते
He whose ego is not active and whose intellect is not tainted, though he kills, he does not kill nor is bound.
Jiska ahankar nahi, buddhi pavitra hai, vo maar kar bhi nahi maarta.

Sanskrit verse: ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविधः कर्मसंग्रहः
Translation (English): Knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the knower are the threefold motivators of action; instrument, action, and doer are the threefold constituents of action.
Hinglish (1): Gyaan, gyaeya, gyaata—ye teen karm ke prerak; karan, karm, karta—ye teen karm ke ang hain.
Hinglish (2): Gyaan, jneya (object of knowledge) aur parigyata (knower) - yeh teen karm ki prerana hain. Karan (senses), karm (action) aur karta (doer) - yeh teen karm ke sangrah hain.
message:
ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविधः कर्मसंग्रहः
Knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the knower are the threefold motivators of action; instrument, action, and doer are the threefold constituents of action.
Gyaan, gyaeya, gyaata—ye teen karm ke prerak; karan, karm, karta—ye teen karm ke ang hain.

Sanskrit verse: ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः प्रोच्यते गुणसङ्ख्याने यथावत्शृणु तान्यपि
Translation (English): Knowledge, action, and doer are declared to be of three kinds according to the gunas—hear them as described in the science of the gunas.
Hinglish (1): Gyaan, karm, karta—ye teenon gunon ke anusaar teen prakaar ke hote hain.
Hinglish (2): Gyaan, karm aur karta - guno ke bhed se teen-teen prakaar ke hi kahe gaye hain. Unhe bhi tum mujhse suno.
message:
ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः प्रोच्यते गुणसङ्ख्याने यथावत्शृणु तान्यपि
Knowledge, action, and doer are declared to be of three kinds according to the gunas—hear them as described in the science of the gunas.
Gyaan, karm, karta—ye teenon gunon ke anusaar teen prakaar ke hote hain.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, Jnana Yoga, Karma

Sanskrit verse: सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावमव्ययमीक्षते अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि सात्त्विकम्
Translation (English): The knowledge by which one sees the one imperishable being in all beings, undivided in the divided—know that to be sattvic.
Hinglish (1): Jo gyaan sab me ek avyay ko dekhta hai, vah sattvik gyaan hai.
Hinglish (2): Jis gyaan se manushya alag-alag praaniyon mein ek hi avinashi, avibhakt bhaav ko dekhta hai, us gyaan ko tum saattvik jaano.
message:
सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावमव्ययमीक्षते अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि सात्त्विकम्
The knowledge by which one sees the one imperishable being in all beings, undivided in the divided—know that to be sattvic.
Jo gyaan sab me ek avyay ko dekhta hai, vah sattvik gyaan hai.

Sanskrit verse: पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान् वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम्
Translation (English): But the knowledge which sees different beings of distinct kinds as separate in all—know that to be rajasic.
Hinglish (1): Jo gyaan sab praniyon ko alag-alag aur alag prakaar ka dekhta hai, vo rajasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Parantu jis gyaan se manushya sabhi praaniyon mein alag-alag prakaar ke, bhinn-bhinn bhaavon ko dekhta hai, us gyaan ko tum raajasik jaano.
message:
पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान् वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम्
But the knowledge which sees different beings of distinct kinds as separate in all—know that to be rajasic.
Jo gyaan sab praniyon ko alag-alag aur alag prakaar ka dekhta hai, vo rajasic hai.

Sanskrit verse: यत्तु कृत्स्नवदेकस्मिन्काऱ्ये सक्तमहैतुकम् अतत्त्वार्थवदल्पं च तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्
Translation (English): That which clings to one effect as if it were the whole, without reason, without understanding truth, and petty—that is called tamasic.
Hinglish (1): Jo gyaan bina karan, sach ko samjhe bina, ek hi baat me atka rahta hai, vo tamasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Aur jo gyaan ek hi kaarya (shareer) mein poorn ki tarah aasakt hai, jo tark-rahit, tattva-arth se heen aur tuchchh hai, woh taamasik kaha gaya hai.
Summary: Tamasic vision is narrow and wrong.
message:
यत्तु कृत्स्नवदेकस्मिन्काऱ्ये सक्तमहैतुकम् अतत्त्वार्थवदल्पं च तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्
That which clings to one effect as if it were the whole, without reason, without understanding truth, and petty—that is called tamasic.
Jo gyaan bina karan, sach ko samjhe bina, ek hi baat me atka rahta hai, vo tamasic hai.
tags: Tamas, Jnana Yoga, lack of focus, negative thoughts

Sanskrit verse: नियतं सङ्गरहितमरागद्वेषतः कृतम् अफलप्रेप्सुना कर्म यत्तत्सात्त्विकमुच्यते
Translation (English): Action that is obligatory, done without attachment, without likes and dislikes, without desire for reward—is called sattvic.
Hinglish (1): Kartavya karm jo bina asakti, rag-dvesh, aur fal ki iccha ke kiya jaye, vo sattvik hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo niyat karm, attachment-rahit, raag-dvesh ke bina, aur phal ki ichha na rakhte hue kiya jaata hai, woh saattvik kehlata hai.
message:
नियतं सङ्गरहितमरागद्वेषतः कृतम् अफलप्रेप्सुना कर्म यत्तत्सात्त्विकमुच्यते
Action that is obligatory, done without attachment, without likes and dislikes, without desire for reward—is called sattvic.
Kartavya karm jo bina asakti, rag-dvesh, aur fal ki iccha ke kiya jaye, vo sattvik hai.

Sanskrit verse: यत्तु कामेप्सुना कर्म साहङ्कारेण वा पुनः क्रियते बहुलायासं तद्राजसमुदाहृतम्
Translation (English): Action done with desire for enjoyment, with ego, or with much strain—is declared rajasic.
Hinglish (1): Jo karm kaamna, ahankar se, ya atyadhik mehnat se kiya jaye, vo rajasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Parantu jo karm kaamnaon ki ichha se, ahankaar-poorvak ya bahut parishram se kiya jaata hai, woh raajasik kaha gaya hai.
message:
यत्तु कामेप्सुना कर्म साहङ्कारेण वा पुनः क्रियते बहुलायासं तद्राजसमुदाहृतम्
Action done with desire for enjoyment, with ego, or with much strain—is declared rajasic.
Jo karm kaamna, ahankar se, ya atyadhik mehnat se kiya jaye, vo rajasic hai.

Sanskrit verse: अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसामनपेक्ष्य च पौरुषम् मोहादारभ्यते कर्म यत्तत्तामसमुच्यते
Translation (English): Action undertaken through delusion, without regard for consequence, loss, injury, or one’s capacity—is declared tamasic.
Hinglish (1): Jo karm moha se, parinam, hani, hinsa, ya apni kshamata dekhe bina kiya jaye, vo tamasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo karm moh-vash, parinaam, haani, hinsa aur saamarthya ka vichaar kiye bina aarambh kiya jaata hai, woh taamasik kehlata hai.
message:
अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसामनपेक्ष्य च पौरुषम् मोहादारभ्यते कर्म यत्तत्तामसमुच्यते
Action undertaken through delusion, without regard for consequence, loss, injury, or one’s capacity—is declared tamasic.
Jo karm moha se, parinam, hani, hinsa, ya apni kshamata dekhe bina kiya jaye, vo tamasic hai.

Sanskrit verse: मुक्तसङ्गोऽनहंवादी धृत्युत्साहसमन्वितः सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योर्निर्विकारः कर्ता सात्त्विक उच्यते
Translation (English): The doer free from attachment, non‑egotistic, endowed with firmness and enthusiasm, unchanged in success and failure—is called sattvic.
Hinglish (1): Asakti rahit, ahankar rahit, dridhta, utsah se yukt, siddhi-asiddhi me samaan karta sattvik hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo karta attachment-rahit, ahankaar-rahit, dhairya aur utsaah se yukt, aur safalta-asafalta mein vikaar-rahit hai, woh saattvik kehlata hai.
message:
मुक्तसङ्गोऽनहंवादी धृत्युत्साहसमन्वितः सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योर्निर्विकारः कर्ता सात्त्विक उच्यते
The doer free from attachment, non‑egotistic, endowed with firmness and enthusiasm, unchanged in success and failure—is called sattvic.
Asakti rahit, ahankar rahit, dridhta, utsah se yukt, siddhi-asiddhi me samaan karta sattvik hai.

Sanskrit verse: रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुर्लुब्धो हिंसात्मकोऽशुचिः हर्षशोकान्वितः कर्ता राजसः परिकीर्तितः
Translation (English): The doer who is attached, desirous of fruit, greedy, harmful, impure, and subject to joy and sorrow—is called rajasic.
Hinglish (1): Ragi, fal ka icchuk, lobhi, hinsak, ashuddh, harsh-shok wala vyakti rajasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo karta raagi (passionate), karm-phal ka ichhuk, lobhi, hinsa-swabhav waala, ashuddh aur harsh-shok se yukt hai, woh raajasik kaha gaya hai.
message:
रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुर्लुब्धो हिंसात्मकोऽशुचिः हर्षशोकान्वितः कर्ता राजसः परिकीर्तितः
The doer who is attached, desirous of fruit, greedy, harmful, impure, and subject to joy and sorrow—is called rajasic.
Ragi, fal ka icchuk, lobhi, hinsak, ashuddh, harsh-shok wala vyakti rajasic hai.

Sanskrit verse: अयुक्तः प्राकृतः स्तब्धः शठो नೈष्कृतिकोऽलसः विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते
Translation (English): The doer who is unsteady, vulgar, arrogant, deceitful, malicious, lazy, despondent, and procrastinating—is called tamasic.
Hinglish (1): Anusashan rahit, ganda, ziddi, kapti, dusht, aalsi, nirash, der karne wala tamasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo karta ayukt (unsteady), prakritik (vulgar), ziddi, shath (deceitful), nishkriya (malicious), aalsi, vishaadi (despondent) aur deergh-sootri (procrastinating) hai, woh taamasik kehlata hai.
Summary: Tamasic doer is dull and unfit.
message:
अयुक्तः प्राकृतः स्तब्धः शठो नೈष्कृतिकोऽलसः विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते
The doer who is unsteady, vulgar, arrogant, deceitful, malicious, lazy, despondent, and procrastinating—is called tamasic.
Anusashan rahit, ganda, ziddi, kapti, dusht, aalsi, nirash, der karne wala tamasic hai.
tags: Tamas, depression, lack of focus, negative thoughts

Sanskrit verse: बुद्धेर्भेदं धृतेश्चैव गुणतस्त्रिविधं शृणु प्रोच्यमानमशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनञ्जय
Translation (English): Hear from Me fully and distinctly the threefold division of intellect and firmness according to the gunas, O Dhananjaya.
Hinglish (1): Hey Dhananjay, ab buddhi aur dhriti ka teen guna me bhed suno.
Hinglish (2): Hey Dhananjaya, ab buddhi aur dhriti (firmness) ka bhi guno ke anusaar teen prakaar ka bhed, jo main poorn roop se alag-alag bataunga, suno.
Summary: Opens discussion on intellect and resolve.
message:
बुद्धेर्भेदं धृतेश्चैव गुणतस्त्रिविधं शृणु प्रोच्यमानमशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनञ्जय
Hear from Me fully and distinctly the threefold division of intellect and firmness according to the gunas, O Dhananjaya.
Hey Dhananjay, ab buddhi aur dhriti ka teen guna me bhed suno.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, Jnana Yoga

Sanskrit verse: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्यमभयम् बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी
Translation (English): That which knows action and renunciation, duty and non-duty, fear and fearlessness, bondage and liberation—that intellect is sattvic, O Partha.
Hinglish (1): Jo buddhi pravritti-nivritti, kartavya-akartavya, bhay-nirbhay, bandhan-moksh ko samjhe, vo sattvik hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, jo buddhi pravritti aur nivritti, kartavya aur akartavya, bhay aur abhay, bandhan aur moksh ko jaanti hai, woh saattviki hai.
message:
प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्यमभयम् बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी
That which knows action and renunciation, duty and non-duty, fear and fearlessness, bondage and liberation—that intellect is sattvic, O Partha.
Jo buddhi pravritti-nivritti, kartavya-akartavya, bhay-nirbhay, bandhan-moksh ko samjhe, vo sattvik hai.

Sanskrit verse: यया धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च अयथावत्प्रजानाति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ राजसी
Translation (English): That by which one incorrectly understands dharma and adharma, duty and non-duty—that intellect is rajasic, O Partha.
Hinglish (1): Jo dharma-adharma, kartavya-akartavya ko galat samjhe, vo rajasic buddhi hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, jis buddhi se manushya dharm aur adharm, kartavya aur akartavya ko yathavat nahi jaan paata, woh raajasi hai.
message:
यया धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च अयथावत्प्रजानाति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ राजसी
That by which one incorrectly understands dharma and adharma, duty and non-duty—that intellect is rajasic, O Partha.
Jo dharma-adharma, kartavya-akartavya ko galat samjhe, vo rajasic buddhi hai.

Sanskrit verse: अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसाऽवृता सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी
Translation (English): That which, covered in tamas, thinks adharma to be dharma and sees all things perverted—that intellect is tamasic, O Partha.
Hinglish (1): Jo tamas se dhak kar adharma ko dharma samjhe, sab kuch ulta dekhe, vo tamasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, jo buddhi tamas se ghiri hokar adharm ko hi dharm maan leti hai aur sabhi arthon ko vipreet dekhti hai, woh taamasi hai.
message:
अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसाऽवृता सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी
That which, covered in tamas, thinks adharma to be dharma and sees all things perverted—that intellect is tamasic, O Partha.
Jo tamas se dhak kar adharma ko dharma samjhe, sab kuch ulta dekhe, vo tamasic hai.
tags: Tamas, Jnana Yoga, confusion, Dharma, negative thoughts

Sanskrit verse: धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी
Translation (English): The firmness by which, with unwavering yoga, one holds the functions of mind, prana, and senses—that firmness is sattvic, O Partha.
Hinglish (1): Jo dridhta se yog me mann, prana, indriya ko sthir rakhe, vo sattvik dhriti hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, jis avyabhicharini (unwavering) dhriti (firmness) se manushya dhyan-yog ke dwara mann, praan aur indriyon ki kriyaon ko dhaaran karta hai, woh saattviki hai.
message:
धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी
The firmness by which, with unwavering yoga, one holds the functions of mind, prana, and senses—that firmness is sattvic, O Partha.
Jo dridhta se yog me mann, prana, indriya ko sthir rakhe, vo sattvik dhriti hai.
tags: Sattva, Raja Yoga, ध्यान, mental peace

Sanskrit verse: यया तु धर्मकामार्थान्धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा पार्थ राजसी
Translation (English): The firmness by which, O Arjuna, one holds to dharma, desire, and wealth, with attachment to the fruit—that is rajasic firmness.
Hinglish (1): Jo dharma, kaam, arth me fal ki iccha se dridhta rakhe, vo rajasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Parantu, hey Arjun, jis dhriti se manushya phal ki aakanksha rakhte hue, attachment-poorvak dharm, kaam aur arth ko dhaaran karta hai, woh raajasi hai.
message:
यया तु धर्मकामार्थान्धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा पार्थ राजसी
The firmness by which, O Arjuna, one holds to dharma, desire, and wealth, with attachment to the fruit—that is rajasic firmness.
Jo dharma, kaam, arth me fal ki iccha se dridhta rakhe, vo rajasic hai.
tags: Rajas, letting go of greed, Karma, Dharma

Sanskrit verse: यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा पार्थ तामसी
Translation (English): The firmness by which one does not give up sleep, fear, grief, depression, and arrogance—that is tamasic firmness.
Hinglish (1): Jo neend, bhay, shok, vyatha, mad ko na chhode, vo tamasic hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, jis dhriti se dur-buddhi manushya swapna, bhay, shok, vishaad aur mad ko nahi chhodta, woh taamasi hai.
message:
यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा पार्थ तामसी
The firmness by which one does not give up sleep, fear, grief, depression, and arrogance—that is tamasic firmness.
Jo neend, bhay, shok, vyatha, mad ko na chhode, vo tamasic hai.

Sanskrit verse: सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दुःखान्तं च निगच्छति
Translation (English): O best of Bharatas, hear from Me the threefold happiness, wherein one comes to rejoice by practice and end sorrow.
Hinglish (1): Hey Bharatshreshtha, ab teen prakaar ke sukh suno.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat-shreshth, ab mujhse teen prakaar ke sukh ko suno, jismein abhyaas se raman hota hai aur dukh ka ant ho jaata hai.
message:
सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दुःखान्तं च निगच्छति
O best of Bharatas, hear from Me the threefold happiness, wherein one comes to rejoice by practice and end sorrow.
Hey Bharatshreshtha, ab teen prakaar ke sukh suno.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, mental peace

Sanskrit verse: यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम् तत्सुखं सात्त्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम्
Translation (English): That which is like poison in the beginning but like nectar in the end, arising from clarity of the self—that happiness is called sattvic.
Hinglish (1): Jo shuru me zeher jaisa, par ant me amrit jaisa lagta hai, aatma ki shuddhi se paida hota hai—vo sattvik sukh hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo sukh aarambh mein vish (zeher) ke samaan aur parinaam mein amrit ke tulya hota hai, aur jo aatm-buddhi ki prasannta se utpann hota hai, woh saattvik kaha gaya hai.
message:
यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम् तत्सुखं सात्त्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम्
That which is like poison in the beginning but like nectar in the end, arising from clarity of the self—that happiness is called sattvic.
Jo shuru me zeher jaisa, par ant me amrit jaisa lagta hai, aatma ki shuddhi se paida hota hai—vo sattvik sukh hai.

Sanskrit verse: विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम् परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम्
Translation (English): That which arises from contact of senses with their objects, like nectar at first but producing poison in the end—is called rajasic happiness.
Hinglish (1): Jo vishay-indriya sang se amrit jaisa shuru hota hai, par ant me zeher deta hai, vo rajasic sukh hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo sukh indriya aur vishayon ke sanyog se aarambh mein amrit ke tulya, par parinaam mein vish ke samaan hota hai, woh raajasik kaha gaya hai.
message:
विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम् परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम्
That which arises from contact of senses with their objects, like nectar at first but producing poison in the end—is called rajasic happiness.
Jo vishay-indriya sang se amrit jaisa shuru hota hai, par ant me zeher deta hai, vo rajasic sukh hai.

Sanskrit verse: यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मनः निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्
Translation (English): That which both at first and after deludes the self, arising from sleep, laziness, and negligence—that is called tamasic happiness.
Hinglish (1): Jo neend, aalas, pramaad se paida hota hai, pehle aur baad me mohit karta hai—vo tamasic sukh hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo sukh aarambh mein aur ant mein bhi aatma ko mohit karta hai, aur jo nidra, aalasya aur pramaad se utpann hota hai, woh taamasik kaha gaya hai.
message:
यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मनः निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्
That which both at first and after deludes the self, arising from sleep, laziness, and negligence—that is called tamasic happiness.
Jo neend, aalas, pramaad se paida hota hai, pehle aur baad me mohit karta hai—vo tamasic sukh hai.

Sanskrit verse: न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभिः स्यात्त्रिभिर्गुणैः
Translation (English): There is no being on earth or even among the gods in heaven who is free from these three gunas born of nature.
Hinglish (1): Na prithvi me, na devlok me koi aisa hai jo in teen gunon se mukt ho.
Hinglish (2): Prithvi par ya swarg mein devtaon ke beech, aisa koi bhi praani nahi hai jo prakriti se utpann in teen guno se mukt ho.
Summary: All embodied beings are under guna influence.
message:
न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभिः स्यात्त्रिभिर्गुणैः
There is no being on earth or even among the gods in heaven who is free from these three gunas born of nature.
Na prithvi me, na devlok me koi aisa hai jo in teen gunon se mukt ho.
tags: three gunas, Sattva Rajas Tamas, Karma

Sanskrit verse: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परन्तप कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणैः
Translation (English): The duties of brahmanas, kshatriyas, vaishyas, and shudras, O scorcher of foes, are divided according to the qualities born of their own nature.
Hinglish (1): Brahmin, kshatriya, vaishya, shudra ke karm unke svabhav se utpann gunon ke anusar bante hain.
Hinglish (2): Hey shatru-vijeta, Brahmanon, Kshatriyon, Vaishyon aur Shudron ke karm unke swabhav se utpann guno ke anusaar vibhakt kiye gaye hain.
message:
ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परन्तप कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणैः
The duties of brahmanas, kshatriyas, vaishyas, and shudras, O scorcher of foes, are divided according to the qualities born of their own nature.
Brahmin, kshatriya, vaishya, shudra ke karm unke svabhav se utpann gunon ke anusar bante hain.

Sanskrit verse: शमो दमस्तपः शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम्
Translation (English): Serenity, self‑control, austerity, purity, patience, uprightness, knowledge, wisdom, and faith—these are the duties of the brahmana, born of his nature.
Hinglish (1): Shama, dama, tap, shauch, kshama, arjava, gyaan, vijnan, aastikya—ye brahmin ke svabhavik karm hain.
Hinglish (2): Mann ka sanyam, indriya-sanyam, tap, pavitrata, kshama, saralta, gyaan, vigyaan aur aastikya - yeh sab Brahman ke svabhavik karm hain.
message:
शमो दमस्तपः शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम्
Serenity, self‑control, austerity, purity, patience, uprightness, knowledge, wisdom, and faith—these are the duties of the brahmana, born of his nature.
Shama, dama, tap, shauch, kshama, arjava, gyaan, vijnan, aastikya—ye brahmin ke svabhavik karm hain.

Sanskrit verse: शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम् दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम्
Translation (English): Valor, vigor, firmness, skill, not fleeing in battle, generosity, and lordliness—these are the duties of kshatriya, born of nature.
Hinglish (1): Shourya, tej, dhriti, dakshata, yuddh me na bhaagna, daan, ishwari bhav—ye kshatriya ke karm hain.
Hinglish (2): Shaurya, tej, dhairya, dakshata (skill), yuddh mein peeth na dikhana, daan aur swami-bhaav - yeh sab Kshatriya ke svabhavik karm hain.
message:
शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम् दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम्
Valor, vigor, firmness, skill, not fleeing in battle, generosity, and lordliness—these are the duties of kshatriya, born of nature.
Shourya, tej, dhriti, dakshata, yuddh me na bhaagna, daan, ishwari bhav—ye kshatriya ke karm hain.

Sanskrit verse: कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम् परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम्
Translation (English): Agriculture, cattle rearing, and trade are duties of the vaishya; service is the duty of the shudra, born of their nature.
Hinglish (1): Krishi, gau raksha, vanijya—ye vaishya ke karm; seva—shudra ka karm.
Hinglish (2): Kheti, gau-raksha aur vyaapaar - yeh Vaishya ke svabhavik karm hain. Aur seva karna Shudra ka svabhavik karm hai.
Summary: Economic and service roles in society.
message:
कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम् परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम्
Agriculture, cattle rearing, and trade are duties of the vaishya; service is the duty of the shudra, born of their nature.
Krishi, gau raksha, vanijya—ye vaishya ke karm; seva—shudra ka karm.

Sanskrit verse: स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः स्वकर्मनिरतः सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु
Translation (English): Each devoted to his own duty attains perfection; hear how one attains perfection by devotion to duty.
Hinglish (1): Apne karm me lage rehkar vyakti siddhi paata hai—maine kaise, suno.
Hinglish (2): Apne-apne svabhavik karmon mein laga hua manushya param siddhi ko prapt kar leta hai. Suno ki kaise apne karm mein laga hua vyakti siddhi prapt karta hai.
Summary: Svadharma as the path to perfection.
message:
स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः स्वकर्मनिरतः सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु
Each devoted to his own duty attains perfection; hear how one attains perfection by devotion to duty.
Apne karm me lage rehkar vyakti siddhi paata hai—maine kaise, suno.
tags: Nishkama Karma, Dharma, finding career purpose

Sanskrit verse: यतः प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदं ततम् स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानवः
Translation (English): From whom all beings originate, who pervades all—by worshiping Him through one’s own duty, man attains perfection.
Hinglish (1): Jis se sab prani upje, jo sabme vyaapt hai, use apne karm se poojkar siddhi milti hai.
Hinglish (2): Jis Paramatma se sabhi praaniyon ki utpatti hui hai aur jisse yeh saara sansaar vyaapt hai, uski apne svabhavik karmon dwara pooja karke manushya siddhi prapt karta hai.
message:
यतः प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदं ततम् स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानवः
From whom all beings originate, who pervades all—by worshiping Him through one’s own duty, man attains perfection.
Jis se sab prani upje, jo sabme vyaapt hai, use apne karm se poojkar siddhi milti hai.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, Nishkama Karma, Dharma, self-realization

Sanskrit verse: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् स्वधर्मे निधनं श्रेयः परधर्मो भयावहः
Translation (English): Better is one’s own duty though imperfect than the duty of another well‑performed; death in one’s own duty is better—duty of another is perilous.
Hinglish (1): Apna dharm galat ho to bhi behtar hai doosre ka dharm sahi se karne se; apne dharm me marna behtar hai. (It is better to perform one's own occupation, even with faults, than to perfectly perform another's. By performing the work prescribed by one's own nature, one incurs no sin.)
Hinglish (2): Apne swa-dharm ko, bhale hi dosh-yukt ho, doosre ke dharm ko achhi tarah se karne se behtar hai. Apne svabhavik karm ko karte hue manushya paap ko prapt nahi hota.
message:
श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् स्वधर्मे निधनं श्रेयः परधर्मो भयावहः
Better is one’s own duty though imperfect than the duty of another well‑performed; death in one’s own duty is better—duty of another is perilous.
Apna dharm galat ho to bhi behtar hai doosre ka dharm sahi se karne se; apne dharm me marna behtar hai. (It is better to perform one's own occupation, even with faults, than to perfectly perform another's. By performing the work prescribed by one's own nature, one incurs no sin.)
tags: Dharma, job dissatisfaction, finding career purpose

Sanskrit verse: सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत् सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाऽग्निरिवावृताः
Translation (English): One should not abandon the duty born of one’s nature, O Kaunteya, even if faulty; all undertakings are clouded by some fault, as fire by smoke.
Hinglish (1): Apne svabhavik karm ko dosh hone par bhi na chhode; sab karm me kuchh na kuchh dosh hota hai.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kaunteya, apne sahaj (natural) karm ko, bhale hi woh dosh-yukt ho, nahi tyagna chahiye. Kyunki sabhi aarambh (undertakings) kisi na kisi dosh se dhake hote hain, jaise agni dhuen se.
message:
सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत् सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाऽग्निरिवावृताः
One should not abandon the duty born of one’s nature, O Kaunteya, even if faulty; all undertakings are clouded by some fault, as fire by smoke.
Apne svabhavik karm ko dosh hone par bhi na chhode; sab karm me kuchh na kuchh dosh hota hai.

Sanskrit verse: असक्तबुद्धिः सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृहः नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां संन्यासेनाधिगच्छति
Translation (English): One who is unattached everywhere, self‑mastered, free from desire, attains the supreme perfection of actionlessness by renunciation.
Hinglish (1): Asakti rahit, jitindriya, ichchaa rahit vyakti sannyas se naiṣkarmya siddhi paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jiski buddhi har jagah aasakti-rahit hai, jo aatm-sanyami hai, aur jo ichha-rahit hai, woh sannyas ke dwara naishkarmya-siddhi (actionlessness) ki param avastha ko prapt karta hai.
message:
असक्तबुद्धिः सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृहः नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां संन्यासेनाधिगच्छति
One who is unattached everywhere, self‑mastered, free from desire, attains the supreme perfection of actionlessness by renunciation.
Asakti rahit, jitindriya, ichchaa rahit vyakti sannyas se naiṣkarmya siddhi paata hai.

Sanskrit verse: सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा
Translation (English): Learn briefly from Me, O Kaunteya, how one who has attained perfection reaches Brahman, the supreme state of knowledge.
Hinglish (1): Hey Kaunteya, siddhi paane ke baad brahma gyaan ki param nishtha kaise paayi jaati hai—suno.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kaunteya, siddhi ko prapt hua vyakti kaise Brahman ko prapt hota hai, jo gyaan ki param nishtha hai, use mujhse sankshep mein suno.
message:
सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा
Learn briefly from Me, O Kaunteya, how one who has attained perfection reaches Brahman, the supreme state of knowledge.
Hey Kaunteya, siddhi paane ke baad brahma gyaan ki param nishtha kaise paayi jaati hai—suno.

Sanskrit verse: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्याऽऽत्मानं नियम्य च शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च
Translation (English): Endowed with pure intellect, self‑controlled with firmness, abandoning sense objects like sound, and ridding oneself of attraction and aversion…
Hinglish (1): Shuddh buddhi, dridhta se sanyamit, vishayon ko tyag, raag‑dvesh chhod de.
Hinglish (2): Vishuddh buddhi se yukt hokar, dhairya se mann ko vash mein karke, shabd aadi vishayon ka tyag karke, aur raag-dvesh ko nasht karke...
message:
बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्याऽऽत्मानं नियम्य च शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च
Endowed with pure intellect, self‑controlled with firmness, abandoning sense objects like sound, and ridding oneself of attraction and aversion…
Shuddh buddhi, dridhta se sanyamit, vishayon ko tyag, raag‑dvesh chhod de.

Sanskrit verse: विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानसः ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रितः
Translation (English): Resorting to solitude, eating lightly, restraining speech, body, mind, devoted to meditation yoga, and taking to dispassion…
Hinglish (1): Akelapan, kam khana, vaani-sharir-mann sanyamit, nitya dhyan, vairagya apnaye.
Hinglish (2): ...ekant sthan mein nivaas karte hue, alp-aahar karte hue, vaani-shareer-mann ko sanyamit karke, hamesha dhyan-yog mein sthit hokar aur vairaagya ka aashray lekar...
message:
विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानसः ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रितः
Resorting to solitude, eating lightly, restraining speech, body, mind, devoted to meditation yoga, and taking to dispassion…
Akelapan, kam khana, vaani-sharir-mann sanyamit, nitya dhyan, vairagya apnaye.

Sanskrit verse: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् विमुच्य निर्ममः शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते
Translation (English): Abandoning ego, power, pride, desire, anger, and possessions, without ‘mine’, peaceful—he is fit to become Brahman.
Hinglish (1): Ahankar, bal, maan, kaam, krodh, sangrah chhodkar, nirmam, shant ho jaye.
Hinglish (2): ...ahankaar, bal, ghamand, kaam, krodh aur sangrah ka tyag karke, mamta-rahit aur shaant hokar, woh Brahma-bhaav ko prapt hone ke yogy ho jaata hai.
message:
अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् विमुच्य निर्ममः शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते
Abandoning ego, power, pride, desire, anger, and possessions, without ‘mine’, peaceful—he is fit to become Brahman.
Ahankar, bal, maan, kaam, krodh, sangrah chhodkar, nirmam, shant ho jaye.

Sanskrit verse: ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम्
Translation (English): One who has become Brahman, with a serene self, neither grieves nor desires, equal to all beings, attains supreme devotion to Me.
Hinglish (1): Brahma swaroop, prasann, na shok, na iccha, sab me samaan drishti—param bhakti paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Brahma-bhaav ko prapt, prasann-chitt vyakti na toh shok karta hai aur na hi kaamna. Sabhi praaniyon mein samaan-bhaav rakhte hue, woh meri paraa-bhakti (supreme devotion) ko prapt karta hai.
message:
ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम्
One who has become Brahman, with a serene self, neither grieves nor desires, equal to all beings, attains supreme devotion to Me.
Brahma swaroop, prasann, na shok, na iccha, sab me samaan drishti—param bhakti paata hai.

Sanskrit verse: भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः ततः मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम्
Translation (English): By devotion, he knows Me in truth, what and who I am; having known Me thus, he enters into Me thereafter.
Hinglish (1): Bhakti se mujhe tattvatah jaankar, mujhme pravesh karta hai.
Hinglish (2): Us bhakti ke dwara woh mujhe, jo main jaisa aur jitna hoon, tattva se jaan leta hai. Mujhe tattva se jaankar, woh turant mujhme pravesh kar jaata hai.
Summary: Bhakti as the gateway to union.
message:
भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः ततः मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम्
By devotion, he knows Me in truth, what and who I am; having known Me thus, he enters into Me thereafter.
Bhakti se mujhe tattvatah jaankar, mujhme pravesh karta hai.

Sanskrit verse: सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम्
Translation (English): Doing all actions always, taking refuge in Me—by My grace he attains the eternal, imperishable abode.
Hinglish (1): Sab karm mujhme arpita karke, meri kripa se avyay pad paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Hamesha sabhi karmon ko karte hue bhi, meri sharan mein rehkar, woh meri kripa se shaashvat, avinashi pad ko prapt karta hai.
message:
सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम्
Doing all actions always, taking refuge in Me—by My grace he attains the eternal, imperishable abode.
Sab karm mujhme arpita karke, meri kripa se avyay pad paata hai.

Sanskrit verse: चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव
Translation (English): With the mind centered on Me, renouncing all actions to Me, intent on Me, resorting to buddhi‑yoga—be ever conscious of Me.
Hinglish (1): Man se sab karm mujhme arpita karo, buddhi yog apnao, aur hamesha mujhme chit lagao.
Hinglish (2): Sabhi karmon ko mann se mujhe arpit karke, mere paraayan hokar, buddhi-yog ka aashray lekar, hamesha apna chitt mujhme lagaye rakho.
message:
चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव
With the mind centered on Me, renouncing all actions to Me, intent on Me, resorting to buddhi‑yoga—be ever conscious of Me.
Man se sab karm mujhme arpita karo, buddhi yog apnao, aur hamesha mujhme chit lagao.

Sanskrit verse: मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि अथ चेत्त्वमहङ्कारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि
Translation (English): With your mind fixed on Me, by My grace you will overcome all difficulties; but if from ego you do not listen, you will perish.
Hinglish (1): Agar mujhme chit lagao to meri kripa se sab mushkilen paar kar loge; ahankar se na mano to vinaash hoga.
Hinglish (2): Apna chitt mujhme lagakar, tum meri kripa se sabhi kathinaiyon ko paar kar jaoge. Parantu, yadi ahankaar-vash tum nahi sunoge, toh tum nasht ho jaoge.
message:
मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि अथ चेत्त्वमहङ्कारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि
With your mind fixed on Me, by My grace you will overcome all difficulties; but if from ego you do not listen, you will perish.
Agar mujhme chit lagao to meri kripa se sab mushkilen paar kar loge; ahankar se na mano to vinaash hoga.
tags: overcoming self-doubt, fear of failure, Bhakti Yoga

Sanskrit verse: यदहंकारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति
Translation (English): If, relying on ego, you think “I will not fight,” your resolve is in vain; your nature will compel you.
Hinglish (1): Agar ahankar se socho ki “main nahi ladoonga” to yeh jhoothi dridhta hai; tumhari prakriti tumhe ladegi.
Hinglish (2): Yadi tum ahankaar ka aashray lekar yeh sochte ho ki 'main yuddh nahi karunga', toh tumhara yeh nishchay vyarth hai. Tumhari apni prakriti (swabhav) tumhein yuddh mein laga degi.
message:
यदहंकारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति
If, relying on ego, you think “I will not fight,” your resolve is in vain; your nature will compel you.
Agar ahankar se socho ki “main nahi ladoonga” to yeh jhoothi dridhta hai; tumhari prakriti tumhe ladegi.

Sanskrit verse: स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोपि तत्
Translation (English): O Kaunteya, bound by your own karma born of nature, what you do not wish to do through delusion, you will do helplessly.
Hinglish (1): Tum apne svabhavik karm se bandhe ho; jo moha se nahi karna chahte, use bhi majbooran karoge.
Hinglish (2): Hey Kaunteya, apne swabhav se utpann hue karm se bandhe hone ke kaaran, tum moh-vash jo nahi karna chahte, use bhi vivash hokar karoge.
Summary: No escape from one’s innate duty.
message:
स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोपि तत्
O Kaunteya, bound by your own karma born of nature, what you do not wish to do through delusion, you will do helplessly.
Tum apne svabhavik karm se bandhe ho; jo moha se nahi karna chahte, use bhi majbooran karoge.

Sanskrit verse: ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति भ्रमयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया
Translation (English): The Lord dwells in the hearts of all beings, O Arjuna, causing them to revolve by His maya, as if mounted on a machine.
Hinglish (1): Ishwar sabke hriday me hai, sabko apni maya se ghumata hai jaise yantra me baithe ho.
Hinglish (2): Hey Arjun, Ishwar sabhi praaniyon ke hriday mein nivaas karte hain, aur apni maya se sabhi praaniyon ko, yantra par chadhe hue ki tarah, ghumaate rehte hain.
message:
ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति भ्रमयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया
The Lord dwells in the hearts of all beings, O Arjuna, causing them to revolve by His maya, as if mounted on a machine.
Ishwar sabke hriday me hai, sabko apni maya se ghumata hai jaise yantra me baithe ho.

Sanskrit verse: तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम्
Translation (English): Seek refuge in Him alone, O Bharata, with all your being; by His grace you will attain supreme peace and eternal abode.
Hinglish (1): Usi ke sharan jao, poore man se; uski kripa se param shanti aur nitya sthan milega.
Hinglish (2): Hey Bharat, tum poorn bhaav se usi ki sharan mein jao. Uski kripa se tum param shaanti aur shaashvat dhaam ko prapt karoge.
message:
तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम्
Seek refuge in Him alone, O Bharata, with all your being; by His grace you will attain supreme peace and eternal abode.
Usi ke sharan jao, poore man se; uski kripa se param shanti aur nitya sthan milega.

Sanskrit verse: इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु
Translation (English): Thus has knowledge most secret of all been declared to you by Me; reflect fully on it, and then do as you wish.
Hinglish (1): Mainne tumhe atyant gupt gyaan diya; ab ise soch samajhkar jo chahe karo.
Hinglish (2): Is prakaar, maine tumhein guhya se bhi ati-guhya (most confidential) gyaan kaha hai. Is par poorn roop se vichaar karke, jaisa chaaho, waisa karo.
message:
इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु
Thus has knowledge most secret of all been declared to you by Me; reflect fully on it, and then do as you wish.
Mainne tumhe atyant gupt gyaan diya; ab ise soch samajhkar jo chahe karo.

Sanskrit verse: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः शृणु मे परमं वचः इस्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम्
Translation (English): Hear again My supreme word, the most secret of all; you are most dear to Me, thus I speak what is for your good.
Hinglish (1): Tum mujhe bahut priya ho, isliye main tumhara kalyan kah raha hoon.
Hinglish (2): Sabse gupt, mere param vachan ko phir se suno. Tum mere atyant priya ho, isliye main tumhare hit ke liye yeh kahunga.
message:
सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः शृणु मे परमं वचः इस्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम्
Hear again My supreme word, the most secret of all; you are most dear to Me, thus I speak what is for your good.
Tum mujhe bahut priya ho, isliye main tumhara kalyan kah raha hoon.

Sanskrit verse: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे
Translation (English): Think of Me, be devoted to Me, sacrifice to Me, bow to Me—you shall come to Me; this is My truth, for you are dear to Me.
Hinglish (1): Mere baare me socho, mere bhakt bano, mujhe namaskar karo—tum mere paas aaoge.
Hinglish (2): Hamesha apne mann ko mujhme lagao, mere bhakt bano, meri pooja karo, aur mujhe pranam karo. Main tumse satya pratigya karta hoon ki tum mujhe hi prapt karoge, kyunki tum mere atyant priya ho.
message:
मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे
Think of Me, be devoted to Me, sacrifice to Me, bow to Me—you shall come to Me; this is My truth, for you are dear to Me.
Mere baare me socho, mere bhakt bano, mujhe namaskar karo—tum mere paas aaoge.
tags: Bhakti Yoga, Moksha, inner peace, self-realization

Sanskrit verse: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः
Translation (English): Abandon all dharmas and take refuge in Me alone; I shall free you from all sins—do not grieve.
Hinglish (1): Sab dharmon ko chhodkar mere sharan aao; main tumhe sab paapon se mukt karunga.
Hinglish (2): Sabhi prakaar ke dharmon ka parityag karke, kewal meri sharan mein aao. Main tumhein sabhi paapon se mukt kar dunga. Shok mat karo.
message:
सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः
Abandon all dharmas and take refuge in Me alone; I shall free you from all sins—do not grieve.
Sab dharmon ko chhodkar mere sharan aao; main tumhe sab paapon se mukt karunga.
tags: Moksha, Bhakti Yoga, Dharma, guilt, overcoming fear

Sanskrit verse: इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति
Translation (English): This is never to be spoken to one who lacks austerity, who is not devoted, who does not render service, nor to one who is envious of Me.
Hinglish (1): Is gyaan ko tapasya rahit, abhakt, seva rahit, ya mera ninda karne wale ko na batayein.
Hinglish (2): Yeh gyaan tumhein kabhi bhi us vyakti ko nahi batana chahiye jo tapasvi nahi hai, jo bhakt nahi hai, jo seva-bhaav nahi rakhta, aur na hi usko jo mujhse dvesh karta hai.
message:
इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति
This is never to be spoken to one who lacks austerity, who is not devoted, who does not render service, nor to one who is envious of Me.
Is gyaan ko tapasya rahit, abhakt, seva rahit, ya mera ninda karne wale ko na batayein.

Sanskrit verse: य इदं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः
Translation (English): He who teaches this supreme secret to My devotees, with supreme devotion to Me, will come to Me without doubt.
Hinglish (1): Jo bhakt is gyaan ko mere anya bhakton ko sikhata hai, vo mujhme milta hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo vyakti mujhme paraa-bhakti karke is param gupt gyaan ko mere bhakton mein kehta hai, woh nishchit roop se mujhe hi prapt hoga.
Summary: Spreading Gita among devotees is glorified.
message:
य इदं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः
He who teaches this supreme secret to My devotees, with supreme devotion to Me, will come to Me without doubt.
Jo bhakt is gyaan ko mere anya bhakton ko sikhata hai, vo mujhme milta hai.

Sanskrit verse: न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि
Translation (English): No man among men shall do dearer service to Me than he, nor shall there be another on earth dearer to Me.
Hinglish (1): Isse bada mera kaam koi nahi karega, na mujhse adhik priya hoga.
Hinglish (2): Manushyon mein usse badhkar mera priya kaarya karne waala koi nahi hai, aur na hi prithvi par usse badhkar mera koi priyatam hoga.
Summary: Preacher of Gita is most beloved.
message:
न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि
No man among men shall do dearer service to Me than he, nor shall there be another on earth dearer to Me.
Isse bada mera kaam koi nahi karega, na mujhse adhik priya hoga.

Sanskrit verse: अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः
Translation (English): He who studies this righteous dialogue of ours—I am worshiped by him through the sacrifice of knowledge—such is My thought.
Hinglish (1): Jo is samvaad ko padhe, vo mujhe gyaan yajya se puje.
Hinglish (2): Aur jo manushya humare is dharm-may samvaad ka adhyayan karega, uske dwara main gyaan-yajna se poojit hounga, aisa mera mat hai.
Summary: Study of the Gita as worship.
message:
अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः
He who studies this righteous dialogue of ours—I am worshiped by him through the sacrifice of knowledge—such is My thought.
Jo is samvaad ko padhe, vo mujhe gyaan yajya se puje.

Sanskrit verse: श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नरः सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम्
Translation (English): Even the man who hears this with faith and without envy will be freed and attain the auspicious worlds of the virtuous.
Hinglish (1): Jo shraddha se, bina jalan ke sunta hai, vo mukt hokar punya logon ke lok paata hai.
Hinglish (2): Jo manushya shraddha-vaan aur dvesh-rahit hokar kewal isko sunega bhi, woh bhi mukt hokar punya-karmiyon ke shubh lokon ko prapt hoga.
Summary: Simply hearing Gita with faith benefits.
message:
श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नरः सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम्
Even the man who hears this with faith and without envy will be freed and attain the auspicious worlds of the virtuous.
Jo shraddha se, bina jalan ke sunta hai, vo mukt hokar punya logon ke lok paata hai.

Sanskrit verse: कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा कच्चिदज्ञानसङ्मोहः प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय
Translation (English): O Partha, has this been heard by you with a concentrated mind? Has your delusion of ignorance been destroyed, O Dhananjaya?
Hinglish (1): Hey Parth, kya tumne dhyan se suna? Kya tumhara agyaan ka moha mita?
Hinglish (2): Hey Parth, kya tumne is gyaan ko ekagra-chitt se suna? Hey Dhananjaya, kya tumhara agyaan-janit moh nasht ho gaya hai?
message:
कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा कच्चिदज्ञानसङ्मोहः प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय
O Partha, has this been heard by you with a concentrated mind? Has your delusion of ignorance been destroyed, O Dhananjaya?
Hey Parth, kya tumne dhyan se suna? Kya tumhara agyaan ka moha mita?

Sanskrit verse: अर्जुन उवाच नष्टो मोहः स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देहः करिष्ये वचनं तव
Translation (English): Arjuna said: My delusion is destroyed, memory regained by Your grace, O Achyuta; I am firm, free from doubt, and will act according to Your word.
Hinglish (1): Arjun bola: Mera moha gaya, smriti mil gayi; main sthir hoon, sandeh rahit, aur aapke vachan anusaar karoonga.
Hinglish (2): Arjun ne kaha: Hey Achyuta, aapki kripa se mera moh nasht ho gaya hai aur mujhe smriti prapt ho gayi hai. Main sthir hoon, mere sandeh chale gaye hain. Main aapke vachan ka paalan karunga.
message:
अर्जुन उवाच नष्टो मोहः स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देहः करिष्ये वचनं तव
Arjuna said: My delusion is destroyed, memory regained by Your grace, O Achyuta; I am firm, free from doubt, and will act according to Your word.
Arjun bola: Mera moha gaya, smriti mil gayi; main sthir hoon, sandeh rahit, aur aapke vachan anusaar karoonga.
tags: self-realization, inner peace, overcoming self-doubt, Dharma

Sanskrit verse: सञ्जय उवाच इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम्
Translation (English): Sanjaya said: Thus I heard this wondrous, thrilling dialogue between Vasudeva and the great‑souled Partha.
Hinglish (1): Sanjay bola: Maine Vasudev aur Parth ke beech ka adbhut samvaad suna jo romanchit karne wala tha.
Hinglish (2): Sanjay ne kaha: Is prakaar maine Vasudev aur mahatma Parth ke is adbhut aur romanch-kaari samvaad ko suna.
message:
सञ्जय उवाच इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम्
Sanjaya said: Thus I heard this wondrous, thrilling dialogue between Vasudeva and the great‑souled Partha.
Sanjay bola: Maine Vasudev aur Parth ke beech ka adbhut samvaad suna jo romanchit karne wala tha.

Sanskrit verse: व्यासप्रसादाच्छ्रुतवानेतद्गुह्यमहं परम् योगं योगेश्वरात्कृष्णात्साक्षात्कथयतः स्वयम्
Translation (English): By Vyasa’s grace, I heard this supreme mystery, yoga, directly from Krishna, Lord of Yoga, Himself speaking.
Hinglish (1): Vyasa ki kripa se maine Krishna se yeh guhyatam yog suna.
Hinglish (2): Vyasa ji ki kripa se maine is param gupt yog ko saakshaat Yogeshwar Shri Krishna se, jo swayam keh rahe the, suna hai.
message:
व्यासप्रसादाच्छ्रुतवानेतद्गुह्यमहं परम् योगं योगेश्वरात्कृष्णात्साक्षात्कथयतः स्वयम्
By Vyasa’s grace, I heard this supreme mystery, yoga, directly from Krishna, Lord of Yoga, Himself speaking.
Vyasa ki kripa se maine Krishna se yeh guhyatam yog suna.

Sanskrit verse: राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम् केशवार्जुनयोः पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहुः
Translation (English): O King, remembering again and again this holy, wondrous dialogue between Keshava and Arjuna, I rejoice again and again.
Hinglish (1): Rajann, main is puny samvaad ko baar-baar yaad karke khushi hota hoon.
Hinglish (2): Hey Rajan, Keshav aur Arjun ke is punya-may, adbhut samvaad ko baar-baar smaran karke, main kshan-kshan harshit ho raha hoon.
message:
राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम् केशवार्जुनयोः पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहुः
O King, remembering again and again this holy, wondrous dialogue between Keshava and Arjuna, I rejoice again and again.
Rajann, main is puny samvaad ko baar-baar yaad karke khushi hota hoon.
tags: inner peace, mental peace, Bhakti Yoga

Sanskrit verse: तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरेः विस्मयो मे महान्राजन्हृष्यामि च पुनः पुनः
Translation (English): And remembering again and again that most wonderful form of Hari, great is my amazement, and I rejoice again and again.
Hinglish (1): Har ka adbhut roop yaad karke mera adbhut badhta hai aur main khushi paata hoon.
Hinglish (2): Aur hey Rajan, Hari ke us atyant adbhut vishwa-roop ko baar-baar smaran karke, mujhe mahaan aashcharya ho रहा है aur main baar-baar harshit ho raha hoon.
message:
तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरेः विस्मयो मे महान्राजन्हृष्यामि च पुनः पुनः
And remembering again and again that most wonderful form of Hari, great is my amazement, and I rejoice again and again.
Har ka adbhut roop yaad karke mera adbhut badhta hai aur main khushi paata hoon.

Sanskrit verse: यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम
Translation (English): Where there is Krishna, Lord of Yoga, and Arjuna, the bowman, there are fortune, victory, prosperity, and sound policy—so is my conviction.
Hinglish (1): Jahan Yogeshwar Krishna aur dhanurdhar Arjun hain, vahan shri, vijay, samriddhi aur neeti hoti hai.
Hinglish (2): Jahan Yogeshwar Shri Krishna hain, aur jahan dhanurdhar Arjun hai, wahan nishchit roop se shree (opulence), vijay, aishwarya (prosperity) aur dhruv neeti (sound morality) hai - aisa mera mat hai.
message:
यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम
Where there is Krishna, Lord of Yoga, and Arjuna, the bowman, there are fortune, victory, prosperity, and sound policy—so is my conviction.
Jahan Yogeshwar Krishna aur dhanurdhar Arjun hain, vahan shri, vijay, samriddhi aur neeti hoti hai.
tags: Dharma, Bhakti Yoga, Karma, inner peace
